<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> bailey <NEXT_INPUT> coffee <NEXT_INPUT> espresso <NEXT_INPUT> speed <NEXT_INPUT> irish <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 14 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 and 3/4 cups cake flour  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons espresso powder  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup unsalted butter softened to room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 large egg whites at room temperature  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 and 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup sour cream or plain yogurt at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup strong black coffee cooled to room temperature  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup Baileys Irish Cream  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup unsalted butter softened to room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon espresso powder  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 Tablespoons Baileys Irish Cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 and 1/2 Tablespoons strong black coffee cooled to room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> pinch of salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> optional for garnish chocolate sprinkles <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 F . <NEXT_STEP> Line a 12 cup muffin pan with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Line a second pan with 2 liners this recipe makes about 14 cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the cake flour, espresso powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter on high speed until smooth and creamy, about 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sugar and beat on high speed for 2 minutes until creamed together. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula as needed. <NEXT_STEP> Add the egg whites and vanilla extract. <NEXT_STEP> Beat on medium high speed until combined, then beat in the sour cream. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl as needed. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on low speed, add the dry ingredients until just incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer still running on low, slowly pour in the coffee then the Baileys. <NEXT_STEP> Beat just until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Do not over mix. <NEXT_STEP> You may need to whisk it all by hand to make sure there are no lumps in the bottom of the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Pour spoon the batter into the liners fill only 2 3 full to avoid spilling over the sides. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 19 22 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> For around bake for about 11 13 minutes, same oven temperature. <NEXT_STEP> Allow the cupcakes to cool completely before frosting. <NEXT_STEP> With a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle or whisk attachment, beat the butter on medium speed until creamy, about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add confectioners sugar, espresso powder , Baileys, and coffee. <NEXT_STEP> Beat on low speed for 30 seconds, then increase to medium high speed and beat for 2 full minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add up to 1 2 cup more confectioners sugar if frosting is too thin or another Tablespoon of Baileys if frosting is too thick. <NEXT_STEP> Add a pinch of salt if frosting is too sweet. <NEXT_STEP> Frost cooled cupcakes and top with sprinkles, if desired. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Baileys & Coffee Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> guinness <NEXT_INPUT> espresso <NEXT_INPUT> reduced <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> powder <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 16 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> one 12 ounce bottle Guinness Extra Stout <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup all purpose flour  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup unsweetened natural cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 and 1/2 teaspoons espresso powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup 1 Tablespoon vegetable or canola oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup packed light or dark brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs at room temperature  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup full fat sour cream at room temperature  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 Tablespoons reduced Guinness from step 1 <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons espresso powder  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 and 1/4 cups unsalted butter softened to room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 and 1/2 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 Tablespoon unsweetened natural cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 Tablespoon milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> pinch of salt to taste <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> In a small saucepan, bring the Guinness to a boil over medium high heat. <NEXT_STEP> Once boiling, reduce to medium heat and allow to simmer until reduced down to 2 3 cup, about 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Set 1 2 cup aside to cool for 10 15 minutes before using in the cupcake batter. <NEXT_STEP> While it s warm, mix the rest of the reduced Guinness  with the 2 teaspoons of espresso powder used in the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Set this mixture aside for step 5. <NEXT_STEP> You can do this step if needed. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate overnight. <NEXT_STEP> Bring reduced beer to room temperature before using in both the cupcake batter and frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Preheat the oven to 350 F . <NEXT_STEP> Line a 12 cup muffin pan with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Line a second pan with 4 liners this recipe makes about 16 cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the flour, cocoa powder, espresso powder, baking soda, and salt together in a large bowl until thoroughly combined. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium bowl, whisk the oil, brown sugar, eggs, sour cream, and vanilla together until completely smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients, add the 1 2 cup  reduced Guinness, then whisk until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> Do not over mix. <NEXT_STEP> The batter will be on the thinner side. <NEXT_STEP> Pour or spoon the batter into the liners. <NEXT_STEP> Fill each to avoid spilling over the sides or sinking. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 19 22 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Don t over bake, which will dry out the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Begin checking for doneness at 19 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> For around 36 mini cupcakes, bake for about 11 13 minutes, same oven temperature. <NEXT_STEP> Allow the cupcakes to cool completely before frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Have the Guinness espresso powder mixture from step 1 handy. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, beat the butter on high speed until completely smooth and creamy, about 2 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the confectioners sugar, cocoa powder, milk, reduced Guinness espresso powder mixture, milk, and vanilla extract. <NEXT_STEP> Beat on low for 30 seconds then increase to high speed and beat until combined and creamy. <NEXT_STEP> Taste. <NEXT_STEP> Add a pinch of salt if desired. <NEXT_STEP> If you want the frosting a little thicker, add 1 4 cup  of confectioners sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Frost cooled cupcakes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Guinness Chocolate Cupcakes with Mocha Guinness Buttercream <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> dough <NEXT_INPUT> cookie <NEXT_INPUT> chunk <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> ball <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 2 and 1/4 cups heat treated all purpose flour  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 and 1/4 teaspoons cornstarch <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup unsalted butter softened to room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup packed light or dark brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup pasteurized egg whites at room temperature  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup mini semi sweet chocolate chips <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 and 3/4 cups all purpose flour  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup whole milk at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup sour cream at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup unsalted butter softened to room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup pasteurized egg whites at room temperature  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup unsalted butter softened to room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 Tablespoon heavy cream or milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 cups confectioners sugar sifted <NEXT_INGREDIENT> remaining cookie dough <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START>  In a medium bowl, whisk the heat treated flour, cornstarch, and salt together. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, beat the butter on medium speed in a large bowl until smooth and creamy, about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the brown sugar and mix on medium until light and fluffy, about 3 full minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Using a rubber spatula, scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl as needed. <NEXT_STEP> Add the egg whites and vanilla extract and mix until fully incorporated, about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add half of the flour mixture and mix on low just until the powdery texture of the flour disappears, about 15 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Immediately add the rest of the flour mixture and mix until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the bowl from the mixer and use a rubber spatula to fold in the chocolate chips. <NEXT_STEP> Freeze or refrigerate the cookie dough for 15 minutes or until the dough is easy to handle. <NEXT_STEP> Roll the dough into 12 one Tablespoon size balls, place on a plate lined with parchment paper, then refrigerate until step 9. <NEXT_STEP> Cover the remaining cookie dough and set aside at room temperature until step 11. <NEXT_STEP> Preheat the oven to 350 F . <NEXT_STEP> Line a 12 cup muffin pan with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> In a small bowl, whisk the milk and sour cream together until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, beat the butter and sugar together on medium speed in a large bowl until light and fluffy, about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Using a rubber spatula, scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl as needed. <NEXT_STEP> Add the egg whites and vanilla and beat for 2 minutes, or until the mixture is totally incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on low, alternate additions of the flour mixture and the sour cream mixture, starting and ending with flour. <NEXT_STEP> Beat for an additional 30 seconds or until the batter appears smooth and creamy. <NEXT_STEP> Fill cupcake liners about 3 4 full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 16 19 minutes or until the cupcake edges are golden brown and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the oven and let cool in the pan for 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove cupcakes from the pan and carefully press 1 chilled cookie dough ball into the center of each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> The dough ball might not sit completely flat, so expect a little lump on top. <NEXT_STEP> Don t worry, you ll cover it with frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Cool cupcakes completely. <NEXT_STEP> While the cupcakes cool, Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, beat the butter in a large bowl on medium speed for 3 minutes, or until light, fluffy, and completely smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla extract, milk, and salt and beat until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Using a rubber spatula, scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl as needed. <NEXT_STEP> Add the confectioners sugar, then beat on low speed for 15 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Switch to medium high speed and beat the frosting until super light and fluffy, about 4 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> The frosting will become lighter in color as air is whipped into it. <NEXT_STEP> Break the remaining cookie dough into quarter size chunks. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer running on medium speed, add the cookie dough chunks. <NEXT_STEP> Mix just until incorporated some chunks can remain. <NEXT_STEP> Once the cupcakes are completely cool, top with frosting. <NEXT_STEP> You can spread the frosting with a knife or icing spatula or apply with a large round piping tip. <NEXT_STEP> Decorate with chocolate chips, sprinkles, or any leftover cookie dough, if desired. <NEXT_STEP> Leftover cupcakes keep well covered tightly in the refrigerator for 3 days. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Molten Cookie Dough Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> birthday <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup sour cream at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 and 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup whole milk at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> frosting chocolate buttercream and sprinkles for garnish or any of these frostings <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 F . <NEXT_STEP> Line a 12 cup muffin pan with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Line a second pan with 2 liners this recipe makes about 14 cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the cake flour, baking powder, and minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula as needed. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs and vanilla extract. <NEXT_STEP> Beat on medium high speed until combined, then beat in the sour cream. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl as needed. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on low speed, add the dry ingredients until just incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer still running on low, slowly pour in the milk until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Do not over mix. <NEXT_STEP> The batter will be slightly thick. <NEXT_STEP> Pour spoon the batter into the liners. <NEXT_STEP> Fill to avoid spilling over the sides. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 19 22 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> For brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 large egg at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup sour cream at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 and 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup whole milk at room temperature  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup very finely crushed or chopped peanuts  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup unsalted butter softened to room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 and 1/2 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup unsweetened natural or dutch process cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 Tablespoons heavy cream or milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup creamy peanut butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> optional for garnish mini Reese s Peanut Butter Cups or chopped peanuts <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 F . <NEXT_STEP> Line a 12 cup muffin pan with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Line a second pan with 2 3 liners because this recipe yields 14 15 cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the flour, baking soda, and salt together in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Using a handheld mixer, stand mixer fitted with a whisk or paddle attachment, or a whisk, mix the oil, peanut butter, brown sugar, egg, sour cream, and vanilla extract together in a large bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Add the dry ingredients, milk, and peanuts and whisk or beat together until completely combined. <NEXT_STEP> Avoid overmixing. <NEXT_STEP> Batter will be slightly thick. <NEXT_STEP> Pour spoon the batter into the liners, filling only 2 3 full to avoid baking over the sides. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 21 23 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean and the tops of the cupcakes spring back when gently touched. <NEXT_STEP> For around bake for about 11 13 minutes, same oven temperature. <NEXT_STEP> Allow the cupcakes to cool completely before frosting. <NEXT_STEP> With a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle or whisk attachment, beat the butter on medium speed until creamy, about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add confectioners sugar, cocoa powder, and milk. <NEXT_STEP> Beat on low speed for 30 seconds, then add the peanut butter, vanilla extract, and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Beat on medium high speed for 2 minutes until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add 1 4 cup more confectioners sugar if frosting is too thin or another 1 2 Tablespoons of cream milk if frosting is too thick. <NEXT_STEP> Taste. <NEXT_STEP> Add extra peanut butter or a pinch of salt if desired. <NEXT_STEP> Frost cooled cupcakes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chai <NEXT_INPUT> spice <NEXT_INPUT> tea <NEXT_INPUT> mix <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 14 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 2 and 1/2 teaspoons ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 and 1/4 teaspoons ground ginger <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 and 1/4 teaspoons ground cardamom <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon ground allspice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 bag chai tea <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup whole milk at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 and 3/4 cups cake flour  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 and 1/2 teaspoons chai spice mix  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 teaspoon sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 large egg whites at room temperature  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup sour cream or plain yogurt at room temperature heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> pinch of salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> optional for garnish cinnamon sticks mix the remaining chai spice mix <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START>  Mix all of the chai spices together. <NEXT_STEP> You ll have 5 and 1 2 teaspoons to use between the cupcake batter, buttercream, and garnish. <NEXT_STEP> Bring milk to a boil or heat in the microwave for 1 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Pour over tea bag and steep for 20 30 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> This chai milk is the milk you ll use in the cupcake batter. <NEXT_STEP> This can be done the day before and refrigerated overnight. <NEXT_STEP> Make sure the chai milk is room temperature before adding to the cupcake batter. <NEXT_STEP> Preheat the oven to 350 F . <NEXT_STEP> Line a 12 cup muffin pan with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Line a second pan with 2 3 liners this recipe makes 14 15 cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the cake flour, 3 and 1 2 teaspoons of chai spice mix, the baking powder, baking soda, and salt together. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, beat the butter and sugar together on high speed until smooth and creamed, about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula as needed. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the egg whites on high speed until combined, about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the sour cream and vanilla extract. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl as needed. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on low speed, add the dry ingredients until just incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer still running on low, slowly pour and mix in the chai milk just until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Do not overmix. <NEXT_STEP> Batter will be slightly thick and smell incredible Pour spoon the batter into the liners. <NEXT_STEP> Fill only 2 3 full to avoid baking over the sides. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 20 22 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> For around bake for about 11 13 minutes, same oven temperature. <NEXT_STEP> Allow the cupcakes to cool completely before frosting. <NEXT_STEP> With a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter on medium speed until creamy, about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add 5 and 1 2 cups confectioners sugar, the heavy cream, 1 and 3 4 teaspoons chai spice mix, vanilla extract, and a pinch of salt with the mixer running on low. <NEXT_STEP> Increase to high speed and beat for 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add up to 1 2 cup more confectioners sugar if frosting is too thin or another Tablespoon of cream if frosting is too thick. <NEXT_STEP> Add another pinch of salt if frosting is too sweet. <NEXT_STEP> Frost cooled cupcakes and serve. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Chai Latte Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> strawberry <NEXT_INPUT> white <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> reduced several <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 14-16 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 3/4 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup cake flour  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/8 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 large egg whites at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 Tablespoon warm water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 teaspoon cream of tartar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Homemade Whipped Cream for topping <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Adjust the oven rack to the lower middle position and preheat oven to 325 F . <NEXT_STEP> Line a 12 cup muffin pan with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Line a second pan with 2 4 liners this recipe makes about 14 16 cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a food processor or blender , pulse the sugar until fine and powdery. <NEXT_STEP> Remove 1 2 cup and set aside to use in step 3 keep the rest inside the food processor. <NEXT_STEP> Add the cake flour and salt to the food processor. <NEXT_STEP> Pulse 5 10 times until sugar flour salt mixture is aerated and light. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl using a hand mixer or a stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, whip egg whites, water, and cream of tartar together on medium low until foamy, about 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Switch to medium high and slowly add the 1 2 cup of sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Whip until soft peaks form, about 5 6 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> See photo above for visual. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla extract and beat just until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> In several additions, slowly sift the flour mixture into the egg white mixture using a fine mesh strainer, gently folding after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> To avoid the cupcakes from deflating or tasting dense, don t add the flour mixture all at once. <NEXT_STEP> Sift and very slowly fold in several additions. <NEXT_STEP> This is important Spoon batter into liners, filling only 2 3 full to avoid spilling over the sides. <NEXT_STEP> Bake the cupcakes until very lightly browned around the edges and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, about 18 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> For around bake for about 10 12 minutes, same oven temperature. <NEXT_STEP> Allow the cupcakes to cool for 10 minutes in the pan, then remove and place on a wire rack to cool completely before frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Spread or pipe homemade whipped cream onto cupcakes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Angel Food Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> piping <NEXT_INPUT> bouquet <NEXT_INPUT> leaf <NEXT_INPUT> tip <NEXT_INPUT> stem <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 4 cups frosting <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 and 1/2 cups unsalted butter softened to room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup heavy cream  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> salt to taste <NEXT_INGREDIENT> food coloring  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 batch baked cooled cupcakes  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> optional for garnish green sprinkles white sugar pearls <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> With a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter on medium speed until creamy, about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add confectioners sugar, heavy cream, and vanilla extract. <NEXT_STEP> Mix on low until it begins to come together, then increase to high speed and beat for 3 full minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add another Tablespoon of cream if frosting is too thick. <NEXT_STEP> Add a pinch of salt if frosting is too sweet. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon 3 4 cup of frosting into a separate bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in a drop of green food coloring. <NEXT_STEP> Add to a piping bag fitted with the 352 leaf piping tip . <NEXT_STEP> This will be for the stems and leaves. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Divide remaining frosting up evenly depending how many colors you are using. <NEXT_STEP> Tint frosting your desired colors. <NEXT_STEP> Fit a piping bag with a 1M piping tip or 2D piping tip. <NEXT_STEP> Add spoonfuls of frosting to the bag, alternating colors. <NEXT_STEP> Your piping bag will be marbled with different colors. <NEXT_STEP> Twist the open end shut and squeeze the frosting down to the tip. <NEXT_STEP> Squeeze some frosting onto a plate until you begin to see more than 1 color. <NEXT_STEP> Place the piping tip on top of the edge of a cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Using steady and medium pressure, begin piping stars all around the edges, then fill in the center. <NEXT_STEP> For some flair, add a few white sugar pearls to the hydrangeas Place the piping tip on top of the center of the cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Using steady and medium pressure, pipe a tight spiral around the cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Lessen some pressure as you come to the end. <NEXT_STEP> If the end looks a little messy, add some leaves using the 352 leaf piping tip. <NEXT_STEP> Arrange cupcakes in a circular shape on a serving platter or food safe tray. <NEXT_STEP> Use any extra cupcakes as decor around the bouquet or serve separately. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe leaves around any edges of cupcakes to fill the gaps. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the stems coming out of the bottom of the bouquet. <NEXT_STEP> If desired, top the stems with green sprinkles. <NEXT_STEP> Using the 1M piping tip or 2D piping tip and any color frosting, pipe a bow on top of the stems. <NEXT_STEP> Your bouquet is ready to serve Store any leftovers in the refrigerator for up to 4 5 days. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> How to Make a Cupcake Bouquet <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> coconut <NEXT_INPUT> carrot <NEXT_INPUT> clove <NEXT_INPUT> ginger <NEXT_INPUT> nutmeg <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 and 1/4 cups all purpose flour  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 teaspoon ground ginger <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon EACH ground nutmeg and ground cloves <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup vegetable oil canola oil or melted coconut oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup packed light or dark brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup plain yogurt sour cream or unsweetened applesauce <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon coconut extract  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup freshly grated carrots  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup sweetened shredded coconut  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces full fat block cream cheese softened to room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup unsalted butter softened to room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 cups confectioners sugar plus an extra 1/4 cup if needed <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon coconut extract  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/8 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> toasted coconut flakes for topping  <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 F . <NEXT_STEP> Line a 12 cup muffin pan with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, and cloves together in a large bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the oil, brown sugar, eggs, yogurt, vanilla and coconut extract  together until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk in the carrots and coconut. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and use a mixer or whisk until completely combined. <NEXT_STEP> Batter will be thick. <NEXT_STEP> Pour spoon the batter into the liners fill only 2 3 full to avoid spilling over the sides. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 20 22 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> For around bake for about 12 13 minutes, same oven temperature. <NEXT_STEP> Allow the cupcakes to cool completely before frosting. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle or whisk attachment, beat the cream cheese and butter together on high speed until smooth and creamy. <NEXT_STEP> Add 3 confectioners sugar, vanilla, coconut extract  and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Beat on low speed for 30 seconds, then switch to high speed and beat for 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> If you want the frosting a little thicker, add the extra 1 4 cup of confectioners sugar . <NEXT_STEP> Frost cooled cupcakes however you d like. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Coconut Carrot Cake Cupcakes <TITLE_END> 14 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 and 3/4 cups cake flour  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup unsalted butter softened to room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 large egg whites at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon peppermint extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup full fat sour cream at room temperature  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup whole milk at room temperature  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 ounces white chocolate coarsely chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup unsalted butter softened to room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon peppermint extract  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/8 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> optional green or red food coloring crushed candy canes coarse sugar sprinkles for topping <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 F . <NEXT_STEP> Line a 12 cup muffin pan with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Line a second pan with 2 liners this recipe makes about 14 cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the cake flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter on high speed until smooth and creamy, about 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sugar and beat on high speed for 2 minutes until creamed together. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula as needed. <NEXT_STEP> Add the egg whites, vanilla extract, and peppermint extract. <NEXT_STEP> Beat on medium high speed until combined, then beat in the sour cream. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl as needed. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on low speed, add the dry ingredients until just incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer still running on low, slowly pour in the milk until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Do not overmix. <NEXT_STEP> You may need to whisk spilling over the sides. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 19 22 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> For around bake for about 11 13 minutes, same oven temperature. <NEXT_STEP> Allow the cupcakes to cool completely before frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Melt the white chocolate in a double boiler or use the microwave. <NEXT_STEP> If using the microwave, melt in 20 second increments stopping and stirring until completely smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to cool for 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle or whisk attachment, beat the butter on high speed until completely smooth and creamy, about 2 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Switch to medium high speed and beat in the confectioners sugar, heavy cream, vanilla extract, and peppermint extract. <NEXT_STEP> Once combined, switch to low speed and slowly pour the white chocolate in with the mixer running. <NEXT_STEP> Taste. <NEXT_STEP> Add the salt if you d like. <NEXT_STEP> Frost cooled cupcakes however you d like. <NEXT_STEP> See note for the swirled frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Top with crushed candy canes and coarse sugar sprinkles, if desired. <NEXT_STEP> yogurt at room temperature  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup buttermilk at room temperature  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces full fat block cream cheese softened to room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup unsalted butter softened to room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 cups confectioners sugar plus an extra 1/4 cup if needed <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/8 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> optional salted caramel and/or banana chips <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 F . <NEXT_STEP> Line a 12 cup muffin pan with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Line a second pan with 6 liners as this recipe yields about 18 cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the flour, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt together. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle or whisk attachment, beat the butter and both sugars together on high speed until smooth and creamy, about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula as needed. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs, yogurt, and vanilla, then beat on medium high speed until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl as needed. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the mashed banana. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on low speed, add the dry ingredients until just incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer still running on low, slowly pour in the buttermilk until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Do not overmix. <NEXT_STEP> You may need to whisk it all by hand to make sure there are no flour pockets at the bottom of the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Pour spoon the batter into the liners fill only 2 3 full to avoid spilling over the sides. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 18 20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> For around bake for about 11 13 minutes, same oven temperature. <NEXT_STEP> Allow the cupcakes to cool completely before frosting. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle or whisk attachment, beat the cream cheese and butter together on high speed until smooth and creamy. <NEXT_STEP> Add 3 confectioners sugar, vanilla, cinnamon, and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Beat on low speed for 30 seconds, then switch to high speed and beat for 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> If you want the frosting a little thicker, add the extra 1 4 cup of confectioners sugar . <NEXT_STEP> Frost cooled cupcakes however you d like. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Banana Cupcakes extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup full fat sour cream at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup canned coconut milk at room temperature  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup sweetened shredded coconut <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 F . <NEXT_STEP> Line a 12 cup muffin pan with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Line a second pan with 3 4 liners this recipe makes about 15 16 cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the cake flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle or whisk attachment, beat the butter and solid coconut oil together on high speed until smooth and creamy about 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sugar and beat on high speed for 2 minutes until creamed together. <NEXT_STEP> combined, then beat in the sour cream. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl as needed. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on low speed, add the dry ingredients until just incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer still running on low, slowly pour in the coconut milk and shredded coconut until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Do not overmix. <NEXT_STEP> You may need to whisk it all by hand to make sure there are no large lumps stuck at the bottom of the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> The batter will be slightly thick with a few lumps of shredded coconut. <NEXT_STEP> Pour spoon the batter into the liners fill only 2 3 full to avoid spilling over the sides. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 19 22 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Allow cupcakes to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then remove from the pan to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Using a sharp knife, cut a circle hole into the center of the cooled cupcake to create a little pocket about 1 inch deep. <NEXT_STEP> This piece you removed will be the shape of a cone. <NEXT_STEP> Set it aside. <NEXT_STEP> Place about 1 teaspoon of caramel inside the cupcake or however much will fit. <NEXT_STEP> Slice off the pointy end of the cone piece of cupcake you removed so that it can fit on top of the filling. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with all cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Prepare frosting and frost cooled cupcakes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate Caramel Coconut Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pistachio <NEXT_INPUT> strawberry <NEXT_INPUT> crumb <NEXT_INPUT> speed second pan with 2 liners this recipe makes about 14 cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the cake flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter on high speed until smooth and creamy about 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sugar and beat on high speed for 2 minutes until creamed together. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula as needed. <NEXT_STEP> Add the egg whites and vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Beat on medium high speed until combined, then beat in the sour cream. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl as needed. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on low speed, add the dry ingredients until just incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer still running on low, slowly pour in the milk until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Do not overmix. <NEXT_STEP> You may need to whisk it all by hand to make sure there are no lumps at the bottom of the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> The batter will be slightly thick. <NEXT_STEP> Pour spoon the batter into the liners fill only 2 3 full to avoid spilling over the sides. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 19 22 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Allow cupcakes to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then remove from the pan to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Using a sharp knife, cut a circle hole into the center of the cupcake to create a little pocket about 1 inch deep. <NEXT_STEP> This piece you removed will be the shape of a cone. <NEXT_STEP> Set it aside. <NEXT_STEP> Place about 1 heaping teaspoon of sprinkles inside the cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Slice off the pointy end of the cone piece of cupcake you removed so that it can fit on top of the sprinkle filling. <NEXT_STEP> See photos above for visual. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with all cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> With a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter on medium speed until creamy about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add 4 and 1 2 cups confectioners sugar, the heavy cream, and vanilla extract with the mixer running on low. <NEXT_STEP> Increase to high speed and beat for 3 full minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add up to 1 2 cup more confectioners sugar if frosting is too thin or another Tablespoon of cream if frosting is too thick. <NEXT_STEP> Add a pinch of salt if frosting is too sweet. <NEXT_STEP> Frost cooled cupcakes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Party Pinata Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> nutella <NEXT_INPUT> speed <NEXT_INPUT> espresso <NEXT_INPUT> beat <NEXT_INPUT> mocha <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12-14 cupakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 and 1/4 cups all purpose flour  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 Tablespoons unsalted butter softened to room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 large egg whites room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 Tablespoons full fat sour cream room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 Tablespoons instant espresso coffee powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 Tablespoons hot water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 Tablespoons whole milk room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup unsalted butter softened to room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup Nutella <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup heavy cream or whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> pinch salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> optional chocolate sprinkles and raspberries <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 F . <NEXT_STEP> Line a 12 cup muffin pan with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Line a second pan with 2 liners this recipe makes about 14 cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the flour, baking powder, and salt together. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter on high speed until smooth and creamy about 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Add the granulated sugar and beat on high speed for 2 minutes until creamed together. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula as needed. <NEXT_STEP> Add the egg whites and vanilla extract. <NEXT_STEP> Beat on high speed until combined, then beat in the sour cream. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl as needed so everything is incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Stir the espresso powder and hot water together until smooth, then stir this into the milk. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside for a second. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer running on low speed, add the dry ingredients until just incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> lumps at the bottom of the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> The batter will be on the thin side. <NEXT_STEP> Pour spoon the batter into the liners fill only halfway with batter to avoid spilling over the sides. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 18 20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to cool completely before frosting. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter on medium speed until smooth, about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Stop the mixer and add confectioners sugar, Nutella, heavy cream, and vanilla extract. <NEXT_STEP> Beat on low speed for 30 seconds, then increase to medium high speed and beat for 2 full minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add up to 1 2 cup more confectioners sugar if frosting is too thin or another Tablespoon of cream if frosting is too thick. <NEXT_STEP> Add a pinch of salt if frosting is too sweet. <NEXT_STEP> Frost and decorate cooled cupcakes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Mocha Nutella aside. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the cake flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter on high speed until smooth and creamy about 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sugar and beat on high speed for 2 minutes until creamed together. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula as needed. <NEXT_STEP> Add the egg whites and the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Beat on medium high speed until combined, then beat in the orange zest and sour cream. cup, about 7 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> You want it room temperature or cold. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, beat the butter on high speed until completely smooth and creamy, about 2 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the confectioners sugar 1 cup at a time, beating on low at first then increasing to high speed. <NEXT_STEP> Once incorporated, add the next cup. <NEXT_STEP> Once creamy and combined, beat in 3 Tablespoons of the reduced champagne and the vanilla extract. <NEXT_STEP> Taste. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining reduced champagne if needed and a pinch of salt if you d like. <NEXT_STEP> Frost cooled cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Garnish with orange slices and gold sprinkles, if desired. liners fill only halfway to avoid spilling over the sides. <NEXT_STEP> Bake in batches for 18 19 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> For around 30 bake for about 10 minutes, same oven temperature. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to cool completely before frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, beat the softened butter on medium speed for 1 minute until completely smooth and creamy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the peanut butter and beat on medium high speed until the two are combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the confectioners sugar, cream, vanilla extract, and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Beat on low speed for about 20 seconds, then gradually increase to high speed. <NEXT_STEP> Beat on high for 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Frost cooled cupcakes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Ultimate Snickers Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> strawberry <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> speed <NEXT_INPUT> dried <NEXT_INPUT> freeze <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 16-17 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 8 9 large strawberries  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 large egg 2 egg whites room temperature and separated <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups all purpose flour  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup cornstarch  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 and 1/2 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup unsalted butter softened to room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 and 1/2 cups granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup whole milk room temperature  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup freeze dried strawberries  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup unsalted butter softened to room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 Tablespoons heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> salt to taste <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat oven to 350 F . <NEXT_STEP> Line a 12 count muffin pan with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> This recipe makes 16 17 cupcakes, so you will have a few cupcakes to bake in a 2nd batch. <NEXT_STEP> Slice 5 strawberries and place in a food processor or blender. <NEXT_STEP> Pulse until strawberries are a chunky puree. <NEXT_STEP> You should have about 1 3 cup. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Finely chop remaining strawberries. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> With a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, beat the 3 egg whites on high speed in a medium bowl until soft peaks form, about 2 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Sift the flour, cornstarch, baking powder, and salt together in a large bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter on high speed until smooth and creamy about 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sugar and beat on high speed for 3 4 minutes until creamed together fairly well. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula as needed. <NEXT_STEP> Add the egg yolk and vanilla and beat on medium high speed until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula as needed. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on low speed, add the dry ingredients in three additions alternating with the whole milk, beginning and ending with the dry ingredients, and mixing each addition just until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Do not overmix. <NEXT_STEP> Fold egg whites, 1 3 cup strawberry puree, and finely chopped strawberries into the cupcake batter. <NEXT_STEP> The batter will be velvety and slightly thick. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon batter into cupcake liners filling halfway. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 20 24 minutes or until the tops of the cupcakes spring back when gently touched and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to cool in the pan for 5 minutes, then transfer to a rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Using a blender or food processor, process the freeze dried strawberries into a powdery crumb. <NEXT_STEP> You should have around 1 2 cup. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> With a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter on medium speed until creamy about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add confectioners sugar, strawberry powder, cream, and vanilla extract with the mixer running on low. <NEXT_STEP> Increase to high speed and beat for 3 full minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add 1 4 cup  more confectioners sugar if frosting is too thin or 1 more Tablespoon of cream if frosting is too thick. <NEXT_STEP> Add a pinch of salt if frosting is too sweet. <NEXT_STEP> Frost cupcakes as desired. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Strawberry Cupcakes with Strawberry Buttercream <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> raspberry <NEXT_INPUT> jam <NEXT_INPUT> buttermilk <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> preserve <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 14 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1/2 cup unsweetened natural cocoa powder  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup all purpose flour  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs at room temperature  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup packed light brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup vegetable oil  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup buttermilk  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cups unsalted butter softened to room temperature  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 and 1/2 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 Tablespoons heavy cream  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon salt to taste <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup thick raspberry preserves or jam  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> raspberries for garnish <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 F . <NEXT_STEP> Line a 12 cup muffin pan with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Line a second pan with 2 liners this recipe makes about 14 cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl, whisk the cocoa powder, flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt together until thoroughly combined. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium bowl, whisk the eggs, sugar, brown sugar, oil, and vanilla together until completely smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Pour half of the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients. <NEXT_STEP> Then half of the buttermilk. <NEXT_STEP> Gently stir about 5 stirs. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with the remaining wet ingredients and buttermilk. <NEXT_STEP> Stir until just combined do not overmix. <NEXT_STEP> The batter won t be very thick. <NEXT_STEP> Pour spoon the batter into the liners fill only halfway to avoid spilling over the sides. <NEXT_STEP> Bake in batches for 18 19 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to cool completely before frosting. <NEXT_STEP> For around 30 bake for about 11 13 minutes, same oven temperature. <NEXT_STEP> Beat softened butter on medium speed for about 3 4 minutes until completely smooth and creamy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the confectioners sugar, cream, vanilla extract, and salt with the mixer running. <NEXT_STEP> Increase to high speed and beat for 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Add the raspberry preserves and beat until thick and creamy, about 2 full minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add more confectioners sugar if frosting is too thin, is separating  or looks too wet. <NEXT_STEP> And then add more salt to offset added sweetness. <NEXT_STEP> Frost cooled cupcakes however you d like. will be thick. <NEXT_STEP> Vigorously whisk the egg, yogurt, milk, vanilla, and lemon zest until combined and uniform in texture. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly whisk the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients until no lumps remain. <NEXT_STEP> Gently fold in the blueberries. <NEXT_STEP> Divide batter among 14 cupcake liners and bake in batches for 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to cool. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle or whisk attachment, beat the cream cheese and butter together on high speed until smooth and creamy. <NEXT_STEP> Add 3 cups confectioners sugar, vanilla, and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Beat on low speed for 30 seconds, then switch to high speed and beat for 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> If you want the frosting a little thicker, add the extra 1 4 cup of confectioners sugar . <NEXT_STEP> Frost cooled cupcakes immediately before serving. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Blueberries stirring between each time. <NEXT_STEP> You may also melt the butter and chocolate over low heat on the stovetop. <NEXT_STEP> Stir until combined, then mix in the instant coffee. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside to slightly cool. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium bowl, toss the cocoa powder, flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt together until thoroughly combined. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a large before frosting. <NEXT_STEP> beat softened butter on medium speed with an electric or stand mixer. <NEXT_STEP> Beat for about 3 minutes until smooth and creamy. <NEXT_STEP> Add confectioners sugar, heavy cream, vanilla extract, and peppermint extract with the mixer running. <NEXT_STEP> Increase to high speed and beat for 3 full minutes . <NEXT_STEP> Add more confectioners sugar if frosting is too thin or more cream if frosting is too thick. <NEXT_STEP> Add salt if frosting is too sweet . <NEXT_STEP> Frost cooled cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> There may be leftover frosting depending how much you use on each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Drizzle with melted chocolate. <NEXT_STEP> Top with crushed candy canes right before serving. <NEXT_STEP> Store leftovers in the refrigerator for up to 4 5 days. <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup pure pumpkin puree  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup mini chocolate chips <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 and 3/4 cup confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup unsweetened cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 Tablespoons unsalted butter softened to room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 Tablespoons heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat oven to 350 F . <NEXT_STEP> Spray two 12 count muffin pans with non stick spray or line with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl, toss the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, and pumpkin pie spice together until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium bowl, whisk the brown sugar and eggs together until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the pumpkin, oil, milk, and vanilla until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> Do NOT overmix the batter. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in the chocolate chips. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon the batter evenly into 14 cups fill the unused cups one third full with water to prevent warping. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 17 18 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to cool completely before frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Sift together the confectioners sugar and cocoa powder to assure there are no lumps. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> With a handheld of stand mixer, beat the butter at medium speed until fluffy about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually add the sifted sugar cocoa powder alternately with the heavy cream and vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Beat on low speed after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Add more powdered sugar if frosting is too dark. <NEXT_STEP> Add a pinch of salt if frosting is too sweet. <NEXT_STEP> Frost cooled cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Cover frosted cupcakes and store at room temperature or in the refrigerator for up to 4 days. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Pumpkin Cupcakes with Dark Chocolate Frosting <TITLE_END> <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup packed light brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup buttermilk  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 ounces white chocolate <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START>  Preheat the oven to 350 F . <NEXT_STEP> Line a 12 count muffin pan with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Melt the butter and chocolate together in the microwave. <NEXT_STEP> Microwave in 30 second increments, stirring between each time. <NEXT_STEP> You may also melt the butter and chocolate over low heat on the stovetop. <NEXT_STEP> Stir until smooth and set aside to slightly cool. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium sized bowl, toss the cocoa powder, flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt together until thoroughly combined. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl, whisk the eggs, sugar, brown sugar, and vanilla together until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add the cooled butter chocolate and whisk until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add half of the flour mixture, then half of the buttermilk. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat until everything is added. <NEXT_STEP> Stir until just combined do not overmix. <NEXT_STEP> The batter will be very thick like pudding. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter between 12 liners in your cupcake pan. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 18 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to cool completely before frosting. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium bowl using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter on medium speed for 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Switch the mixer to low speed and slowly add the confectioners sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Quickly stir the cooled white chocolate so that it is smooth and add to the butter sugar mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Switch the mixer to medium speed and beat for 2 minutes until combined and creamy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the cream, vanilla extract, and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Beat for 1 minute until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Frost the cupcakes and top with melted chocolate drizzle and chocolate sprinkles, if desired. <NEXT_STEP> Store leftovers in the refrigerator for up to 4 5 days. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate White Chocolate Cupcakes <TITLE_END> to use in the whipped cream. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl, whip the cream, sugar, and vanilla extract together on high speed until stiff peaks begin to form, about 4 full minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in the remaining strawberry filling with a large spoon or rubber spatula. <NEXT_STEP> Frost the cupcakes with the strawberry whipped cream. <NEXT_STEP> You may have some whipped cream leftover. cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Top with Oreo crumbles. <NEXT_STEP> Store cupcakes in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days and in the refrigerator up to 5. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Cookies other ingredients. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt in a medium sized bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl, using an electric hand or stand mixer, cream the softened butter and sugar until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs, one at a time, beating until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the vanilla extract. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly add the flour mixture and beat only until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> In a steady stream, add the cooled cocoa mixture and stir until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Fill each muffin tin 3 4 of the way full with batter. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 16 19 minutes, keeping an eye on them to avoid even the slightest burning . <NEXT_STEP> My cupcakes took 17 minutes and a toothpick inserted in the middle came out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from oven and place on a wire rack to cool before frosting. <NEXT_STEP> beat softened butter on medium speed with an electric mixer. <NEXT_STEP> Beat for about 30 60 seconds until smooth and creamy. <NEXT_STEP> Add 3 cups of powdered sugar, cream, peppermint extract, and food coloring. <NEXT_STEP> Increase to high speed and beat for 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add more powdered sugar if frosting is too thin  or more cream if mixture is too thick. <NEXT_STEP> Add salt if the frosting is too sweet. <NEXT_STEP> You may also add more food coloring if desired or more peppermint extract if it is not minty enough. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the chocolate chips by hand. <NEXT_STEP> Frost cooled cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> There may be leftover frosting depending how much you use on each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Makes 14 cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Cupcakes taste best the day of or 1 day after they are made. <NEXT_STEP> Store covered in the refrigerator for up to 4 days. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate Cupcakes with Mint Chip Frosting <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> peanut <NEXT_INPUT> chip <NEXT_INPUT> banana <NEXT_STEP> Divide batter evenly between 12 cupcake tins. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 23 25 minutes or until toothpick inserted in the middle of a cupcake comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Allow cupcakes to cool <YIELD_START> 12-14 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 and 1/2 cups all purpose flour  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup packed dark brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup unsalted butter softened to room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup whole milk  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup salted or unsalted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup packed dark brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 3 cups confectioners sugar sifted <NEXT_INGREDIENT> salt to taste <NEXT_INGREDIENT> optional salted caramel candies for decoration <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat oven to 350 F . <NEXT_STEP> Line 12 cup muffin pan with paper liners, plus a second pan with only 2 liners. <NEXT_STEP> Fill empty cups halfway with water to prevent the pan from warping. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt. <NEXT_STEP> In a separate medium bowl, beat the butter and sugars together at medium high speed until light and fluffy, 2 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs and vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Beat until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly mix in the dry ingredients until no flour remains, scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly stir in the milk. <NEXT_STEP> Do not overmix the batter. <NEXT_STEP> Fill each cupcake liner only 1 2 way full with batter. <NEXT_STEP> Bake cupcakes for 22 23 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center of the cupcake comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Let the cupcakes cool before frosting, about 1 hour. <NEXT_STEP> While the cupcakes are cooling, melt the butter in a small saucepan. <NEXT_STEP> Once melted, add brown sugar and heavy cream. <NEXT_STEP> Stir constantly over medium heat until sugar is dissolved. <NEXT_STEP> Add salt. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to bubble for 3 full minutes, no more. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from heat and allow to slightly cool, only about 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Do not place in the refrigerator to cool. <NEXT_STEP> With a hand mixer at medium speed, beat in powdered sugar 1 cup at a time, until you reach desired consistency. <NEXT_STEP> Add a little heavy cream if you d like the frosting a little creamier or thinner . <NEXT_STEP> Add more salt if the frosting tastes too sweet. <NEXT_STEP> Frost cooled cupcakes and adorn with salted caramel candies. <NEXT_STEP> Cupcakes stay fresh in an airtight container for up to 2 days at room temperature and 5 in the refrigerator. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Salted Triple Caramel Cupcakes <TITLE_END> sugar if frosting is too thin or more cream if frosting is too thick. <NEXT_STEP> Add salt if frosting is too sweet . <NEXT_STEP> Frost cooled cupcakes and top with sprinkles. <NEXT_STEP> Store cupcakes in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days and in the refrigerator up to 5. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Easy Homemade Funfetti Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> little cream or milk if you find the frosting too thick. <NEXT_STEP> Frost cooled cupcakes and drizzle with salted caramel sauce, if desired. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Apple Spice Cupcakes with Salted powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 tsp baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 tsp salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup unsalted butter room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 tsp vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 tbsp milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup fresh lemon juice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tbsp fresh lemon zest tsp lemon zest <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Salt to taste <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat oven to 350 F  and prepare a pan with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt in a medium sized bowl and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter, oil, sugar and vanilla extract to a large mixer bowl and beat together until light in color and fluffy, about 1 1/2 to 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Do not skimp on the creaming time. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time, mixing until mostly combined after each. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed to be sure all ingredients are well incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Add half of the dry ingredients to the batter and mix until mostly combined. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the milk and lemon juice, then slowly add the mixture to the batter along with the lemon zest and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining dry ingredients and mix just until well combined and smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed to be sure all ingredients are well incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Do not over mix the batter. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners about 3/4 full and bake for 15-18 minutes or until a 3-4 tablespoons of lemon juice and the lemon zest to the frosting and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining powdered sugar and salt and mix until well combined and smooth. <NEXT_STEP> skimp on the creaming time. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time, mixing until well combined after each. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed to be sure all ingredients are well <NEXT_INPUT> lowest <NEXT_INPUT> speed <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 14 <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1/2 cup 2 tbsp buttermilk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 large egg <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large egg yolks <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 tsp vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 tsp baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 tsp baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 tsp salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup unsalted butter room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 cups unsalted butter room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 3/4 cups 2 tbsp powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 tbsp natural unsweetened cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 5 tbsp water or milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> pinch of salt <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat oven to 350 F  and prepare a cupcake pan with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the buttermilk, egg, egg yolks and vanilla extract in a large bowl, then separate about 1/4 cup of the mixture into another bowl or measuring cup. <NEXT_STEP> About 3/4 cup should remain in the other bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Set both aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a large mixer bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda and salt. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on the lowest speed, add the butter about a tablespoon at a time, allowing it to incorporate before adding the next tablespoon. <NEXT_STEP> As you add more butter, the mixture will start to clump together a bit and should end up resembling wet sand. <NEXT_STEP> Add the larger of the reserved egg mixture  to the dry ingredients/butter mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Stir on the lowest speed until it s incorporated, then scrape down the sides of the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Increase the speed to medium high and beat until light and fluffy, about 45 seconds to a minute. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the speed down to low and slowly add the remaining egg mixture in a slow stream until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape the sides of the bowl, then turn the speed back up and mix until well combined, about 10-15 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners about 3/4 full and bake for 15-18 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Remove cupcakes from the oven and allow to cool for 2-3 minutes, then turn out onto a cooling rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> When cupcakes are cool, make the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter to a large mixer bowl and beat until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Carefully pour in about half of the powdered sugar and mix until smooth and well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the cocoa powder, vanilla extract and 2-3 tablespoons of water or milk and the salt to the frosting and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining powdered sugar and mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add additional milk or water as needed to get the right consistency. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the frosting onto the cupcakes. <STEP_END> For the cupcakes, combine the flour, cinnamon, baking powder and salt in a medium sized bowl and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter, oil, sugar and vanilla extract to a large mixer bowl and beat together until light in color and fluffy, about 3-4 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Do not skimp on the creaming time. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time, mixing until mostly combined after each. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed to be sure all ingredients are well incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Add half of the dry ingredients to the batter and mix until mostly combined. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly add the milk and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> The batter may look a little curdled, but that s ok. frosting and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining powdered sugar and mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add additional milk or water as needed to get the right consistency. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the frosting onto the cupcake and sprinkle with any remaining cinnamon sugar swirl. <NEXT_STEP> Keep in mind that the cinnamon sugar on top will soak up moisture as the cupcakes sit, so if you want the obvious look of the cinnamon sugar you see in the photos, you ll want to add that just before serving <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Cinnamon Sugar Swirl Cupcakes <TITLE_END> should be able to see a noticeable change in color and texture. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time, beating until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the cocoa powder, vanilla and water and stir until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the mixture to the cake batter and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Alternate adding the flour mixture and milk to the batter. <NEXT_STEP> Begin by adding half of the dry <NEXT_STEP> . <NEXT_STEP> Allow the chocolate and cream and to sit for 3-5 minutes, then whisk together until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside to cool until at least room temperature. <NEXT_STEP> You could also refrigerate it until cold. <NEXT_STEP> . <NEXT_STEP> When you re ready to build the cupcakes, make the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter to a large mixer bowl and beat until smooth and creamy. <NEXT_STEP> . <NEXT_STEP> Add about half of the powdered sugar and mix until smooth and well combined. <NEXT_STEP> . <NEXT_STEP> Add the cocoa powder and mix until well combined and smooth. corer or knife to remove the centers of the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> . <NEXT_STEP> Fill the centers of the cupcakes with the ganache filling , then pipe the frosting onto the cupcakes with the chocolate buttercream. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Moist Chocolate Cupcakes with Ganache Filling <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> whipping <NEXT_INPUT> whip <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> angel <NEXT_INPUT> tartar <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 16-18  <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 3/4 cup sugar divided <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 tbsp cake flour  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 tbsp all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/8 tsp salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup egg whites room temperature  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tbsp warm water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 tsp cream of tartar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 tsp vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups heavy whipping cream cold <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 tsp vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Fresh fruit optional <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat oven to 325 F and prepare a cupcake pan with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Combine half of the sugar , flour and salt and sift them together through a fine mesh sieve 5 times. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the egg whites, warm water, cream of tartar and vanilla extract and whip with a mixer on low speed until they get foamy. <NEXT_STEP> Increase speed to medium and continue whipping, adding remaining sugar 1 tablespoon at a time. <NEXT_STEP> Wait 5-10 seconds between each addition to give time for the sugar to incorporate. <NEXT_STEP> Increase to medium-high speed and whip until it reaches soft peaks. <NEXT_STEP> Using a rubber spatula, gently fold the flour mixture into the egg whites a couple tablespoons at a time. <NEXT_STEP> Sift the flour mixture again as you add it to the egg whites. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat until all the flour mixture has been added. <NEXT_STEP> It s important to add the flour mixture slowly to not deflate the egg whites. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon the batter into the cupcake liners and fill 3/4 full they should be pretty full. <NEXT_STEP> They rise better when more full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake the cupcakes until lightly browned, about 18-23 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove cupcakes from the oven, then allow to cool completely on a wire rack. <NEXT_STEP> The cupcakes do fall a bit as they cool. <NEXT_STEP> Whip together your cream, sugar and vanilla on medium-high speed. <NEXT_STEP> This pace will make it easier to avoid over-whipping or under-whipping the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Stop whipping as soon as the mixture becomes smooth and billowy. <NEXT_STEP> If you let the ingredients whip for too long, your frosting will curdle or take on a grainy texture. <NEXT_STEP> You want it to have a medium peak that forms when you lift up the whisk. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe or spread the frosting onto the cupcakes and top with your desired decoration. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Fluffy Angel Food Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 6 tbsp unsalted butter room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 tbsp sour cream room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tsp vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 large egg whites room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tsp baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  tsp salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 tbsp milk room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tbsp water room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 oz semi sweet chocolate chips <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup heavy whipping cream cold divided <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 tsp vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup chopped strawberries <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup salted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup shortening <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 cups powdered sugar <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat oven to 350 F  and prepare a cupcake pan with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> 2. <NEXT_STEP> In a large mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar together until light in color and fluffy, about 3-4 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Do not skimp on the amount of creaming time. <NEXT_STEP> 3. <NEXT_STEP> Add sour cream and vanilla extract and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> 4. <NEXT_STEP> Add egg whites in two batches, mixing until well combined after each. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed to be sure all ingredients are well incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> 5. <NEXT_STEP> Combine dry ingredients in a separate bowl, then combine the milk and water in a small measuring cup. <NEXT_STEP> 6. <NEXT_STEP> Add half of the dry until a toothpick inserted comes out with a few crumbs. <NEXT_STEP> 8. <NEXT_STEP> Remove cupcakes from oven and allow to cool for 2-3 minutes, then remove to cooling rack to finish cooling. <NEXT_STEP> 9. <NEXT_STEP> To make the chocolate mousse, put the chocolate chips in a large bowl. <NEXT_STEP> 10. <NEXT_STEP> Bring 1/4 cup of heavy whipping cream to a boil, then pour over the chocolate chips. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to sit for 3-5 minutes, then whisk until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside to cool to about room temperature. <NEXT_STEP> 11. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining 1/2 cup of heavy whipping cream, powdered sugar and vanilla extract to a mixer bowl and whip until stiff peaks form. <NEXT_STEP> 12. <NEXT_STEP> Gently fold about 1/3 of the whipped cream into the cooled chocolate ganache, then fold in the remaining whipped cream. <NEXT_STEP> 13. <NEXT_STEP> Cut out the centers of the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> You can use a cupcake corer or a knife. <NEXT_STEP> 14. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the centers of the cupcakes with chocolate mousse. <NEXT_STEP> Set cupcakes in the fridge while you make the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> 15. <NEXT_STEP> Add the chopped strawberries to a food processor and puree until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Strain the puree through a fine mesh sieve to remove the seeds. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> 16. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the butter and shortening with a mixer until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> 17. <NEXT_STEP> Add about half of the powdered sugar and mix until smooth and well combined. <NEXT_STEP> 18. <NEXT_STEP> Add about 5 tablespoons of strawberry puree to the frosting and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> 19. <NEXT_STEP> Add remaining powdered sugar and mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> 20. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the frosting onto the cupcakes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Neapolitan Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pumpkin <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> cheese <NEXT_INPUT> clove <NEXT_INPUT> frosting <INPUT_END> <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup shortening <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 cups powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 tsp vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 3 tbsp water or milk <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat oven to 350 F  and prepare a cupcake pan with liners. <NEXT_STEP> 2. <NEXT_STEP> Add the flour, sugar, baking powder and salt to a large mixer bowl and combine. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> 3.
