<INPUT_START> macadamia <NEXT_INPUT> creamer <NEXT_INPUT> brittle <NEXT_INPUT> bailey <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12-14 Cupcakes  <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 2/3 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 tsp baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup salted butter room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup sour cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup Macadamia Brittle BAILEYS Coffee Creamer <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> pinch of salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup macadamia nuts chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup butter divided <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup shortening <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 5 cups powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 4 tbsp baileys creamer <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat oven to 350 degrees. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk together flour, sugar and baking powder in a large mixing bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Add butter, egg whites, vanilla, sour cream, milk and creamer and mix on medium speed just until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Do not over mix. <NEXT_STEP> Fill cupcake liners a little more than half way. <NEXT_STEP> Bake 18-20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to cool for 1-2 minutes, then remove to cooling rack to finish cooling. <NEXT_STEP> While cupcakes cool, make macadamia brittle. <NEXT_STEP> Line a cookie sheet with a silicon baking mat, set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Stir together sugar, water and salt in a medium saucepan. <NEXT_STEP> Cook over high heat without stirring, until sugar begins to melt and turn golden, about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Continue to cook, stirring occasionally, until sugar has melted and mixture turns golden amber, about 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Mixture will turn amber quickly, so keep a close eye on it. <NEXT_STEP> Once mixture turns amber, stir in macadamia nuts. <NEXT_STEP> Immediately remove mixture from heat and pour onto baking mat. <NEXT_STEP> Quickly spread to about 1/2 inch thick. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool completely, about 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Break brittle into pieces. <NEXT_STEP> Place 1/2 cup of butter and brown sugar into a microwave-safe bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Microwave for about 30 seconds at a time, stirring after each interval, until the sugar is mostly dissolved, about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> It ll boil and bubble up. <NEXT_STEP> Set caramel aside to cool. <NEXT_STEP> Cream remaining 1/2 cup butter and shortening until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add 3 cups powdered sugar and 1 tbsp creamer and beat until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Pour caramel into icing and mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add another 1-2 cups of powdered sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Add more creamer to reach desired icing consistency. <NEXT_STEP> Ice cooled cupcakes, then top with a piece of macadamia brittle. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> BAILEYS's Macadamia Brittle Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> <INPUT_START> strawberry <NEXT_INPUT> puree <NEXT_INPUT> reduction <NEXT_INPUT> add <NEXT_INPUT> well <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 14-16 Cupcakes  <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 2/3 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 tsp baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 tsp salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup unsalted butter melted <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tsp vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup sour cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup 2 tbsp milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups chopped strawberries <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 1/2 cups chopped strawberries  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 1/4 cups unsalted butter room temperature  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  5 cups powdered sugar  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1/2 tsp vanilla extract  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  Pinch or two of salt  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  Strawberries for decorating  <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat oven to 350 F  and prepare a cupcake pan with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt in a medium sized bowl and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl, whisk the melted butter, sugar and vanilla extract together until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs and whisk together until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sour cream and whisk together until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the milk and whisk together until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the dry ingredients and whisk together until combined, but do not over mix. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in the chopped strawberries. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners a little more than half full and bake for 18-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Remove cupcakes from the oven and place on a cooling rack to cool. <NEXT_STEP> To make the strawberry buttercream, make the strawberry reduction. <NEXT_STEP> Add the strawberries to a food processor or blender and puree until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> You should have about 3/4 cups of puree. <NEXT_STEP> Add the puree to a small sized saucepan and cook over medium heat. <NEXT_STEP> Allow the mixture to come to a slow boil, stirring consistently to keep it from burning, until it has thickened and reduced to about 6 tbsp, about 10-15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> To measure, pour the puree into a measuring cup. <NEXT_STEP> If it s more than 6 tbsp , add it back to the pan and continue cooking. <NEXT_STEP> When the puree has thickened and reduced, pour into a large measuring cup and allow to cool to at least room temperature. <NEXT_STEP> This strawberry mixture can be made ahead, if you like, and stored in the fridge. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter to a large mixer bowl and beat until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Carefully add about half of the powdered sugar and mix until smooth and well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add 4 tablespoons of the strawberry reduction, vanilla extract and the salt to the frosting and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining powdered sugar and mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add additional strawberry reduction as needed to get the right consistency and flavor. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the frosting onto the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Serve at room temperature <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Fresh Strawberry Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> well <NEXT_INPUT> combined <NEXT_INPUT> add <NEXT_INPUT> mix <NEXT_INPUT> sprinkle <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes  <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 1/4 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 tsp baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 tsp salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs divided <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 tbsp unsalted butter room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 tbsp vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 tsp vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup 2 tbsp milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup sprinkles  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup unsalted butter room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 cups powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 4 tbsp water or heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch or two salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Sprinkles <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Prepare a cupcake pan with cupcake liners and preheat the oven to 350 F . <NEXT_STEP> 2. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the flour, baking powder and salt in a medium sized bowl and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> 3. <NEXT_STEP> Add the egg whites to a large mixer bowl and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside the egg yolks for later use. <NEXT_STEP> 4. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter, sugar, oil and vanilla extract to a large mixer bowl and cream together until light in color and fluffy, about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Do not skimp on the creaming time. <NEXT_STEP> You should be able to see a visible change in the color and texture of the mixture when it s ready. <NEXT_STEP> 5. <NEXT_STEP> Add the egg yolks one at a time, mixing until combined after each. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed to be sure all ingredients are well incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> 6. <NEXT_STEP> Add about a third of the dry ingredients to the batter and mix until mostly combined. <NEXT_STEP> 7. <NEXT_STEP> Add half of the milk and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> The batter might look a little curdled, but that s ok. 8. <NEXT_STEP> Add another third of the dry ingredients and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed to be sure all ingredients are well incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> 9. <NEXT_STEP> Add the other half of the milk and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> 10. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining dry ingredients and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed to be sure all ingredients are well incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Do not over mix the batter. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> 11. <NEXT_STEP> Grab the egg whites and whip on high speed with the whisk attachment until soft peaks form. <NEXT_STEP> 12. <NEXT_STEP> Gently fold about half of the whipped egg whites into the cake batter and gently fold together until mostly combined. <NEXT_STEP> 13. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining egg whites and sprinkles and gently fold together until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> 14. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners about 3/4 full and bake for 15-18 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> 15. <NEXT_STEP> Remove cupcakes from the oven and place on a cooling rack to cool. <NEXT_STEP> 16. <NEXT_STEP> To make the frosting, add the butter to a mixer bowl and beat until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> 17. <NEXT_STEP> Add about half of the powdered sugar and mix until well combined and smooth. <NEXT_STEP> 18. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla extract and 1-2 tablespoons of water or cream and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> 19. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining powdered sugar and mix until well combined and smooth. <NEXT_STEP> 20. <NEXT_STEP> Add additional water or cream as needed to get the right consistency frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Add salt to taste. <NEXT_STEP> 21. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the buttercream onto the cupcakes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Homemade Funfetti Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> peach <NEXT_INPUT> puree <NEXT_INPUT> pie <NEXT_INPUT> powdered <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12-14 Cupcakes  <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 2/3 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp cinnamon <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 tsp baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup salted butter room minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to cool for 1-2 minutes, then remove to cooling rack to finish cooling. <NEXT_STEP> To make the icing, beat the shortening and butter until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly add 3 cups of powdered sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Mix until combined. <NEXT_STEP> . <NEXT_STEP> Mix in 5 tbsp of peach puree. <NEXT_STEP> . <NEXT_STEP> Add the rest of the powdered sugar and mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> . <NEXT_STEP> Add more peach puree to get the right consistency and flavor. <NEXT_STEP> The more puree added, the thinner the icing will be. <NEXT_STEP> If it gets too thin, add more <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup finely chopped apple <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 cups unsalted butter room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 cups sized bowl and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter, oil and sugars to a large mixer bowl and beat together until light in color and fluffy, about 3-4 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Do not skimp on the creaming time. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla extract and sour cream and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time, mixing until mostly combined after each. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed to be sure all ingredients are well incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Add half of the dry ingredients to the batter and mix until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly add the milk and <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining powdered sugar and mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add additional caramel sauce as needed to get the right consistency and taste. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the frosting onto the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Decorate with a drizzle of caramel sauce and apple slice Cupcakes are best when stored well covered in the fridge for 2-3 days. <NEXT_STEP> Serve at room temperature. <STEP_END> temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 tbsp vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tsp coconut extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup 2 tbsp milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 egg yolks <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 tbsp sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 tbsp cornstarch <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tbsp salted Challenge Butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp coconut extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup sweetened flaked coconut <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup salted Challenge Butter room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup shortening <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 cups powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp coconut extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 3 tbsp water or milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Toasted coconut <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Refrigerated pie crust optional <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat oven to 350 F  and prepare a cupcake pan with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> 2. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the flour, baking powder and salt in a medium sized bowl and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> 3. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter, sugar, oil and coconut extract to a large mixer bowl and beat together until light in color and fluffy, about 3-4 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Do not skimp on the creaming time. <NEXT_STEP> 4. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time, mixing until mostly combined after each. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed to be sure all ingredients are well incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> 5. <NEXT_STEP> Add half of the dry ingredients to the batter and mix until mostly combined. <NEXT_STEP> 6. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly add the milk and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> The batter will look curdled, but that s ok. 7. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining dry ingredients and mix until well combined and smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed to be sure all ingredients are well incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Do not over mix the batter. <NEXT_STEP> 8. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners about 3/4 full and bake for 13-15 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out with a few crumbs. <NEXT_STEP> 9. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the cupcakes from the oven and allow to cool for about 2-3 minutes, then remove to cooling racks to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> 10. <NEXT_STEP> While the cupcakes cool, make the pastry cream. <NEXT_STEP> Put the egg yolks in a medium sized bowl and gently beat them together. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> 11. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sugar, cornstarch and milk to a large saucepan and mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> 12. <NEXT_STEP> Cook, stirring continuously, over medium-high heat until mixture begins to thicken and bubble. <NEXT_STEP> 13. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce heat to medium and simmer for 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from heat. <NEXT_STEP> 14. <NEXT_STEP> Add a little bit of milk mixture to the egg yolks and whisk together, then add egg mixture to milk mixture. <NEXT_STEP> This process ensures that you don t cook the egg yolks. <NEXT_STEP> 15. <NEXT_STEP> Place the pan back on the heat and bring to a light boil. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to boil for 1-2 minutes, stirring continuously. <NEXT_STEP> 16. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from heat and add butter, coconut extract and flaked coconut. <NEXT_STEP> Stir until smooth, then set aside to cool to room temperature. <NEXT_STEP> 17. <NEXT_STEP> To make the frosting, combine the butter and shortening in a large mixer bowl and mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> 18. <NEXT_STEP> Add 2 cups of powdered sugar and mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> 19. <NEXT_STEP> Add the coconut extract and 1 tablespoon of water or milk and mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> 20. <NEXT_STEP> Add remaining powdered sugar and mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> 21. <NEXT_STEP> Add remaining water or milk as needed and mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> 22. <NEXT_STEP> Using a cupcake corer or small knife, remove the centers from the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> 23. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the centers of the cupcakes with the filling. <NEXT_STEP> 24. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the frosting onto the cupcakes and sprinkle with toasted coconut. <NEXT_STEP> 25. <NEXT_STEP> If you d like to add the pie crust toppers, bring the refrigerated pie crust to room temperature. <NEXT_STEP> 26. <NEXT_STEP> Roll out the pie crust and use a mini cutter  to cut out the toppers. <NEXT_STEP> 27. <NEXT_STEP> Place on a baking sheet covered with parchment paper and bake according to package instructions . <NEXT_STEP> 28. <NEXT_STEP> Top cupcakes with toppers and refrigerate until ready to serve. <NEXT_STEP> Cupcakes are best when stored in an airtight container. <NEXT_STEP> Best for 2-3 days. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Coconut Cream Pie Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> lemon <NEXT_INPUT> meringue <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> curd <NEXT_INPUT> zest <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12-14 Cupcakes  <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 1/4 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 tsp baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 tsp salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tsp lemon zest <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 large egg <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 tbsp fresh lemon juice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tbsp finely grated lemon zest <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 large egg yolks <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 tbsp unsalted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 tsp cream of tarter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 large egg whites room temperature <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 F  and prepare a cupcake pan with liners. <NEXT_STEP> 2. <NEXT_STEP> Add the flour, sugar, baking powder and salt to a large mixer bowl and combine. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> 3. <NEXT_STEP> Add the milk, vegetable oil, vanilla extract, lemon zest and egg to a medium sized bowl and combine. <NEXT_STEP> 4. <NEXT_STEP> Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and beat until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> 5. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly add the water to the batter and mix on low speed until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed to make sure everything is well combined. <NEXT_STEP> 6. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners about half way and bake for 15-17 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out with a few moist crumbs. <NEXT_STEP> 7. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the cupcakes from the oven and allow to cool for 2 minutes, then remove to a cooling rack to finish cooling. <NEXT_STEP> 8. <NEXT_STEP> To make the lemon curd, combine all the ingredients in a double boiler . <NEXT_STEP> Heat while whisking constantly until mixture thickens and reaches 160 degrees, or coats the back of a spoon. <NEXT_STEP> 9. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the lemon curd into a small bowl and cover with clear wrap pressed against the top of the curd to prevent a film from forming. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate until completely cool and firm, 3-4 hours. <NEXT_STEP> 10. <NEXT_STEP> When you are ready to build the cupcakes, make the meringue frosting. <NEXT_STEP> To make the meringue, combine the sugar, cream of tartar, vanilla extract and egg whites in a large mixer bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Place the bowl over a saucepan or pot of simmering water. <NEXT_STEP> You can also use a double boiler. <NEXT_STEP> 11. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk constantly until sugar is dissolved and egg whites are warm, to 160 degrees on a thermometer, about 4-6 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from heat. <NEXT_STEP> 12. <NEXT_STEP> Using the whisk attachment, beat the egg white mixture on low speed, gradually increasing to high, until stiff, glossy peaks form, 5 to 7 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> 13. <NEXT_STEP> To put the cupcakes together, use a cupcake corer  to cut a hole in the center of the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> 14. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the center of the cupcake with lemon curd. <NEXT_STEP> 15. <NEXT_STEP> Frost the cupcakes with the meringue frosting. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Lemon eggs one at a time, mixing until mostly combined after each. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed to be sure all ingredients are well incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> 5. <NEXT_STEP> Add <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 tbsp champagne reduction above <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/8 tsp salt <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> To make the champagne reduction used in the cupcakes, filling and frosting, add all of the champagne to a medium sized saucepan and cook over medium heat until you ve got 1 cup remaining. <NEXT_STEP> Don t boil. <NEXT_STEP> To measure how much champagne remains, pour into a glass measuring cup. <NEXT_STEP> Add it back to the pan if it needs longer to cook down. <NEXT_STEP> When done, refrigerate until cool. <NEXT_STEP> 2. <NEXT_STEP> To make the filling, put the white chocolate chips in a medium sized bowl. <NEXT_STEP> 3. <NEXT_STEP> Put the champagne reduction and heavy whipping cream in a microwave safe measuring cup or bowl and microwave until it begins to boil. <NEXT_STEP> 4. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the cream over the white chocolate chips and allow to sit for 2-3 minutes, then whisk until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> If needed, microwave the mixture for 10-20 more seconds, then whisk until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> 5. <NEXT_STEP> Set the ganache in the fridge to firm up, about 2-3 hours. <NEXT_STEP> 6. <NEXT_STEP> To make the cupcakes, prepare a cupcake pan with cupcake liners and preheat the oven to 350 F . <NEXT_STEP> 7. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the flour, baking powder and salt in a medium sized bowl and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> 8. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter, sugar and oil to a large mixer bowl and beat together until light in color and fluffy, about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Do not skimp on the creaming time. <NEXT_STEP> 9. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time, mixing until mostly combined after each. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla extract with the second egg. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed to be sure all ingredients are well incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> 10. <NEXT_STEP> Add half of the dry ingredients to the batter and mix until mostly combined. <NEXT_STEP> 11. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly add the milk and champagne and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> The batter might look a little curdled, but that s ok. 12. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining dry ingredients and mix until well combined and smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed to be sure all ingredients are well incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Do not over mix the batter. <NEXT_STEP> 13. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners about 3/4 full and bake for 14-16 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> 14. <NEXT_STEP> Remove cupcakes from the oven and place on a cooling rack to cool. <NEXT_STEP> 15. <NEXT_STEP> While the cupcakes cool, finish the filling. <NEXT_STEP> Put the chilled mixture in the bowl of a mixer and whip with the whisk attachment until soft peaks form, about 5-7 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> You ll notice the mixture lighten in color. <NEXT_STEP> 16. <NEXT_STEP> Cut out the centers of the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> You can use a cupcake corer or a knife. <NEXT_STEP> 17. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the centers of the cupcakes with the filling. <NEXT_STEP> Set the cupcakes in the fridge while you make the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> 18. <NEXT_STEP> To make the frosting, combine the butter and shortening in a large mixer bowl and beat until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> 19. <NEXT_STEP> Add about half of the powdered sugar and mix until smooth and well combined. <NEXT_STEP> 20. <NEXT_STEP> Add 3 tablespoons of the champagne reduction and the salt to the frosting and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> 21. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining powdered sugar and mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add additional champagne reduction as needed to get the right consistency. <NEXT_STEP> 22. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the frosting onto the cupcakes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Champagne Cupcakes with Truffle Filling <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> mix <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> smooth <NEXT_INPUT> powdered <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12-14 Cupcakes  <YIELD_END> oven to 350 degrees. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk together flour, sugar, baking soda and baking powder in a large mixing bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Add butter, egg whites, vanilla, sour cream and milk and mix on medium speed just until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Do not over mix. <NEXT_STEP> Fill cupcake liners a little more than half way. <NEXT_STEP> Bake 18-20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to cool for 1-2 minutes, then sugar and vanilla extract to a large mixer bowl and beat together until light in color and fluffy, about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Do not skimp on the creaming time. <NEXT_STEP> 4. <NEXT_STEP> Add the room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tsp vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 large egg whites room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tsp baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  tsp salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 tbsp milk room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tbsp water room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 egg yolks <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 tbsp sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 tbsp cornstarch <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup 2 tbsp milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tbsp salted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 oz semi sweet chocolate chips <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tbsp light corn syrup <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup 2 tbsp heavy whipping cream <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat oven to 350 F  and prepare a cupcake pan with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> 2. <NEXT_STEP> In a large mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar together until light in color and fluffy, about 3-4 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Do not skimp on the amount of creaming time. <NEXT_STEP> 3. <NEXT_STEP> Add sour cream and vanilla extract and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> 4. <NEXT_STEP> Add egg whites in two batches, mixing until well combined after each. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed to be sure all ingredients are well incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> 5. <NEXT_STEP> Combine dry ingredients in a separate bowl, then combine the milk and water in a small measuring cup. <NEXT_STEP> 6. <NEXT_STEP> Add half of the dry ingredients to the batter and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the milk mixture and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add remaining dry ingredients and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed to be sure all ingredients are well incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> 7. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners about halfway. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 15-17 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted comes out with a few crumbs. <NEXT_STEP> 8. <NEXT_STEP> Remove cupcakes from oven and allow to cool for 2-3 minutes, then remove to cooling rack to finish cooling. <NEXT_STEP> 9. <NEXT_STEP> While the cupcakes cool, make the pastry cream. <NEXT_STEP> Put the egg yolks in a medium sized bowl and gently beat them together. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> 10. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sugar, cornstarch and milk to a large saucepan and mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> 11. <NEXT_STEP> Cook, stirring continuously, over medium-high heat until mixture begins to thicken and bubble. <NEXT_STEP> 12. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce heat to medium and simmer for 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from heat. <NEXT_STEP> 13. <NEXT_STEP> Add a little bit of milk mixture to the egg yolks and whisk together, then add egg mixture to milk mixture. <NEXT_STEP> This process ensures that you don t cook the egg yolks. <NEXT_STEP> 14. <NEXT_STEP> Place the pan back on the heat and bring to a light boil. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to boil for 2 minutes, stirring continuously. <NEXT_STEP> 15. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from heat and add butter and vanilla extract. <NEXT_STEP> Stir until smooth, then set aside to cool to room temperature. <NEXT_STEP> 16. <NEXT_STEP> While the cupcakes and cream are cooling, make the chocolate ganache. <NEXT_STEP> Put the chocolate chips and corn syrup in a large bowl. <NEXT_STEP> 17. <NEXT_STEP> Bring the heavy cream to a boil, then pour over the chocolate chips. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to sit for 3-5 minutes, then whisk until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> 18. <NEXT_STEP> Place the chocolate ganache in the fridge until completely cool and firm, 1-2 hours. <NEXT_STEP> 19. <NEXT_STEP> Once everything is cooled and ready, cut out the centers of the cupcakes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Boston Cream Pie Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cranberry <NEXT_INPUT> sparkling whipping cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Rosemary <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> To make the cranberries, bring 1/2 cup sugar and the water to a simmer in a saucepan. <NEXT_STEP> Heat until sugar is completely dissolved. <NEXT_STEP> 2. <NEXT_STEP> Pour simple syrup into a heatproof bowl and allow to cool for about 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> 3. <NEXT_STEP> Add cranberries and stir to coat. <NEXT_STEP> 4. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate cranberries in syrup overnight or for several hours, stirring a couple times to coat with syrup. <NEXT_STEP> 5. <NEXT_STEP> To make the cupcakes, prepare a cupcake pan with cupcake liners and preheat the oven to 350 F . <NEXT_STEP> 6. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the flour, baking powder and salt in a medium sized bowl and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> 7. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter, incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> 9. <NEXT_STEP> Add half of the dry ingredients to the batter and mix until mostly combined. <NEXT_STEP> 10. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly add the milk and mix until well combined. the cupcakes cool, make the cranberry filling. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the water, sugar and cranberries in a medium saucepan and cook on medium heat. <NEXT_STEP> Allow the cranberries to pop and release their juices. <NEXT_STEP> Let the filling continue to cook for approximately 8-10 minutes, until the mixture thickens. <NEXT_STEP> 14. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer cranberry mixture to a food processor and puree. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside and allow to cool to room temperature. <NEXT_STEP> 15. <NEXT_STEP> While everything is cooling, finish the sparkling cranberries. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the cranberries from the syrup a few at a time and roll in the remaining cup of sugar. <NEXT_STEP> You ll need to roll them a few times and sprinkle the sugar over them to get a full coat of sugar on them. <NEXT_STEP> 16. <NEXT_STEP> Set cranberries aside to dry for about 30 minutes to an hour. <NEXT_STEP> 17. <NEXT_STEP> When the filling has cooled, add the mascarpone cheese and stir until well incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> 18. <NEXT_STEP> When the cupcakes are cool, the filling is ready and cranberries are dry, make the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Place the white chocolate chips in a microwave safe bowl and heat in 10-20 second increments, stirring between each, until white chocolate is melted and smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside to cool a bit. <NEXT_STEP> 19. <NEXT_STEP> In a large mixer bowl, beat the butter until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> 20. <NEXT_STEP> Add the cooled white chocolate in 2-3 batches and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> 21. <NEXT_STEP> Add about half of the powdered sugar and 2 tablespoons of heavy cream and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> 22. <NEXT_STEP> Add remaining powdered sugar and salt and mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> 23. <NEXT_STEP> Add remaining heavy cream as needed to get the right consistency of frosting. <NEXT_STEP> 24. <NEXT_STEP> To put the cupcakes together, use a cupcake corer or knife to remove the centers of the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> 25. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the centers of the cupcakes with the cranberry filling, then top the cupcakes with the white chocolate buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> 26. <NEXT_STEP> Finish off the cupcakes with 2-3 sparkling cranberries and a bit of rosemary. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Sparkling Cranberry White Chocolate Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> red <NEXT_INPUT> <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 cups powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 tbsp apple butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Apple chips or mini snickerdoodles optional <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat oven to 350 F  and prepare a cupcake pan with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> 2. <NEXT_STEP> In a large mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar together until light in color and fluffy, about 3-4 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> 3. <NEXT_STEP> Add sour cream and vanilla extract and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> 4. <NEXT_STEP> Add egg whites in two batches, mixing until well combined after each. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed to be sure all ingredients are well incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> 5. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the flour, baking powder and salt in a separate bowl, set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the apple butter and milk in a small measuring cup. <NEXT_STEP> 6. <NEXT_STEP> Add half of the dry ingredients to the batter and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the apple butter mixture and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add remaining dry ingredients and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed to be sure all ingredients are well incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> 7. <NEXT_STEP> In a small bowl, combine the cinnamon and sugar. <NEXT_STEP> 8. <NEXT_STEP> To fill the cupcake liners, add a little less than a tablespoon of batter to each liner. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle some cinnamon sugar over the batter, covering it. <NEXT_STEP> Add a little more batter to the liner, then another layer of cinnamon sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Finish them off with a little more batter, so the liners are filled about halfway, or just a bit more. <NEXT_STEP> 9. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 17-19 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted comes out with a few crumbs. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the oven and set aside on a cooling rack to cool. <NEXT_STEP> 10. <NEXT_STEP> To make the frosting, combine the butter and shortening and mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> 11. <NEXT_STEP> Add about half of the powdered sugar and the apple butter and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> 12. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining powdered sugar and mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> 13. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the frosting onto the cooled cupcakes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Apple Snickerdoodle Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> lucky <NEXT_INPUT> charm <NEXT_INPUT> cereal <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> marshmallow <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes  <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup Lucky Charms Cereal <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 tsp baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 tsp salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 tbsp unsalted butter room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 tbsp vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 tsp vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup 2 tbsp cereal milk  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 tbsp unsalted butter room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 7 oz marshmallow creme <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup Lucky Charms Cereal marshmallows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups Lucky Charms Cereal chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup unsalted butter room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup shortening <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 cups powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 tsp vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch of salt <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> To make the cereal milk, add the milk and Lucky Charms to a bowl and let sit for 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Strain the milk and discard the cereal. <NEXT_STEP> You ll have a little more milk than you need for the cupcakes, so set the extra aside for the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> 2. <NEXT_STEP> To make the cupcakes, prepare a cupcake pan with cupcake liners and preheat the oven to 350 F . <NEXT_STEP> 3. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the flour, baking powder and salt in a medium sized bowl and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> 4. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter, sugar and oil to a large mixer bowl and beat together until light in color and fluffy, about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Do not skimp on the creaming time. <NEXT_STEP> You should see a noticeable change in the color and texture of the mixture light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> 5. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time, mixing until mostly combined after each. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla extract with the second egg. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed to be sure all ingredients are well incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> 6. <NEXT_STEP> Add half of the dry ingredients to the batter and mix until mostly combined. <NEXT_STEP> 7. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly add the cereal milk and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> The batter might look a little curdled, but that s ok. 8. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining dry ingredients and mix until well combined and smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed to be sure all ingredients are well incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Do not over mix the batter. <NEXT_STEP> 9. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners about 3/4 full and bake for 14-16 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> 10. <NEXT_STEP> Remove cupcakes from the oven and place on a cooling rack to cool. <NEXT_STEP> 11. <NEXT_STEP> To make the filling, add the butter to a mixer bowl and beat until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> 12. <NEXT_STEP> Add about half of the powdered sugar and mix until well combined and smooth. <NEXT_STEP> It may take a few minutes to incorporate, but it will. <NEXT_STEP> 13. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining powdered sugar and mix until well combined and smooth. <NEXT_STEP> 14. <NEXT_STEP> Add the marshmallow cream and stir until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> 15. <NEXT_STEP> Gently fold in the Lucky Charms marshmallows. <NEXT_STEP> 16. <NEXT_STEP> To fill the cupcakes, cut out the centers of the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> You can use a cupcake corer or a knife. <NEXT_STEP> 17. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the centers of the cupcakes with the filling, then spread some additional filling over the top of the cupcake in a thin layer. <NEXT_STEP> You don t need much on top. <NEXT_STEP> 18. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the cupcake over and press it into a bowl of the chopped up Lucky Charms cereal. <NEXT_STEP> Set cupcakes aside. <NEXT_STEP> 19. <NEXT_STEP> To make the frosting, add the butter and shortening to a mixer bowl and beat until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> 20. <NEXT_STEP> Add about half of the powdered sugar and mix until well combined and smooth. <NEXT_STEP> 21. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla extract and salt and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> 22. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining powdered sugar and mix until well combined and smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add some of the left over cereal milk, as needed for the right consistency. <NEXT_STEP> 23. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the frosting onto the cupcakes, leaving the edges of the cupcakes exposed, so you can see the Lucky Charms cereal. <NEXT_STEP> Top each cupcake with a Lucky Charms cereal marshmallow. <NEXT_STEP> 24. <NEXT_STEP> Cupcakes are best if served the same day, so the cereal doesn t get too soft, but will stay moist and tasty for 2-3 days. <STEP_END> Do not skimp on the amount of creaming time. <NEXT_STEP> 3. <NEXT_STEP> Add sour cream and vanilla extract and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> 4. <NEXT_STEP> Add egg whites in two batches, mixing until well combined after each. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed to be sure all ingredients are well incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> 5. <NEXT_STEP> Combine dry ingredients in a separate bowl, then combine the milk and water in a small measuring cup. <NEXT_STEP> 6. <NEXT_STEP> Add half of the dry ingredients to the batter and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the milk <NEXT_STEP> Put the egg yolks in a medium sized bowl and gently beat them together. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> 10. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sugar, cornstarch and milk to a large saucepan and mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> 11. <NEXT_STEP> Cook, stirring continuously, over medium-high heat until mixture begins to thicken and bubble. <NEXT_STEP> 12. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce heat to medium and simmer for 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from heat. <NEXT_STEP> 13. <NEXT_STEP> Add a little bit of milk mixture to the egg yolks and whisk together, then add egg mixture to milk mixture. <NEXT_STEP> This process ensures that you don t cook the egg yolks. <NEXT_STEP> 14. <NEXT_STEP> Place the pan back on the heat and bring to a light boil. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to boil for 2 minutes, stirring continuously. <NEXT_STEP> 15. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from heat and add butter and vanilla extract. <NEXT_STEP> Stir until smooth, then set aside to cool to room temperature. <NEXT_STEP> 16. <NEXT_STEP> To make the frosting, beat the butter and shortening together in a large mixer bowl until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> 17. <NEXT_STEP> Add about half of the powdered sugar and mix until smooth and well combined. <NEXT_STEP> 18. <NEXT_STEP> Add 3 tablespoons of caramel sauce and and mix until combined. <NEXT_STEP> 19. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining powdered sugar and mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> 20. well combined after each. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed to be sure all ingredients are well incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> 5. <NEXT_STEP> Combine dry ingredients in a separate 14. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining orange juice as needed for the right consistency of frosting and mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> 15. <NEXT_STEP> Color the frosting as desired, then pipe the frosting shortening <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 cups powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 4 tbsp champagne <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 2 Oranges sliced <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> To make the cranberries, bring 1/2 cup sugar and the water to a simmer in a saucepan. <NEXT_STEP> Simmer until sugar is completely dissolved. <NEXT_STEP> 2. <NEXT_STEP> Pour simple syrup into a heatproof bowl and allow to cool for about 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> 3. <NEXT_STEP> Add cranberries and stir to coat. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate cranberries in syrup overnight, stirring a couple times to coat with syrup. <NEXT_STEP> 4. <NEXT_STEP> To make the cupcakes, preheat oven to 350 F  and prepare a cupcake pan with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> 5. <NEXT_STEP> In a large mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar together until light in color and <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 5 tbsp milk or water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 oz semi sweet chocolate chips <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 tbsp heavy whipping cream <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Combine the peanut butter, butter and vanilla extract with a mixer until combined. <NEXT_STEP> 2. <NEXT_STEP> Add 1 cup of the powdered sugar and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> 3. <NEXT_STEP> Add additional powdered sugar until the mixture is at the consistency where you can create a ball that will hold it s shape and stay on a toothpick. <NEXT_STEP> 4. <NEXT_STEP> Create balls of about 1 tablespoon each. <NEXT_STEP> You should get about 16 balls. <NEXT_STEP> 5. <NEXT_STEP> Melt the chocolate according to package directions and dip each peanut butter ball into the chocolate using a toothpick. <NEXT_STEP> Set balls and 3 tablespoons of milk or water and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> 17. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining powdered sugar and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> 18. <NEXT_STEP> Add additional water or milk, as needed, to get the right consistency of frosting. <NEXT_STEP> 19. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the frosting onto the cooled cupcakes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Peanut Butter Chocolate Buckeye water, cocoa powder and vanilla extract to another medium-sized bowl and combine. <NEXT_STEP> Mixture will be thick. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> 4. <NEXT_STEP> In a large mixer bowl, cream the butter and vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Stir until smooth, then set aside to cool too room temperature. <NEXT_STEP> 7. <NEXT_STEP> Once cooled, beat the heavy whipping cream and powdered sugar until stiff out of the cupcakes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Banana Cream Pie Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> lemon <NEXT_INPUT> blueberry <NEXT_INPUT> zest <NEXT_INPUT> juice oz cup cream cheese <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 5 cups powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tbsp molasses <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 2 tbsp milk or water if needed <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat oven to 350 <NEXT_STEP> Fill cupcake liners about half way. <NEXT_STEP> Bake 18-20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to cool for 1-2 minutes, then remove to cooling rack to finish cooling. <NEXT_STEP> Place 1/2 cup of It ll boil and bubble up. <NEXT_STEP> Set caramel aside to cool. <NEXT_STEP> Cream remaining 1/2 cup butter and cream cheese until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add 3 cups powdered sugar and 1 tbsp milk or water to butter mixture and beat until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Pour caramel into icing and mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add another 1-2 cups of powdered sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Add molasses and milk or water, if needed, to reach desired icing consistency. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Gingerbread Cupcakes with Caramel Molasses Cream Cheese Icing <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> graham . <NEXT_STEP> . <NEXT_STEP> Whisk constantly until sugar is dissolved and whites are warm, to between 120 and 140 degrees on a thermometer, about 4-6 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from heat. <NEXT_STEP> and mix until well combined and smooth. <NEXT_STEP> 12. <NEXT_STEP> Add 2 tablespoons of raspberry puree and mix until well combined 13. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining powdered sugar and mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> 14. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining raspberry puree as needed to get the right consistency of frosting and flavor. <NEXT_STEP> 15. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the frosting onto the cupcakes. <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 14 Heart candies <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> To make the strawberry truffle filling, put the white chocolate chips in a medium sized bowl. <NEXT_STEP> 2. <NEXT_STEP> Put the strawberry extract and heavy whipping cream in a microwave safe measuring cup or bowl and microwave until it begins to boil. <NEXT_STEP> 3. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the cream over the white chocolate chips and allow to sit for 2-3 minutes, then whisk until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> If needed, microwave the mixture for 10-20 more seconds, then whisk until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> 4. <NEXT_STEP> Add a very small amount of pink gel icing color and stir until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add a small amount more, if needed, to get the right shade of pink. <NEXT_STEP> Keep in mind that once you whip this filling later, it ll lighten a bit, so make it a touch darker than you ll end up wanting it to be in the end. <NEXT_STEP> 5. <NEXT_STEP> Set the ganache in the fridge to firm up, about 2-3 hours. <NEXT_STEP> 6. <NEXT_STEP> To make the cupcakes, prepare a cupcake pan with cupcake liners and preheat the oven to 350 F . <NEXT_STEP> 7. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the flour, baking powder and salt in a medium sized bowl and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> 8. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter, sugar and oil to a large mixer bowl and beat together until light in color and fluffy, about 2-3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Do not skimp on the creaming time. <NEXT_STEP> 9. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time, mixing until mostly combined after each. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla extract with the second egg. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed to be sure all ingredients are well incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> 10. <NEXT_STEP> Add half of the dry ingredients to the batter and mix until mostly combined. <NEXT_STEP> 11. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly add the milk and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> The batter might look a little curdled, but that s ok. 12. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining dry ingredients and mix until well combined and smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed to be sure all ingredients are well incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Do not over mix the batter. <NEXT_STEP> 13. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners about 3/4 full and bake for 14-16 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> 14. <NEXT_STEP> Remove cupcakes from the oven and place on a cooling rack to cool. <NEXT_STEP> 15. <NEXT_STEP> While the cupcakes cool, finish the filling. <NEXT_STEP> Put the chilled mixture in the bowl of a mixer and whip with the whisk attachment until soft peaks form, about 5-7 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> You ll notice the mixture lighten in color. <NEXT_STEP> 16. <NEXT_STEP> Cut out the centers of the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> You can use a cupcake corer or a knife. <NEXT_STEP> 17. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the centers of the cupcakes with the filling. <NEXT_STEP> Set the cupcakes in the fridge while you make the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> 18. <NEXT_STEP> To make the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Place the white chocolate chips in a microwave safe bowl and heat in 10-20 second increments, stirring between each, until white chocolate is melted and smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside to cool a bit. <NEXT_STEP> 19. <NEXT_STEP> In a large mixer bowl, beat the butter until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> 20. <NEXT_STEP> Add the cooled white chocolate in 2-3 batches and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> 21. <NEXT_STEP> Add about half of the powdered sugar and 2 tablespoons of heavy cream and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> 22. <NEXT_STEP> Add remaining powdered sugar and salt and mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> 23. <NEXT_STEP> Add remaining heavy cream as needed to get the right consistency of frosting. <NEXT_STEP> 24. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the frosting roughly in half. <NEXT_STEP> Add some pink gel icing color to one half of the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> 25. <NEXT_STEP> To frost the cupcakes with the colored swirl, <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Strawberry Truffle Cupcakes <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 tbsp sour cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tsp baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 tbsp milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tbsp water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 egg yolks <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 tbsp sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup mascarpone cheese <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup heavy whipping cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/2 tbsp warm water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tbsp instant espresso coffee granules <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup Kahlua <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup unsalted butter room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 cups powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/2 tbsp Kahlua or espresso <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup mascarpone cheese room temperature <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat oven to 350 degrees and prepare a cupcake pan with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Beat butter and sugar until light in color and fluffy, about 2-3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add vanilla extract and sour cream and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add egg whites in two batches, mixing until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Combine dry ingredients in another bowl, then combine milk and water in another bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Add half of the dry ingredients to the batter and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the milk mixture and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add remaining dry ingredients and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Fill cupcake liners about halfway. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 15-17 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted comes out with a few crumbs. <NEXT_STEP> Remove cupcakes from oven and allow to cool for 2-3 minutes, then remove to have a double boiler, you can use a metal mixing bowl set over a pot with simmering water in it. <NEXT_STEP> Cook for about 6-8 minutes, with heat on low, stirring constantly, or until mixture is light in color and sugar is dissolved. <NEXT_STEP> If mixture starts to get too thick and a darker yellow, it s overcooked. <NEXT_STEP> When done, whip yolks with mixer until they thicken and yellow a bit. <NEXT_STEP> Fold mascarpone cheese into whipped yolks. <NEXT_STEP> Add heavy whipping cream to another mixer bowl and whip until stiff peaks form, about 5-7 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Fold whipped cream into mascarpone mixture. <NEXT_STEP> In another small bowl, combine warm water, espresso and Kahlua. <NEXT_STEP> Once cupcakes are cool, cut out the centers. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Tiramisu <NEXT_STEP> As the cream starts to thicken, add the powdered sugar and extracts. <NEXT_STEP> Whip until stiff peaks form, for a total whipping time of about 5-7 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Make sure not to over mix. <NEXT_STEP> It quickly goes from smooth whipped cream to curdled whipped cream, so watch it closely. <NEXT_STEP> To make each cupcake, place one brownie brittle square on a plate, or <INGREDIENT_START> 4 cups sweetened coconut flakes <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 tsp cream of tarter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tsp coconut extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 large egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 tbsp unsalted butter room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 tbsp sour cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tbsp coconut extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tsp baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 tsp salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 tbsp milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tbsp water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 oz semi sweet chocolate chips <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 1/2 tbsp heavy whipping cream <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> To toast the coconut, preheat the oven to 400 F . <NEXT_STEP> 2. <NEXT_STEP> Spread the coconut out over a cookie sheet lined with parchment paper. <NEXT_STEP> Toast it in the oven until lightly browned, tossing occasionally. <NEXT_STEP> It should take a total of about 7-10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> 3. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the coconut from the oven and set aside to cool. <NEXT_STEP> 4. <NEXT_STEP> To make the cupcakes, turn the oven down to 350 F  and prepare a cupcake pan with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> 5. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the butter and sugar until light in color and fluffy, about 3-4 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> 6. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sour cream and coconut extract and mix until well remaining dry ingredients and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> 10. <NEXT_STEP> Fill cupcake liners about halfway. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 15-17 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted comes out with a few crumbs. <NEXT_STEP> 11. <NEXT_STEP> Remove cupcakes from oven and allow to cool for 2-3 minutes, then remove to cooling rack to finish cooling. <NEXT_STEP> 12. <NEXT_STEP> While cupcakes cool, make the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> To make the meringue, combine the sugar, cream of tartar, coconut extract and egg whites in a large mixer bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Place the bowl over a saucepan or pot of simmering water. <NEXT_STEP> You can also use a double boiler. <NEXT_STEP> 14. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk constantly until sugar is dissolved and whites are warm, to 160 degrees on a thermometer, about 4-6 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from heat. <NEXT_STEP> 15. <NEXT_STEP> Using the whisk attachment, beat the egg white mixture on low speed, gradually increasing to high, until stiff, glossy peaks form, 5 to 7 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> 16. <NEXT_STEP> Fold 3 cups of the toasted coconut into the meringue. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> 17. <NEXT_STEP> Put the chocolate chips for the ganache in a medium heat proof bowl. <NEXT_STEP> 18. <NEXT_STEP> Heat the heavy whipping cream until it begins to boil, then pour it over the chocolate chips. <NEXT_STEP> 19. <NEXT_STEP> Allow the chocolate and cream to sit for 3-5 minutes, then whisk until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> 20. <NEXT_STEP> Spread a small amount of chocolate ganache over the tops of each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> 21. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the frosting onto the top of the cupcakes in a mound. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Coconut Macaroon Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> oreo <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> add <NEXT_INPUT> milk, as needed, and beating until smooth and a nice consistency for piping. <NEXT_STEP> 15. <NEXT_STEP> To decorate the cupcakes, fit a piping bag with a large round piping tip  and pipe frosting onto cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Finish cupcakes off with an Oreo. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Oreo Chocolate Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pineapple <NEXT_INPUT> coconut peeled carrots in a steamer basket  set over the boiling water. <NEXT_STEP> Cover and steam the carrots until very tender, about 10-15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> 2. <NEXT_STEP> Put the warm carrots into a food processor and puree. <NEXT_STEP> You should end up with a little less than a cup of carrot puree. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside to cool. <NEXT_STEP> 3. <NEXT_STEP> Preheat the oven to 350 F  and line a 7. <NEXT_STEP> To make the cake batter, cream the butter and sugar on medium speed in a large mixer bowl until light in color and fluffy, 3-4 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Don t skimp on the creaming time. <NEXT_STEP> Add another tablespoon of cupcake batter and another half tablespoon of cheesecake batter. <NEXT_STEP> 17. <NEXT_STEP> Top the cupcakes with another tablespoon of cupcake batter, then swirl everything around with a toothpick. <NEXT_STEP> 18. <NEXT_STEP> Bake the cupcakes for 16-18 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out with a few crumbs. <NEXT_STEP> 19. <NEXT_STEP> Remove cupcakes from the oven and allow to cool for 2-3 minutes, then remove to a cooling rack to finish cooling. <NEXT_STEP> The centers may fall a bit as they cool, which is ok. <NEXT_STEP> It s from the cooling of the cheesecake layers. <NEXT_STEP> 20. <NEXT_STEP> To make the frosting, beat the cream cheese and butter together in a large mixer bowl until well combined and egg, vanilla and milk and mix on medium speed just until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Do not over mix. <NEXT_STEP> Add 3 pieces of peach to the bottom of the cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Fill cupcake liners about 3/4 of the way full with batter. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle some additional cinnamon on top of batter, then swirl with a toothpick. <NEXT_STEP> Add another 3 pieces of peaches to the top of the batter. <NEXT_STEP> Bake 19-21 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> . <NEXT_STEP> Allow to cool for 1-2 minutes, then remove to cooling rack to finish cooling. <NEXT_STEP> . <NEXT_STEP> To make whipped cream, whip heavy whipping cream until it begins to thicken. <NEXT_STEP> . <NEXT_STEP> Add powdered sugar and vanilla extract and whip until stiff peaks form. <NEXT_STEP> . <NEXT_STEP> Ice cupcakes with the whipped cream and a sprinkle of cinnamon. <NEXT_STEP> . <NEXT_STEP> Store cupcakes in the fridge until ready to serve. <NEXT_STEP> Can be served warm by reheating in the microwave for about 10 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Makes about 12 cupcakes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Peach Cobbler Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> caramel <NEXT_INPUT> brown <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> cream <NEXT_INPUT> foam <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12-14 Cupcakes  <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 3/4 cup salted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 2/3 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup brown sugar loosely packed <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 tsp baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup sour cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup 3 tbsp milk  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup salted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup light brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 cups powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 4 tbsp milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 14 caramel cream candies <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup vegetable shortening <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/4 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 tsp vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/8 cup water <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Slice butter into tablespoon sized pieces. <NEXT_STEP> Heat butter in a light colored saucepan on medium heat until melted, whisking while it melts. <NEXT_STEP> After the butter melts, it will foam and bubble. <NEXT_STEP> Keep whisking. <NEXT_STEP> As the foam starts to fade, the butter will start to brown and have a nutty smell. <NEXT_STEP> Once brown, remove it from heat and pour into another bowl to cool. <NEXT_STEP> The butter can go from brown to burned very quickly, so watch it carefully. <NEXT_STEP> Preheat oven to 350 degrees. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk together flour, sugar, baking soda and baking powder in a large mixing bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Add egg whites, vanilla, sour cream and milk and mix on medium speed until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly add brown butter while mixing. <NEXT_STEP> Fill cupcake liners a little more than half way. <NEXT_STEP> . <NEXT_STEP> Bake 18-20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> . <NEXT_STEP> Allow to cool for 1-2 minutes, then remove to cooling rack to finish cooling. <NEXT_STEP> Note You may notice little bits of butter in the batter, but that s ok. <NEXT_STEP> They will melt into the cupcake as they bake. <NEXT_STEP> Melt butter in a saucepan. <NEXT_STEP> Add brown sugar and heavy cream and whisk constantly over medium heat until sugar is dissolved. <NEXT_STEP> Bring to a boil and allow to boil for 3 minutes, no more. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from heat and allow to cool for about 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer caramel to mixer bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Mix in powdered sugar, beginning with 3 cups and increasing from there until you get the desired consistency. <NEXT_STEP> Add milk to thin out the icing a bit. <NEXT_STEP> Allow icing to cool fully. <NEXT_STEP> Icing will be thick. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the shortening until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add the powdered sugar, vanilla extract and water and mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Filling will me thick. <NEXT_STEP> Use a cupcake corer to remove the center of the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> If you don t have a corer, use a knife. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon filling into the hole in the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Ice the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Top cupcakes with caramel cream candies. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Caramel Cream Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> nutella <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12-14 Cupcakes  <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 8 oz white chocolate chips <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 tbsp Amaretto <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 tbsp heavy whipping cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 tbsp unsalted butter room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 tbsp sour cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 tsp almond extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tsp baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 tsp salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 tbsp milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tbsp water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup salted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup shortening <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 cups powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 tsp almond extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 4 tbsp water or milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Sliced almonds broken into pieces <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> To make the ganache, put the white chocolate chips in a medium sized bowl. <NEXT_STEP> 2. <NEXT_STEP> Put the amaretto and heavy whipping cream in a microwave safe measuring cup or bowl and microwave until it begins to boil. <NEXT_STEP> 3. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the cream over the white chocolate chips and allow to sit for 2-3 minutes, then whisk until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> If needed, microwave the mixture for 10-20 more seconds, then whisk until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> 4. <NEXT_STEP> Set the ganache in the fridge to firm up, about 2-3 hours. <NEXT_STEP> 5. <NEXT_STEP> To make the cupcakes, preheat oven to 350 F  and prepare a cupcake pan with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> 6. <NEXT_STEP> In a large mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar together until light in color and fluffy, about 3-4 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Do not skimp on the amount of creaming time. <NEXT_STEP> 7. <NEXT_STEP> Add sour cream and almond extract and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> 8. <NEXT_STEP> Add egg whites in two batches, mixing until well combined after each. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed to be sure all ingredients are well incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> 9. <NEXT_STEP> Combine dry ingredients in a separate bowl, then combine the milk and water in a small measuring cup. <NEXT_STEP> 10. <NEXT_STEP> Add half of the dry ingredients to the batter and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the milk mixture and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add remaining dry ingredients and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed to be sure all ingredients are well incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> 11. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners about halfway. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 15-17 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted comes out with a few crumbs. <NEXT_STEP> 12. <NEXT_STEP> Remove cupcakes from oven and allow to cool for 2-3 minutes, then remove to cooling rack to finish cooling. <NEXT_STEP> 13. <NEXT_STEP> While the cupcakes cool, finish the ganache. <NEXT_STEP> Put the ganache in the bowl of a mixer and whip with the whisk attachment until soft peaks form, about 5-7 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> You ll notice the ganache lighten in color. <NEXT_STEP> 14. <NEXT_STEP> Cut out the centers of the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> You can use a cupcake corer or a knife. <NEXT_STEP> 15. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the centers of the cupcakes with the white chocolate ganache. <NEXT_STEP> Set the cupcakes in the fridge while you make the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> 16. <NEXT_STEP> To make the frosting, combine the butter and shortening with a mixer until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> 17. <NEXT_STEP> Add about half of the powdered sugar and mix until smooth and well combined. <NEXT_STEP> 18. <NEXT_STEP> Add 3 tablespoons of water or milk and the almond extract to the frosting and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> 19. <NEXT_STEP> Add remaining powdered sugar and mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add additional water or milk as needed to get the right consistency. <NEXT_STEP> 20. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the frosting onto the cupcakes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Almond Amaretto Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/2 tsp baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 tsp salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup unsalted butter room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 tbsp cups powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tbsp vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 7 tbsp water or milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Salt to taste <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Violet get icing color <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Cornflower blue gel icing color <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Sprinkles  <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Prepare three 8 inch cake pans with parchment paper circles in the bottom and grease the sides. <NEXT_STEP> Preheat oven to 350 F . <NEXT_STEP> Combine the flour, baking powder and salt in a medium sized bowl and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter, sugar, oil and vanilla extract to a large mixer bowl and beat together until light in color and fluffy, about 3-4 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Do not skimp on the creaming time. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time, mixing until mostly combined after each. oven and allow to cool for about 2-3 minutes, then remove to cooling racks to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> To make the frosting, beat the butter until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly add half of the powdered sugar and mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla extract, 4-5 tablespoons of water or milk and salt and mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly add the remaining powdered sugar and mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add additional water or milk, as needed to get the right consistency of frosting. <NEXT_STEP> To put the cake together, use a large serrated knife to remove the domes from the top of the cakes so that they re flat. <NEXT_STEP> These cakes don t have a large dome, but <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Moist Vanilla Layer Cake Recipe <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> butter room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup shortening  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 cups powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 3 tbsp water or heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Salt to taste  <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Combine the butter and shortening in a large mixer bowl and beat until smooth and creamy. <NEXT_STEP> Add about half of the powdered sugar and mix until smooth and well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla extract and 1 tablespoon of water or cream and mix until smooth and well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining powdered sugar and mix until smooth and well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add more water or cream until desired consistency is reached, then add salt to taste. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Vanilla Buttercream Frosting <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> guinness <NEXT_INPUT> beer <NEXT_INPUT> buttercream <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 24 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START>  1 bottle Guinness Stout  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1/2 cup milk  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1/2 cup vegetable oil  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 tablespoon pure vanilla extract  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  3 large eggs  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  3/4 cup sour cream  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  3/4 cup unsweetened cocoa powder  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  2 cups granulated sugar  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  2 1/2 cups all purpose flour the oven to 350 F. muffin tins. <NEXT_STEP> Bake 25 minutes, until risen and set in the middle but still soft and tender. <NEXT_STEP> Cool before turning out of the tins. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe or spread the frosting onto the cooled cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, beat the butter on medium high speed for 6 7 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on low speed, slowly add in the salt and powdered sugar, and continue beating until the sugar is fully incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Add in vanilla and cream or milk and mix on low speed until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the mixer back up to medium high speed and beat the buttercream for an additional 6 7 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> If the buttercream is too thick, add in a bit of milk, one teaspoon at a time until you reach the desired consistency. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Guinness Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> marshmallow <NEXT_INPUT> treat <NEXT_INPUT> pumpkin <NEXT_INPUT> spice <NEXT_INPUT>
