valentine <NEXT_INPUT> beating <NEXT_INPUT> funfetti <NEXT_INPUT> speed <NEXT_INPUT> milk <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 18-20 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START>  2 1/4 cups cake flour  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 tablespoon baking powder  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1/2 teaspoon kosher salt  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 1/4 cups whole milk room temperature  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  4 large egg whites room temperature  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 stick unsalted butter at room temperature  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 1/2 cups sugar  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1/2 cup sprinkles  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  3 sticks unsalted butter softened  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  Tiny pinch fine sea salt  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 pounds powdered sugar sifted  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 tablespoon clear vanilla extract  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  2 3 tablespoons heavy cream or milk  <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Center a rack in the oven to 350 degrees F. Line cupcake pan with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder and salt. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium bowl, whisk together the milk and egg whites. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, or with a hand mixer, beat the butter and sugar at medium speed for 3 minutes, or until the butter and sugar are very light. <NEXT_STEP> Add in the vanilla extract and one third of the flour mixture, still beating on medium speed. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in half of the milk egg mixture, then beat in half of the remaining dry ingredients until well incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Add the rest of the milk and eggs, beating until the batter fully incorporated and smooth, then add the last of the dry ingredients. <NEXT_STEP> Once ingredients are thoroughly incorporated, give the batter a good 1 minute beating to ensure that it is thoroughly mixed and well aerated. <NEXT_STEP> Use a rubber spatula to fold the sprinkles into the batter. <NEXT_STEP> Using a large scoop , distribute the batter between 18 muffin wells, filling each well 2 3 full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 18 24 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the centers come out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Cool on wire rack. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, beat the butter on medium high speed for 6 7 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on low speed, slowly add in the salt and powdered sugar, and continue beating until the sugar is fully incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Add in vanilla and cream or milk and mix on low speed until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the mixer back up to medium high speed and beat the buttercream for an additional 6 7 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> If the buttercream is too thick, add in a bit of milk, one teaspoon at a time until you reach the desired consistency. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Homemade Funfetti Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> strawberry <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> frosting <NEXT_INPUT> mixer <NEXT_INPUT> easy <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 24 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START>  1 package French Vanilla cake mix  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1/2 package instant vanilla pudding mix  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 cup Greek strawberry yogurt  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  3/4 cup vegetable oil  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1/2 cup water  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  4 eggs lightly beaten  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 cup diced fresh strawberries  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  4 sticks unsalted butter room temperature  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1.5 pounds confectioners sugar sifted  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  About 8 medium fresh strawberries pureed  <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line muffin tin with paper liners or spray with non stick cooking spray. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer, fitted with the paddle attachment, or with a hand mixer in a large bowl, beat together the cake and pudding mixes, Greek yogurt, oil, water, eggs and vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Beat for about two minutes on medium speed until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in diced strawberries Using a large cookie scoop, distribute the batter between 24 muffin wells about 3 tablespoons of batter per well. <NEXT_STEP> Bake in preheated oven for 18 22 minutes or until the tops of the cakes spring back when lightly touched. <NEXT_STEP> Allow cupcakes to cool inside muffin tins for about 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> The cupcakes may develop a slight divot in the center as they cool, but no worries, you ll cover that with delicious frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Remove cupcakes from muffin tins and allow to fully cool on a wire rack. <NEXT_STEP> Once cupcakes are cool, prepare your frosting. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, beat the butter on medium high speed for about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the mixer down to low speed and gradually add in the confectioners sugar until it is completely incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Add in vanilla and 3 tablespoons of the strawberry puree, mix until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Turn off the mixer and check the buttercream for taste and texture. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually add in the last 2 tablespoons of strawberry puree until you reach the desired level of strawberry flavor. <NEXT_STEP> Please note that adding more than the recommended 5 tablespoons could result in a thinner frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the mixer back up to medium high speed and beat the mixture for about 3 4 minutes or until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the frosting onto the cooled cupcakes and if desired, garnish with fresh strawberries. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Easy Strawberry Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> marshmallow <NEXT_INPUT> campfire <NEXT_INPUT> treat <NEXT_INPUT> swirlers <NEXT_INPUT> buttered <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 servings <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START>  3 tablespoons unsalted butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 package Campfire Egg Swirlers OR Campfire Mini Fruit Marshmallows  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  5 cups crispy rice cereal  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 cup unsalted butter room temperature  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  3 cups powdered sugar sifted  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 2 tablespoons milk as needed  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  sprinkles edible grass and additional Campfire Marshmallows for topping  <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the Marshmallow Treat CupcakesSpray the wells of a 12 cup standard cupcake pan with nonstick cooking spray. <NEXT_STEP> In large pan, melt butter over low heat. <NEXT_STEP> Add the marshmallows to the pan and stir until completely melted. <NEXT_STEP> If using Campfire Egg Swirlers this will take a little patience due to their size. <NEXT_STEP> To decrease the melting time, you can cut the marshmallows into smaller pieces before add them to the pan. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually add crispy rice cereal stirring until well coated. <NEXT_STEP> Use a buttered spatula or clean, buttered hands to firmly press the mixture into the wells of the prepared cupcake pan. <NEXT_STEP> You ll need to work quickly, so the mixture doesn t set up in the pan you melted the marshmallows in. <NEXT_STEP> Cool for about 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove marshmallow treat cupcakes from the pan and prepare the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> For the Buttercream Frosting In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, or in a large bowl with an electric mixer, beat butter on medium high speed for about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on low speed, slowly add in powdered sugar, and continue beating until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add in vanilla, and 1 teaspoon of milk. <NEXT_STEP> Mix on low speed until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Beat at high speed until frosting is smooth and fluffy about 4 5 more minutes. <NEXT_STEP> If your frosting is too thick, gradually add a little more milk, 1 teaspoon at a time until you reach the desired consistency. <NEXT_STEP> Spread or pipe frosting onto cooled marshmallow treat cupcakes and top with colorful sprinkles, edible grass and additional Campfire Marshmallows <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Marshmallow Treat Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sparkling <NEXT_INPUT> heart <NEXT_INPUT> cupidmallows <NEXT_INPUT> marshmallow <NEXT_INPUT> melt <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 24 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START>  1 package devil s food cake mix  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 package instant chocolate pudding mix  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  3/4 cup sour cream  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  3/4 cup vegetable oil  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  3 large eggs lightly beaten  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1/2 cup warm water  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  2/3 cup mini chocolate chips optional  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  24 Campfire CupidMallows  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1/2 cup candy melts  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  sparkling sugar  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  3 sticks unsalted butter softened  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 pounds powdered sugar sifted  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  2 teaspoons clear vanilla extract  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  2 3 tablespoons heavy cream or milk  <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat oven to 350 F. Line 2 12 cup standard muffin tins with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer, fitted with the paddle attachment, or with a hand mixer in a large bowl, beat together the cake and pudding mixes, sour cream, oil, eggs, vanilla and water. <NEXT_STEP> Beat for about two minutes on medium speed until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in chocolate chips. <NEXT_STEP> Be sure to scrape down the sides of the bowl and give them batter one final mix. <NEXT_STEP> Using a large cookie scoop, distribute the batter between 24 muffin wells about 3 tablespoons of batter per well. <NEXT_STEP> Bake in preheated oven for 18 22 minutes or until the tops of the cakes spring back when lightly touched. <NEXT_STEP> Allow cupcakes to cool inside muffin tins for about 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove cupcakes from muffin tins and allow to fully cool on a wire rack. <NEXT_STEP> Once the cupcakes have cooled, prepare the sparkling hearts and buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. <NEXT_STEP> Melt the candy melts according to package directions. <NEXT_STEP> Dip one side of the heart into the melts and use an offset spatula to remove any excess melted candy, immediately sprinkle the heart with sparkling sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Place the dipped heart on prepared sheet and allow the candy to harden. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with remaining CupidMallows. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, beat the butter on medium high speed for five minutes. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on low speed, slowly add in the powdered sugar, and continue beating until well blended. <NEXT_STEP> Add in vanilla and mix on low speed until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the mixer back up to medium high speed and beat the buttercream for an additional 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> If the buttercream is too thick, add in a bit of milk, one teaspoon at a time until you reach the desired consistency. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe buttecream onto cooled cupcakes and top with sparkling hearts. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Valentine Marshmallow Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> marshmallow <NEXT_INPUT> gingerbread <NEXT_INPUT> Lemonade Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> bunny <NEXT_INPUT> butt <NEXT_INPUT> coconut <NEXT_INPUT> buttercream <NEXT_INPUT> beating <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 20 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START>  2 1/4 cups cake flour  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 tablespoon baking powder  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1/2 teaspoon salt  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 1/4 cups whole milk room temperature  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  4 large egg whites room temperature  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 stick unsalted butter at room temperature  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 1/2 cups sugar  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  seeds scraped from one vanilla bean  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  3 sticks unsalted butter softened  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 pounds powdered sugar sifted  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  2 teaspoons clear vanilla extract  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  2 3 tablespoons heavy cream or milk  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 cup shredded sweetened coconut  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  8 vanilla candy melt wafers  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  24 Campfire Mini Marshmallows  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  bunny feet decorations  <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat oven to 350 F. Line cupcake pan with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder and salt. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium bowl, whisk together the milk and egg whites. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, or with a hand mixer, beat the butter, sugar and vanilla bean seeds at medium speed for 3 minutes, or until the butter and sugar are very light. <NEXT_STEP> Add in the vanilla extract and one third of the flour mixture, still beating on medium speed. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in half of the milk egg mixture, then beat in half of the remaining package directions. <NEXT_STEP> Dip half of each mini marshmallow into the melted candy melts and then dip in coconut to create fluffy bunny tails. <NEXT_STEP> Use the reserved buttercream to adhere the bunny tails and bunny feet onto the coconut coated cupcakes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Bunny Butt Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> banana <NEXT_INPUT> cheese bottomed pan and spread evenly. <NEXT_STEP> Heat over medium low heat, watching constantly and carefully. <NEXT_STEP> The sugar will begin to liquefy along the edges first. <NEXT_STEP> Watch it carefully as it liquefies, using a high heat spatula to break up any clumps. <NEXT_STEP> When it has liquefied completely and resembles a shiny penny in color, remove from heat. <NEXT_STEP> Temperature should be about 340 to 350 degrees Fahrenheit. <NEXT_STEP> Pour evenly onto the prepared parchment paper and sprinkle generously with sea salt flakes. <NEXT_STEP> The sugar will have hardened in about 5 minutes, at which point you can crush it up and sprinkle it on top of the cupcakes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Gingerbread Icebox Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> temperature  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1/2 teaspoon orange extract  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  3 tablespoons orange juice  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 1/2 tablespoons orange zest  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1/2 cup buttermilk  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 cup white rice flour  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1/3 cup potato starch  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  2 tablespoons 2 teaspoons tapioca flour / starch  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1/2 teaspoon xanthan gum  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  If you need these cupcakes to be gluten free make sure all your ingredients are certified gluten free.  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  6 tablespoons unsalted butter softened  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  4 ounces cream cheese  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  pinch of salt  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 1/2 cups powdered sugar  <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat oven to 375 F. Line a muffin pan with 12 muffin liners. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium mixing bowl, stir together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a large mixing bowl using an electric hand mixer or a stand mixer, beat the butter and sugar at medium speed until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs, orange extract, vanilla extract, orange juice and orange zest. <NEXT_STEP> Beat on medium until no lumps of butter remain. <NEXT_STEP> Gently fold in half of the flour mixture until combined, followed by 1 4 cup of buttermilk, the remaining flour mixture, on a wire rack before frosting. <NEXT_STEP> To make the frosting, beat the butter on high speed until fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the cream cheese, vanilla extract and salt and beat until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually beat in the powdered sugar on low. <NEXT_STEP> If you add all the sugar at once, the frosting may turn out runny. <NEXT_STEP> Frost the cooled cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Store unfrosted cupcakes at room temperature for 1 day and refrigerate frosted cupcakes for up to 2 days. <NEXT_STEP> Let come to room temperature before serving. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Orange Creamsicle cream  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  2 tablespoons honey  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  maraschino cherries optional  <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 F. Line 24 standard muffin cups with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment, or in a large bowl with an electric mixer combine the Coca Cola , milk, vegetable oil, and vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on low speed, beat in the eggs, one at a time. <NEXT_STEP> Add in sour cream, mix until fully incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the cocoa, sugar, flour, and baking soda. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually mix the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> The batter will be thin. <NEXT_STEP> Evenly divide batter amongst the prepared muffin wells. <NEXT_STEP> Bake 20 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove pan to wire rack. <NEXT_STEP> Cool completely before removing from muffin tins. <NEXT_STEP> slowly add in powdered sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Once the powdered sugar is fully incorporated, beat the butter and sugar on medium speed for an additional 5 minutes Add in vanilla, and maraschino cherry juice. <NEXT_STEP> Blend on low speed until moistened. <NEXT_STEP> Beat at medium high speed until frosting is smooth and fluffy about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe frosting onto cooled cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> In a small saucepan over medium heat, warm the heavy cream until very hot, but not boiling. <NEXT_STEP> Place chocolate in a heat safe bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the hot cream over the chocolate and allow it to sit for about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the cream and chocolate until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk in the honey and vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to cool for about 5 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Do not let the glaze sit for too long or it will harden up before you spoon it over the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon the glaze on the tops of the frosted cupcakes, allowing it to drip down the sides a little bit. <NEXT_STEP> Don t add too much glaze or it will drip all over your liners. <NEXT_STEP> If desired, top each cupcake with a stemmed maraschino cherry. <NEXT_STEP> Store cupcakes in the refrigerator. <NEXT_STEP> Remove them to room temperature one hour before serving. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Coca-Cola Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pudding coconut <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> chunk <NEXT_INPUT> samoa <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 16 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START>  1 1/2 cups sweetened shredded coconut  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  3/4 cup packed dark brown sugar  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  2/3 cup whipping cream  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  7 tablespoons unsalted butter cut into 7 chunks  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 teaspoon vanilla extract  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  3/8 teaspoon salt  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 cup coconut flour  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1/2 teaspoon baking soda  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1/4 teaspoon salt  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  2/3 cup unsalted butter melted  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 cup 2 tablespoons packed dark brown sugar  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  8 large eggs room temperature  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1/2 cup whole milk  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  4 teaspoons vanilla extract  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  3/4 cup semi sweet chopped chocolate or chocolate chips  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  6 tablespoons whipping cream or heavy cream  <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 F. Prepare two muffin pans with 16 muffin liners. <NEXT_STEP> Place the coconut on a rimmed pan and toast for 5 8 minutes or until lightly browned. <NEXT_STEP> Keep a close eye on it as it burns quickly and stir after every 3 4 minutes to ensure even browning. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the oven and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Prepare the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium mixing bowl, stir together the coconut flour, baking soda and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the beater blade, beat the melted butter, brown sugar, eggs, milk and vanilla together until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the dry mixture to the wet and beat at medium speed until no lumps remain. <NEXT_STEP> Fill each muffin liner with slightly less than 1 3 cup of batter. <NEXT_STEP> The liners should be about 4 5 full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center of a cupcake comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Let the cupcakes cool for 5 minutes in the pan and then remove the cupcakes to a wire rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Once the cupcakes are almost cool, prepare the ganache. <NEXT_STEP> Place the chopped chocolate in a small bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Heat the cream in a small saucepan over medium heat until hot and steamy. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the cream over the chocolate and stir until thoroughly combined and no chunks of chocolate remain. <NEXT_STEP> Let the ganache sit for about 5 10 minutes to firm up slightly. <NEXT_STEP> Dip the tops of the cupcakes in the ganache and place back on the wire rack. <NEXT_STEP> Place the rack in the refrigerator to allow the chocolate to firm up. <NEXT_STEP> Prepare the caramel coconut topping. <NEXT_STEP> Heat the sugar, cream, butter, vanilla and salt in a heavy bottom saucepan  over medium heat. <NEXT_STEP> Stir until well combined and no more chunks of butter remain. <NEXT_STEP> Simmer for 8 minutes, readjusting the heat as needed. <NEXT_STEP> Do not stir. <NEXT_STEP> If needed, tilt the pan to redistribute the mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat. <NEXT_STEP> The caramel will be quite thin at this point. <NEXT_STEP> Let it cool for 20 minutes or until considerably thickened and just barely pourable. <NEXT_STEP> Add the toasted coconut and stir until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add a little more than 1 tablespoon of caramel coconut topping to the top of each ganache dipped cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe on the remaining ganache or use a fork to drizzle it on top. <NEXT_STEP> Store in an airtight container for up to 2 days. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate any leftovers after that. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Gluten Free Samoa Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> mint <NEXT_INPUT> peppermint <NEXT_INPUT> cooky <NEXT_INPUT> scout peppermint bark <NEXT_INGREDIENT> For the Buttercream 4 sticks unsalted butter softened 1 pounds confectioners sugar sifted 1 tablespoon clear vanilla extract 4 6 tablespoons heavy cream or milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> For the Ganache 4 oz bittersweet chocolate chopped into very small pieces 1/2 cup heavy whipping cream 2 tablespoons honey 2 tablespoons light corn syrup 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the Cupcakes 1. <NEXT_STEP> Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line muffin tin with paper liners or spray with non stick cooking spray. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer, fitted with the paddle attachment, or with a hand mixer in a large bowl, beat together the cake and pudding mixes, sour cream, oil, eggs, vanilla and water. <NEXT_STEP> Beat for about two minutes on medium speed until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Using a large cookie scoop, distribute the batter between 24 muffin wells about 3 tablespoons of batter per well. <NEXT_STEP> Bake in preheated oven for 18 22 minutes or until the tops of the cakes spring back when lightly touched. <NEXT_STEP> Allow cupcakes to cool inside muffin tins for about 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove cupcakes from muffin tins and allow to fully cool on a wire rack. <NEXT_STEP> Once cupcakes are cool, prepare vanilla buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> For the Buttercream 1. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, or in a large mixing bowl with an electric mixer, cream butter on medium high speed for about 6 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on low speed, slowly add in confectioners sugar, and continue beating until well blended. <NEXT_STEP> Add in vanilla, and 3 tablespoons of heavy cream or milk. <NEXT_STEP> Blend on low speed until moistened. <NEXT_STEP> Add an additional 1 to 3 tablespoons of heavy cream or milk until you reach the desired consistency. <NEXT_STEP> Beat at high speed until frosting is smooth and fluffy about 5 more minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe frosting onto cooled cupcakes and prepare chocolate ganache. <NEXT_STEP> For the Ganache 1. <NEXT_STEP> In a small saucepan over medium heat, warm the heavy cream until very hot, but not boiling. <NEXT_STEP> Place chocolate pieces in a heat safe bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the hot cream over the chocolate and allow it to sit for about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the cream and chocolate until smooth and thoroughly combined. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk in the honey, corn syrup, and vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to cool for about 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Do not let the glaze sit for too long or it will harden up before you spoon it over the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon the glaze on the tops of the frosted cupcakes, allowing it to drip down the sides a little bit. <NEXT_STEP> Don t add too much glaze or it will drip all over your liners. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate coconut lightly toasted  <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line muffin tins with paper liners or spray with nonstick cooking spray. <NEXT_STEP> Sift the flour, sugar, cocoa, baking soda, baking powder, and salt into the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with a paddle attachment and mix on low speed until combined. <NEXT_STEP> In another bowl, combine the buttermilk, oil, eggs, and vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on low speed, slowly add the wet ingredients to the dry. <NEXT_STEP> With mixer still on low, add in the coffee and mix until just combined, scraping the bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula. <NEXT_STEP> The batter will be thin. <NEXT_STEP> Using a large scoop , distribute the batter into the prepared muffin tins filling about 2 3 of the way full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 18 22 minutes, or until a cake tester comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Cool in the pans for 15 minutes, then remove them onto a cooling rack and cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, beat butter, vanilla, and salt on medium speed until creamy. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl, sift together the cocoa powder and confectioners sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually add the dry ingredients to the butter and mix at low speed until fully incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed. <NEXT_STEP> Once all of the dry ingredients have been incorporated, add in 3 tablespoons of cold coffee. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the mixer up to medium speed and beat the buttercream for about 5 minutes, scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed. <NEXT_STEP> If you want your frosting a little thinner, gradually add in more coffee, 1 teaspoon at a time until you reach the desired consistency. <NEXT_STEP> Frost your cooled cupcakes and garnish with toasted shaved coconut. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Coconut-Mocha Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> tagalong <NEXT_INPUT> scout <NEXT_INPUT> girl <NEXT_INPUT> glaze <NEXT_INPUT> cream <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 package devil s food cake mix 1 package instant chocolate pudding mix 1 cup sour cream 1 cup vegetable oil 4 eggs lightly beaten 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract 1 tablespoon instant espresso granules dissolved in 1/2 cup warm water or 1/2 cup warm coffee <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 36 Tagalong Cookies for garnish <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 sticks unsalted butter softened 1 cup creamy peanut butter 2 tablespoons vanilla extract 2 pounds confectioners sugar sifted 6 8 tablespoons heavy cream  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 oz bittersweet chocolate chopped into very small pieces 1/2 cup heavy cream 2 tablespoons honey 2 tablespoons light corn syrup 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line muffin tin with paper liners or spray with non stick cooking spray. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer or a large bowl with a hand mixer, add the cake and pudding mixes, sour cream, oil, eggs, vanilla and espresso water mixture or coffee. <NEXT_STEP> Mix on medium speed for about 2 minutes until all ingredients are well combined and the batter is mostly smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon about 2 tablespoons of batter into 24 cupcake wells. <NEXT_STEP> Add a Tagalong  cookie on top of the batter. <NEXT_STEP> Cover the cookie with one more tablespoon of batter in each well. <NEXT_STEP> Bake in preheated oven for 18 22 minutes or until the tops of the cakes spring back when lightly touched. <NEXT_STEP> Allow cupcakes to cool inside muffin tins for about 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove cupcakes from muffin tins and allow to fully cool on a wire rack. <NEXT_STEP> Once cupcakes are cool, prepare your frosting. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl with a hand mixer, or the bowl of a stand mixer, cream butter and peanut butter on medium speed until fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Turn your mixer down to low speed and slowly add in the confectioner s sugar, and continue mixing until well blended. <NEXT_STEP> Add vanilla and 4 tablespoons of heavy cream. <NEXT_STEP> Blend on low speed until moistened. <NEXT_STEP> Add an additional 1 to 4 tablespoons of heavy cream until you reach the desired consistency. <NEXT_STEP> Beat at high speed until frosting is smooth and fluffy Pipe frosting onto cooled cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> In a small saucepan over medium heat, warm the heavy cream until very hot. <NEXT_STEP> Do not boil. <NEXT_STEP> Place chocolate pieces in a glass bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the hot cream over the chocolate and allow it to sit for about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the cream and chocolate until smooth and thoroughly combined. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk in the honey, corn syrup, and vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to cool for about 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Do not let the glaze sit for too long or it will harden up before you spoon it over the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon the glaze on the tops of the frosted cupcakes, allowing it to drip down the sides a little bit. <NEXT_STEP> Don t add too much glaze or it will drip all over your liners. <NEXT_STEP> Top with half a Tagalong  cookie before the glaze hardens, otherwise it will crack when you insert the cookie. <STEP_END> well combined. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer of low, slowly add the confectioners sugar until thoroughly incorporated and smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add vanilla and ginger syrup and mix to combine. <NEXT_STEP> Line cupcake tins with paper liners or spray with non stick cooking spray. <NEXT_STEP> 2. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder and salt. <NEXT_STEP> 3. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium bowl, whisk together the buttermilk and egg whites. <NEXT_STEP> 4. <NEXT_STEP> Place the sugar and lemon zest in the bowl of your mixer or another large bowl and rub them together with your fingers until the sugar is moist and fragrant. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter and, working with the paddle or whisk attachment, or with a hand mixer, beat at medium speed for 3 minutes, until the butter half of the remaining dry ingredients until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Add the rest of the milk and eggs, beating until the batter is thoroughly combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the last of the dry <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> bean <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> seed <NEXT_INPUT> dorie <NEXT_INPUT> greenspan <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 2 1/4 cups cake flour  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 cups whole milk room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 large egg whites room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 stick unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> seeds scraped from one vanilla bean <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 sticks unsalted butter softened <NEXT_INGREDIENT> seeds scraped from one vanilla bean <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons clear vanilla extract  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 pounds confectioners sugar sifted <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 6 tablespoons heavy cream or milk <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Center a rack in the oven to 350 F. Line muffin tin with paper liners or spray with non stick cooking spray. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer, fitted with the paddle attachment, or with a hand mixer in a large bowl, beat together the cake and pudding mixes, sour cream, oil, eggs, vanilla and espresso water mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Beat for about two minutes on medium speed until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in Heath English Toffee Bits. <NEXT_STEP> Using a large cookie scoop, distribute the batter between 24 muffin wells about 3 tablespoons of batter per well. <NEXT_STEP> Bake in preheated oven for 18 22 minutes or until the tops of the cakes spring back when lightly touched. <NEXT_STEP> Allow cupcakes to cool inside muffin tins for about 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove cupcakes from muffin tins and allow to fully cool on a wire rack. <NEXT_STEP> Once cupcakes are cool, prepare your frosting. <NEXT_STEP> In a large mixing bowl, cream butter until fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly add in confectioner s sugar, and continue creaming until well blended. <NEXT_STEP> Add salt, vanilla, and 3 tablespoons of heavy cream or milk. <NEXT_STEP> Blend on low speed until moistened. <NEXT_STEP> Add an additional 1 to 3 tablespoons of heavy cream or milk until you reach the desired consistency. <NEXT_STEP> Beat at high speed until frosting is smooth and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> In a small saucepan over medium heat, warm the heavy cream until very hot, but not boiling. <NEXT_STEP> Place chocolate pieces in a heat safe bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the hot cream over the chocolate and allow it to sit for about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the cream and chocolate until smooth and thoroughly combined. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk in the honey, corn syrup, and vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to cool for about 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Do not let the glaze sit for too long or it will harden up before you spoon it over the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon the glaze on the tops of the frosted cupcakes, allowing it to drip down the sides a little bit. <NEXT_STEP> Don t add too much glaze or it will drip all over your liners. <NEXT_STEP> Top each cupcake with a piece of Heath Bar. <NEXT_STEP> Store cupcakes in the refrigerator. <NEXT_STEP> Remove them to room temperature one hour before serving. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Heath Bar Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> orange <NEXT_INPUT> cheese <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 bottle stout 1/2 cup milk 1/2 cup vegetable oil 1 tablespoon pure vanilla extract 2 teaspoons instant espresso granules dissolved in two teaspoons warm water 3 large eggs 3/4 cup sour cream 3/4 cup unsweetened dark cocoa powder 2 cups granulated sugar 2 1/2 cups all purpose flour 1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 ounces good quality semisweet chocolate chopped 1 cup heavy cream 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Chopped chocolate covered pretzel twists Fine grain sea salt <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 F. Line muffin tin with paper liners or spray with nonstick cooking spray. <NEXT_STEP> In a large mixing bowl, combine the stout, milk, vegetable oil, vanilla and espresso. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the eggs, one at a time until thoroughly incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Add in the sour cream and mix until combined. <NEXT_STEP> In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the cocoa, sugar, flour, and baking soda. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually mix the dry ingredients into the stout mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Batter will be thin. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 18 22 minutes, until risen and set in the middle but still soft and tender. <NEXT_STEP> Cool completely on wire rack. <NEXT_STEP> Place chocolate in a large heat safe bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium saucepan, heat heavy cream over medium heat until it just begins to boil. <NEXT_STEP> DO NOT walk away from the stove. <NEXT_STEP> The cream could boil over and you will be with a big mess to clean up. <NEXT_STEP> Immediately pour hot cream over chocolate and let it sit for five minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Begin stirring the cream with a wooden spoon or whisk starting in the center of the bowl and working your way outward. <NEXT_STEP> As you stir, you will see the cream and chocolate come together. <NEXT_STEP> Allow your ganache to cool for 15 minutes and stir in vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Let ganache sit at room temperature for another 3 45 minutes before topping cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Invert the top of the cupcake into the bowl of cooled ganache, use a spoon or offset spatula to spread evenly. <NEXT_STEP> Finish cupcakes with chopped chocolate covered pretzels and a tiny pinch of fine grain sea salt. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Stout Cupcakes with Chocolate Covered Pretzels <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> lemon <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 3/4 cups all purpose flour 2 cups sugar 3/4 cups good cocoa powder 2 teaspoons baking soda 1 teaspoon baking powder 1 teaspoon kosher salt 1 cup buttermilk shaken 1/2 cup vegetable oil 2 large eggs at room temperature 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract 1 cup freshly brewed hot coffee <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 18 ounces good quality semi sweet or bittersweet chocolate chopped 1 cups heavy cream 4 tablespoons Chambord <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line standard muffin tins with paper liners set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Sift the flour, sugar, cocoa, baking soda, baking powder, and salt into the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with a paddle attachment and mix on low speed until combined. <NEXT_STEP> In another bowl, combine the buttermilk, oil, eggs, and vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on low speed, slowly add the wet ingredients to the dry. <NEXT_STEP> With mixer still on low, add the coffee and stir just to combine, scraping the bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula. <NEXT_STEP> Using a large scoop, distribute the batter between 24 muffin wells, filling each well 2 3 full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 18 to 22 minutes, or until a cake tester comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Cool in the pans for 10 minutes, then remove to a cooling rack and five minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Begin stirring the cream with a wooden spoon or whisk starting in the center of the bowl and working your way outward. <NEXT_STEP> As you stir, you will see the cream and chocolate come together. <NEXT_STEP> Allow your ganache to cool for 15 minutes and stir in Chambord. <NEXT_STEP> Allow ganache to cool completely and set up before piping . <NEXT_STEP> You can also place the bowl into the refrigerator for about an hour, just be careful to keep checking on it so it doesn t get too firm. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe ganache onto cupcakes and garnish with fresh raspberry. buttermilk shaken 1/2 cup vegetable oil 2 eggs at room temperature 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract 1 cup freshly brewed hot coffee 1 teaspoons instant espresso granules <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 sticks unsalted butter softened pinch of fine grain sea salt 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract 2 pounds confectioners sugar sifted 2 tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder sifted 1 tablespoon instant espresso granules dissolved in 1 tablespoon warm water 3 6 tablespoons heavy cream or milk <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line muffin tins with paper liners or spray with nonstick cooking spray. <NEXT_STEP> Sift the flour, sugar, cocoa, baking soda, baking powder, and salt into the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with a paddle attachment and mix on low speed until combined. <NEXT_STEP> In another bowl, combine the buttermilk, oil, eggs, and vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on low speed, slowly add the wet ingredients to the dry. <NEXT_STEP> Add the 1 teaspoons of espresso granules to the cup of hot coffee and stir to combine. <NEXT_STEP> With mixer still on low, add in the coffee espresso mixture and stir just to combine, scraping the bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula. <NEXT_STEP> Using a large scoop , distribute the batter into the prepared muffin tins. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 18 22 minutes, or until a cake tester comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Cool in the pans for 15 minutes, then remove them onto a cooling rack and cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl, sift together the confectioners sugar and cocoa powder set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a large mixing bowl, cream butter until fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly add in confectioner s sugar cocoa powder mixture, and continue creaming until well blended. <NEXT_STEP> Add salt, vanilla, 2 tablespoons heavy cream or milk and espresso water. <NEXT_STEP> Blend on low speed until moistened. <NEXT_STEP> Add an additional 1 to 3 tablespoons of heavy cream or milk until you reach the desired consistency. <NEXT_STEP> Beat at high speed until frosting is smooth and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Place 3 4 cup semisweet chocolate chips in a microwave safe bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Heat the chips on 50 power in 30 seconds increments until chocolate is melted. <NEXT_STEP> Drizzle over cupcakes and finish with a chocolate covered coffee bean. <NEXT_STEP> Put the sugar and lemon zest in a mixer bowl or another large bowl and rub them together with your fingers until the sugar is moist and fragrant. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter and, working with the paddle or whisk attachment, or with a hand mixer, beat at medium speed for a full 3 minutes, until the butter and sugar are very light. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the extracts, then add one third of the flour mixture, still beating on medium speed. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in half of the milk egg mixture, then beat in half of the remaining dry ingredients until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Add the rest of the milk and eggs, beating until the batter is homogeneous, then add the last of the dry ingredients. <NEXT_STEP> Finally, give the batter a good 2 minute beating to ensure that it is thoroughly mixed and well aerated. <NEXT_STEP> Place the batter into the cupcake tins. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 18 22 minutes, or until the cupcakes are well risen and springy to the touch a thin knife inserted into the centers should come out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Cool on wire rack. <NEXT_STEP> Using a mixer, blend the butter and cream cheese together until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually add in the confectioners sugar until fully incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Finally mix in vanilla and lemon juice and mix until combined. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Lemon Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sweetened condensed milk in a medium sized bowl. <NEXT_STEP> In a separate bowl, pour in the pudding mix and begin to slowly whisk in the liquid mixture, until it is smooth with no lumps, about one minute. <NEXT_STEP> Cover and refrigerate for at least an hour until it s firm, or leave overnight. <NEXT_STEP> Whip the heavy cream until it starts to thicken, then increase the speed until stiff peaks form. <NEXT_STEP> Add your pudding mixture to the whipped cream and fold with a spatula until there are no streaks of pudding in the mixture. <NEXT_STEP> In a trifle or wide glass bowl, spread one quarter of the pudding over the bottom and place a layer with one third of the cookies as well as about 1 to 1 1 2 of the sliced bananas to cover the full layer. <NEXT_STEP> Continue the process until complete, ending with one final layer of pudding and a garnish of some of the remaining wafers. <NEXT_STEP> Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for four to six hours. <NEXT_STEP> It to color the frosting before spreading or piping frosting onto cooled cookies Cut the cookie dough into snowflake shapes and bake according to the recipe instructions. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Prepare the buttercream frosting according to the recipe instructions. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the frosting into several piping bags fitted with different decorating tips. vanilla and beat until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly add the flour and salt, stirring just until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Turn dough out onto a lightly floured work surface and use your hands to form into a disk. <NEXT_STEP> Roll the dough to 1 8 to 1 4 inch thick and cut with lightly floured cookie cutters. <NEXT_STEP> Place cookies on the prepared baking sheets. <NEXT_STEP> Bake cookies for 10 12 minutes, or just until the edges barely start to turn golden. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the baking sheets to a rack to cool before frosting. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the and continue beating until well blended. <NEXT_STEP> Add in vanilla and 2 tablespoons of heavy cream or milk. <NEXT_STEP> Mix on low speed until moistened. <NEXT_STEP> Add up to an additional tablespoon of heavy cream or milk until you reach the desired consistency. <NEXT_STEP> Beat at high speed until frosting is smooth and fluffy about 5 more minutes. <NEXT_STEP> If desired, use gel dye to color the frosting before spreading or piping frosting onto cooled cookies Cut the cookie dough into circles and bake according to the recipe instructions. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to cool completely.  2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 cup firmly packed light brown sugar  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 cup all purpose flour  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 teaspoon ground cinnamon  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  Pinch of salt  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  2 3 cup Bob s Red Mill Organic Rolled Oats  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 2 cup unsalted butter softened  <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line the bottom of a 9 x 13 inch baking pan with parchment paper  and lightly spray the pan with nonstick cooking spray. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl, mix together the graham cracker crumbs, pecans, 3 tablespoons light brown sugar, 1 1 2 teaspoons cinnamon and pinch of salt. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the melted butter and mix to combine. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the crumb mixture into the prepared pan and use clean hands or the bottom of a measuring cup to firmly press the crumbs into the bottom of the pan. <NEXT_STEP> Bake crust in preheated oven for 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Once the crust is baked, reduce the oven temperature to 325 degrees. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, or in a large bowl with an electric mixer, beat cream cheese and 1 cup brown sugar for about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl and mix for an additional 30 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Add in eggs, one at a time, scraping down the sides of the bowl after adding the second and fourth egg. <NEXT_STEP> After adding the final egg and scraping the sides of the bowl, mix again for 30 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> The mixture should be smooth and creamy. <NEXT_STEP> Add in the maple syrup and extracts and mix for an additional 30 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the cheesecake filling over the crust. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium bowl, stir together all of the streusel ingredients except the butter. <NEXT_STEP> Once the dry ingredients are combined, use a fork to work the butter into the dry ingredients until fully incorporated and small clumps form. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle the streusel topping over the cheesecake filling, but do not press it into the cheesecake. <NEXT_STEP> Bake in 325 degree oven for 40 45 minutes or until the sides of the cheesecake bars appear to be set, but the center still has a very slight jiggle. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the cheesecake bars from the oven and to a wire cooling rack. <NEXT_STEP> Allow the cheesecake bars to cool to room temperature for about an hour before placing it in the refrigerator to chill completely. <NEXT_STEP> Cut into squares. <NEXT_STEP> Before serving, lightly drizzle each piece with maple syrup. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Maple <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1/2 teaspoon vanilla bean paste  <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> In a medium skillet add all ingredients and set over medium heat. <NEXT_STEP> While it s cooking break some of the cherries in half to create a jam like consistency. <NEXT_STEP> Cook for about 10 minutes until the mixture is thick and bubbly. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Note you want the mixture to look like pie filling. <NEXT_STEP> Preheat your oven to 350 degrees and spray an 8x8 dish with non stick cooking spray, set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of your electric mixer add brown sugar and butter. <NEXT_STEP> Mix together until creamed about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add in applesauce, egg and almond extract. <NEXT_STEP> Mix until combined. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium sized bowl whisk together flour, baking soda, baking powder and kosher salt. <NEXT_STEP> Add dry ingredients to the mixer alternating with the yogurt until fully combined. <NEXT_STEP> Spread half the dough in the bottom of your prepared baking dish, top with cherry mixture and then top with remaining batter. <NEXT_STEP> You will have to carefully spread the batter over the top. <NEXT_STEP> It s ok if it doesn t cover it 100 but try to cover the best you can. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle the top with almonds. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for about 35 40 minutes until the cake is fully cooked and lightly browned on the top. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the oven, add to cooling rack and pour glaze over the top. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool so the glaze hardens and the fruit is set. <NEXT_STEP> Right before the cake is about to come out of the oven in a small bowl whisk together all ingredients until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> If the mixture is too thick add a little milk to thin it out. <NEXT_STEP> If it s too thin add more powdered sugar. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Cherry Fritter Cake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cheesecake <NEXT_INPUT> substitute <NEXT_INPUT> carb <NEXT_INPUT> pan <NEXT_INPUT> Line two baking sheets with parchment paper. <NEXT_STEP> Remove dough logs from the freezer and remove the plastic wrap. <NEXT_STEP> Slice dough into inch thick slices and place on prepared baking sheets 1 inch apart. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until cookies are just golden at the edges, about 16 18 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Allow cookies to cool on wire racks. <NEXT_STEP> Store cookies in an airtight container for up to 4 days. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Orange Shortbread Cookies <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> lemon <NEXT_INPUT> cookie <NEXT_INPUT> wholesome <NEXT_INPUT> strawberry <NEXT_INPUT> organic <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 24 cookie cups <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START>  2 cups all purpose flour  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1/2 teaspoon salt  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 cup WHOLESOME Organic Cane Sugar  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  zest of one medium lemon  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1/2 cup unsalted butter room temperature  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 egg  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  2 tablespoons milk  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 teaspoons vanilla extract  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  teaspoon lemon extract  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 12.5 ounce container of WHOLESOME Organic Wild White Strawberry Frosting  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 teaspoon freshly squeezed lemon juice  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 tablespoon strawberry puree optional  <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. zest and mix with your fingertips until the sugar is fragrant. <NEXT_STEP> In a separate large mixing bowl, beat the butter and lemon sugar on medium speed until fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> In a small bowl, until just incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Scoop balls of dough with a tablespoon and place one dough ball into each cup of the prepared mini muffin tin. <NEXT_STEP> Bake in the preheated oven for 10 12 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Allow cookie cups to cool for about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Gently press a round teaspoon measuring spoon into each cookie cup to create a small indentation. <NEXT_STEP> Let the cookies cool for 5 minutes in the pan before removing to finish cooling on a rack. <NEXT_STEP> Once the cookie cups have cooled completely, pipe or spread the frosting onto each cookie cup. <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> caramel <NEXT_INPUT> salted <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> cake <NEXT_INPUT> photography <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 servings <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START>  2 cups sugar  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 3/4 cups all purpose flour  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  3/4 cup unsweetened cocoa powder  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  2 tablespoons King Arthur Flour Black Cocoa optional  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  2 teaspoons baking soda  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 teaspoon baking powder  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 teaspoon kosher salt  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  2 eggs  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 cup buttermilk  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 cup strong brewed black coffee  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1/2 cup vegetable oil  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  2 teaspoons vanilla extract  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 cup unsalted butter softened  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  4 ounces semisweet chocolate melted and cooled  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  4 cups powdered sugar sifted  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  2 tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder sifted  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  2 teaspoons vanilla extract  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  2 3 tablespoons milk  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  4 oz semisweet chocolate chopped into very small pieces  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1/2 cup heavy whipping cream  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 teaspoon vanilla extract  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1 tablespoon honey  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1/3 cup homemade salted caramel sauce  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  salted caramel sugar pieces optional  <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Heat oven to 350 F. Grease and flour two 9 inch round baking pans or one 13x9x2 inch baking pan. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment or in a large bowl with an electric mixer, combine the sugar, flour, cocoa, baking soda, baking powder and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Mix on low speed until dry ingredients are thoroughly combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add eggs, buttermilk, coffee, oil and vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Beat on medium speed for about two minutes the batter will be thin. <NEXT_STEP> Pour batter evenly into prepared pans. <NEXT_STEP> Bake in preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes for round pans, 35 to 40 minutes for rectangular pan or until wooden toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Cool 10 minutes remove from pans to wire racks. <NEXT_STEP> Cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, beat butter on medium high speed for about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon in cooled, melted chocolate  and mix on low speed to incorporate the melted chocolate. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed. <NEXT_STEP> Add in powdered sugar, cocoa, and vanilla and mix on low speed until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the mixer back up to medium high speed and beat for an additional 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add in milk, 1 tablespoon at a time until you reached the desired consistency. <NEXT_STEP> Place one cake layer on a cake stand or plate and frost the top of the cake with a little less than half of the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Add the next layer and frost the top of the cake with the remaining frosting. <NEXT_STEP> If desired, top with salted caramel chocolate pieces. <NEXT_STEP> In a small saucepan over medium heat, warm the heavy cream until very hot, but not boiling. <NEXT_STEP> Place chocolate pieces in a heat safe bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the hot cream over the chocolate and allow it to sit for about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the cream and chocolate until smooth and thoroughly combined. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk in the vanilla and honey. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to cool at room temperature for about 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Do not let the glaze sit for too long or it will harden up before you spoon it over the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Drizzle ganache and salted caramel sauce over the cake before serving. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate any leftover cake for up 3 days. cut in fourths for easier melting  <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Place egg whites, sugar, corn syrup and water in the top of a double boiler. <NEXT_STEP> Beat with a handheld electric mixer for about 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Place pan over boiling water. <NEXT_STEP> Make sure the boiling water does not touch the bottom of the top pan. <NEXT_STEP> Beat constantly with an electric mixer on high speed for 7 8 minutes, or until it is stiff and glossy. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in vanilla and marshmallows. <NEXT_STEP> Continue beating until marshmallows are melted and frosting is smooth about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Use immediately. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Marshmallow Frosting <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> rhubarb <NEXT_INPUT> strawberry <NEXT_INPUT> oat <NEXT_INPUT> gluten but firms up in the last 10 15 minutes of baking. <NEXT_STEP> The filling may also appear runny while warm but thickens as it cools. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool for 30 minutes and serve warm or room safe bowl at medium  for 3 4 minutes or until butter is melted. <NEXT_STEP> Stir until chocolate is melted. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk in sugar, eggs, vanilla and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually add in flour and <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 30 35 minutes do not over bake. <NEXT_STEP> Remove to cooling rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Before serving, prepare the ganache. <NEXT_STEP> To make the ganache, pour the chopped chocolate into a medium mixing bowl, set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the heavy cream into a microwave safe measuring cup  and microwave on high for about 1 minute or until bubbles begin to form on the surface. <NEXT_STEP> Take care to not overheat because the cream will boil over. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the hot cream over the chocolate and allow it to sit for about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Use a small whisk to combine the mixture into a smooth chocolate glaze. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon the ganache over the brownies. <NEXT_STEP> If desired, top with additional chopped Whoppers. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> pies <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START>  2 cups all purpose flour  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  3/4 teaspoon baking powder  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1/2 teaspoon baking soda  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile, make the filling. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the mascarpone and sugar in a small bowl and mix with a rubber spatula until the sugar is thoroughly incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Once the cookies are cool, spread 2 tablespoons of the filling onto the flat side of 1 2 of the cookies. <NEXT_STEP> Top with the remaining cookies and arrange on a platter in a single layer. <NEXT_STEP> The gelatin to firm up a bit. <NEXT_STEP> Evenly spoon the gelatin between each the jars. <NEXT_STEP> Place jars back into the refrigerator for at least 1 hour. <NEXT_STEP> Serve chilled. <STEP_END> Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 tbsp Orange juice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Orange extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Orange zest <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 200g Cream cheese <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 100g Unsalted butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 600g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Orange extract <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 180 C . <NEXT_STEP> Line two cupcake trays with cupcake cases. <NEXT_STEP> Using either an electric mixer or mixing bowl and whisk beat the butter and golden caster sugar together until pale and fluffy then whisk in the orange extract and orange zest. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the whisk speed and slowly add the eggs along with a tbsp of the flour to prevent it from curdling. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining flour to the butter and sugar mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Using either a piping bag or ice cream scoop divide the batter between the cupcake cases and place in the oven for 20 minutes or until lightly golden and firm to the touch. <NEXT_STEP> To make the syrup place the golden caster sugar in a pan with the orange juice. <NEXT_STEP> Simmer for a few minutes until dissolved then take off the heat and set aside to cool. <NEXT_STEP> Once cool stir in the orange extract and zest. <NEXT_STEP> Leave the cakes to cool a little on a wire rack then add some orange sugar syrup to the top of each one. <NEXT_STEP> To ice put the cream cheese butter orange extract and golden icing sugar in a mixing bowl and slowly mix together until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Place in a piping bag and ice accordingly. <NEXT_STEP> Top with additional orange zest. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Orange Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> coffee <NEXT_INPUT> cappuccino <NEXT_INPUT> chip <NEXT_INPUT> caster <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 250ml Guinness <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 250g Unsalted butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 400g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 Large free range egg  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 140ml Buttermilk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 280g Allinson s Plain White Flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tsp Bicarbonate of soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 tsp Baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 tbsp Cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 150g Butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 300g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 tbsp Bailey s  <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 170 C and line a cupcake tin with 12 cupcake cases. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the Guinness into a saucepan and add the butter heat gently and stir until the butter has melted. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat and add the cocoa powder and sugar stirring until well mixed. <NEXT_STEP> In another bowl mix together the eggs vanilla extract and buttermilk then add this to the mixture in the saucepan. <NEXT_STEP> Sift together the flour bicarbonate of soda and baking powder into a large bowl and pour in the contents of the pan then using a freestanding or hand held mixer mix until the ingredients are all well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon the mixture into the cupcake cases until they are about 2/3 full then bake in the oven for 25 minutes or until a skewer comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Leave the cakes on a cooling wire to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> To make the buttercream mix together the butter and icing sugar until there are no lumps then add the Bailey s and mix until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> The longer that you beat the buttercream for the lighter in texture it will become. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon the buttercream into a piping bag fitted with a star nozzle and pipe onto each cupcake. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Guinness Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> lustre <NEXT_INPUT> gold <NEXT_INPUT> bag <NEXT_INPUT> galaxy <NEXT_INPUT> purple <INPUT_END> 3 Egg  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 125g Self raising white flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 25g Cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Chocolate extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 220g Silver Spoon White caster sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 Egg white  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 80ml Water <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  Sprinkle decorations <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 150g Butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 150g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 Egg  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 125g Self raising white flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 25g Cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Chocolate extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 220g Silver Spoon White caster sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 Egg white  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 80ml Water <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  Sprinkle decorations <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 180 C and line a cupcake tin with 12 cupcake cases. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl cream together the butter and sugar until they are pale and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time beating well in between each one. <NEXT_STEP> Then add the chocolate extract. <NEXT_STEP> Carefully fold in the sieved flour and cocoa powder mixing until it is evenly combined. <NEXT_STEP> Then spoon into the cupcake cases until they are about 2/3 full. <NEXT_STEP> Place in the oven and bake for about 20 minutes or until a skewer comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the oven and leave to cool. <NEXT_STEP> To make the marshmallow frosting place the sugar and water in a medium saucepan and gently heat until the sugar has dissolved. <NEXT_STEP> Don t stir. <NEXT_STEP> Bring this to the boil and simmer until it reaches 116 C on your sugar thermometer. <NEXT_STEP> This will take about 10 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat and let the bubbles subside. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the egg whites until they reach the soft peak stage then still whisking pour in the sugar syrup. <NEXT_STEP> Then continue to whisk for about 10 minutes until it is thick and cool. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the frosting onto the cooled cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Decorate roses decorations <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 175g Unsalted butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 175g Self Raising Flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 175g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 tsp Baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 Large free range egg  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 175g Unsalted butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Cherry extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 tbsp Milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 350g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 drops Pink food colouring gel <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 Love bird / roses decorations <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 180 C and line a 12 hole muffin/cupcake tin with your chosen cupcake cases. <NEXT_STEP> Place all the cupcake ingredients into a large mixing bowl or food mixer and beat together until light fluffy and pale in colour. <NEXT_STEP> Using a spoon spoon the mixture into the cupcake cases filling each one 2/3 full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake the cupcakes in the oven for 20 25 minutes until golden springy to touch and baked throughout. <NEXT_STEP> Once the cupcakes are baked leave to cool on a wire cooling rack whilst you make up the buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> To make the buttercream beat the butter in a mixer until light and fluffy then gradually add in the icing sugar and cherry flavouring. <NEXT_STEP> Add the milk gradually if needed to loosen up the buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> It is best to beat the buttercream for as long as you can as the longer that you beat it for the lighter and fluffier it will be. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the mixture in two seperating into two separate bowls. <NEXT_STEP> Using a few drops of pink food colouring gel into one of the bowls of buttercream beat the buttercream until it reaches the desired pink colour. <NEXT_STEP> Open up a piping bag fitted with a star nozzle and spread the pink buttercream down one side of the inside of the bag and the white buttercream down the other side. <NEXT_STEP> Alternatively you could use a duo colour piping bag to create the same effect. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the buttercream on to the cupcakes in a circular motion and this should create the double colour effect. <NEXT_STEP> Finish with the lovebird or rose cake decorations. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Cherry Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> icing <NEXT_INPUT> belle <NEXT_INPUT> nielsen <NEXT_INPUT> massey and sugar together until pale and fluffy then add the eggs on by one beating after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Then add the vanilla extract. <NEXT_STEP> Sieve in the flour and baking powder and then add the milk having removed the star anise. <NEXT_STEP> Fold the mix together until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Then add the liquorice and stir in until evenly distributed. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon the mixture into the cupcake cases and bake for approximately 25 minutes or until a skewer comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> The leave to cool on a wire rack. <NEXT_STEP> Roll out the black sugar paste on a surface lightly dusted with icing sugar to a thickness of a 1 coin. <NEXT_STEP> Using a pastry cutter about the same size as the top of the cupcake cut out circles of sugar paste. <NEXT_STEP> Lightly brush the surface of the cakes with the warmed apricot jam then place the sugar paste discs on top. <NEXT_STEP> Decorate with the liquorice sweets. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Liquorice cupcakes <TITLE_END> skewer comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the oven and leave to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> To make the robin cake topper roll out 2 balls of the brown icing one smaller than the other for the robin body and head. <NEXT_STEP> Then roll out a small amount of brown icing to approximately 5mm thickness and cut 2 triangle shapes for the wings. <NEXT_STEP> Roll out some red icing for the red set to one side. <NEXT_STEP> Next roll out some orange icing and cut a diamond for the beak and 2 triangle shapes for the feet. <NEXT_STEP> Stick the feet onto the cake using a little boiled water. <NEXT_STEP> Next roll out some red icing for the redbreast and cut into shape place this on the cake covering the tops of the feet next attach the beak to the top of the redbreast again using water to glue. <NEXT_STEP> Next attach the wings using water and finally add the eyes using small balls of white and black icing. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Robin Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 100g Unrefined demerara sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tbsp Water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tbsp Dark rum <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  Mint leaves  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 Lime zest <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 50g <NEXT_STEP> Line a mini muffin tin with paper cases. <NEXT_STEP> In a small bowl mix together the buttermilk rum and vanilla extract. <NEXT_STEP> In another bowl mix together the flour baking powder and salt. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer mix the butter and sugar on high speed until creamy. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce speed and add eggs one at a time scraping the sides of the bowl after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Add 1/3 of the flour mixture then 1/2 the buttermilk mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Add another 1/3 of the flour then the remaining buttermilk and finally the remaining flour. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape the edges of the bowl to ensure all of the flour has been incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the mixture into the prepared tin filling the cases halfway and bake for 20 mins in a preheated oven. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile prepare the syrup. <NEXT_STEP> In a small saucepan bring the water and sugar to the boil. <NEXT_STEP> Once the sugar dissolves remove from heat and add rum. <NEXT_STEP> Then add the zest of lime and mint. <NEXT_STEP> Let this steep for 5 minutes then pass the syrup through a sieve into a bowl discarding what is left over. <NEXT_STEP> Once the cupcakes are cool use a skewer to make a hole in the centre of each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Get a piping bag with a small round nozzle and poke the end of the nozzle into the hole you ve made in the first cupcake and pour some of the syrup into the bag filling the cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Alternatively poke holes in the cupcakes with a skewer and drizzle the syrup into the holes with a spoon. <NEXT_STEP> To make the icing beat the butter at high speed in an electric mixer until creamy. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce speed and add the icing sugar gradually. <NEXT_STEP> Beat for 1 minute until well incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Beat for another 2 minutes at high speed. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape the edges of the bowl add the rum and chopped mint. <NEXT_STEP> Beat one last time at medium speed. <NEXT_STEP> Once cupcakes are fully cooled ice with the buttercream icing. <NEXT_STEP> Decorate with slices of lime and mint leaves. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Mojito Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> designer <NEXT_INPUT> icing <NEXT_INPUT> bean <NEXT_INPUT> rainbow <NEXT_INPUT> pale <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 300g Butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 300g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 300g Self Raising Flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Bean Paste <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 Eggs  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 250g Butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Bean Paste <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 500g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 different colours Food colouring gels <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 300g Butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 300g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 300g Self Raising Flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Bean Paste <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 Eggs  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 250g Butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Bean Paste <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 500g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 different colours Food colouring gels <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 180 C . <NEXT_STEP> Grease 2 x 20 cm round cake tins or a 12 hole cupcake tray. <NEXT_STEP> Place the butter sugar and vanilla or other flavourings into a mixing bowl and combine. <NEXT_STEP> If using an electric mixer turn the speed to high and beat until the mixture is very pale soft and fluffy and the granules of sugar have disappeared. <NEXT_STEP> Add the beaten eggs about one quarter at a time beating them in slowly each time. <NEXT_STEP> Add the flour gradually one quarter at a time mixing gently on a slow speed until it has mostly been incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Then add the baking powder. <NEXT_STEP> Fold with a metal spoon if doing this by hand. <NEXT_STEP> Take care not to mix or beat vigorously or your sponge can turn out a bit tough. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape the mixture into cupcake cases or lined tins as required. <NEXT_STEP> For cupcakes bake for around 12 15 minutes checking every few minutes. <NEXT_STEP> For a larger cake begin checking after 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remember all ovens vary so if in doubt use an oven thermometer. <NEXT_STEP> The cakes should be a light golden brown springy to the touch. <NEXT_STEP> A sharp knife or metal skewer should come out clean and free of mixture when inserted into the centre. <NEXT_STEP> Leave to cool for a couple of minutes in the tins then turn out onto a cooling rack. <NEXT_STEP> If you have an electric stand mixer then use this with the beater or paddle attachment. <NEXT_STEP> Otherwise use a hand held mixer or a wooden spoon. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape the seeds from the vanilla pod if using or add the paste. <NEXT_STEP> In the mixer or bowl cream the butter with the vanilla seeds and extract until very pale creamy and smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add about one quarter of the icing sugar. <NEXT_STEP> To make sure the sugar doesn t puff out in clouds and cover your kitchen mix slowly at first. <NEXT_STEP> You can also place a damp tea towel over the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Once the icing sugar is incorporated beat at a high speed for about 1 minute until the mix is really creamy and pale. <NEXT_STEP> It will take you a few more minutes by hand. <NEXT_STEP> Continue adding the sugar one quarter at a time taking care to beat it in well after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the buttercream at high speed for 1 2 minutes until fluffy and pale. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the piping bag inside out then drizzle with strips of the gel colours to create stripes. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the bag right side out then fit it with the star nozzle and fill with buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> Clip the bag to keep it all in. <NEXT_STEP> Squeeze the buttercream onto the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Hold the bag in a vertical position and pipe in a spiral starting around the outside edge of the case winding inwards and building height to create a peak. <NEXT_STEP> The colour will be blended onto the buttercream giving a lovely rainbow swirl effect. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Rainbow Swirl Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sugarpaste <NEXT_INPUT> ear <NEXT_INPUT> pink <NEXT_INPUT> bunny <NEXT_INPUT> icing Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 Large free range eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 175g Unsalted butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> icing <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 250g Pink sugarpaste icing <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 180 C/gas mark 4 and line the 12 hole muffin tin with paper cupcake or muffin cases. <NEXT_STEP> Put all the cake ingredients into a bowl and beat until smooth and evenly mixed. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the mixture evenly between the paper cases and bake for 20 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile make the bunny ears. <NEXT_STEP> Roll out the white sugarpaste icing and the pink sugarpaste icing to approximately 2 3mm thick .With a sharp knife cut out the bunny ear shape making sure the the white sugarpaste ears are 2mm bigger than the pink. <NEXT_STEP> With a little bit of edible glue stick the pink inner ear to the outer white ear. <NEXT_STEP> You can bend the ears over slightly if you want to give different looks. <NEXT_STEP> The sugarpaste will start to harden quite quickly so it s best to work as quickly as you can so it doesn t start to crack. <NEXT_STEP> Leave the cupcakes to cool on a wire rack while you make some buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl put the butter vanilla extract 1 tbsp of milk and half the icing sugar and beat until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add in the remaining icing sugar and mix well until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add more milk if you need to loosen it. <NEXT_STEP> Add the food colouring a tiny bit at a time until you get the desired colour. <NEXT_STEP> Once the cupcakes have cooled completely pipe your buttercream in any design you like. <NEXT_STEP> Add 2 of the bunny ears in to the pink buttercream icing in each cupcake. <STEP_END> flour and cocoa powder until smooth and well mixed. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon into the cases until 2/3 full then place in the oven for about 20 minutes until a skewer inserted into the cake comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the oven and leave to cool slightly before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> To make the buttercream beat together the icing sugar butter and cocoa powder until well mixed then slowly add the milk whilst still beating. <NEXT_STEP> Continue beating until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Next gently melt the large marshmallows in a heatproof bowl over simmering water. <NEXT_STEP> Scoop out a small well in the centre of each cupcake and pour in a little melted marshmallow into each one then leave to cool. <NEXT_STEP> Finally use a spoon or small palette knife to spread chocolate frosting onto the cakes and finish with the small marshmallows. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate Marshmallow Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START>
