<STEP_START> For the lemon curd place the sugar and lemon juice in a heatproof bowl then add the eggs and butter. <NEXT_STEP> Don t allow the mixture to sit around start whisking immediately as the sugar and acidity of lemons will start to cook the eggs. <NEXT_STEP> Place the bowl over a pan of gently simmering water but be careful that the bowl doesn t touch the water. <NEXT_STEP> Cook over gentle heat whisking all the time until butter melted and mixture has thickened. <NEXT_STEP> The mixture will continue to thicken on cooling. <NEXT_STEP> Place the curd in sterilised jar and put to one side while prepare the sponge. <NEXT_STEP> For the cupcake sponge preheat the oven to 180 C and line a cupcake tray with paper cases. <NEXT_STEP> Cream the butter sugar and vanilla seeds together in a large mixing bowl until pale fluffy and well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Crack in the eggs one at a time and beat until both are fully incorporated into the mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in the flour candied lemon zest if using and lemon zest until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Place a couple teaspoons of batter in the bottom of the cases and add a teaspoonful of lemon curd to the middle of each cupcake and then cover with a little more mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Bake the cupcakes in the oven for 15 20 minutes or until they are pale golden brown and spring back when pressed lightly in the centre. <NEXT_STEP> For the meringue make a sugar syrup by dissolving sugar in water over a gentle heat. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the egg whites until soft peaks and doubled in volume. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually add the sugar syrup while you continue to whisk being careful that the syrup doesn t touch the whisks/beaters. <NEXT_STEP> Keep whisking continuously until the meringue mixture is thick and glossy and has cooled down check by feeling the side of the mixing bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon the meringue in a piping bag and pipe some meringue on the top of each cake using a blow torch lightly brown the top of each cake to toast the meringue. <NEXT_STEP> Finish with lemon zest and sprinkling icing sugar. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Lemon meringue cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> tea <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 200g Cream cheese <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 100g Unsalted butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 600g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Nielsen massey rose water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 drops Pink food colouring gel <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 180 C . <NEXT_STEP> Using either an electric mixer or mixing bowl and whisk beat the butter and golden caster sugar together until pale and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually add the eggs to the mixture with a spoonful of flour after each egg to prevent the mix from curdling. <NEXT_STEP> To make the syrup place the golden caster sugar in a pan with the water. <NEXT_STEP> Simmer for a few minutes until dissolved then take off the heat and set aside to cool. <NEXT_STEP> Once cool stir in 1 tsp of rose water. <NEXT_STEP> Add the icing <NEXT_INPUT> paste <NEXT_INPUT> red <NEXT_INPUT> nose <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 150g Butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 150g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 Egg  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tbsp Milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 150g Self raising white flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 85g Butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 175g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tbsp Milk  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  Red sugar paste icing <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  White sugar paste icing <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  Black sugar paste icing <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  Writing icing <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 150g Butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 150g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 Egg  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tbsp Milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 150g Self raising white flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 85g Butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 175g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tbsp Milk  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  Red sugar paste icing <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  White sugar paste icing <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  Black sugar paste icing <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  Writing icing <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 170 C . <NEXT_STEP> Line a cup cake tin with cup cake cases. <NEXT_STEP> Make sure your butter is nice and soft to start with so it is easy to beat. <NEXT_STEP> Add the caster sugar to the butter and using a wooden spoon beat the butter and sugar until it is really smooth and creamy. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the eggs together lightly with a fork then add a drop at a time to the butter and sugar mixture beating really well until the mixture is emulsified before adding the next bit of egg. <NEXT_STEP> If the mixture starts to curdle just beat in a tablespoon of the flour and continue. <NEXT_STEP> Using a large metal spoon fold in the vanilla extract milk and flour lifting the mixture in a figure of eight to scoop up the flour and fold it in. <NEXT_STEP> Do this as lightly as you can to keep all the air in your mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Using a dessert spoon place a rounded spoonful in each cake case. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for about 15 18 minutes but check after 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> The cakes should be evenly browned and just feel firm and springy when you touch them in the centre. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to cool for 5 minutes then remove from the tin and allow to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> To make the buttercream beat together the butter icing sugar milk and vanilla extract until it becomes a smooth texture. <NEXT_STEP> Either pipe or smooth on to the top of the cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> To decorate roll out the red sugar paste icing and using a circular cutter press out 12 circles Then roll out 12 small circular balls for the noses. <NEXT_STEP> Secure these on to the centre of the circle using a light brushing of water. <NEXT_STEP> To make the eyes roll out white sugar paste icing in to small balls and flatten gently between your thumb and finger. <NEXT_STEP> Secure these above the nose and make the black dots either using a edible decorating pen or writing icing. <NEXT_STEP> Finally for the smile roll a small sausage shape of black sugar paste icing for each face and secure onto the red circle with water curving slightly to make the expression. <NEXT_STEP> Place the red sugar paste circle carefully on top of the buttercream on your cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> This will set in place once the buttercream hardens. <STEP_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 190 C and line a 12 bun muffin tin with muffin cases. <NEXT_STEP> Using a hand held electric whisk or freestanding mixer mix the butter sugar flour cocoa powder baking extract and continue to mix. <NEXT_STEP> Fill a piping bag with the chocolate buttercream and pipe on top of the cooled cupcakes to decorate. <NEXT_STEP> To finish lightly grate some orange zest on Extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 63g Popping candy <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 100g Allinson s Plain White Flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 140g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 80g Butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 25ml Milk  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 63g Popping candy <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 190 C and line a 12 hole muffin tin with muffin cases. <NEXT_STEP> Mix together the softened butter sugar flour cocoa powder baking powder and salt on a low speed until it is the texture of breadcrumbs. <NEXT_STEP> Put the egg in a separate bowl and whisk lightly. <NEXT_STEP> Add the milk and continue to mix before gradually pouring into the dry mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Blend all the ingredients together on a low speed gradually increasing to a medium speed until the consistency becomes smooth and thick. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon the mixture into the paper cases filling them 2/3 full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake in the oven for 20 25 minutes or until risen and springy to the touch. <NEXT_STEP> Leave to cool fully on a wire rack. <NEXT_STEP> To make the buttercream blend together the icing sugar vanilla extract milk and butter until it forms a smooth buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> Continue to mix and sprinkle in the popping candy. <NEXT_STEP> Once the cupcakes are cool carefully cut the centre out of each cupcake and fill with the vanilla buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the remaining buttercream on the top of the cupcakes dust with gold lustre and top with an indoor sparkler for an extra special effect. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Popping Candy Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> lemon <NEXT_INPUT> curd <NEXT_INPUT> meringue <NEXT_INPUT> golden <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 100g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 100g Butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 100g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 Egg  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 100g Self raising white flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 Lemon zest  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 50g Lemon curd  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 Egg white  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 100g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 180 C . <NEXT_STEP> Sit 12 paper cases into a muffin tin. <NEXT_STEP> Cream together the butter sugar and vanilla extract together in a large mixing bowl until pale and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> This is easier to do with an electric whisk. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time and beat until fully incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> If the mix starts to curdle add a little of the flour. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in the flour and lemon zest until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon into the cupcake cases. <NEXT_STEP> Add a teaspoonful of lemon curd to the top of each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 15 20 minutes or until golden brown and lightly springy. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the cakes from the tin and leave to cool on a cooling rack. <NEXT_STEP> For the meringue topping whisk the egg whites until soft peaks form when the whisk is removed. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually add the sugar whisking until stiff peaks are formed. <NEXT_STEP> The mixture should be thick and glossy. <NEXT_STEP> Preheat the grill. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the meringue over the cupcakes and grill for 2 3 minutes or until the meringue is golden brown. <NEXT_STEP> Do not turn your back on these little cakes the meringue can burn very quickly . <NEXT_STEP> If you are one who like gadgets you could also brown the meringue with a blow torch. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Lemon Curd Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cointreau <NEXT_INPUT> orange <NEXT_INPUT> zest <NEXT_INPUT> cocoa <NEXT_INPUT> powder <STEP_START> Preheat your oven to 180 c/160 c fan and line a 12 hole muffin tin with lining cases. <NEXT_STEP> Cream together the butter and caster sugar until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Grate in the lime zest. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs on at a time with a tablespoon of flour each time to prevent curdling. <NEXT_STEP> Beat well until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in the remaining flour and then gently mix in the tonic water to make a mixture with a smooth dropping consistency. <NEXT_STEP> Fill each cake case about 2/3 full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake in your preheated oven for about 25 minutes until icing will become. <NEXT_STEP> Once the cakes are cool you can pipe or spread your icing onto your cakes and decorate with a slice of Lime. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Gin & Tonic Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <TITLE_START> Father's Day Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pop <NEXT_INPUT> snitch <NEXT_INPUT> wing <NEXT_INPUT> lustre <NEXT_INPUT> cake <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 285g Unsalted butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 285g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 Eggs  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 285g Self raising white flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 tbsp Milk  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 160g Unsalted butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 320g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Bean Paste <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tbsp Milk  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 400g White chocolate <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 pot Gold lustre or food spray <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 285g Unsalted butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 285g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 Eggs  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 285g Self raising white flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 tbsp Milk  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 160g Unsalted butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 320g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Bean Paste <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tbsp Milk  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 400g White chocolate <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 pot Gold lustre or food spray <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> To make the cupcakes begin by preheating the oven to 190 C/170 Fan/Gas Mark 5. <NEXT_STEP> Line a muffin tin with 12 cases. <NEXT_STEP> Cream together the butter and sugar then add the eggs one at a time with a spoonful of the flour to stop it curdling. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla extract and fold in the rest of the flour and milk until you have a soft dropping consistency. <NEXT_STEP> Use 2/3 of the mixture to fill your muffin cases. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Once fully baked remove from the tin and cool on a rack. <NEXT_STEP> To make the cake pop decorations line the tin with 5 or 6 more additional cupcake cases. <NEXT_STEP> Fill these cases with the remaining mixture and bake for 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool on a rack and keep aside  While the cakes are cooling make the buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> Cream together the butter and icing sugar add the milk and the vanilla bean paste. <NEXT_STEP> Whip for about 5 minutes until its very soft and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Separate of this mixture to make the cake pops the rest will be for the finished cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> To make the cake pops crumble the second smaller batch of cooled cupcakes by hand or with a food processor. <NEXT_STEP> When they are fine crumbs mix in the small amount of buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> Shape into 12 balls about 20g each. <NEXT_STEP> Chill the cake pops until they are very firm. <NEXT_STEP> Draw a template for the wings and lay it under some baking parchment. <NEXT_STEP> Melt 200g of white chocolate and put in a piping bag. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe pairs of wings onto the baking parchment. <NEXT_STEP> Make a few more than you need in case you make any mistakes. <NEXT_STEP> Chill until set. <NEXT_STEP> When the cake pops are set melt more white chocolate and coat the little balls. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to set hard in the fridge. <NEXT_STEP> When the wings and cake pops are chilled and firm paint them gold with lustre powder or food spray paint. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe swirls of buttercream onto your cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Cut the cake pop sticks until they are short enough to stand up in the cupcakes so the cake pops sit securely on the top. <NEXT_STEP> Position the wings either side of the cake pop to make a Golden Snitch. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Golden Snitch Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flavour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tbsp Maple syrup flavour  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 250g Butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 500g Icing sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tbsp Maple syrup flavour  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 Bacon rasher ) <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tbsp Maple syrup flavour  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 125g Butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 125g Billington s Unrefined Light Muscovado Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 Egg  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 175g Allinson s Self Raising White Flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 tsp Cinnamon <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tbsp Maple syrup flavour  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 250g Butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 500g Icing sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tbsp Maple syrup flavour  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 Bacon rasher ) <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tbsp Maple syrup flavour  <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 180 c / 160 c fan and line a 12 hole muffin tin with 12 cupcake cases. <NEXT_STEP> Place the butter and sugar in a mixing bowl and beat with a wooden spoon or electric mixer until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually beat in the eggs and vanilla extract a bit at a time until smooth adding a little of the flour if the mixture starts to curdle. <NEXT_STEP> Sift and fold the flour and cinnamon into the mixture before folding in the Maple flavoured Treat. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the mixture evenly between the cupcake cases and bake in the pre heated oven for 18 20 minutes or until a skewer comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Leave to cool slightly before removing from the tin and leaving to cool fully on a wire rack. <NEXT_STEP> To make the buttercream beat the butter until softened before adding the icing sugar in two parts. <NEXT_STEP> Add the maple syrup flavour Treat and a tablespoon of milk if required to loosen the buttercream slightly. <NEXT_STEP> Grill the bacon until crispy and set aside to cool before cutting into 1 inch long pieces. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe swirls or rounds of icing onto the cupcakes before adding a piece of bacon Finish with a final drizzle of maple flavour Treat before serving. <NEXT_STEP> These cupcakes are best eaten within a few hours of making or alternatively we recommend cooking the bacon on the day of the desired serving. <STEP_END> <YIELD_START> 24 <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 100ml White rum <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 170g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 150g Strawberries  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 40g Butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 120g Allinson s Plain White Flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1.5 tsp Baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 Egg  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 120ml Milk  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 0.5 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 80g Butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 250g Icing sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 tsp Milk  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  Strawberries  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 100ml White rum <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 170g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 150g Strawberries  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 40g Butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 120g Allinson s Plain White Flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1.5 tsp Baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 Egg  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 120ml Milk  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 0.5 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 80g Butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 250g Icing sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 tsp Milk  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  Strawberries  <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 170 C and place cupcake cases in a muffin tin. <NEXT_STEP> Place the white rum and 30g sugar into a small saucepan and bring to the boil until the liquid has reduced by half then set aside to cool. <NEXT_STEP> Add the chopped strawberries and leave to soak for about 30 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Place the butter flour remaining sugar and baking powder into a large bowl and using a hand held or freestanding electric mixer slowly mix together until it resembles breadcrumbs. <NEXT_STEP> In a seperate bowl mix together the egg milk and vanilla extract then gradually add incorporate with the dry mix mixing thoroughly. <NEXT_STEP> Drain the strawberries from the rum sugar mixture saving the liquid. <NEXT_STEP> Place a few pieces of strawberry into the bottom of each cupcake case then spoon batter on top until the case is 2/3 full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake in the oven for 15 20 minutes or until the cakes are golden brown and a skewer comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Whilst the cakes are still warm spoon over about 1 teaspoon of the reserved rum sugar reduction. <NEXT_STEP> To make the buttercream mix together the butter and icing sugar until it resembles breadcrumbs in texture then add the milk and remaining rum reduction and mix on a high speed until the frosting is soft and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Decorated the cupcakes with buttercream using either a piping bag or palette knife and finish with a slice of strawberry. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Strawberry Daiquiri Cupcakes <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 190 C and line a 12 bun muffin tin with muffin cases. <NEXT_STEP> Using a hand held electric whisk or freestanding mixer mix the butter sugar flour baking powder and salt on a low speed until it is the texture of breadcrumbs. <NEXT_STEP> Put the eggs in a jug and whisk by hand. <NEXT_STEP> Add the milk and champagne and mix together. <NEXT_STEP> Pour most of the milk mixture into the dry ingredients mixing on a low speed then increase the mixing speed to medium add the rest of the milk mixture and mix until smooth and thick. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon the mixture into the paper cases until full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake in the oven for 18 20 minutes or until risen and springy to the touch. <NEXT_STEP> Leave to cool slightly and then place on a wire rack To make the buttercream use a hand held whisk or freestanding mixer whisk the icing sugar with the butter until mixed then pour in the champagne mixing slowly then increase the speed to high and whisk until soft fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Add a few drops of pink food colouring to achieve a pale pink buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> Top the cooled cupcakes with buttercream with a palette knife or alternatively fill a piping bag and use a star nozzle to pipe onto the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle each cupcake with pink sprinkles. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Pink champagne cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> colouring <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 10g Black sugar paste icing <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 250g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 250g Butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 Egg  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 250g Self raising white flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tbsp Apricot glaze <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 100g White sugar paste icing <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 0.5 tsp Blue food colouring <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 0.5 tsp Pink food colouring <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 10g Black sugar paste icing <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 180 C and line a 12 hole muffin tin with paper cases. <NEXT_STEP> Place the butter and caster sugar in a bowl and cream together until pale and fluffy then add the eggs one by one beating well in between each addition then add the vanilla extract. <NEXT_STEP> Finally carefully fold in the flour until evenly mixed. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon the batter into the paper cases. <NEXT_STEP> Then place in the oven and bake for 20 25 minutes or until a skewer comes out clean and the cupcakes are golden brown and springy to the touch. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the oven and leave to cool on a cooling wire. <NEXT_STEP> To decorate the cakes lightly dust your work surface with icing sugar and roll out the white icing until it is about 5mm thick. <NEXT_STEP> Using a cutter that is the same size as the top of the cupcake cut out discs of the icing. icing and add a small amount of the pink food colour kneading it into the icing until the colour is evenly distributed through the icing. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat this with the blue food colour. <NEXT_STEP> Roll out onto a surface that has been lightly dusted with icing sugar cut a disc from each colour then cut this in half. <NEXT_STEP> Place one half onto the cake for the hat. <NEXT_STEP> Place one half onto the cake for the hat. <NEXT_STEP> For the brim cut a strip of icing and place this on the bottom edge of the hat using a small amount of water to attach. <NEXT_STEP> You can make a bobble for the hat using a small ball of icing or attach a flower to the hat cut using a small flower plunger cutter. <NEXT_STEP> To finish the face you can add a nose using a small ball of icing and 2 eyes made using small balls of black sugar paste icing. <NEXT_STEP> Use baby bottle pram or bib cutters if you have them to decorate other cupcakes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Baby Shower Cupcakes layer of the first colour into all the cases smoothing down and spreading evenly with the back of a teaspoon. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat the process with the other colours in the order of blue green yellow ball of white icing to the top right corner of the eye. <NEXT_STEP> For the nose roll out a ball of black icing and attach to the centre of the cupcake slightly pressing down when attaching to flatten. <NEXT_STEP> For the eye brow and mouth simply roll a little sausage shape of black icing cutting to size if necessary and attach. <NEXT_STEP> To decorate Pudsey s eye patch cut out small Sugar paste icing  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 250g Sugar paste icing  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 250g Butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 250g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 Egg  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 250g Self raising white flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 500g Icing sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 250g Butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 250g Sugar paste icing  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 250g Sugar paste icing  <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 180 C and line a 12 hole cupcake tin with cupcake cases. <NEXT_STEP> Cream together the butter and sugar until pale and fluffy then add the beaten eggs one by one and the vanilla extract mixing well between each one to ensure the mixture doesn t curdle. <NEXT_STEP> Sift in the flour and carefully fold in until just incorporated do not over mix. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon into the cupcake cases until they are 2/3 full then place in the oven for 25 minutes or until a skewer comes out clean and the cakes are golden brown. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the oven leave to cool then transfer to a cooling wire to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Whilst the cakes are cooling you can make the ribbon roses. <NEXT_STEP> Knead the red and white icings and to make pink add some red to the white and knead until the colour is uniform repeat until you have the desired shade of pink. <NEXT_STEP> Next take small pieces of the icing and roll into a thin sausage then using a small rolling pin roll this out until it s flat and quite thin. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in half lengthways then begin to roll the short end over quite tightly until you ve made a small rose bud. <NEXT_STEP> You may need to cut off the excess icing from the base. <NEXT_STEP> Put to one side to set whilst you make the rest. <NEXT_STEP> To make the buttercream place the butter and icing sugar in a large bowl with the vanilla extract and start to beat together slowly to start with then increase the speed and beat until the buttercream is light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> You can add a few drops of food colour here if you wish. <NEXT_STEP> Then spoon into a piping bag with a star nozzle fitted. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe swirls of buttercream onto the top of each cake then place the roses on top. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Ribbon rose cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> between each one then add the rose water OR orange blossom extract. <NEXT_STEP> Carefully fold in the flour then spoon into the cupcake cases until they are about 2/3 full. <NEXT_STEP> Place in the wonderfully light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> This can take up to 5 7 minutes so this stage should not be rushed. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the eggs one at a time with a spoonful of the flour with each one to and carefully mix until distributed evenly through the batter. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon into the cupcake cases until they are 2/3 full then place in the oven for 25 minutes or until a skewer comes out clean and the cakes are springy to the touch. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the oven leave to cool then transfer to a cooling wire to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Whilst the cakes are cooling you can make the sugar paste hearts. <NEXT_STEP> Knead the red and white sugar paste icings and to make pink add a small amount of red to some of the white and knead until the colour is uniform repeat until you have the desired shade of pink. <NEXT_STEP> Roll the icings out on a surface dusted with icing sugar until they are about 2 3mm thick then cut out different sized hearts using heart shaped cutters. <NEXT_STEP> Put to one side on some baking parchment to set whilst you make the rest. <NEXT_STEP> To make the buttercream place the butter and icing sugar in a large bowl with the vanilla extract and start to beat together slowly to start with then increase the speed and beat until the buttercream is light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> You can add a few drops of food colour here if you wish. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe or smooth buttercream onto the top of each cake using a piping bag or palette knife then place the rolo on top. <NEXT_STEP> Add sweets as extra decorations if desired. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START>  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  Edible glitter ) <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 190 C . <NEXT_STEP> Line cupcake trays with 16 cupcake cases. <NEXT_STEP> Place all of the cupcake ingredients in Single cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 250g Dark chocolate <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 50g Butter  <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 200 C and line a cupcake tin with paper cases. <NEXT_STEP> Melt the butter in a large heatproof bowl placed over a saucepan of barely simmering water making sure the bowl does not touch the surface of the water. <NEXT_STEP> When it is half melted add the chocolate. <NEXT_STEP> When the chocolate is completely melted remove from the heat and stir to mix in any lumps then allow to cool for a few minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Dissolve the coffee in the vanilla extract then add this mixture and the sugar to the cooled chocolate and butter. <NEXT_STEP> When these are fully mixed together add the eggs and mix in. <NEXT_STEP> Sift the baking powder and the flour into the mixture and beat until all ingredients are well incorporated and the batter is thick. <NEXT_STEP> Then stir in the water a little at a time making sure the liquid is entirely absorbed into the batter. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the mixture between the paper cases filling each about half full. <NEXT_STEP> Place 3 raspberries on the surface of each they will sink into the batter. <NEXT_STEP> Then fill each case almost to the top and place another fresh raspberry on top. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for about 25 minutes or until each cupcake is firm to the touch or a skewer comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Leave to cool in the tin for 10 minutes and then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> To make the chocolate frosting heat the cream in a small saucepan but do not allow it to boil. <NEXT_STEP> Put the chocolate in a heatproof bowl and pour the hot cream over it through a fine seive. <NEXT_STEP> Gently stir the cream into the chocolate until the mixture is nice and glossy. <NEXT_STEP> Gently mix in the soft butter. <NEXT_STEP> Leave to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Once it is cool ideally using an electric hand whisk beat until nice and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the frosting in swirls on top of each cupcake and decorate with fresh raspberries on top. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate and raspberry cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 40g Butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 pinch Salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 tsp Baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 120ml Milk  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 Egg  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 125g Butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 300g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tsp Milk  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 200g Dark chocolate <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tube Sprinkle decorations <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 170 C and line a muffin tin with 12 paper cases. <NEXT_STEP> To make the sponge put the flour cocoa powder sugar baking powder salt and butter in a freestanding mixer with the paddle attachment or in a bowl and mix with an electric mixer until you get a sandy consistency. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the milk egg and vanilla extract in a jug then slowly add to the flour mixture and beat until smooth and well mixed. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon the mixture into the paper cases and bake in the oven for 20 25 minutes until the sponge bounces back when touched. <NEXT_STEP> Cool on a wire rack leave in the fridge overnight to stale. <NEXT_STEP> To make the frosting put the butter in a large bowl and cream using a hand held electric whisk then add the icing sugar a bit at a time mixing in between. <NEXT_STEP> Add the milk and vanilla extract then whisk until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the cakes from the fridge and crumble into a large bowl until it resembles fine breadcrumbs then mix in some of the frosting until the mixture can be formed into small balls. <NEXT_STEP> Make balls of the mixture by rolling between your hands and place on a baking tray. <NEXT_STEP> Place these in the fridge to set for about 30 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Next melt your dark chocolate and white chocolate in separate bowls. <NEXT_STEP> Dip a lollipop stick into the melted dark chocolate then place into the cake ball. <NEXT_STEP> Once you have put sticks in every ball dip each one into the chocolate to entirely cover the ball. <NEXT_STEP> Then either leave plain or add the sprinkle decorations of your choice. <NEXT_STEP> Leave to set. bowl and mix with an electric mixer until you get a sandy consistency. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the milk and egg together in a jug then slowly add to the flour mixture and beat until smooth and well mixed. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon the mixture into the paper cases and bake in the oven for 20 25 minutes until the sponge bounces back when touched or when a skewer comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Cool on a wire rack then leave in the fridge overnight to stale. <NEXT_STEP> To make the buttercream put the butter in a large bowl and cream until pale and fluffy then add the icing sugar and cocoa powder and mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add the milk and vanilla extract then whisk until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the cakes from the fridge and crumble into a large bowl until it resembles fine breadcrumbs then mix in some of the frosting until the mixture can be formed into small balls. <NEXT_STEP> Make balls of the mixture by rolling between your hands and place on a baking tray then put in the fridge for 15 20 mins. <NEXT_STEP> Melt the dark chocolate then use a fork to dip each cake ball in chocolate entirely covering the ball then leave to set. <NEXT_STEP> Make the icing according to the instructions on the box to a thick consistency then using a teaspoon pour a small amount onto the top of the cake ball allowing it to flow down the sides of the ball. <NEXT_STEP> Once all the cake balls have been iced and this has set finish with some holly and berries decorations. <NEXT_STEP> If you like this recipe why not transform our favourite brownie recipe into some holiday treats <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Christmas Pudding Cake Balls <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> strawberry <NEXT_INPUT> centre <NEXT_INPUT> white <NEXT_INPUT> chip <NEXT_INPUT> muffin <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 150g Self Raising Flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 50g Plain flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 25g Cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 Large free range eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 25g Unsalted butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 85g Proper Nutty peanut butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 65g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 tsp Milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 tsp Salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 packet Green candy melts <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat your oven to 150 c/130 c fan/Gas 2. <NEXT_STEP> Grease and line the base and sides of a 6 inch spring form round tin. <NEXT_STEP> Cream together the butter well to make a smooth fairly stiff batter. <NEXT_STEP> Place in your prepared tin and level the top. <NEXT_STEP> Bake in your preheated oven for 1 hr 15 mins. <NEXT_STEP> and then check to see if it s melts over a pan of simmering water. <NEXT_STEP> Once melted you may need to add 1/2 a teaspoon of vegetable shortening to thin the mixture. <NEXT_STEP> One by one dip the chilled balls into the green candy. <NEXT_STEP> Shake off any drips and place on a board covered with baking parchment. <NEXT_STEP> Use a cocktail stick or paintbrush to rough up the surface a little. <NEXT_STEP> If you would like to you can paint little faces on them using a fine brush and black food paint. <NEXT_STEP> We used edible lustre powder applied with a soft brush to give them rosy cheeks. <STEP_END> swirls. <NEXT_STEP> Anti clockwise swirls will create a buttercream rose effect. <NEXT_STEP> You can practise on a sheet of baking paper beforehand. <NEXT_STEP> Decorate with chocolate shavings. <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tsp Cider vinegar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 0.5 tsp Xanthan powder <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Set the oven to 180 C fan and put 12 flour Xanthan and baking powder and beat again until the flour is incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in the cherries and chocolate chips gently. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the mixture into a jug and pour evenly into the 12 muffin cases. <NEXT_STEP> There should be at least 1cm of paper case above the mixture to allow the muffins to rise without spilling over the top. <NEXT_STEP> If you have more mixture then keep it back and bake anything extra when the first batch are done. <NEXT_STEP> Bake the muffins for 25 minutes or until well risen and firm to light pressure a skewer will come out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Eat while still warm or keep in an airtight box for a few days. <NEXT_STEP> If you would like to keep these longer then freeze in the paper case and warm a little in the oven after defrosting. <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> icing <NEXT_INPUT> colouring <NEXT_INPUT> fondant <NEXT_INPUT> colour <NEXT_INPUT> food <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 50 <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 400g Butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 400g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 Egg  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 400g Self raising white flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 200g Fondant icing sugar  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  Water  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  Food colouring  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  Apricot jam  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 150g Butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 300g Icing sugar  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1.5 tbsp Milk  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  Food colouring  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1kg Sugar paste icing  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  Food colouring  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 400g Butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 400g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 Egg  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 400g Self raising white flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 200g Fondant icing sugar  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  Water  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  Food colouring  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  Apricot jam  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 150g Butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 300g Icing sugar  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1.5 tbsp Milk  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  Food colouring  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1kg Sugar paste icing  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  Food colouring  <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 200 C . <NEXT_STEP> Line 2 x 12 hole muffin tray with the paper cases of your choice. <NEXT_STEP> Place the butter in a large mixing bowl and add the sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Beat together preferably with an electric whisk until the mixture is wonderfully light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> This can take up to 5 7 minutes so this stage should not be rushed. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the eggs one at a time with a spoonful of the flour with each one to prevent the mixture from curdling. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in the remaining flour with a metal spoon until you have a soft smooth cake batter. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the mixture between the paper cases filling only to half the height. <NEXT_STEP> Place in the oven and bake in the oven for about 12 15 minutes or until the cakes spring back when pressed gently with a finger and are pale golden in colour. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cakes on a wire cooling rack. <NEXT_STEP> Wrap in cling film to keep for up to a day in a cool dry place. <NEXT_STEP> If you want to make the cupcakes in advance wrap and freeze. <NEXT_STEP> To decorate the cup cakes with fondant icing mix together the fondant icing sugar and water adding the water a teaspoon at a time until the icing has a smooth consistency that will cover the back of spoon. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the icing into small bowls and colour each using a few drops of food colouring the colour of your choice. <NEXT_STEP> Brush the cupcakes with a little melted apricot jam. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon a little icing onto each cupcake and turn them allowing the icing to flow gently to the edge of the cup cakes. <NEXT_STEP> Let the icing set firmly before decorating with fondant cut outs or piping. <NEXT_STEP> To decorate with buttercream beat the butter in a large bowl until soft. <NEXT_STEP> Add half of the icing sugar and continue to beat until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining icing sugar and one tablespoon of the milk and mix together until creamy and smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add more milk if necessary to loosen the icing. <NEXT_STEP> Colour the buttercream by adding a few drops of the food colouring of your choice. <NEXT_STEP> To pipe swirls on cupcakes use a large star or plain nozzle hold the bag vertically and pipe a ring of icing around the edge of the cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe a small spiral overlapping the ring stop pressure when the bag is in the center of the swirl then push the bag down and draw up sharply to finish the peak. <NEXT_STEP> To make sugar paste decorations add a few drops food colouring to white sugar paste by dipping a wooden skewer into the food colouring and piercing the icing all over. <NEXT_STEP> Knead until you get a nice even colour. <NEXT_STEP> You may need to wear food safe gloves to avoid staining your hands. <NEXT_STEP> Lightly dust a surface with icing sugar and roll the coloured icing and cut shapes such as hearts flowers or butterflies and leave to set. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Cupcake wedding cake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> lemon <NEXT_INPUT> tray <NEXT_INPUT> curd <NEXT_INPUT> victoria <NEXT_INPUT> squirt <INPUT_END> Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 Eggs  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 150g Self raising white flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 tsp Baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 250g Icing sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 80g Butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 340g Dark green candy melts <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 30g White sugar paste icing <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Begin by preheating your oven to 180 C . <NEXT_STEP> Line a cupcake tin with 12 paper cupcake cases. <NEXT_STEP> Beat together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually add in the eggs baking powder flour and vanilla extract and beat until fully combined. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon the mixture into the cupcake cases filling each of them 2/3 full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 20 25 minutes until the cupcakes are golden and springy to touch. <NEXT_STEP> Once the cupcakes are baked allow them to cool on a cooling rack. <NEXT_STEP> You can leave the cupcake overnight to stale a bit as stale crumbs work well for cake pops. <NEXT_STEP> To make the buttercream beat together the butter icing sugar and vanilla extract. <NEXT_STEP> Keep to one side. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl crumble the cupcake sponge finely and mix together with the buttercream to form a large ball. <NEXT_STEP> Break off small amounts of the mixture and roll into individual bitesize balls. <NEXT_STEP> Place each ball on a piece of greaseproof paper on a plate or a baking tray and leave to chill in the fridge. <NEXT_STEP> Place a quarter of the candy melts in a microwaveable bowl and gradually melt them in short blasts in the microwave mixing each time to loosen the mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the cake balls from the fridge and dip the end of each cake pop stick in the melted Candy Melt mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Insert the cake pop sticks partially into the cake balls and then return them back to the fridge to set. <NEXT_STEP> Once the sticks have set securely keep aside 12 of the Candy Melts and melt the remaining ones in the microwave. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the cake pops from the fridge and dip each one into the melted mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Twizzle the cake pops when removing them from the Candy Melts to give a smooth finish and then place them upright to dry  You will need to move quickly before the melted Candy Melts set. <NEXT_STEP> Use a clean small paintbrush to paint on the added facial features to the Yoda. <NEXT_STEP> Slice one of the unmelted Candy Melts in half and insert into the side of the cake pops for the ears. <NEXT_STEP> Break off small amount of white sugar paste icing and roll into two tiny balls for Yoda s eyes. <NEXT_STEP> Position them on the face whilst the Candy Melts are still wet so that they will stick into place. <NEXT_STEP> For the finishing touches use an edible pen to mark the pupils in the eyes. <NEXT_STEP> Roll another small ball of white sugar paste fondant for the nose dip in the Candy Melt and carefully position under the eyes. <NEXT_STEP> This will secure in place when the mixture sets. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Yoda Cake Pops <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> apple <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tbsp Cinnamon <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Pre heat the oven to 200 C . <NEXT_STEP> Line muffin trays with 16 muffin cases. <NEXT_STEP> To make the topping combine the sugar and cinnamon in a small bowl and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl sieve together the flour baking powder bicarbonate of soda cream of tartar nutmeg and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a seperate bowl cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time and beat well after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the vanilla extract followed by the sour cream and buttermilk. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in the dry ingredients until just incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Using an ice cream scoop or large spoon drop a scoop of batter into the bowl with the sugar and cinnamon topping. <NEXT_STEP> Roll the dough around until it is covered in topping before placing into the muffin liner. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with the remaining batter. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle with any leftover topping. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until the muffins are golden brown and a skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> This should take approximately 18 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Set on a wire rack to cool slightly before removing from the tin and serving warm. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Snickerdoodle muffins  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> icing <NEXT_INPUT> <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  Apricot Jam <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 180 C and line a 12 hole cupcake tin with cases. <NEXT_STEP> Cream together the butter and sugar until pale and fluffy then add the eggs one by one mixing well in between then add the vanilla extract. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in the flour then spoon into the cases until they are about 2/3 full. <NEXT_STEP> Place in the oven for 20 25 minutes or until golden and a skewer comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the oven and leave to cool completely To make the father christmas cake topper use the red sugar paste icing and roll out a ball about 5cm in diameter then flatten the base. <NEXT_STEP> Next roll out a sausage about 10cm long and 1.5cm diameter for his arms and finally make a cone shape for his hat and squash the pointed end over to one side. <NEXT_STEP> Take some of the white icing and a little of the red and roll them together until the red blends in to give you a pink colour for his head. <NEXT_STEP> Next take some black icing and roll 2 small balls for eyes 2 larger balls for his gloved hands and then roll out a little for a belt. <NEXT_STEP> Cut this out using a sharp knife. <NEXT_STEP> You can use a small star for his belt buckle. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble use a little water to glue the black belt onto the red body. <NEXT_STEP> Next finish the arms by attaching the black hands to the ends of the red sausage shape. <NEXT_STEP> The roll out some of the white icing until it is about 5mm thick and cut 2 strips using a sharp knife roll these around the end of the arms for his cuffs using some water to glue. <NEXT_STEP> Then cut the arms leaving a diagonal edge. <NEXT_STEP> Attach these using a little water squashing the arms around the body. <NEXT_STEP> Next make a small ball using the white icing for a pom pom and attach to the top of the hat then attach the hat to the top of his head using some water. <NEXT_STEP> Take a strip of rolled out white icing and place this around the base of the hat to hide the join. <NEXT_STEP> To finish cut a disc of white icing using a fluted biscuit cutter and cut out a small edge piece for his beard and 2 smaller pieces for his moustache attach these to the face using a little water. <NEXT_STEP> Make a small ball using red icing for his nose and attach this. <NEXT_STEP> Then attach 2 small balls of white icing and smaller ball of black icing for his eyes. <NEXT_STEP> To decorate your cupcake roll out some chocolate icing and cut into a disc the same size as the top of the cupcake place this on the cake using some warmed apricot jam to stick. <NEXT_STEP> Then sit your jolly father christmas on the top. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Father christmas cupcake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> kirsch <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 400g Butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 500g Icing sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 0.5 tsp Lemon extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 0.5 tsp Rose water <NEXT_STEP> Place the butter and sugar in a mixing bowl and beat with a wooden spoon or electric mixer until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually beat in the eggs a little at a time until smooth adding a little flour if the mixture curdles. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the flour and vanilla extract until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Place heaped dessertspoon full in each cupcake case and bake for 20 25 minutes until golden brown and just firm to the touch. <NEXT_STEP> Allow the cupcakes to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> They are best made the day before if possible. <NEXT_STEP> To make the buttercreams mix 200g of the softened butter with 250g of icing sugar in two separate bowls until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> In one bowl add 1/2 teaspoon of lemon extract and a few drops of yellow food colouring in the other polystyrene ball into the bucket or vase and push down firmly so that it sits securely and the bucket is cutting into the ball to hold it in place. <NEXT_STEP> Make a little slit with the point of a knife in the base of each cupcake case and insert a wooden lollypop stick into the cake. <NEXT_STEP> Push the lollypop stick into the polystyrene ball and start arranging the cakes first in a circle around the edge of the bucket then another circle of cakes on top until all the ball is covered. <NEXT_STEP> You may not need all the cakes. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the cakes with a swirl of butter cream on each cake to make it look like a rose. <NEXT_STEP> Cut small squares of green tissue paper bring up all 4 corners to make a scrunch of paper and push in between the cakes. <NEXT_STEP> Keep the bouquet in a cold place and serve within 1 day. <NEXT_STEP> Wrap in cellophane when the icing has dried and tie with a ribbon if desired. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Cupcake Bouquet <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> mincemeat <NEXT_INPUT> almond <NEXT_INPUT> icing <NEXT_INPUT> silver <NEXT_INPUT> macarons <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 30 <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 115g Ground Almonds <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 180g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1.5 tsp Cinnamon <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 Egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch Salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tbsp Billington s Unrefined Light Muscovado Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 0.25 tsp Cream of tartar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2.5 tbsp Mincemeat <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 60g Unsalted butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 50g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Nielsen massey orange extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 115g Ground Almonds <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 180g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1.5 tsp Cinnamon <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 Egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch Salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tbsp Billington s Unrefined Light Muscovado Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 0.25 tsp Cream of tartar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2.5 tbsp Mincemeat <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 60g Unsalted butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 50g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Nielsen massey orange extract <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Line three baking sheets with baking parchment. <NEXT_STEP> Place the ground almonds in a food processor and whizz to a fine powder. <NEXT_STEP> Sift the icing sugar cinnamon and ground almonds together. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the egg whites with the salt using a hand held mixer or table top electric mixer until stiff peaks. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually whisk in the light muscovado with the cream of tartar and continue to beat until the mixture is stiff and glossy. <NEXT_STEP> Fold through half of the almond mixture using a large metal spoon and once combined well add the remaining almond mixture and repeat the process. <NEXT_STEP> Place the mixture in a piping bag fitted with a 1.5cm plain nozzle and pipe 4cm rounds onto the baking trays. <NEXT_STEP> Hold the piping bag upright so that they expand evenly when baked. <NEXT_STEP> Lightly tap the trays onto the work surface to knock out any air bubbles and then flatten any peaks with a dampened finger. <NEXT_STEP> Let the macarons sit for 20 30 minutes to form skins on top . <NEXT_STEP> Preheat the oven to 160C . <NEXT_STEP> Bake each one separately on the middle shelf of the oven for 10 12 minutes or until feel firm to the touch on top. <NEXT_STEP> Remove and cool completely on the trays. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile make the filling by whizzing the mincemeat in a small food processor until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> In a separate bowl whisk together the butter and icing sugar with the orange extract until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the mincemeat and then fill a piping bag. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the buttercream icing onto half of the macarons and sandwich with the remaining macaron halves. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Christmas Macaroons <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> lime <NEXT_INPUT> citrus <NEXT_INPUT> orange <NEXT_INPUT> lemon <NEXT_INPUT> silver <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 10 <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 100g Unsalted butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 Orange lemon or lime  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 200g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 100g Unsalted butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 Orange lemon or lime  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 200g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Beat the butter and sugar together until smooth then add the vanilla extract. <NEXT_STEP> Mix in the orange/lemon/lime juice depending on your taste preference. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Citrus Buttercream <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> biscuit <NEXT_INPUT> icing <NEXT_INPUT> shape <NEXT_INPUT> till <NEXT_INPUT> fray <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 20 <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 200g Butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 400g Allinson s plain white flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 200g Silver Spoon White Caster Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 Egg  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 500g Sugar paste icing  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 200g Butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 400g Allinson s plain white flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 200g Silver Spoon White Caster Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 Egg  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 500g Sugar paste icing  <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Line two or three baking trays with greaseproof paper. <NEXT_STEP> Place all the ingredients in a bowl and mix with a spoon. <NEXT_STEP> Once blended use your hands to thoroughly knead the dough. <NEXT_STEP> Wrap the dough in cling film and leave in the fridge for 30 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Preheat the oven to 170 C . <NEXT_STEP> To roll out the cookies sprinkle a little flour on your work surface and knead a little dough at a time leaving the rest in the fridge till you are ready to use it. <NEXT_STEP> When making iced biscuits its best to make them quite thick so that they can be handled easily. <NEXT_STEP> Cut out your desired shape place the cookie on a piece of baking parchment and then place the baking tray in the fridge. <NEXT_STEP> By cooling the tray and cookies they are less likely to spread when cooking and it prevents them from losing their shape. <NEXT_STEP> Bake your cookies in the oven for 10 12 minutes or until golden. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to cool before icing. <NEXT_STEP> When icing your cookies roll out sugar paste icing till it is really thin about 1 2mm thick. <NEXT_STEP> Then use the same cutter as you used for the cookie to cut out your shape in icing. <NEXT_STEP> Lift each piece of icing as you go so you can ensure that the edges are clean and sharp and there is no fraying which will look messy once it is on the biscuit. <NEXT_STEP> To get a sharp edge make sure that you have enough icing sugar under the icing when you roll it out to prevent the shape from sticking to the surface and when cutting out the shape move it around a little bit. <NEXT_STEP> If you need to remove any fray from the edges place the icing flat on your hand and with a soft bristled brush sweep the edges so the fray goes underneath. <NEXT_STEP> Do this lightly or you will make indents. <NEXT_STEP> When ready brush the back of the icing with water so that it becomes moist not wet then position on the biscuit. <NEXT_STEP> Use the palm of your hand to smooth the icing and leave to set/dry for a few hours. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat for each biscuit. <NEXT_STEP> For additional decoration make up a batch of royal icing which can be coloured with food colouring and pipe onto the biscuits. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Birthday Biscuits <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> buttercream <NEXT_INPUT> icing <NEXT_INPUT> loosens <NEXT_INPUT> silver <NEXT_INPUT> nielsen <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 1 <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 100g Unsalted butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 200g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tbsp Whole milk <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Bring your butter to room temperature so that it is softened then using either a hand or electric mixer beat together the butter adding in the icing sugar gradually until fully incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Add in the vanilla and continue to beat until the buttercream is light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> This might take a few minutes the longer that you beat your buttercream for the light in texture it will be. <NEXT_STEP> If your buttercream is quite stiff add half a table spoon of milk and whisk until it loosens. <NEXT_STEP> Once the buttercream is ready fill a piping bag fitted with a nozzle with the buttercream to pipe decorations on your cupcakes or alternatively use a pallet knife to smooth your buttercream inside or over your cake. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Basic buttercream icing <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> biscuit <NEXT_INPUT> star <NEXT_INPUT> white Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Cinnamon for dusting <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 150g White chocolate  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 250g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 125g Butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tbsp Cinnamon <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tbsp Milk  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 340g Butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 340g Billington s Light Brown Soft Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 Eggs  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 340g Allinson s self raising wholemeal flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tbsp Ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tbsp Milk  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 225ml Water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 115g Butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 145g Allinson s Plain White Flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 Eggs  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 115g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp Cinnamon for dusting <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 150g White chocolate  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 250g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 125g Butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tbsp Cinnamon <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tbsp Milk  <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat your oven to 190 c/170 c fan/gas mark 5. <NEXT_STEP> Grease and line the bases of 3 20cm loose bottomed sandwich tins. <NEXT_STEP> Cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk in the eggs one at a time adding a tablespoon of flour with each one to stop the mixture curdling. <NEXT_STEP> Once the eggs have been added sift in the remaining flour baking powder and cinnamon. <NEXT_STEP> Tip in any bran left in the sieve. <NEXT_STEP> Gently fold in the flour and finally the milk until the batter has a soft dropping consistency. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the mixture evenly between the three tins and bake for 28 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Check to see if the sponges spring back. <NEXT_STEP> They may need an additional 3 minutes and perhaps moving up in the oven if they have been baking on a lower shelf. <NEXT_STEP> When the sponges are cooked allow to cool in the tins for 5 minutes before turning out onto a rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> To make the churros heat the oven to 200c/180fan/Gas6 and line 2 baking trays with parchment. <NEXT_STEP> Place the water butter and sugar into a medium saucepan and bring to a simmer. <NEXT_STEP> When the liquid is simmering remove from the heat and shoot in the flour. <NEXT_STEP> Beat vigorously until the mixture form a ball. <NEXT_STEP> Place back on the heat and stir for one minute. <NEXT_STEP> Remove form the heat and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the eggs in a jug together with the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually beat this mixture into the flour mixture in the pan a quarter at a time. <NEXT_STEP> The mixture will seem slimy but when beaten vigorously it will become a stiff elastic paste. <NEXT_STEP> Prepare a piping bag with an open star nozzle and pipe 10cm lengths on the lined trays leaving space for them to expand. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 18 minutes and then allow to dry out in the turned off oven for 10 minutes before cooling completely on a rack. <NEXT_STEP> To make the icing melt the chocolate and allow to cool to room temperature. <NEXT_STEP> Cream together the butter and icing sugar until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the cinnamon and the cooled white chocolate. <NEXT_STEP> Finally add the milk and whisk hard for up to 5 minutes until the icing is very smooth and light. <NEXT_STEP> Before you assemble the cake brush the churros with a little melted butter and dust with the extra sugar and cinnamon. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble lay one cake on your plate and top with 1/3 of the buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with the second and third cakes. <NEXT_STEP> Finally top with the churros. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Churros Cake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INGREDIENT_START> 2 cups white whole wheat flour or gluten free flour  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  tsp baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  tsp ground allspice <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  tsp ground nutmeg <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  tsp salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  tbsp unsalted butter or coconut oil melted and cooled slightly <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large egg whites room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tbsp vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tsp liquid stevia <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tbsp confectioners style erythritol <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  cup plain nonfat Greek yogurt <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  cup 2 tbsp nonfat milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups freshly grated carrots  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> cream cheese frosting for serving  <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 F and line 36 mini muffin cups with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Generously coat the liners with nonstick cooking spray. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium bowl whisk together the flour baking powder baking soda cinnamon allspice nutmeg and salt. <NEXT_STEP> In a separate bowl whisk together the butter or coconut oil and egg whites. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the vanilla extract liquid stevia and erythritol. <NEXT_STEP> Add the Greek yogurt stirring until no lumps remain. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in 2 tablespoons of milk. <NEXT_STEP> Alternate between adding the flour mixture and remaining milk beginning and ending with the flour mixture and stirring just until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Gently fold in the carrots. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter between the prepared muffin cups. <NEXT_STEP> Bake at 350 F for 13 16 minutes or until the tops are firm to the touch. <NEXT_STEP> Cool in the muffin cups for 5 minutes before carefully transferring to a wire rack. <NEXT_STEP> Once completely cool top the mini cupcakes with cream cheese frosting just before serving. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Healthy Mini Carrot Cake Cupcakes <TITLE_END> Line 14 muffin cups with paper liners and coat the liners with cooking spray. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium bowl whisk together the flour baking powder baking soda salt and orange zest. <NEXT_STEP> In a separate bowl whisk together the coconut oil egg whites vanilla and vanilla stevia. <NEXT_STEP> Add in the Greek yogurt stirring until no large lumps remain. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the orange juice. <NEXT_STEP> Alternate between adding the flour mixture and the milk beginning and ending with the flour mixture and stirring just until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Gently fold in the cranberries. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter between the prepared paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Bake at 350 F for 22 25 minutes or until the centers feel firm to the touch and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Cool in the pan for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> While the cupcakes bake prepare the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Add the Greek yogurt cream cheese instant pudding and vanilla stevia to a large bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Beat with an electric mixer for 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cover the top of the bowl with foil and refrigerate for at least 2 hours. <NEXT_STEP> Once the cupcakes have completely cooled pipe the cream cheese frosting on top just before serving. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Healthy Cranberry Orange Cupcakes with Cream Cheese foil cupcake liners in 12 muffin cups. <NEXT_STEP> Lightly coat the liners with nonstick cooking spray. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium bowl whisk together the cocoa powder flour baking powder and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Add the Greek yogurt pudding mix and Truvia to a large bowl and beat for 2 minutes or until thickened. <NEXT_STEP> Mix in the raspberry pur e. room temperature  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tsp vanilla extract  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  tsp peppermint extract  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  c plain nonfat Greek yogurt  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 c granulated sugar  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tbsp nonfat milk  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>   <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 c plain nonfat Greek yogurt  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 servings sugar free fat free vanilla instant pudding mix  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 4 tbsp granulated sucralose  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tbsp chocolate syrup  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 York Peppermint Pattie Minis <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 F and Add in Greek yogurt stirring until no large lumps of yogurt remain. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the maple syrup and 1 tablespoon of milk. <NEXT_STEP> Alternate between adding the oat mixture and remaining 4 tablespoons of milk beginning and ending with the oat mixture and stirring just until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Gently fold in the peaches. <NEXT_STEP> Spread the batter into the prepared pan. <NEXT_STEP> Bake at 350 F for 30 35 minutes or until the center feels firm to the touch and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean or with a few crumbs attached. <NEXT_STEP> Cool completely to room temperature in the pan before slicing and serving. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Healthy Peach Oatmeal Breakfast Cake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> almond Dairy-Free!} <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> truffle <NEXT_INPUT> raspberry <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> sphere <NEXT_INPUT> dried <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 24 truffles <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START>  cup freeze dried raspberries  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  cup fresh raspberries <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tbsp water <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  tsp salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp liquid stevia or adjusted to taste  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  cup oat flour  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  cup roughly chopped dark chocolate  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> optional flaky sea salt for finishing  <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Place a sheet of wax paper or parchment paper on a baking tray. <NEXT_STEP> Add the freeze dried raspberries to a blender food processor or coffee grinder. <NEXT_STEP> Pulse until they re a fine powder. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer to a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Add the fresh raspberries and water to a blender or food processor. <NEXT_STEP> Pulse until they form a smooth pur e. Add them to the bowl with the freeze dried raspberries and stir until they re thoroughly combined. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the salt and liquid stevia until thoroughly combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add in the oat flour stirring until just incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Working with a small amount of the mixture at a time roll into a bite sized sphere. <NEXT_STEP> Place on the prepared baking sheet. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with the remaining mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Place the dark chocolate into a microwave safe bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Microwave on HIGH for 30 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Stir for 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Continue to heat for 10 second intervals stirring for 1 minute between each until the chocolate has completely melted. <NEXT_STEP> Working with one filling sphere at a time carefully dip it in the melted chocolate using two forks and let the excess drip off by rocking it between the two forks. <NEXT_STEP> Place back onto the wax paper. <NEXT_STEP> If using the flaky sea salt sprinkle a small amount on the top of the dipped truffle . <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with the remaining chocolate and filling spheres. <NEXT_STEP> Once all 24 truffles have been coated place them in the freezer for 5 10 minutes or until the chocolate has hardened. <NEXT_STEP> Store in the refrigerator until ready to eat. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Healthy Raspberry Truffles <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> truffle <NEXT_INPUT> eggnog <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> flaky <NEXT_INPUT> sphere <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 24 truffles <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 5 tbsp almond milk eggnog  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  tsp ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  tsp ground nutmeg <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  tsp salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  tsp vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  tsp liquid stevia or adjusted to taste <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup oat flour  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  cup roughly chopped dark chocolate  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> optional flaky sea salt for finishing  <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Place a sheet of wax paper or parchment paper on a baking tray. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium bowl stir together the eggnog cinnamon nutmeg salt vanilla and liquid stevia. <NEXT_STEP> Add in the oat flour stirring until just incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Working with a small amount of the mixture at a time roll into a bite sized sphere. <NEXT_STEP> Place on the prepared baking sheet. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with the remaining mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Place the dark chocolate into a microwave safe bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Microwave on HIGH for 30 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Stir for 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Continue to heat for 10 second intervals stirring for 1 minute between each until the chocolate has completely melted. <NEXT_STEP> Working with one filling sphere at a time carefully dip it in the melted chocolate using two forks and let the excess drip off by rocking it between the two forks. <NEXT_STEP> Place back onto the wax paper. <NEXT_STEP> If using the flaky sea salt sprinkle a small amount on the top of the dipped truffle . <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with the remaining chocolate and filling spheres. <NEXT_STEP> Once all 24 truffles have been coated place them in the freezer for 5 10 minutes or until the chocolate has hardened. <NEXT_STEP> Store in the refrigerator until ready to eat. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Healthy Eggnog Truffles <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> blueberries <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tsp nonfat milk <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 425 F and line a baking sheet with a silicone baking mat or parchment paper. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium <NEXT_INPUT> wrap <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 1 pie, 10 slices <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 cup white whole wheat flour  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  tsp salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 tbsp cold butter cut into cubes <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tsp nonfat milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp pure maple syrup <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  tsp vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 2 tsp ice water <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> generous 2 cups thick slices Fuji apple cut in half  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> generous 2 cups thick slices Gala apple cut in half  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> heaping 1 cups thick slices Granny Smith apple cut in half  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 tbsp cornstarch <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tsp ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  tsp ground allspice <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  tsp ground nutmeg <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 tbsp water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tbsp pure maple syrup <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> To prepare the crust whisk together the flour and salt in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Cut in the butter using a pastry cutter the back of a fork or two knives until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. <NEXT_STEP> In a separate bowl stir together the milk maple syrup vanilla extract and teaspoon of ice water. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle the liquid mixture over the flour mixture and stir until fully incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Continue to add ice water teaspoon at a time until the mixture comes together to form a dough. <NEXT_STEP> Place a large sheet of plastic wrap on the counter. <NEXT_STEP> Using your hands form the dough into a 1 thick circle. <NEXT_STEP> Place the dough in the center of the plastic wrap and lay another large sheet of plastic wrap on top. <NEXT_STEP> Fold up the excess plastic wrap and refrigerate the dough for at least 30 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> While the dough chills prepare the filling. <NEXT_STEP> Toss together the apple slices cornstarch cinnamon allspice and nutmeg until the spices are evenly distributed on the apples. <NEXT_STEP> Drizzle in the maple syrup and water and toss the apples again until they re evenly coated. <NEXT_STEP> Preheat the oven to 425 F and place a dark metal baking sheet into the oven on the middle rack. <NEXT_STEP> Lightly coat a regular 9 pie plate with cooking spray. <NEXT_STEP> Leaving the dough between the sheets of plastic wrap roll it out until it s 1 to 2 wider than the top of the pie plate. <NEXT_STEP> Peel off the top layer of plastic wrap and gently invert the pie dough into the prepared pie plate. <NEXT_STEP> Peel off the second layer of plastic wrap and gently press the pie dough into place. <NEXT_STEP> Trim the overhang. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the filling on top of the pie dough and gently but firmly press down to eliminate as much space between the apples as possible. <NEXT_STEP> Cover the top of the entire pie plate with foil trying to bump up the center so it s not touching the apple slices. <NEXT_STEP> Place the foil covered pie plate on the dark metal baking sheet in the oven. <NEXT_STEP> Bake the pie at 425 F for 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Without opening the oven door reduce the temperature to 350 F and continue to bake for an additional 40 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Carefully remove the foil from the top of the pie plate and continue to bake at 350 for another 15 minutes or until the outer crust is golden in color. <NEXT_STEP> Let the pie cool completely to room temperature before slicing and serving. the sphere until it s just barely smaller than the mini muffin cup. <NEXT_STEP> Place onto the prepared baking sheet. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with the rest of the filling mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Place the dark chocolate into a microwave safe bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Microwave on HIGH for 30 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Stir for 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Continue to heat for 10 second intervals stirring for 1 minute between each until the chocolate has completely melted. <NEXT_STEP> Dollop a small amount of melted chocolate into one mini muffin liner enough to cover the bottom and carefully set one of the flattened filling spheres on top. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon more melted chocolate on top carefully spreading it so it drips over the sides of the filling and into every nook and cranny of those liners. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with the remaining chocolate and filling discs. <NEXT_STEP> Once all 24 mini muffin cups have been filled place them in the freezer for 5 10 minutes or until the chocolate has hardened. <NEXT_STEP> Store in the refrigerator or freezer until ready to eat. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Healthy Dark Chocolate Funfetti Peanut Butter Cups <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> cut out shapes and transfer the cookie dough circles onto the prepared baking sheets. <NEXT_STEP> Gather the unused dough squish it into a ball between your palms and roll it out between the sheets of plastic wrap again. <NEXT_STEP> Continue to cut out circles until all of the dough has been used. <NEXT_STEP> Bake the cookies at 350 F for 13 16 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let them cool on the baking sheet for 10 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Line two large baking sheets with wax paper. <NEXT_STEP> Melt the chocolate in a small bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Carefully dip Fold in the zucchini and 3 tablespoons of miniature chocolate chips. <NEXT_STEP> Spread the batter into the prepared muffin cups and gently press the remaining miniature chocolate chips on top. <NEXT_STEP> Bake at 350 F for 12 15 minutes or until the tops feel firm to the touch and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Cool in the pan for 10 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Healthy Chai Spice Chocolate Chip Zucchini Mini Muffins <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cranberry <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 2 cups whole wheat flour  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 tbsp coconut sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tsp ground cinnamon  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  tbsp unsalted butter melted <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Lightly coat a 9 round pan with nonstick cooking spray. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl stir together the milk butter sugar and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle the yeast on top and wait 10 15 minutes or until the mixture turns frothy. <NEXT_STEP> Mix in 1 cups of flour. <NEXT_STEP> If the dough is still wet continue stirring in flour 2 tablespoons at a time until the dough begins to pull away from the sides of the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the dough out onto a well floured surface and knead for 3 5 minutes or until the dough springs back most of the way when you gently press your index finger into it. <NEXT_STEP> Let the dough rest while preparing the filling. <NEXT_STEP> To prepare the filling stir together the coconut sugar and cinnamon in a small bowl. <NEXT_STEP> On a clean well floured surface roll the dough out into a 16x10 rectangle. <NEXT_STEP> Brush with the melted butter leaving a 1 border on the two longer sides. <NEXT_STEP> <NEXT_STEP> Pinch the ends to seal. <NEXT_STEP> If the dough won t stick together gently brush the second longer edge with water before pinching to seal. <NEXT_STEP> Slice the log into 12 pieces using dental floss or a sharp serrated knife. <NEXT_STEP> Place the rolls into the prepared pan and cover the pan with a clean towel. <NEXT_STEP> Set the pan in a warm draft free spot and let the rolls rise for 30 45 minutes or until doubled in size. <NEXT_STEP> Preheat the oven to 350 F. Bake the cinnamon rolls for 18 22 minutes or until the filling is bubbling and the sides feel firm. <NEXT_STEP> Cool in the pan for at least 10 minutes before serving. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> The
