pur e and Greek yogurt mixing until no large lumps remain. <NEXT_STEP> Alternate between adding the flour mixture and milk beginning and ending with the flour mixture and stirring just until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Gently fold in 3 tablespoons of mini chocolate chips. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter between the prepared muffin cups and gently press the remaining chocolate chips into the tops. <NEXT_STEP> Bake at 350 F for 12 15 minutes or until the tops are firm to the touch. <NEXT_STEP> Cool in the muffin cups for 5 minutes before carefully transferring to a wire rack. <STEP_END> <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tbsp vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tbsp vanilla cr me stevia <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  cup plain nonfat Greek yogurt <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  cup freshly squeezed Meyer lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> roll <NEXT_INPUT> cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> dough <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cinnamon rolls <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START>  cup warm nonfat milk  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  tbsp unsalted butter melted <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tbsp coconut sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  tsp salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tsp dry yeast <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 2 cups whole wheat flour  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 tbsp coconut sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tsp ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  tbsp unsalted butter melted <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Line a 5 or 6 quart slow cooker with foil and lightly coat the foil with nonstick cooking spray. <NEXT_STEP> Wipe up any cooking spray that lands on the rim of the slow cooker with a paper towel. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl stir together the milk butter sugar and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle the yeast on top and wait 10 15 minutes or until the mixture turns frothy. <NEXT_STEP> Mix in 1 cups of flour. <NEXT_STEP> If the dough is still wet continue stirring in flour 2 tablespoons at a time until the dough begins to pull away from the sides of the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the dough out onto a well floured surface and knead for 3 5 minutes or until the dough springs back most of the way when you gently press your index finger into it. <NEXT_STEP> Let the dough rest while preparing the filling. <NEXT_STEP> To prepare the filling stir together the coconut sugar and cinnamon in a small bowl. <NEXT_STEP> On a clean well floured surface roll the dough out into a 16x10 rectangle. <NEXT_STEP> Brush with the melted butter leaving a 1 border on the two longer sides. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle with the cinnamon sugar leaving a 1 border on the two longer sides again. <NEXT_STEP> Carefully roll up the dough into a log starting at one long edge and rolling towards the other one. <NEXT_STEP> Pinch the ends to seal. <NEXT_STEP> If the dough won t stick together gently brush the second longer edge with water before pinching to seal. <NEXT_STEP> Slice the log into 12 pieces using dental floss or a sharp serrated knife. <NEXT_STEP> Place the rolls into the prepared slow cooker and place the lid on top. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the slow cooker to its Keep Warm setting and let the rolls rise for 30 45 minutes or until doubled in size. <NEXT_STEP> Without removing the lid turn the slow cooker to its Low setting. <NEXT_STEP> Bake the cinnamon rolls for 1 hour 15 minutes to 1 hour 30 minutes or until the filling is bubbling and the sides of the cinnamon rolls feel firm. <NEXT_STEP> Cool in the pan for at least 10 minutes before carefully lifting the foil insert out of the slow cooker and serving. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Healthy Slow Cooker Cinnamon Rolls <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> protein <NEXT_INPUT> carrot <NEXT_INPUT> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 425 F and lightly coat 8 standard sized muffin cups with nonstick cooking spray. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk together the coconut flour protein powder baking powder cinnamon nutmeg and salt in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> In a separate bowl whisk together the coconut oil egg and vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the Greek yogurt until no large lumps remain. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the maple syrup and liquid stevia. <NEXT_STEP> Alternate between adding the coconut flour mixture and milk beginning and ending with the coconut flour mixture and stirring just until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Let the batter rest for 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Gently fold in the carrots. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter between the prepared muffin cups. <NEXT_STEP> Bake at 425 F for 8 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Without opening the oven door reduce the oven temperature to 350 F and continue baking for an additional 19 22 minutes or until the tops feel firm to the touch and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Cool in the muffin cups for 5 minutes before carefully transferring to a wire rack. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Healthy Carrot Cake Protein Muffins Clean Classic Gingerbread with Maple Glaze <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> roll <NEXT_INPUT> dough <NEXT_INPUT> cranberry <NEXT_INPUT> sweet <NEXT_INPUT> yeast <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 sweet rolls <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 2 cups fresh cranberries chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tbsp coconut sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tsp cornstarch <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  cup warm nonfat milk  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  tbsp unsalted butter or coconut oil melted <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tbsp coconut sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  tsp salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tsp active dry yeast <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 2 cups whole wheat flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 10 tsp confectioners style stevia <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tsp nonfat milk <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Lightly coat a 9 round springform pan or cake pan with nonstick cooking spray. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> To prepare the filling toss together the cranberries sugar and cornstarch in a medium bowl until thoroughly combined. <NEXT_STEP> To prepare the dough stir together the milk butter sugar and salt in a large bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle the yeast on top and wait 10 15 minutes or until the mixture turns frothy. <NEXT_STEP> Mix in 1 cups of flour. <NEXT_STEP> If the dough is still wet continue stirring in flour 2 tablespoons at a time until the dough begins to pull away from the sides of the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the dough out onto a well floured surface and knead for 3 5 minutes or until the dough springs back most of the way when you gently press your index finger into it. <NEXT_STEP> Let the dough rest for 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> On a clean well floured surface roll the dough out into a 14x10 rectangle. <NEXT_STEP> Spread the filling on top of the dough leaving a 1 border on the two longer sides. <NEXT_STEP> Carefully roll up the dough into a log starting at one long edge and rolling towards the other one. <NEXT_STEP> Pinch the ends to seal. <NEXT_STEP> If the dough won t stick together gently brush the second longer edge with water before pinching to seal. <NEXT_STEP> Slice the log into 12 pieces using dental floss or a sharp serrated knife. <NEXT_STEP> Place the rolls into the prepared pan and cover the pan with a clean towel. <NEXT_STEP> Set the pan in a warm draft free spot and let the rolls rise for 30 45 minutes or until doubled in size. <NEXT_STEP> Preheat the oven to 350 F. Bake the cinnamon rolls for 18 22 minutes or until the filling is bubbling and the sides feel firm. <NEXT_STEP> Cool in the pan for at least 10 minutes before serving. <NEXT_STEP> While the rolls cool prepare the drizzle. <NEXT_STEP> Stir together the stevia and milk in a small bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the mixture to a zip topped bag snip off a small corner and drizzle on top of the rolls just before serving. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Whole Wheat Cranberry Sweet Rolls {Recipe Video!} <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cooky <NEXT_INPUT> cranberry <NEXT_INPUT> dark <NEXT_INPUT> pumpkin <NEXT_INPUT> dough <NEXT_INPUT> crust <NEXT_INPUT> stevia <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 1 pie, 10 slices <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 cup white whole wheat flour  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  tsp salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 tbsp unsalted butter cold and cubed <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tsp nonfat milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp pure maple syrup <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  tsp apple cider vinegar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 2 tbsp ice cold water <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 can pumpkin pur e  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  cup plain nonfat Greek yogurt <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  cup nonfat milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tbsp cornstarch <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  tsp ground nutmeg <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  tsp ground ginger <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  tsp salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  tsp black pepper  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  cup pure maple syrup <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tsp vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  tsp liquid stevia  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 large egg whites room temperature lightly beaten <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 tbsp heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 tbsp plain nonfat Greek yogurt <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  tsp liquid stevia or adjusted to taste  <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> To prepare the crust whisk together the flour and salt in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Cut in the butter using a pastry cutter or the back of a fork until the mixture resembles crumbs. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk together the milk and maple syrup and drizzle over the flour mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk together the vinegar and 1 teaspoon of water and drizzle over the flour mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Mix until all of those liquid ingredients have been incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Continue to add water 1 teaspoon at a time and mixing until completely incorporated until the mixture forms a dough. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the dough to the center of a large sheet of plastic wrap and shape into a 4 wide circle. <NEXT_STEP> Cover the top with another large sheet of plastic wrap. <NEXT_STEP> Chill the dough for at least 30 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> While the dough chills prepare the filling. <NEXT_STEP> Stir together the pumpkin pur e and Greek yogurt in a large bowl. <NEXT_STEP> In a separate smaller bowl whisk together the milk and cornstarch. <NEXT_STEP> Stir the milk mixture into the pumpkin mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Add the cinnamon nutmeg ginger salt and pepper stirring until fully incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the maple syrup vanilla and liquid stevia. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually stir in the egg whites until fully incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Preheat the oven to 375 F and coat a standard 9 round pie plate with nonstick cooking spray. <NEXT_STEP> Leaving the dough between the sheets of plastic wrap roll it out into a 11 wide circle. <NEXT_STEP> Peel off the top layer of plastic wrap and turn it out into the prepared pie plate. <NEXT_STEP> Peel off the other layer of plastic wrap. <NEXT_STEP> Gently press the dough into the pie plate and trim the overhang. <NEXT_STEP> Line the center of the pie with foil ensure that the foil is fully touching the dough all the way around the steep sides of the pie plate and pour pie weights or uncooked rice into the center. <NEXT_STEP> Bake the crust at 375 F for 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Carefully remove the foil and pie weights or rice. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the filling into the center of the parbaked crust. <NEXT_STEP> Bake the pie at 350 F for an additional 35 40 minutes or until the center barely jiggles when lightly shaken. <NEXT_STEP> Cool completely to room temperature then chill the pie for an additional 8 hours before serving. <NEXT_STEP> To prepare the whipped cream place a glass or metal bowl and the electric beater attachment in the freezer for 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the freezer. <NEXT_STEP> Add the heavy cream and beat for 2 3 minutes or until it reaches the soft peak stage. <NEXT_STEP> Add the Greek yogurt and liquid stevia and beat for an additional 1 2 minutes or until it reaches the stiff peak stage. <NEXT_STEP> Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve the pie. <NEXT_STEP> Top each slice with a dollop of whipped cream. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> The Ultimate Healthy Pumpkin Pie <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> an additional 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Carefully remove the foil covering the crust and bake for another 15 minutes or until the crust is golden. <NEXT_STEP> Cool completely to room temperature then <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> roll <NEXT_INPUT> dough <NEXT_INPUT> apple <NEXT_INPUT> pie <NEXT_INPUT> cinnamon <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cinnamon rolls <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START>  cup warm nonfat milk  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp coconut oil melted <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tbsp coconut sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  tsp salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tsp dry yeast <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 2 cups whole wheat flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups homemade apple pie filling <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Lightly coat a 9 round cake pan with nonstick cooking spray. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl stir together the milk coconut oil sugar and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle the yeast on top and wait 10 15 minutes or until the mixture turns frothy. <NEXT_STEP> Mix in 1 cups of flour. <NEXT_STEP> If the dough is still wet continue stirring in flour 2 tablespoons at a time until the dough begins to pull away from the sides of the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the dough out onto a well floured surface and knead for 3 5 minutes or until the dough springs back most of the way when you gently press your index finger into it. <NEXT_STEP> Let the dough rest for 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> On a clean well floured surface roll the dough out into a 16x10 rectangle. <NEXT_STEP> Spread the apple pie filling on top leaving a 1 border on the two longer sides again. <NEXT_STEP> Carefully roll up the dough into a log starting at one long edge and rolling towards the other one. <NEXT_STEP> Pinch the long ends to seal. <NEXT_STEP> If the dough won t stick together gently brush the second longer edge with water before pinching to seal. <NEXT_STEP> Pinch the short ends to seal as well. <NEXT_STEP> Working quickly slice the log into 12 pieces using dental floss or a sharp serrated knife and place the rolls into the prepared pan as soon as they re cut. <NEXT_STEP> Scoop up any filling that leaked out with a spoon drizzle over the rolls in the pan and cover the pan with a clean towel. <NEXT_STEP> Set the pan in a warm draft free spot and let the rolls rise for 30 45 minutes or until doubled in size. <NEXT_STEP> Preheat the oven to 350 F. Bake the cinnamon rolls for 24 minutes then carefully cover the pan with foil to prevent the tops from burning. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for an additional 5 9 minutes or until the filling is bubbling and the sides feel firm. <NEXT_STEP> Cool in the pan for at least 10 minutes before serving. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Whole Wheat Apple Pie Cinnamon Rolls <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> crunchy <NEXT_INPUT> thins <NEXT_INPUT> wheat <NEXT_INPUT> cracker <NEXT_INPUT> dough <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 4 servings <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 cup whole wheat flour  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  tsp salt divided <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp coconut oil melted <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tbsp pure maple syrup room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  cup water room temperature <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 F. flour mixture is fully incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured silicone baking mat and lightly knead a few times. <NEXT_STEP> Roll the dough into a 1/16 thick rectangle. silicone baking mat onto a baking sheet at bake at 350 F for 28 32 minutes or until crunchy. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the crackers on the baking sheet for at least 5 minutes before serving. <STEP_END> tablespoons at a time until the dough begins to pull away from the sides of the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the dough out onto a well floured surface and knead for 3 5 minutes or until the dough springs back most of the way when you gently press your index finger into it. <NEXT_STEP> Let the dough rest while preparing the filling. <NEXT_STEP> To prepare the filling stir together the coconut sugar and cinnamon in a small bowl. <NEXT_STEP> On a clean well floured surface roll the dough out into a 16x10 rectangle. <NEXT_STEP> Brush with the melted butter leaving a 1 border on the two longer sides. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle with the cinnamon sugar leaving a 1 border on the two longer sides again. <NEXT_STEP> Carefully roll up the dough into a log starting at one long edge and rolling towards the other one. <NEXT_STEP> Pinch the ends to seal. <NEXT_STEP> If the dough won t stick together gently brush the second longer edge with water before pinching to seal. <NEXT_STEP> Slice the log into 12 pieces using dental floss or a sharp serrated knife. <NEXT_STEP> Place the rolls into the prepared pan and cover the pan with a clean towel. <NEXT_STEP> Set the pan in a warm draft free spot and let <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  cup plain nonfat Greek yogurt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 tbsp honey <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  cup nonfat milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup diced fresh strawberries  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tbsp miniature chocolate chips <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 F and lightly coat 12 muffin cups with nonstick cooking spray. <NEXT_STEP> In a small bowl whisk together the flour baking powder pan. <NEXT_STEP> Add the peanut butter to a zip topped bag seal and microwave on HIGH for 5 10 seconds or until warm and slightly melted. <NEXT_STEP> Cut off one corner and pipe in straight lines on top of the batter. <NEXT_STEP> Drag a toothpick through in perpendicular lines to achieve the V effect. <NEXT_STEP> Bake the brownies at 300 F for 19 22 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool completely in the pan and let the brownies rest for at least 2 hours at room temperature before slicing into squares. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Peanut Butter Banana Bread Brownies <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <NEXT_INPUT> peanut <NEXT_INPUT> buddy <NEXT_INPUT> muddy <NEXT_INPUT> puppy <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> about 5 cups <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 6 c rice chex cereal  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  c white chocolate chips melted  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  c creamy peanut butter  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tbsp cornstarch  <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 c skim milk  <NEXT_INGREDIENT>  c powdered sugar <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 300 F and lightly coat a 9 x13 baking pan with nonstick cooking spray. <NEXT_STEP> Add the cereal to a large bowl and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a small bowl stir together the melted chocolate and peanut butter. <NEXT_STEP> In a separate small bowl whisk together the cornstarch and 2 tablespoons of milk until a slurry forms. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining milk to a small pot and cook over medium low heat stirring frequently until it begins to simmer. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the heat to low and slowly pour in the cornstarch slurry in a thin stream while stirring constantly. <NEXT_STEP> Continue to stir for 1 more minute until the mixture begins to thicken. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the pot from the heat and add in the peanut butter mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Stir until the peanut butter is mostly incorporated then return to low heat and continue stirring for another 2 minutes until it reaches the consistency of thin pudding. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the chocolate mixture over the cereal and gently toss with a spatula until the cereal is coated. <NEXT_STEP> Pour into the prepared pan and bake at 300 F for 50 60 minutes stirring every 15 minutes until mostly crunchy. <NEXT_STEP> Cool for 3 minutes before breaking apart any clumps. <NEXT_STEP> While the cereal mixture bakes add the powdered sugar to a large zip topped bag. <NEXT_STEP> After breaking apart the cereal immediately pour into the bag with the powdered sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Seal the top and shake until all of the cereal is coated. <NEXT_STEP> Discard any remaining powdered sugar. <STEP_END> flour. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the batter into the prepared pan and bake at 350 F for 22 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool in the pan for 10 minutes before turning out onto a wire rack to cool completely. butter onto the frosting in lines and draw lines in the opposite direction using a toothpick to create the V effect. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Banana Cake with Fudgy Chocolate Peanut Butter Swirl juice beginning and ending with the flour. <NEXT_STEP> Gently fold in the blueberries. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter between the cake cup cones. <NEXT_STEP> The batter should come up to within the top of the cone or about where the straight part ends. <NEXT_STEP> Bake at 350 for 24 27 minutes or until a toothpick comes out with barely any crumbs attached. <NEXT_STEP> Cool in the muffin tin for 5 minutes before setting out on a wire rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> To decorate add 2 tablespoons of whipped cream on each cupcake cone and sprinkle a little of the blue and red sugars on top. <NEXT_INPUT> standard <NEXT_INPUT> muffin <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes (or about 48 mini cupcakes) <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 1/2 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 sticks unsalted butter melted <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Your favorite frosting for topping <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and position a rack in the middle of the oven. <NEXT_STEP> Line one 12 cup standard muffin tin or two 24 cup mini muffin tins with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the flour baking powder and salt together in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> In another medium bowl beat the eggs and sugar with an electric mixer until light and foamy about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> While beating gradually pour in the melted butter and then the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> While mixing slowly add half of the flour mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Then add all the milk followed by the remaining flour mixture take care not to overmix the batter. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter evenly in the prepared muffin tin. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a cake tester inserted into the center of the cupcakes comes out clean rotating the tin about halfway through baking time 18 to 20 minutes for standard cupcakes or 10 to 12 minutes for minis. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes in the tin on a rack for 10 minutes then remove from the tin and cool on the rack completely. <NEXT_STEP> Frost and decorate as desired. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Go-To Vanilla Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> beat <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> pan <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 1/2 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 stick unsalted butter softened <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup whole milk at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Frosting recipe follows for topping <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 large egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch of salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 sticks unsalted butter cut into pieces softened <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a 12 cup muffin pan with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the flour baking powder and salt in a bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the butter and sugar in a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment on medium high speed until fluffy about 4 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the eggs one at a time scraping down the bowl as needed. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the mixer speed to medium low beat in half of the flour mixture then all of the milk then the remaining flour mixture until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter among the muffin cups filling each three quarters full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted into the center of a cupcake comes out clean 18 to 20 minutes rotating the pan halfway through. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the pan to a rack and let cool 5 minutes then remove the cupcakes to the rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Top with Frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the egg whites sugar and salt in a heatproof bowl set over a saucepan of simmering water until the mixture is warm and the sugar dissolves. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the bowl from the pan let cool slightly. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the egg white mixture in a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment on medium high speed until stiff peaks form 12 to 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the butter a few pieces at a time then continue beating until smooth. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Vanilla Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> magnolia <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> addition <NEXT_INPUT> add <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 24 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 1/2 cups self rising flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup unsalted butter softened <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 large eggs at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Vanilla Buttercream recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup unsalted butter softened <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 to 8 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons vanilla extract <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line 2 muffin tins with cupcake papers. <NEXT_STEP> In a small bowl combine the flours. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl on the medium speed of an electric mixer cream the butter until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sugar gradually and beat until fluffy about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs 1 at a time beating well after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Add the dry ingredients in 3 parts alternating with the milk and vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> With each addition beat until the ingredients are incorporated but do not over beat. <NEXT_STEP> Using a rubber spatula scrape down the batter in the bowl to make sure the ingredients are well blended. <NEXT_STEP> Carefully spoon the batter into the cupcake liners filling them about 3/4 full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until a cake tester inserted into the center of the cupcake comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes in tins for 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the tins and cool completely on a wire rack before icing. <NEXT_STEP> Place the butter in a large mixing bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Add 4 cups of the sugar and then the milk and vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> On the medium speed of an electric mixer beat until smooth and creamy about 3 to 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually add the remaining sugar 1 cup at a time beating well after each addition until the icing is thick enough to be of good spreading consistency. <NEXT_STEP> You may not need to add all of the sugar. <NEXT_STEP> If desired add a few drops of food coloring and mix thoroughly. <NEXT_STEP> Icing can be stored in an airtight container for up to 3 days. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Magnolia's Vanilla Cupcake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> lime <NEXT_INPUT> lemon <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> zest <NEXT_INPUT> mini <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 48 mini cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 3/4 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon baking soda 1/2 cups powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons lemon zest <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons lime zest <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the batter Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F line a mini cupcake pan with paper liners . <NEXT_STEP> Sift together the flour baking powder baking soda and salt in a medium bowl and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of an electric stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment cream together the granulated sugar and butter until light and fluffy 1 to 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add in the eggs one at a time letting them incorporate fully between additions. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on low add in half of the flour mixture followed by the milk and then the remaining flour mixture let each incorporate fully before the next addition. <NEXT_STEP> Then mix in the lemon and lime juice and lemon extract. <NEXT_STEP> Using a scoop fill each mini cupcake cup three quarters full with batter. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until golden and cooked through 12 to 14 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the cupcakes from the pan and allow them to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the glaze While the cupcakes are cooling whisk together the powdered sugar milk and lemon and lime zest in a bowl until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Once the cupcakes have cooled dip the top of each cupcake in the glaze allowing the excess to drip back into the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Chill the cupcakes in the fridge for at least 30 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Serve cold and enjoy. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Lemon Lime Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon cream of tartar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 graham cracker sheets broken into 24 pieces <NEXT_INGREDIENT> One 4 ounce bar semisweet chocolate broken into 24 shards <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the graham cracker crust Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line two standard 12 cup muffin tins with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> In a small bowl stir together the graham cracker crumbs butter and sugar until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Press a heaping tablespoon of the crust mixture into the bottom of each muffin cup and bake until golden and just set 5 to 7 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside to cool. <NEXT_STEP> For the cupcakes In a large bowl whisk together minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool in the tins on a wire rack for about 5 minutes then remove the cupcakes from the tins and allow to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the marshmallow frosting Combine the the touch 3 to 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer to the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment and beat on low speed gradually increasing to medium and then finally up to high. <NEXT_STEP> Beat until stiff glossy peaks form 7 to 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the mixer to low and whisk in the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Spread the frosting on the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> With a handheld pastry torch lightly brown the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Decorate each cupcake with a graham cracker piece and a shard of chocolate. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Super S'Mores Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> almond <NEXT_INPUT> german <NEXT_INPUT> buttermilk <NEXT_INPUT> coconut <NEXT_INPUT> evaporated <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 14 to 15 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup unsweetened cocoa powder such as Pernigotti <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 tablespoons unsalted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 can evaporated milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 cups light brown sugar lightly packed <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 extra large egg yolks <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. <NEXT_STEP> Line cupcake pans with 14 or 15 paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment cream the butter granulated sugar and brown sugar on medium high speed for 5 minutes until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Lower the speed to medium add the eggs one at a time then add the vanilla and mix well. <NEXT_STEP> In a separate bowl whisk together the buttermilk sour cream and coffee. <NEXT_STEP> In a third bowl sift together the flour cocoa powder baking soda and salt. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on low add the buttermilk and flour mixtures alternately in thirds beginning with the buttermilk and ending with the flour. <NEXT_STEP> Don t overmix Fold the batter a few times with a rubber spatula to be sure it s mixed. <NEXT_STEP> Scoop the batter into the cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Bake in the center of the oven for 20 to 25 minutes until a toothpick comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Cool for 10 minutes remove from the pans and allow to cool completely before frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Coconut Frosting Melt the butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk in the evaporated milk brown sugar and egg yolks and bring to a simmer over medium heat. <NEXT_STEP> Simmer stirring constantly with a wooden spoon for about 15 minutes until slightly thickened. <NEXT_STEP> If the mixture looks a bit curdled beat it vigorously with a whisk. <NEXT_STEP> Off the heat stir in the vanilla extract almond extract coconut almonds pecans and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to cool for about an hour. <NEXT_STEP> Frost the cupcakes with a knife or small metal spatula. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> German Chocolate Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> lemon <NEXT_INPUT> white in a small bowl set aside . <NEXT_STEP> Beat the butter 3/4 cup sugar and the lemon zest in a large bowl with a mixer on medium high speed until light and fluffy about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the mixer speed to low. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the flour mixture in three batches alternating with the milk mixture in two batches until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Increase the mixer speed to medium and beat briefly until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the egg whites in a large bowl with a mixer on high speed until foamy. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually beat in the remaining 1/4 cup sugar continue beating until stiff 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool 5 minutes in the pan then transfer to a rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile make the frosting Whisk the sugar egg whites water vanilla cream of tartar and salt in a large metal bowl set over a saucepan of simmering water until combined . <NEXT_STEP> With the bowl still over the simmering water beat the mixture with a hand mixer on medium high speed until stiff glossy peaks form 5 to 7 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the bowl from the saucepan and let cool 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the frosting to a piping bag fitted with a large round tip. the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a 12 cup muffin tin with paper liners and spray the liners with nonstick cooking spray. <NEXT_STEP> For the cake Whisk together the flour granulated sugar baking powder baking soda and salt in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk together the almond milk brown sugar oil and vanilla in another medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Add the almond milk mixture to the flour mixture and gently fold until just combined . <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter evenly among the prepared liners. <NEXT_STEP> Bake the cupcakes until they are golden brown and bounce back when pressed and a toothpick inserted in the center <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 tablespoons corn syrup <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces bittersweet chocolate <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 stick butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup shortening such as Crisco <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 cups powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/8 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. <NEXT_STEP> Thoroughly spray 18 muffin cups with baking spray. <NEXT_STEP> To make the cake batter combine the flour granulated sugar and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a separate container combine the buttermilk baking soda vanilla and eggs. <NEXT_STEP> Stir to combine and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a saucepan melt the butter over medium heat. <NEXT_STEP> Add the cocoa powder and stir to combine. <NEXT_STEP> Add the boiling water allow to bubble for a few seconds and then turn off the heat. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the chocolate mixture over the flour mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Stir a few times to cool the chocolate. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the buttermilk mixture over the top and stir to combine. <NEXT_STEP> Fill muffin cups just over half full . <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 13 to 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to cool for 5 minutes in the pan and then remove the cupcakes and allow to cool completely on a baking rack. <NEXT_STEP> For the ganache To make the ganache heat the cream and corn syrup over medium heat. <NEXT_STEP> Chop the chocolate and add to a bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla to the cream mixture and then pour the cream mixture over the top of the chopped chocolate. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk together until melted smooth and glossy. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to cool slightly. <NEXT_STEP> For the creme filling Whip together the butter and shortening until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Sift together the powdered sugar and salt and add it to the butter mixture in batches. <NEXT_STEP> Add the milk then the vanilla beating the whole time. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape the sides of the bowl and beat until very light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Put the filling into a pastry bag fitted with a medium tip. <NEXT_STEP> When the cupcakes are totally cool insert the tip of the pastry bag into the bottom of the cupcake and fill with creme filling. <NEXT_STEP> When cupcakes are filled spoon ganache so that it completely coats each cupcake OR dip to coat. <NEXT_STEP> Let them set before serving. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Heavenly Creme Filled Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> mug <NEXT_INPUT> chiffon <NEXT_INPUT> whisk <NEXT_INPUT> place <NEXT_INPUT> becomes <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> about 24 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 5 1/4 ounces cake flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon kosher salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 large eggs separated <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 ounces sugar divided <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5/8 teaspoon cream of tartar <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Place paper liners into 2 muffin tins and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> If you prefer set 12 ovenproof coffee mugs on a half sheet pan and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium mixing bowl whisk together the flour baking powder and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Place the egg yolks and 5 ounces of the sugar into the bowl of a stand mixer and whisk on high for 2 minutes or until the mixture becomes pale yellow and ribbons when lifted. <NEXT_STEP> Add the water vegetable oil and vanilla and whisk to combine. <NEXT_STEP> Add the dry ingredients and whisk just to combine. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the batter to a mixing bowl while you whisk the egg whites. <NEXT_STEP> Place the egg whites and cream of tartar into a clean bowl and whisk on high using the whisk attachment until it becomes foamy. <NEXT_STEP> Decrease the speed to low and gradually add the remaining ounce of sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Increase speed to high and continue whisking until stiff peaks form approximately 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer 1/3 of the egg whites to the batter and whisk until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining egg whites and fold in gently. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer batter into prepared muffin tins or coffee mugs evenly dividing the batter between the cups. <NEXT_STEP> Place both muffin tins on the middle rack of the oven or if using mugs place all of them on a half sheet pan and set on the bottom rack of the oven. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 30 minutes until a toothpick comes out clean or the cupcakes reach an internal temperature of 205 to 210 degrees F. Remove from the oven to a cooling rack and allow to cool completely before frosting. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Chiffon Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> banana <NEXT_INPUT> walnut <NEXT_INPUT> gina <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> molasses <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 cup all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 stick butter softened <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup sour cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large ripe bananas peeled and mashed <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup chopped walnuts <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 ounce cream cheese softened <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons butter softened <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons molasses <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons whole milk <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 F. Line a muffin tin with paper cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium bowl combine the flour baking powder baking soda and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl add the butter and granulated sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Beat with a hand held mixer until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sour cream and vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly beat in the eggs one at a time. <NEXT_STEP> Incorporate the dry mixture and wet mixture together until thoroughly combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the bananas and 1/2 cup walnuts being careful not to over mix. <NEXT_STEP> Using an ice cream scoop fill each cupcake liner three quarters of the way full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake in the oven until the tops turn golden brown and a toothpick inserted in the middle of the cupcake comes out clean 18 to 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the cupcakes from the oven to a wire rack and let cool before frosting. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl add the cream cheese and butter. <NEXT_STEP> Beat together until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Add the molasses and mix well. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the confectioner s sugar milk and vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Heavily frost the cupcakes and garnish with the remaining 1/4 cup walnuts. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Gina's Banana Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> meringue <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> filling <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> brown <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 3/4 cup all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup finely ground graham crackers <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 sticks unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup packed light brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Filling <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces bittersweet chocolate chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon light corn syrup <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Meringue Frosting <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 egg whites at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/8 teaspoon cream of tartar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Chocolate squares for garnish <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line one 12 cup standard muffin tin with paper cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> In a small bowl whisk the flour ground graham crackers baking powder and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment beat the butter and brown sugar on medium speed until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Increase the speed to medium high and continue to beat stopping once or twice to scrape down the sides of the bowl until light and fluffy 3 to 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs and vanilla and beat until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the flour mixture and milk alternating starting and ending with the flour mixture until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter between the muffin cups filling each about two thirds full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until golden brown or a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean and the top springs back to the touch about 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool in the tin 5 minutes and then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the filling While the cupcakes cool prepare the filling Combine the chocolate cream and corn syrup in a medium bowl and microwave in 30 second intervals on high stirring until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside until cooled and thickened slightly about 30 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> For the meringue frosting Bring 1 inch of water to a simmer in a saucepan that can hold a heatproof stand mixer s bowl above the water. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the egg whites granulated sugar and cream of tartar in the stand mixer bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Set the bowl above the simmering water and whisk until the sugar is dissolved and the egg whites are warm to the touch turn white and are beginning to get fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the bowl to the stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment and whip on high speed until the meringue is cooled fluffy and very thick. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Place the chocolate filling in a pastry bag or re sealable plastic bag fitted with a small round tip and snip the end. <NEXT_STEP> Pierce the center of each cupcake with the pastry tip and gently squeeze in the chocolate filling until it begins to come out of the top of the cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with the remaining cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe or swirl the meringue frosting onto each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> If desired brown the meringue with a kitchen torch or place briefly under the broiler. <NEXT_STEP> Garnish with a chocolate square. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> S'mores Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> coffee <NEXT_INPUT> beat <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> lech <NEXT_INPUT> tres <NEXT_INPUT> mascarpone <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> cream <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> about 18 standard cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 2 1/2 cups cake flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 stick unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Tres Leches Mix recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Whipped Cream Mascarpone Frosting recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> One 12 ounce can evaporated milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Half 14 ounce can sweetened condensed milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 cups heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 ounces mascarpone cheese <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line cupcake tins with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Sift together the flour baking powder baking soda and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Cream the butter and granulated sugar with an electric mixer until fluffy and light. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time beating well between each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Then add the vanilla and mix until fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in the flour mixture alternating with the milk. <NEXT_STEP> Do not over mix. <NEXT_STEP> Portion into the prepared cupcake tins. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for about 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Once the cupcakes have cooled about 30 minutes you can inject the cake with about 2 ounces of the Tres Leches Mix. <NEXT_STEP> If you do not have an injector then fork the cupcake gently on the top and then spoon the tres leches over top so as to not break up the cake. <NEXT_STEP> Let sit in the fridge for at least an hour. <NEXT_STEP> Top each cupcake with some of the Whipped Cream Mascarpone Frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the three milks in a blender until well combined and then chill in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour. <NEXT_STEP> Chill a metal bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Add the heavy cream vanilla extract and confectioners sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Start to beat the heavy cream until you see the liquid thicken and continue to beat until stiff peaks form. <NEXT_STEP> Mix in the mascarpone cheese and blend to combine. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Tres cream cheese <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons lemon zest <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Lemon peel <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Blueberries <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Sprig of fresh mint <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. For the batter Mix the butter and eggs. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium bowl mix the flour baking powder baking soda and salt together. <NEXT_STEP> Mix the granulated sugar milk and lemon peel together. <NEXT_STEP> Then mix the butter and eggs into the milk and sugar mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Mix the flour into the wet mixture and blend. <NEXT_STEP> Place paper cups into a pan spray with butter baking spray and fill each cup three quarters full with batter. <NEXT_STEP> Drop the coated blueberries on top. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 18 to 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting Combine the powdered sugar butter cream cheese lemon juice and zest together until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe onto the cupcakes and decorate with lemon peel blueberries and a mint leaf. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Missy's Lemon and Blueberry Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> velvet <NEXT_INPUT> red <NEXT_INPUT> cheese <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> mix <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 16 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 15 1/2 ounces all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 teaspoons baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 teaspoons salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 teaspoons unsweetened cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 13 ounces granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 cups buttermilk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons plus 2 teaspoons red food coloring <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 teaspoons vinegar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 teaspoons vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/8 cup water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 pounds cream cheese room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 pound butter room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 pounds powdered sugar sifted <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon vanilla extract <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat oven 350 degrees F. Sift together flour baking soda salt and cocoa powder into a bowl and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a mixer fitted with paddle attachment mix oil sugar and buttermilk until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add eggs food coloring vinegar vanilla and water and mix well. <NEXT_STEP> Add the dry ingredients a little bit at a time and mix on low scraping down sides occasionally and mix until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> Be sure not to over mix or the batter will come out tough. <NEXT_STEP> Line a 16 cup cupcake pan with paper liners scoop the batter into the liners and bake at 350 degrees F for 20 to 30 minutes or until the toothpick comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool. <NEXT_STEP> For the cream cheese frosting Whip the butter and cream cheese together in a mixer fitted with a paddle attachment until creamed. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually add powdered sugar to the mixture and scrape down the bowl as needed. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla and mix until combined. <NEXT_STEP> The frosting can be used right away or stored in the refrigerator up to a week. <NEXT_STEP> Frost cooled cupcakes with the cream cheese frosting. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Red Velvet Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> pumpkin <NEXT_INPUT> puree <NEXT_INPUT> spice <NEXT_INPUT> whipped <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> One 15.25 ounce box spice cake mix <NEXT_INGREDIENT> One 15 ounce can pumpkin puree <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup whipped cream cheese <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a standard 12 cup muffin tin with paper cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium mixing bowl combine the flour cinnamon baking soda baking powder and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of an electric mixer cream the butter granulated sugar light brown sugar sour cream vanilla and eggs until fluffy about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the speed to low and add the dry ingredients. <NEXT_STEP> Blend until well combined about 25 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Pour 2 1/2 to 3 tablespoons of batter into each cupcake liner. <NEXT_STEP> Bake the cupcakes until a tester inserted into the center comes out clean about 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool. <NEXT_STEP> For the buttercream Using an electric mixer with the paddle attachment cream the butter vanilla and cinnamon until smooth scraping down the sides as needed about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> With the machine running on low add the powdered sugar 1 cup at a time alternating with the milk and mix until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Fit a pastry bag with a star tip and fill with the buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> For the tortilla crisps Mix together the granulated sugar and cinnamon on a large plate. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium heavy bottomed saucepan add enough oil to come halfway up the sides of the pan. <NEXT_STEP> Heat over medium high heat until a deep frying thermometer inserted in the oil registers 350 degrees F. Meanwhile using a cookie cutter cut the tortillas into different shapes and/or letters. <NEXT_STEP> Fry the tortilla pieces until golden brown 2 to 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> With a slotted spoon transfer the crisps to paper towels to drain. <NEXT_STEP> While still warm transfer to the cinnamon sugar mixture and turn to coat. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble the cupcakes Pipe a swirl of buttercream on each cupcake and top with a tortilla crisp. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Churro Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flan <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> pan <NEXT_INPUT> evaporated <NEXT_INPUT> condensed <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 18 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 1/2 cups granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> One 8 ounce package cream cheese <NEXT_INGREDIENT> One 14 ounce can sweetened condensed milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> One 12 ounce can evaporated milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/2 cups cake flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 stick unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 pound cream cheese <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 sticks unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons vanilla extract <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the flan custard Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. In a medium pot over medium heat add sugar and 1/2 cup water. <NEXT_STEP> Cook until the sugar caramelizes and turns an amber color about 10 minutes without stirring. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the caramelized sugar into an 8 by 10 inch pan or 10 inch cake pan and let it cool. <NEXT_STEP> In a blender blend the eggs cream cheese condensed milk and evaporated milk. <NEXT_STEP> Blend for about 4 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the mixture into the pan. <NEXT_STEP> Put the pan inside an 11 by 14 inch pan. <NEXT_STEP> Put water into the larger pan until almost full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until it sets and has a slight uniform jiggle about 1 hour. <NEXT_STEP> When done take the smaller pan out of the larger pan and let it cool. <NEXT_STEP> For the cupcakes Line cupcake tins with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Sift together the flour baking powder baking soda and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Cream the butter and granulated sugar with an electric mixer until fluffy and light. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time beating well between each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Then add the vanilla and mix until fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in the flour mixture alternating with the milk. <NEXT_STEP> Do not over mix. <NEXT_STEP> Portion into the prepared cupcake tins. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for about 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting Combine the cream cheese butter confectioners sugar and vanilla in a standing mixer or large bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Mix until smooth and spreadable. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble the cupcakes Cut a hole in the top of each cupcake with an apple corer. <NEXT_STEP> Fill a pastry bag with the flan. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe in enough flan to fill the hole in the cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Top each cupcake with frosting. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Flan Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> stout <NEXT_INPUT> cream <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> heap <NEXT_INPUT> cocoa <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 24 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 3/4 cup unsweetened cocoa plus more for dusting finished cupcakes <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 bottle stout beer <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 stick butter melted <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup sour cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 package cream cheese softened at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 to 1 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 box confectioners sugar <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a large mixing bowl whisk together the cocoa sugar flour baking soda and salt. <NEXT_STEP> In another medium mixing bowl combine the stout melted butter and vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in eggs 1 at time. <NEXT_STEP> Mix in sour cream until thoroughly combined and smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually mix the dry ingredients into the wet mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Lightly grease 24 muffin tins. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter equally between muffin tins filling each 3/4 full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for about 12 minutes and then rotate the pans. <NEXT_STEP> Bake another 12 to 13 minutes until risen nicely domed and set in the middle but still soft and tender. <NEXT_STEP> Cool before turning out. <NEXT_STEP> To make the icing In a medium bowl with a hand mixer beat the cream cheese on medium speed until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually beat in the heavy cream. <NEXT_STEP> On low speed slowly mix in the confectioners sugar until incorporated and smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate until ready to use. <NEXT_STEP> Icing can be made several hours ahead and kept covered and chilled. <NEXT_STEP> Top each cupcake with a heap of frosting and dust with cocoa. <STEP_END> <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 24 frozen peach wedges thawed and patted dry <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup peach preserves <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pecan Crumble <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup pecan halves chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup light brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 tablespoons unsalted butter melted <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Cream Topping <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup sour cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon confectioners sugar <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Position an oven rack in the middle of the oven and preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line one 12 cup standard muffin tin with cupcake liners and spray the top of the tin lightly with baking spray. <NEXT_STEP> Spread the pecans out on a baking sheet and bake until nicely toasted 8 to 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to cool then pulse in a food processor until finely ground. <NEXT_STEP> Add the flour baking powder baking soda and salt and pulse to combine. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the granulated sugar and butter in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment . <NEXT_STEP> Beat on medium high speed until light and fluffy about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs 1 at a time beating to incorporate after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the lemon zest. <NEXT_STEP> Adjust the speed to low and add the flour mixture and sour cream in alternating batches beginning and ending with the flour. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter evenly in the tin filling each cup about two thirds rack in the tin for 10 minutes then remove. <NEXT_STEP> Cool on the rack completely. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the peach preserves and lemon juice in a small microwave safe bowl and heat for a few seconds just to warm through. <NEXT_STEP> Generously brush the top of each cupcake with the preserves. <NEXT_STEP> For the pecan crumble Combine the flour pecans brown sugar butter and salt in a bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Spread the mixture out on a rimmed baking sheet and bake until golden about 15 minutes rotating the baking sheet about halfway through. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to cool completely then crumble. <NEXT_STEP> For the cream topping Combine the heavy cream sour cream and confectioners sugar in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment. <NEXT_STEP> Whip on medium high speed until stiff peaks form about 4 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Top each cupcake with the cream topping and sprinkle with the pecan crumble. <NEXT_STEP> Serve immediately. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Peach Cobbler Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> ricotta <NEXT_INPUT> wrapper <NEXT_INPUT> basil <NEXT_INPUT> meat <NEXT_INPUT> wonton <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 2 tablespoons olive oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 whole cloves <NEXT_INGREDIENT> One 1 inch cinnamon stick <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 cloves garlic minced <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 medium onion finely diced <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Kosher salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 pound mild Italian chicken sausage casing removed <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup tomato paste <NEXT_INGREDIENT> One 28 ounce can crushed tomatoes <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup chopped fresh basil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Freshly ground pepper <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup shredded mozzarella plus more for topping <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup freshly grated Parmesan plus more for topping <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup part skim ricotta <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup mango chutney <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 package wonton wrappers <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 whole small fresh basil leaves <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. For the meat sauce In a large skillet over medium high heat warm the olive oil until it shimmers. <NEXT_STEP> Add the whole cloves and cinnamon stick and remove after a few minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the garlic and onions sprinkle with a little salt and saute until softened but not browned. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sausage breaking up the clumps with your spoon. <NEXT_STEP> Cook until the sausage is no longer pink 2 to 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the tomato paste and cook 1 to 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the crushed tomatoes basil as well as some salt and pepper. <NEXT_STEP> Stir to combine and simmer uncovered for about 15 minutes stirring every now and then. <NEXT_STEP> Allow the meat sauce to cool about 15 minutes before building lasagna cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> As the meat sauce is cooking prepare the ricotta filling. <NEXT_STEP> For the ricotta filling Stir together the mozzarella Parmesan ricotta and mango chutney. <NEXT_STEP> Season with salt and lots of pepper about a teaspoon and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble the cupcakes Pull out your favorite cupcake pan. <NEXT_STEP> If your pan is not nonstick spray the cups with cooking spray. <NEXT_STEP> Place a wonton wrapper in each cup. <NEXT_STEP> Don t worry if you re using square ones. <NEXT_STEP> Drop about 1 teaspoon of meat sauce into the bottom of each cup. <NEXT_STEP> Then add 1 teaspoon of ricotta filling. <NEXT_STEP> Then cover with another wonton wrapper rotating it about 90 degrees so that the corners of the first wrapper and the second wrapper aren t right on top of each other. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat this until you ve built three layers total. <NEXT_STEP> Top each with a small basil leaf then another wonton wrapper. <NEXT_STEP> Finish each cupcake with a spoonful of meat sauce a little shredded mozzarella and pinch of grated Parmesan. <NEXT_STEP> Pop them into the oven and bake for 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> When time s up resist the temptation to eat them right away or else you ll burn your mouth Let them rest on the counter for about 10 minutes and they should slip out of the muffin tin easily. <NEXT_STEP> Top with more shredded basil if you like. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Lasagna vanilla paste or extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Position two racks in upper and lower thirds of the oven and preheat to 350 degrees F. Line two 12 cup muffin tins with 18 cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the flour cornstarch baking powder salt and baking soda in a large bowl until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter sugar oil and vanilla to the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment and beat on medium high speed until light and fluffy 3 to 4 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs and yolks one at a time beating to blend between additions and occasionally scraping down the sides and bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula until completely combined and smooth. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on low add the dry ingredients in 3 additions alternating with the buttermilk beginning and ending with the dry ingredients. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter evenly in the prepared muffin tins. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a cake tester inserted into the center of the cupcakes comes out clean rotating the tins halfway through baking time 18 to 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes in the tins on a rack for 10 minutes then remove from the tins and cool on the rack completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting Add the butter to the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment and beat on high speed until smooth about 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the speed to low and gradually mix in the confectioners sugar until completely smooth. <NEXT_STEP> With the motor running add the heavy cream vanilla and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Increase the speed to high and beat until the frosting is light and fluffy 1 to 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the frosting to a pastry bag or large resealable plastic bag fitted with a large star tip. <NEXT_STEP> Decoratively pipe the frosting onto the cupcakes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> The Best Vanilla Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> peanut <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup sour cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Filling <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces cream cheese at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 large egg <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Frosting <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 ounces cream cheese at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 tablespoons unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup sour cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon lemon juice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Graham cracker pieces for garnish <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the crust Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line two 12 cup standard muffin tins with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the graham cracker crumbs granulated sugar cinnamon and butter in a small bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Drop a heaping tablespoon of graham cracker mixture into each muffin cup. <NEXT_STEP> Press to create a firm layer of crust on the bottom. <NEXT_STEP> Bake 7 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the cupcakes Combine the flour baking powder baking soda and salt in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Using a hand mixer or stand mixer cream the butter and granulated sugar together until fluffy 2 to 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time scraping down the bowl between additions. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk together the sour cream and the milk. <NEXT_STEP> Add the flour mixture and milk mixture in three additions alternating between wet and dry ingredients and starting and ending with flour mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Beat just until well combined taking care not to overmix. <NEXT_STEP> For the filling Beat the cream cheese and granulated sugar in a bowl with an electric mixer at medium speed until light and fluffy about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the egg just until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon the filling into a pastry bag fitted with a medium size plain tip . <NEXT_STEP> Insert the tip into the top of each cupcake batter and squeeze the filling until the batter rises to fill each cup about three quarters of the way up the side of the tin. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until lightly golden and a toothpick inserted about 3/4 inch from the edge of the cupcakes comes out clean 18 to 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes in the tins on a rack for 10 minutes and then remove from the tins and cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting Using an electric or stand mixer beat the cream cheese and butter together at medium speed until fluffy about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the sour cream and lemon juice. <NEXT_STEP> On low speed gradually add the confectioners sugar and beat until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Frost the cupcakes as desired. <NEXT_STEP> Garnish with graham cracker pieces. <YIELD_START> about 24 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 4 ounces cake flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon kosher salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup hot water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 ounce cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 large egg yolks <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 ounces sugar divided <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 large egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon cream of tartar <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Place paper liners into 2 muffin tins and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> If you prefer set 12 ovenproof coffee mugs on a half sheet pan and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium mixing bowl whisk together the flour baking powder and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Place the hot water and the cocoa powder into a small bowl and whisk to thoroughly combine. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Place the egg yolks and 5 ounces of the sugar into the bowl of a stand mixer and whisk on high for 2 minutes or until the mixture becomes pale yellow and ribbons when lifted. <NEXT_STEP> Add the cocoa mixture vegetable oil and vanilla and whisk to combine. <NEXT_STEP> Add the dry ingredients and whisk just to combine. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the mixture to a mixing bowl while you whisk the egg whites. <NEXT_STEP> Place the egg whites and cream of tartar into a clean bowl and whisk on high using the whisk attachment until it becomes foamy. <NEXT_STEP> Decrease the speed to low and gradually add the remaining ounce of sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Once the sugar has all been added increase the speed back to high and continue to beat until stiff peaks form approximately 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer 1/3 of the egg whites to the batter and whisk until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining egg whites and fold in gently. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer batter into prepared muffin tins or coffee mugs evenly dividing the batter between the cups. <NEXT_STEP> Place both muffin tins on the middle rack of the oven or if using mugs place all of them on a half sheet pan and set on the bottom rack of the oven. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 30 minutes until a toothpick comes out clean or the cupcakes reach an internal temperature of 205 to 210 degrees F. Line a 12 cup muffin tin with cupcake liners and lightly coat with cooking spray. <NEXT_STEP> Sift the flour confectioners sugar and 1/4 teaspoon salt through a fine sieve into a medium bowl set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the egg whites in a bowl and beat with an electric mixer on medium speed until frothy about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the cream of tartar and beat until soft peaks form about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually add the granulated sugar about 1 tablespoon at a time. <NEXT_STEP> Increase the speed to medium high and continue beating until the peaks are stiff and very shiny about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the vanilla and lemon zest. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the bowl from the stand. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle 1/4 of the flour mixture on top of the eggs and gently fold in with a rubber spatula. <NEXT_STEP> Evenly fold in the remaining flour mixture in 3 additions. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter evenly among the lined muffin cups in messy mounds taller than the liners and bake until the cupcakes spring back when gently pressed and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean 14 to 16 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool in the pan for a few minutes then transfer to a rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the halo decorations Cut 12 sticks 1 inch long and about 1/8 inch thick out of the crystallized ginger. <NEXT_STEP> Trim the ends so they are straight across. <NEXT_STEP> Trace 12 circles on a piece of parchment with a 1 inch round cookie cutter. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the paper over set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Fit one of the pastry bags with the tip. <NEXT_STEP> Microwave the candy coating in a small bowl uncovered at 40 percent power in 30 second increments stirring in between until melted and completely smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the candy coating to the pastry bag and pipe it into 12 circles using the parchment template as a guide. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside to let harden slightly. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe 1 small dollop of the candy coating directly onto each circle and push a ginger stick into each so it is standing straight up. <NEXT_STEP> Let the halos harden completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting Bring a few inches of water to a boil in a saucepan that can hold a stand mixer s heatproof bowl above the water . <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the egg whites granulated sugar cream of tartar and a pinch of salt together in the bowl set the bowl above the boiling water and whisk until the mixture is warm to the touch and the sugar dissolves 1 to 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the egg white mixture with an electric mixer at medium high speed until it is cool and forms stiff peaks about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Decorate the cupcakes Transfer the frosting to the remaining pastry bag and pipe generous swirls on top of each cupcake lifting the bag up quickly to make a peak. <NEXT_STEP> Push the ginger stem of a halo into each and serve right away. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Angel's Food Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START>
