salt in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the eggs and granulated sugar in a large bowl with a mixer on medium high speed until pale and fluffy about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the speed to medium low slowly beat in the melted butter then add the orange zest and vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the flour mixture in 2 additions alternating with the milk beginning and ending with the flour mixture beat until just combined . <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter evenly among the muffin cups filling each about two thirds of the way. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted into the centers comes out clean about 18 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool 5 minutes then remove the cupcakes to a rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile make the frosting Bring the orange juice to a boil in a saucepan reduce the heat to medium and simmer until reduced to1 1/2 tablespoons about 8 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the cream cheese in a large bowl with a mixer on medium high speed until smooth and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the butter a little at a time until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the mixer speed to low sift the confectioners sugar into the bowl and beat until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla the cooled orange syrup orange zest and food coloring and beat on medium speed until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate until spreadable about 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Spread the frosting on the cupcakes top with candied orange zest. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Orange Cream Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> green <NEXT_INPUT> simmering <NEXT_INPUT> white <NEXT_INPUT> pan <NEXT_INPUT> velvet <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 cup cake flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 large egg <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon distilled white vinegar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon green gel food coloring <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 ounces white chocolate chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 large egg whites at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch of cream of tartar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 sticks unsalted butter cut into pieces at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Assorted green sprinkles for decorating <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Make the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 . <NEXT_STEP> Line a 12 cup muffin pan with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Sift the cake flour cocoa powder baking soda and salt into a large bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the sugar milk vegetable oil egg vinegar and vanilla in a separate large bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk in the flour mixture until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add the green food coloring and stir until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter among the prepared muffin cups filling them three quarters of the way. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted into the centers comes out clean about 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool slightly in the pan then remove to a rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile make the frosting Put the white chocolate in a small heatproof bowl set over a saucepan of simmering water . <NEXT_STEP> Cook stirring until melted remove the bowl from the pan and let cool slightly. <NEXT_STEP> Reserve the pan of simmering water. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the egg whites sugar salt and cream of tartar in a large heatproof bowl set over the pan of simmering water . <NEXT_STEP> Cook whisking until the sugar dissolves and the mixture registers 130 on a candy thermometer 3 to 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the bowl from the pan beat with a mixer on high speed until stiff peaks form 1 to 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the mixer speed to medium and beat until the bowl is no longer warm 1 to 2 more minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Increase the mixer speed to medium high and continue beating adding the butter one piece at a time until thick and combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the melted white chocolate and vanilla and continue beating until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the frosting to a resealable plastic bag and snip a corner. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe onto the cupcakes and decorate with green sprinkles. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Green Velvet Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pudding <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> whip <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> frosted <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 24 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 1/2 cups cake flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup Dutch process cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 sticks butter room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup buttermilk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup freshly brewed coffee cooled to room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Chocolate Pudding Frosting recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 pint heavy whipping cream very cold <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> One 3.9 ounce box dry pudding mix chocolate fudge flavor <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line two 12 cup muffin pans with cupcake liners and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Sift together the flour sugar cocoa powder and baking soda and add to the bowl of a stand mixer. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter buttermilk and eggs and beat on low until moistened. <NEXT_STEP> Raise the speed to medium and beat until light and fluffy 2 to 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the coffee and beat until fully incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter evenly among the muffin cups filling each about 3/4 full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted into the center of a cupcake comes out clean 22 to 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the pans to wire racks and allow the cupcakes to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the cupcakes from the muffin pans and spread each with frosting. <NEXT_STEP> In a stand mixer fitted with a whip attachment whip the cream at high speed until light and fluffy about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sugar vanilla extract and pudding mix and whip until smooth. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate Pudding Frosted Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> curd <NEXT_INPUT> pineapple <NEXT_INPUT> rum <NEXT_INPUT> coconut <NEXT_INPUT> colada <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1/2 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup pineapple juice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs plus 2 egg yolks <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons unsalted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon white rum <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 stick unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup packed light brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 sticks unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon coconut extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 tablespoons whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups sweetened shredded coconut <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Make the pineapple curd Whisk the granulated sugar pineapple juice and salt in a medium saucepan. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk in the eggs and egg yolks until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Cook over medium heat whisking constantly and reducing the heat if the mixture starts bubbling too much until the curd is the consistency of pudding 7 to 8 minutes . <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat and whisk in the butter and rum . <NEXT_STEP> Strain the curd through a fine mesh sieve into a bowl pressing it through with a rubber spatula. <NEXT_STEP> Cover with plastic wrap pressing it directly on the surface and refrigerate until completely cooled about 2 hours. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile make the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 F. Line 12 muffin cups with paper or foil liners. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the flour baking powder and salt in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the butter granulated sugar and brown sugar in a large bowl and beat with a mixer on medium high speed until light and fluffy 3 to 4 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the eggs one at a time then beat in the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on medium speed beat in half of the flour mixture then the milk then the remaining flour mixture until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter among the muffin cups filling them two thirds of the way. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted into the centers of the cupcakes comes out clean 20 to 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer to a rack and let cool 10 minutes in the pan then remove the cupcakes to the rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Make the frosting Combine the butter and confectioner s sugar in a large bowl beat with a mixer on medium high speed until smooth and fluffy 2 to 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the coconut extract and milk beat until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Using a paring knife cut a slit in the top of each cupcake cutting about three quarters of the way down. <NEXT_STEP> Fill a piping bag with the pineapple curd pipe the curd into the slit in each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Fill another piping bag with the frosting and pipe onto the cupcakes . <NEXT_STEP> Top with the shredded coconut. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Piña Colada Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> lime <NEXT_INPUT> key <NEXT_INPUT> zest <NEXT_INPUT> juice <NEXT_INPUT> curd <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1/2 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 large egg plus 1 egg yolk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup fresh Key lime juice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons cornstarch <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 tablespoons unsalted butter cut into pieces <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon grated Key lime zest <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch of salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 chocolate wafer cookies <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 tablespoons unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon grated Key lime zest <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons fresh Key lime juice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup buttermilk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 stick unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 1/4 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup sour cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon fresh Key lime juice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch of salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Key lime slices and grated zest for topping <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Make the lime curd Combine the granulated sugar egg and egg yolk lime juice and cornstarch in a small saucepan. <NEXT_STEP> Cook over medium low heat whisking until thick enough to coat a spoon 8 to 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat and whisk in the butter a little at a time until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Strain through a fine mesh sieve into a bowl then stir in the lime zest and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Set in a larger bowl of ice and stir until the curd is completely cool. <NEXT_STEP> Press plastic wrap directly onto the surface refrigerate until ready to use. <NEXT_STEP> Make the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and line a muffin pan with 12 cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Pulse the wafer cookies in a food processor until finely ground. <NEXT_STEP> Melt 2 tablespoons butter add to the processor and pulse until the mixture comes together. <NEXT_STEP> Press about 1 tablespoon crumbs into each muffin cup. <NEXT_STEP> Sift the flour baking powder baking soda and salt into a medium bowl set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the remaining 10 tablespoons butter and the granulated sugar in a large bowl and beat with a mixer on medium high speed until fluffy 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the speed to low beat in the eggs one at a time. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla lime zest and juice and beat until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the flour mixture in 3 additions alternating with the buttermilk beginning and ending with the flour mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Increase the speed to medium high and mix until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter among the prepared muffin cups filling each about three quarters of the way. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted into the centers comes out clean 20 to 22 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove to a rack let cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Make the frosting Beat the butter in a large bowl with a mixer on medium high speed until fluffy 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the speed to low and beat in the confectioners sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Increase the speed to medium high add the sour cream lime juice and salt and beat until fluffy 2 more minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Place the lime curd in a pastry bag fitted with a 1/4 inch tip. <NEXT_STEP> Insert the tip into the center of each cupcake and squeeze to fill. <NEXT_STEP> Frost the cupcakes then pipe more lime curd on top. <NEXT_STEP> Top with lime slices and zest. <NEXT_STEP> Cook s Note Key limes are smaller and more tart than regular limes. <NEXT_STEP> If you can t find them look for bottled Key lime juice and use regular lime zest. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Key Lime Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> lemon <NEXT_INPUT> blueberry <NEXT_INPUT> cream <NEXT_INPUT> cheese <NEXT_INPUT> zest <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 24 bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter and sugar to a mixing bowl and cream until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs 1 at a time and mix thoroughly. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla and lemon zest and mix to combine. <NEXT_STEP> Add the dry mixture in 3 parts alternating with the sour cream ending with dry mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the blueberries. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the prepared tins two thirds full and bake 16 to 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting Cream the butter and cream cheese until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla lemon zest and juice contestant during a cooking competition. <NEXT_STEP> The Food Network Kitchens have not tested it for home use therefore we cannot make any representation as to the results. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> cream <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 8 ounces cream cheese at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 large egg at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup light brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon white vinegar <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Position a rack in the center of the oven and preheat to 350 degrees F. Line a 12 cup muffin tin with liners. <NEXT_STEP> Beat together the cream cheese egg 1/3 cup of the granulated sugar and 1/2 teaspoon of the vanilla extract in a medium bowl on medium speed with an electric mixer until smooth and no lumps remain 1 to 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the flour cocoa powder brown sugar baking soda salt and remaining 2/3 cup granulated sugar in a on a wire rack and cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the filling Place small saucepan on the stovetop and put on medium heat. <NEXT_STEP> Put the peaches and sugar in and bring to slight boil. <NEXT_STEP> Cool completely before use. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting Put the mascarpone cream and confectioners sugar in a stand mixer with the paddle attachment and beat on medium speed until thick 4 to 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcakes with the peach filling and then frost with the mascarpone frosting. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Peaches n' Cream Cupcakes <TITLE_END> ounces reduced fat cream cheese at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup confectioners sugar <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line 48 mini muffin cups with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk together the flour cocoa and 1/4 teaspoon of the salt in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Beat together the oil and granulated sugar on medium high speed with a hand mixer in a large bowl until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the egg and beat until well blended. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the food coloring and 1/2 teaspoon of the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> On low speed alternately add the flour mixture and buttermilk in thirds beginning and ending with the flour beating well after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk together the baking soda and <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons ground ginger <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 stick unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup plus 2 tablespoons granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup very finely chopped crystallized ginger <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons fresh lime juice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 sticks unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon finely grated lime zest plus 1 tablespoon fresh lime juice plus small slices for garnish <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch of salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon vodka <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Make the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 F. Line a 12 cup muffin tin with foil or paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the flour ground ginger baking powder and salt in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl beat the butter 1 cup granulated sugar and the crystallized ginger with a mixer on medium high speed until light and fluffy 4 to 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the eggs one at a time then the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the mixer with the lime sugar mixture and let cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile make the frosting Beat the butter and lime zest in a large bowl with a mixer on medium high speed until smooth and creamy <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup milk at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 large banana peeled and <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 to 2 tablespoons milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Vanilla wafer cookies and banana slices for topping <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Make the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 F. Line 12 muffin cups with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the flour ground cookies baking powder and salt in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the butter and granulated sugar in a large bowl with a mixer on medium high speed until light and fluffy scraping down the bowl occasionally 3 to 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the eggs one at a time. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the milk and vanilla in a liquid measuring cup. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on low speed beat the flour mixture into the batter in two batches alternating with the milk mixture in two batches. <NEXT_STEP> Add the chopped banana and stir with a rubber spatula until blended. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter evenly among the muffin cups filling each about three quarters of the way. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until the cupcakes are golden and spring back when gently pressed 25 to 30 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer to a rack and let cool 5 minutes in the pan then remove to the rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Make the filling Put the white chocolate chips in a small bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Heat the heavy cream in the microwave until steaming then pour over the white chocolate and let stand until softened 3 to 5 minutes stir until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool about 15 minutes then refrigerate until thickened slightly 5 to 15 minutes stirring occasionally. <NEXT_STEP> The filling should fall off a spoon in a slow thick ribbon. <NEXT_STEP> Make the frosting Beat the butter and salt in a large bowl with a mixer on medium high speed until creamy 1 to 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the speed to low and beat in the confectioners sugar then increase the speed to medium high and beat until fluffy 2 to 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla and 1 tablespoon milk and beat until smooth about 1 more minute. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the remaining 1 tablespoon milk if the frosting is too stiff. <NEXT_STEP> Cut a 1 inch wide slit in the top of each cupcake cutting about halfway down. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the filling to a piping bag fitted with a small round tip. <NEXT_STEP> Gently squeeze each cupcake to open and pipe the filling into the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Spread or pipe the frosting on the cupcakes top each with a cookie and a banana slice. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Banana Pudding Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> icing <NEXT_INPUT> parchment <NEXT_INPUT> crowd <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> sift <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> about 8 cups, enough for at least 6 dozen cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 pound unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 pounds confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup whole milk at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Food coloring such as yellow blue and red or your favorite <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> In the bowl of a large electric mixer using the paddle attachment whip the butter on high speed until very soft. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile place a large sheet of parchment paper on a work surface. <NEXT_STEP> Using a large sifter sift a pound of confectioners sugar onto the parchment. <NEXT_STEP> This helps prevent clumping and makes the mixing easier. <NEXT_STEP> Lower the speed of the mixer and using the parchment as a funnel pour the sugar into the bowl and mix slowly until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the milk and mix until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Sift the second pound of sugar onto the parchment sheet. <NEXT_STEP> Again at low speed add the sugar and mix well. <NEXT_STEP> Once combined sift the remaining sugar and add it with the vanilla and mix. <NEXT_STEP> Once it is combined turn the mixer speed up and beat the icing until very light and fluffy about 3 to 4 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> If desired divide the icing into smaller batches and color with food coloring. <NEXT_STEP> Spread the icing on cooled cupcakes while at room temperature. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate any leftover icing but be sure to let it come back to room temperature before using. <NEXT_STEP> Re whip the icing to make it fluffy again. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Cupcake Icing for a Crowd <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> lime <NEXT_INPUT> strawberry <NEXT_INPUT> cups whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups raspberry preserves <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Vanilla Bean Cream Cheese Frosting recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Raspberry Coulis recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 pound cream cheese softened <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 tablespoons butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups sifted powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons vanilla bean paste <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 ounces fresh or frozen raspberries <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup sugar <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Line two standard 12 cavity muffin pans with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Evenly distribute the gluten free cookie crumbs into the liners about a tablespoon in each cup. <NEXT_STEP> Crack the eggs into a small container and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer with a paddle attachment beat the butter on medium speed until it is light in color and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sugar to the butter and continue beating until the sugar is uniformly incorporated into the butter. <NEXT_STEP> Stop the mixer and scrape down the sides of the bowl and then restart the mixer on low speed. <NEXT_STEP> Add 1 egg at a time waiting until it is fully incorporated in the butter mixture before adding the next egg. <NEXT_STEP> Once all the eggs have been added stop the mixer and scrape down the sides of the bowl to ensure that all the butter is incorporated with the eggs. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla bean paste and blend uniformly. <NEXT_STEP> Add the gluten free baking mix in three additions alternating with the milk in two additions fully incorporating each addition into the batter before moving to the next step. <NEXT_STEP> If needed stop the mixer after each addition and scrape down the sides of the bowl and then resume mixing on low. <NEXT_STEP> Once all the dry ingredients and the milk have been combined with the butter mixture evenly fill the cupcake pan cavities two thirds of the way full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake the cupcakes until the top of each cupcake is slightly springy to the touch and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean 14 to 16 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the oven and immediately turn the cupcakes out of the pan onto a cooling rack. <NEXT_STEP> Let the cupcakes cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Using an apple corer or knife core out the center of each cooled cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Then fill with 1 tablespoon raspberry preserves and top with the Vanilla Bean Cream Cheese Frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Drizzle a small amount of the Raspberry Coulis over the top. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer combine the cream cheese and butter and beat until soft and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the powdered sugar and vanilla bean paste. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk on low speed to combine so there is no loose powdered sugar on the bottom of the bowl and then turn the mixer onto medium high. <NEXT_STEP> Whip until very light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Fit an 18 inch plastic piping bag with an 847 star tip and twist the bag right by the tip to prevent the buttercream from leaking out. <NEXT_STEP> While you grasp the piping bag right above the star tip with your hand fold the top of the piping bag over your hand and spoon the cream cheese frosting into the piping bag. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Put the raspberries in a heavy saucepot and heat until warm. <NEXT_STEP> Mix together the sugar and 3 tablespoons water and add to the raspberries. <NEXT_STEP> Bring just to a boil until all the sugar dissolves. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool and pour the raspberry mix into a blender or food processor and puree. <NEXT_STEP> Strain through a fine mesh sieve to remove all or part of the seeds. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> New York Cheesecake Cupcakes <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> speed <NEXT_INPUT> raise <NEXT_INPUT> waiting <NEXT_INPUT> cheese <NEXT_INPUT> mixer <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 3/4 cup unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups cake flour sifted <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup milk at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 large eggs at room temperature separated <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Cream Cheese Frosting recipe follows or about 2 cups frosting of your choice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Colorful sprinkles <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces cream cheese at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 3/4 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons heavy cream at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon grated orange zest <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Place a rack in the middle of the oven and preheat to 375 degrees F. Line the muffin pan with paper cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> In a standing mixer fitted with the paddle attachment combine the butter and sugar and mix on low speed until just incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Raise the speed to high and mix until light and fluffy about 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile in a medium bowl whisk together the flour baking powder and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a small bowl whisk together the milk and vanilla and also set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Add the egg yolks to the creamed butter one at time waiting for each one to be fully incorporated before adding the next. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the speed of the mixer to low. <NEXT_STEP> Alternately add the flour mixture in 3 additions and the milk in 2 additions waiting for each to be fully incorporated before adding the next . <NEXT_STEP> Raise the speed to medium and mix briefly until a smooth batter is formed. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the batter to a large bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Thoroughly clean the bowl of the mixer and put the egg whites inside. <NEXT_STEP> Whip the egg whites on high speed using the whisk attachment until stiff peaks are formed. <NEXT_STEP> Working in 3 batches using a rubber spatula fold the egg whites into the batter until just incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter evenly among the cups in the muffin pan. <NEXT_STEP> Bake rotating the pan once until golden brown and a toothpick inserted in the center of the cakes comes out clean about 30 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the cakes from the oven and cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Using a palette knife or rubber spread some of the frosting all over the tops of the cakes and decorate with the sprinkles. <NEXT_STEP> In a standing mixer fitted with the paddle attachment or with a hand held electric mixer in a large bowl mix the cream cheese and sugar on low speed until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Increase the speed to high and mix until light and fluffy about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the speed of the mixer to low. <NEXT_STEP> Add the heavy cream vanilla and zest. <NEXT_STEP> Raise the speed to high and mix briefly until fluffy . <NEXT_STEP> Store in the refrigerator until somewhat stiff before using. <NEXT_STEP> May be stored in the refrigerator for 3 days. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Yellow Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> carrot <NEXT_INPUT> ounce <NEXT_INPUT> raisin <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 1/2 ounces all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 1/2 ounces corn oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup dark brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces carrots shredded <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup walnuts toasted chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Maple Cinnamon Pastry Cream Filling recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Cream Cheese Frosting recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Orange and green food coloring for garnish optional <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Marzipan or almond paste for garnish optional <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 ounce butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon maple flavoring <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 egg plus 2 egg yolks <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 ounces sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 ounces cornstarch <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/8 teaspoon ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 16 ounces milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 vanilla bean <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 ounces butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 16 ounces cream cheese at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 ounces powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Prepare the cupcake pans by spraying with nonstick coating and using cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> In a small bowl pour the hot water over the raisins to rehydrate and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium mixing bowl sift together the flour baking powder baking soda salt cocoa powder and cinnamon and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a large mixing bowl combine the corn oil dark brown sugar granulated sugar vanilla and eggs. <NEXT_STEP> Mix well to fully incorporate. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the wet and the dry ingredients stirring to fully incorporate. <NEXT_STEP> Drain the raisins and squeeze out the moisture. <NEXT_STEP> Fold them in to the batter with the carrots and walnuts. <NEXT_STEP> Scoop the batter into the prepared cupcake pans and bake until the cupcakes spring back when lightly touched with a finger about 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Core and fill the cupcakes with the Maple Cinnamon Pastry Cream Filling after they have cooled. <NEXT_STEP> Frost the cupcakes with the Cream Cheese Frosting using a pastry bag or offset spatula. <NEXT_STEP> Optional garnish Using orange and green food color and some marzipan or almond paste form carrots by rolling a ball of marzipan in the palms of your hand. <NEXT_STEP> Use a knife to make marks in the carrots and make a small batch of greens to attach to each carrot. <NEXT_STEP> The key to making pastry cream is in the set up. <NEXT_STEP> It s best to set the stage with everything before you start cooking anything. <NEXT_STEP> Cut the butter into small pieces and place in a medium mixing bowl with the maple flavoring and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a large mixing bowl place 1/2 cup water and some ice and set aside you will need it to help cool and stop the cooking of the pastry cream. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium mixing bowl beat the eggs and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a small mixing bowl combine 2 ounces sugar cornstarch and cinnamon and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium saucepan combine the milk the remaining 2 ounces sugar and vanilla bean. <NEXT_STEP> Now that the stage is set add the sugar cornstarch mixture to the eggs mixing really well with a whisk. <NEXT_STEP> Bring the milk to a boil on the stove and then temper it into the sugar egg mixture . <NEXT_STEP> Put it all back into the pot and back on the stove. <NEXT_STEP> Whisking constantly cook the pastry cream until it boils for at least 30 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> It will quickly pass a lumpy stage and then get creamy and shiny. <NEXT_STEP> Immediately dump it into the bowl with the butter and mix to incorporate fully. <NEXT_STEP> Place the bowl in the prepared ice bath and stir to cool. <NEXT_STEP> Cover the surface with plastic wrap and refrigerate until set about 1 hour. <NEXT_STEP> In a large mixing bowl of a stand mixer beat the butter to soften. <NEXT_STEP> Add the cream cheese in bits about 2 tablespoons at a time. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the bowl and mix on medium speed until fully combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the powdered sugar and mix until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Mix in the vanilla. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Carrot Cake Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> strawberry <NEXT_INPUT> Line 2 muffin tins with paper cupcake liners and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a bowl using an electric mixer mix the cake mix water oil eggs and coconut extract on medium speed until moistened and smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the chopped coconut. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter evenly among the muffin tins. <NEXT_STEP> The batter will nearly fill each liner to the top. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until the muffins spring back when lightly touched or a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean about 15 to 18 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer to a rack to cool. <NEXT_STEP> When cool put the icing out with spoons or small spatulas along with bowls of the cupcake toppings for the kids to decorate their own cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a large electric mixer using the paddle attachment whip the butter on high speed until very soft. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile place a large sheet of parchment paper on a work surface. <NEXT_STEP> Using a large sifter sift a pound of confectioners sugar onto the parchment. <NEXT_STEP> This helps prevent clumping and makes the mixing easier. <NEXT_STEP> Lower the speed of the mixer and using the parchment as a funnel pour the sugar into the bowl and mix slowly until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the milk and mix until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Sift the second pound of sugar onto the parchment sheet. <NEXT_STEP> Again at low speed add the sugar and mix well. <NEXT_STEP> Once combined sift the remaining sugar and add it with the vanilla and mix. <NEXT_STEP> Once it is combined turn the mixer speed up and beat the icing until very light and fluffy about 3 to 4 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> If desired divide the icing into smaller batches and color with food coloring. <NEXT_STEP> Spread the icing on cooled cupcakes while at room temperature. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate any leftover icing but be sure to let it come back to room temperature before using. <NEXT_STEP> Re whip the icing to make it fluffy again. <NEXT_STEP> Yield about 8 cups enough for at least 6 dozen cupcakes Prep Time 10 minutes Ease of preparation easy <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Quickie Coconut Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cone <NEXT_INPUT> rosewater <NEXT_INPUT> rose <NEXT_INPUT> petal <NEXT_INPUT> leaf <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 servings <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 1/4 room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons flavorless oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons clear imitation vanilla extract preferably McCormick s <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons rosewater <NEXT_INGREDIENT> A few drops pink food coloring <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 tablespoons whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup rainbow sprinkles <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 flat bottomed ice cream cones <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup unsalted butter softened <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons rosewater <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch kosher salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Food coloring optional <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Sprinkles <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Combine the flour cornstarch salt and baking powder in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Set the dry mixture aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy 3 to 4 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the egg whites one at a time mixing well after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Add the oil vanilla extract rosewater and food coloring. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer running on low speed add the dry mixture and the milk to the wet mixture in two or three alternating batches and mix until just barely combined. <NEXT_STEP> Using a rubber spatula gently fold in the sprinkles until they re evenly distributed. <NEXT_STEP> Arrange the ice cream cones in a 9 by 13 inch pan. <NEXT_STEP> Add the batter to a large piping bag and snip a hole at the tip about 1 inch wide . <NEXT_STEP> Fill the ice cream cones to the inner line of each cone. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool in the pan for 10 minutes and then transfer the cupcakes to a wire rack to cool completely about 1 hour. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting Meanwhile in a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment beat the butter until smooth then gradually beat in the powdered sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Add the milk rosewater vanilla extract and salt and beat to combine. <NEXT_STEP> For the assembly Decorate the cupcakes with the frosting of your choice. <NEXT_STEP> Or if you made a double batch of frosting to have enough for the roses separate the frosting adding dye if you choose and place into piping bags fitted with a rose petal tip and a leaf tip. <NEXT_STEP> Directly onto the center of the cupcake pipe one small arch shape with the rose petal tip then another halfway overlapping the previous petal continuing until your flower is complete. <NEXT_STEP> Using the piping bag with the leaf tip add leaves. <NEXT_STEP> You can also form any other decorations your heart desires . <NEXT_STEP> Add the sprinkles. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Rose Cupcake Cones <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> candy <NEXT_INPUT> circus <NEXT_INPUT> chick <NEXT_INPUT> beat <NEXT_INPUT> eyeball <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 circus peanut candies <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Yellow sanding sugar for topping <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 24 medium candy eyeballs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 yellow candy melts cut in half <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Make the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. smooth about 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Add the granulated sugar and beat until creamy about 4 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the eggs one at a time then the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the speed to low and <INGREDIENT_START> 1 stick plus 1 tablespoon soft butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup plus 1 tablespoon sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 to 3 tablespoons milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Royal Icing recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon lemon juice <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Take everything you need out of the fridge in time to get to room temperature and this makes a huge difference to the lightness of the cupcakes later and preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Put all of the ingredients for the cupcakes except for the milk into a food processor and blitz until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Pulse while adding the milk down the funnel to make a smooth dropping consistency. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the mixture between a 12 bun muffin tin lined with muffin papers and bake in the oven for 15 to 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> They should have risen and be golden on top. <NEXT_STEP> Let them cool a little in their tins on a rack and then take them carefully out of the tin to cool in their papers still on the wire rack. <NEXT_STEP> Ice with Royal Icing. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the egg whites and confectioners sugar in a medium size mixing bowl and whip with an electric mixer on medium speed until opaque and shiny about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk in the lemon juice this will thin out the icing. <NEXT_STEP> Beat for another couple of minutes until you reach the right spreading consistency for the cupcakes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> la <NEXT_INPUT> mode <NEXT_INPUT> ice <NEXT_INPUT> scoop <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 1/4 sticks unsalted butter softened and cut into pieces <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup unsweetened cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 ounces unsweetened chocolate finely chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup boiling water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup finely chopped toasted walnuts <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup semisweet chocolate chips <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 pint vanilla ice cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup prepared hot fudge sauce <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons rainbow colored sprinkles <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 jarred maraschino cherries with stems drained and patted dry <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and line one 12 cup standard muffin tin with paper cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl combine the butter cocoa powder and chocolate. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the boiling water over and let stand 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk until smooth and then whisk in the sugar vanilla and eggs. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk in the flour salt baking powder and baking soda until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in the walnuts and chocolate chips. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter among the prepared liners so they are about three quarters full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out with moist crumbs 22 to 24 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool in the tins 5 minutes and then cool completely on a wire rack. <NEXT_STEP> While the cupcakes bake and cool scoop 12 small scoops of ice cream onto a large plate or baking sheet and place in the freezer until hard. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble scoop off a small piece of the cupcake to make a concave top and then top each cupcake with a scoop of ice cream. <NEXT_STEP> Drizzle the ice cream with hot fudge and top with some sprinkles and a cherry. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Brownie Cupcakes a la Mode <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> coconut <NEXT_INPUT> almond <NEXT_INPUT> cheese <NEXT_INPUT> pure <NEXT_INPUT> cream <INPUT_END> <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon pure almond extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 pounds confectioners sugar sifted <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 325 degrees. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of the bowl after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla and almond extracts and mix well. <NEXT_STEP> In a separate bowl sift together the flour baking powder baking soda and salt. <NEXT_STEP> In three parts alternately add the dry ingredients and the buttermilk to the batter beginning and ending with the dry. <NEXT_STEP> Mix until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in 7 ounces of coconut. <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon ground cardamom <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 teaspoon ground pink peppercorns <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/8 teaspoon ground black pepper <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 stick unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons finely grated grapefruit zest <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 sticks unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 tablespoons Campari <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Red and orange gel food coloring <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Orange coarse sugar for decorating <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Small orange slices for garnish <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Make the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 F. Line a 12 cup muffin tin with foil or paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the flour baking powder salt cardamom and both peppers in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl beat the butter granulated sugar and grapefruit zest with a mixer on medium high speed until light and fluffy about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the speed to medium low and beat in the flour mixture in three additions alternating with the milk in two additions until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> In a clean bowl with clean beaters beat the egg whites on high speed until they hold stiff peaks but are not dry and clumpy about 4 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Gently fold the egg whites into the batter until no white streaks remain. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter evenly among the muffin cups. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until the cupcakes are golden and a toothpick inserted into the centers comes out clean 22 to 24 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool 5 minutes in the pan then remove to a rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile make the frosting Beat the butter and confectioners sugar in a large bowl with a mixer on medium speed until combined then increase the speed to medium high and beat until smooth and fluffy about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the Campari then tint with red and orange food coloring until Campari colored. <NEXT_STEP> Spread the frosting on the cupcakes with an offset spatula. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle with the coarse sugar and garnish each with an orange slice. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Negroni Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> glaze <NEXT_INPUT> bourbon <NEXT_INPUT> swirling <NEXT_INPUT> heat <NEXT_INPUT> occasionally <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 1/4 sticks unsalted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/3 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon ground allspice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/8 teaspoon smoked paprika <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup packed light brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup sour cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon packed finely grated orange zest <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup packed light brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons dark corn syrup <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 tablespoons unsalted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch of salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon cornstarch <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons bourbon <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Orange twist and maraschino cherries for garnish <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Make the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 F. Line a 12 cup muffin pan with foil or paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Melt 4 tablespoons butter in a small skillet over medium heat swirling the pan. <NEXT_STEP> Continue to cook swirling occasionally until the butter is browned 3 to 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining 6 tablespoons butter and remove from the heat. <NEXT_STEP> Let stand stirring occasionally until all the butter is melted pour into a large bowl and let cool slightly. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the flour baking soda salt baking powder nutmeg allspice and paprika in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Add the brown and granulated sugars to the bowl with the butter along with the sour cream vanilla orange zest and eggs whisk until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add the flour mixture and stir with a rubber spatula until just combined then briefly whisk until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter among the muffin cups filling them about two thirds of the way. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until the centers of the cupcakes spring back when gently pressed 20 to 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool 5 minutes in the pan then remove to a rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Make the glaze Combine the brown sugar corn syrup butter and salt in a small high sided saucepan over medium heat. <NEXT_STEP> Add the water and stir then bring to a simmer over medium heat. <NEXT_STEP> Cook swirling the pan occasionally but not stirring until the mixture is a rich brown color and thick enough to slowly drip off the end of a rubber spatula 12 to 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile combine the cornstarch and heavy cream in a small bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the glaze from the heat and carefully add the cream mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Return to the heat and cook carefully stirring frequently until the mixture thickens slightly about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat and stir in the bourbon . <NEXT_STEP> Let stand stirring occasionally for 30 minutes the caramel will be thick and slightly warm. <NEXT_STEP> Cut a slit in the top of each cupcake cutting almost all the way across and about halfway down. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer 1/3 cup of the glaze to a piping bag fitted with a small round tip. <NEXT_STEP> Gently squeeze the cupcakes to open the slits pipe the glaze into the cupcakes filling until the glaze comes up to the top. <NEXT_STEP> Dip the tops of the cupcakes in the remaining glaze in the saucepan letting the excess drip off then return to the rack. <NEXT_STEP> Pop any air bubbles in the glaze with a toothpick. <NEXT_STEP> Garnish each cupcake with an orange twist and a maraschino cherry. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Old-Fashioned Cupcakes <NEXT_INPUT> stem <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 24 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> One 15.25 ounce box strawberry cake mix <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 32 small strawberries with leaves <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> One .55 ounce piece green taffy such as AirHeads Watermelon <NEXT_INGREDIENT> One 12 ounce container frozen whipped topping such as Cool Whip thawed <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Prepare the cake mix according to the package directions to make 24 cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Bake and let cool 15 minutes in the pan on a rack then transfer the cupcakes to a rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Hull and chop about 8 strawberries . <NEXT_STEP> Stir together the chopped strawberries sugar and lemon juice in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Let stand at room temperature tossing a few times until the strawberries are juicy about 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> For the remaining 24 strawberries put a strawberry stem side down on a cutting board. <NEXT_STEP> Make 2 crisscross slices down and almost all the way through the strawberry stopping just before the stem to keep the stem end intact. <NEXT_STEP> Gently pull the 4 sections apart to form a butterfly. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with the remaining strawberries. <NEXT_STEP> Make the antennae by cutting 2 thin strips of green taffy about 1 inch long and 1 millimeter wide each. <NEXT_STEP> Roll the taffy strips between your hands to make ropes and curl up one end of each rope slightly. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat making a pair of antennae for the remaining 23 butterflies. paring knife. <NEXT_STEP> Fill each with some macerated strawberries and pipe a swirl of whipped topping on top to cover. <NEXT_STEP> Decorate each cupcake with a strawberry butterfly. <NEXT_STEP> Tuck a pair of antennae into the whipped topping behind each strawberry butterfly with the curled ends up and facing outward. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Strawberry Shortcake Butterfly Cupcakes <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 banana chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup salted roasted peanuts chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/2 sticks unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/2 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch of salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 sugar ice cream cones crushed <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 ounces semisweet chocolate chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 tablespoons coconut oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Rainbow sprinkles for decorating <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Make the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a 12 cup muffin pan with liners. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the butter and unsweetened chocolate in a large microwave safe bowl microwave in 30 second intervals stirring until melted and smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool slightly then whisk in the granulated sugar and eggs until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add the flour baking powder baking soda and salt whisk until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the milk and whisk until smooth then stir in the banana and peanuts. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter among the prepared muffin cups filling each about three quarters of the way. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until the tops of the cupcakes spring back when gently pressed about 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool 5 minutes in the pan then transfer to a rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile make the frosting Beat the butter confectioners sugar and salt in a large bowl with a mixer on medium speed until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla and milk increase the speed to medium high and beat until light and fluffy about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the crushed sugar cones and beat 1 more minute. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer to a piping bag fitted with a large star tip. <NEXT_STEP> Arrange the cupcakes on a baking sheet pipe tall swirls of frosting onto the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate until the frosting is firm about 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile make the chocolate shell Combine the semisweet chocolate and coconut oil in a microwave safe bowl microwave in 30 second intervals stirring until melted and smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool slightly then pour into a short wide drinking glass for dunking the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> One at a time turn each cupcake upside down and dunk the frosting in the melted chocolate rotate to coat and let the excess drip off. <NEXT_STEP> Return to the baking sheet and decorate with sprinkles while the chocolate is still wet. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate until set at least 30 minutes or overnight. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Sundae Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 3/4 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup sour cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons vanilla Line two standard muffin pans with 20 cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> For the cupcakes Put 1/2 cup of the granulated sugar the egg whites and whole egg in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment and beat on medium high speed for about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Pour into another bowl and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Clean the mixing bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Put the remaining 1 cup sugar and the powdered sugar and vanilla in a chilled mixing bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Whip until medium stiff peaks form. <NEXT_STEP> Be careful not to over whip. <NEXT_STEP> Chill briefly if not using right away. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Use a chopstick or fat skewer to poke 4 or 5 holes halfway through each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Squeeze some of the quatro leches mixture into each hole you can let it sink in a bit and then squeeze in some more to fill. <NEXT_STEP> Frost generously with the whipped cream frosting. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Cuatro Leches Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 tablespoons unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 stick unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch of salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Yellow pink and blue food coloring <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Make the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. cups filling them two thirds of the way. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until the cupcakes are golden and the tops spring back when pressed about 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer to a rack and let cool 10 minutes then remove the cupcakes to the rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile make the frosting Beat the butter confectioners sugar and salt in a large bowl with a mixer on medium speed until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla and beat on medium high speed until creamy about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the milk and beat until fluffy about 1 more minute. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the frosting among 3 small bowls. <NEXT_STEP> Tint one yellow one pink and one blue with food coloring. <NEXT_STEP> Drop alternating spoonfuls of the frosting into a pastry bag fitted with a 1/2 inch round tip. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the frosting in a swirl onto the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Serve in a clean egg carton. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Mini Egg Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> strawberry <NEXT_INPUT> semisweet <NEXT_INPUT> frosting <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 cup all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon instant espresso powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 large egg <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup strawberry preserves or jelly <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 ounces semisweet chocolate finely chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 medium strawberries <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 ounces white chocolate finely chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 sticks unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 pinches salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons whole milk <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Make the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a 12 cup muffin pan with liners. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the flour salt and baking soda in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the cocoa powder and espresso powder in a large bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Heat the milk in a small saucepan over medium heat until hot but not simmering pour over the cocoa powder mixture and whisk until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool a few minutes then add the granulated sugar and whisk until dissolved. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk in the vegetable oil egg and vanilla then whisk in the flour mixture until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter among the prepared muffin cups filling each about two thirds of the way. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until the tops of the cupcakes spring back when gently pressed about 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Stir together the strawberry preserves and lemon juice and brush on the warm cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer to a rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile make the chocolate dipped strawberries Microwave 4 ounces semisweet chocolate in a bowl in 30 second intervals stirring until melted. <NEXT_STEP> Dip the strawberries in the chocolate place on a plate. <NEXT_STEP> Let set 20 to 30 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Make the frosting Microwave the white chocolate and the remaining 2 ounces semisweet chocolate in separate bowls in 30 second intervals stirring until melted. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool. <NEXT_STEP> Beat 6 tablespoons butter and a pinch of salt in a bowl with a mixer on medium high speed until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the melted white chocolate. <NEXT_STEP> Add 1 cup confectioners sugar beat until fluffy 3 minutes then beat in 1 teaspoon vanilla and 1 tablespoon milk. <NEXT_STEP> Set the white chocolate frosting aside. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat this step with the melted semisweet chocolate to make a semisweet chocolate frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon the white chocolate frosting onto one side of a piping bag fitted with a large round tip. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon the semisweet chocolate frosting next to the white chocolate frosting so the two flavors are side by side pipe the swirled frosting onto the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Top each with a chocolate dipped strawberry. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate-Strawberry Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> champagne <NEXT_INPUT> custard <NEXT_INPUT> gelatin <NEXT_INPUT> pod <NEXT_INPUT> pearl <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 half bottle champagne or other sparkling wine <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 tablespoons unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 vanilla bean split lengthwise and seeds scraped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 large egg separated <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons unflavored gelatin powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 large egg yolks <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup cold heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Sugar pearls for decorating <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Make the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a 12 cup muffin pan with liners. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the champagne into a bowl and whisk until the bubbles dissipate. <NEXT_STEP> Combine 1/2 cup of the champagne and the vanilla extract in a small bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside the remaining champagne for the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the flour baking powder and salt in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the butter sugar and vanilla seeds in a large bowl with a mixer on medium high speed until light and fluffy about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the egg yolk and beat until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the mixer speed to low beat in the flour mixture in two batches alternating with the champagne vanilla mixture in two batches until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> In a separate bowl whisk the egg white until stiff peaks form then gently fold into the batter with a rubber spatula. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter among the prepared muffin cups filling each about two thirds of the way. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until the tops of the cupcakes spring back when gently pressed 20 to 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool 5 minutes in the pan then remove to a rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile make the frosting Put 1 1/2 tablespoons of the reserved champagne in a small bowl sprinkle the gelatin on top and let stand 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the sugar salt and egg yolks in a small saucepan until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk in the remaining champagne and add the vanilla pod. <NEXT_STEP> Cook over medium heat stirring until the custard is thick enough to coat the back of a spoon 3 to 4 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the hot custard through a fine mesh sieve into a large metal bowl discard the vanilla pod. <NEXT_STEP> Add the gelatin mixture and stir until dissolved. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate the custard stirring every 5 minutes until it is the consistency of soft whipped cream 10 to 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the heavy cream in a medium bowl with a mixer on medium speed until stiff peaks form. <NEXT_STEP> Add the whipped cream to the custard and gently whisk until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate the frosting gently folding with a rubber spatula every 5 minutes until thick enough to pipe 10 to 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Working quickly transfer the frosting to a piping bag fitted with a large round tip and pipe onto the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Decorate with sugar pearls. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate immediately to set the frosting at least 30 minutes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Champagne-Vanilla Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pool <NEXT_INPUT> bear <NEXT_INPUT> blue <NEXT_INPUT> candy <NEXT_INPUT> taffy <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 24 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> One 15.25 ounce box vanilla cake mix <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Three 16 ounce tubs vanilla frosting <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Blue food coloring as needed <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 ounces blue candy coated chocolates such as M M s <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 14 ounces white candy coated chocolates such as M M s <NEXT_INGREDIENT> One 3 ounce package blue sweetened powdered gelatin <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 striped sour candy belt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 11 graham cracker bears <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 candy necklaces <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 small jawbreaker <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 gummy ring candies such as Lifesavers Gummies <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 chocolate chew candy such as Tootsie Roll <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 white flat taffy candy strip such as Airheads <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 green flat taffy candy strip such as Airheads <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Line two 12 cup muffin pans with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Prepare the cupcakes according to the package directions. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer to cooling racks and cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> In a clean mixer bowl combine 1 1/2 tubs of the frosting and about 1/4 teaspoon blue food coloring. <NEXT_STEP> Beat until smooth and no streaks remain adding more color if needed to make a light blue frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Dollop a tiny bit of blue frosting on the bottom of the liner of one of the cupcakes then dollop a generous amount on top of the cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Anchor the cupcake to a serving tray large enough to hold all 24 cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with the remaining cupcakes arranging them in a 4 by 6 cupcake grid with the edges touching. <NEXT_STEP> Using an offset spatula smooth the blue frosting across the tops of the cupcakes adding more as necessary so it appears as 1 layer and the individual cupcakes are no longer visible. <NEXT_STEP> Smooth the remaining blue frosting on the sides to cover the cupcakes but not the liners. <NEXT_STEP> Put the remaining 1 1/2 tubs white frosting in a pastry bag fitted with a large round tip. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the outline of a rectangle in white closer to one short edge of the cupcake grid to make the pool. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe around the outline of the rectangle all the way to the edges of the cupcake grid with white leaving the inside of the pool blue. <NEXT_STEP> Smooth the white frosting with an offset spatula. <NEXT_STEP> For the decorations Arrange a row of blue candy coated chocolates on the white frosting around the perimeter of the pool then arrange another row of blue candy coated chocolates around the outer perimeter of the cupcake grid. <NEXT_STEP> Fill in between the 2 blue rows with rows of white candy coated chocolates to make the pool deck. <NEXT_STEP> Chill the cake 30 minutes to set the frosting inside the pool. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile bring 1/2 cup water to a boil in a small saucepan. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the blue gelatin until dissolved. <NEXT_STEP> Combine a mixture of water and ice in a measuring cup to make 1/2 cup. <NEXT_STEP> Stir into the dissolved gelatin until the ice melts. <NEXT_STEP> Chill the gelatin mixture while the cake chills. <NEXT_STEP> After 30 minutes pour the gelatin into the pool. <NEXT_STEP> Chill until completely set about 2 hours. <NEXT_STEP> Cut 2 strips of sour candy belt each slightly larger than a graham bear to make beach towels. <NEXT_STEP> Lay 1 bear on each towel and arrange them to relax by the pool. <NEXT_STEP> Add a drink umbrella over each to shade them from the sun. <NEXT_STEP> Cut the candy necklaces open where they tie to make 2 long strips. <NEXT_STEP> Cut 2 strips the same size as the length of the pool and arrange them over the gelatin for lanes. <NEXT_STEP> Gently pull out and discard the strings keeping the candies in straight lines. <NEXT_STEP> Arrange 3 bears around a jawbreaker in the pool to play a game of volleyball. <NEXT_STEP> Stick a bear in each gummy ring candy for floaties and add to the pool. <NEXT_STEP> Cut the chocolate chew into 4 pieces crosswise to make legs for the diving board. <NEXT_STEP> Cut a 1 1/2 inch piece from the white taffy and attach it to the legs to make a diving board. <NEXT_STEP> Set at the deep end of the pool and press a bear at the end ready to dive in. <NEXT_STEP> Cut the green taffy into a rectangle a little larger than a bear. <NEXT_STEP> With the back of a paring knife score lines in the taffy to resemble the puffy parts of a blow up raft. <NEXT_STEP> Stick a bear on the raft and add him to the pool. <NEXT_STEP> Stick the remaining bears in the pool to hang out. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Pull-Apart Pool Cupcake Cake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> orange <NEXT_INPUT> dreamsicle <NEXT_INPUT> speed <NEXT_INPUT> gummy <NEXT_INPUT> <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon orange oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup fresh orange juice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 sticks unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INPUT> coloring <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 23 servings <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 6 1/2 cups white buttercream or frosting <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Ivory gel food coloring <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Brown gel food coloring <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Red gel food coloring <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 23 of your favorite cupcakes <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 large red gumdrop <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Multi colored sprinkles for decorating <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Reserve about 1 cup white buttercream and transfer to a piping bag fitted with a large star tip. <NEXT_STEP> Color about 2 cups buttercream dark tan/light brown using ivory food coloring with a few drops of brown. <NEXT_STEP> Color about 3 1/2 cups buttercream a medium pink using red food coloring. <NEXT_STEP> Assemble the ice cream cone Arrange 8 cupcakes as follows to make the cone one row of 3 two rows of 2 and 1 cupcake at the bottom. <NEXT_STEP> Use an ice cream scoop or large spoon to dollop about 1/4 cup of the tan/brown frosting on each cupcake and smooth over the top and sides of the cupcakes to make a cone shape smoothing to a point at the bottom. <NEXT_STEP> With the back of a butter knife drag through the buttercream in a crosshatch pattern to resemble the lines on an ice cream cone. <NEXT_STEP> Wash and dry the ice cream scoop and offset spatula. <NEXT_STEP> Arrange 15 cupcakes above the cone to make a scoop of ice cream with a flat ish bottom and a domed top. <NEXT_STEP> Use the ice cream scoop or large spoon to dollop about 1/4 cup of the pink frosting on each of the 15 cupcakes and spread with the offset spatula making swirls in the frosting so it resembles a scoop of ice cream. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe a freeform pattern of white buttercream stars on the top of the scoop to resemble whipped cream. <NEXT_STEP> Place a large red gumdrop on the top cupcake for the cherry. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle the white buttercream with multi colored sprinkles. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Ice Cream Cone Pull-Apart Cupcake Cake <TITLE_END> <STEP_START> For the cake Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line 24 muffin tins with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Using a hand mixer or standing mixer cream the butter and vanilla sugar together until fluffy about 2 to 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add eggs one at a a stand mixer cream the granulated sugar and butter until fluffy about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time beating well after each addition and scraping down the bowl as needed. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the milk and bourbon in a small bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Add the flour mixture to the butter sugar mixture in 3 additions alternating with the milk bourbon mixture in 2 additions. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the batter until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Using an ice cream scoop fill each muffin cup two thirds full with batter. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick <NEXT_STEP> For decorating Roll the yellow gum paste very thin . <NEXT_STEP> Using a 1 1/2 inch round cutter cut 12 rounds from the gum paste. <NEXT_STEP> Elevate a wooden dowel or thin handled wooden spoon on 2 cans or paper cups with notches cut to hold in place. <NEXT_STEP> Drape the gum paste rounds over the dowel to dry and form taco shells about 30 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Fill a pastry bag fitted with a leaf tip with the blue buttercream frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Starting in the center of each of 12 cupcakes while spinning the cupcake pipe the frosting on a flat angle to the top of the cupcake moving the bag slightly up and down to form a ruffle. <NEXT_STEP> Cover the top of each cupcake completely with frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Add the coconut to a small bowl with a few drops of green food coloring. <NEXT_STEP> Stir with a fork to distribute the food coloring adding additional coloring until the desired lettuce color is reached. <NEXT_STEP> Snip the red gummy candy into small pieces using kitchen shears to form the tomato salsa. <NEXT_STEP> Crumble one of the remaining cupcakes to fine crumbs to form the taco meat. <NEXT_STEP> Assemble the tacos by layering each taco shell with some cupcake crumbs green coconut and red gummy tomatoes. <NEXT_STEP> Finish by grating white chocolate over the top of each for a cheese effect. <NEXT_STEP> Place one taco on top of each frosted cupcake. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Spicy Chocolate Bourbon Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pumpkin <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> cheese <NEXT_INPUT> allspice
