<STEP_START> For the almond bees Fill a piping bag with a very small round tip with the chocolate. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe 2 eyes side by side on the rounder end of each almond followed by 3 crosswise stripes starting in the middle of the almond down to the narrower end. <NEXT_STEP> Attach 2 sliced almonds to the top chocolate stripe . <NEXT_STEP> Repeat to make 18 almond bees total. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to dry. <NEXT_STEP> For the sugar cookies Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Whisk the flour baking powder and salt in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the butter and both sugars in another medium bowl with a handheld electric mixer on medium high speed until light and fluffy about 30 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs and vanilla mixing until fully incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly add the flour mixture and continue beating just until the dough comes together stopping and scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the dough in half pat into discs wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate until firm at least 2 hours. <NEXT_STEP> Generously flour a clean work surface. <NEXT_STEP> Gently roll out the chilled dough to about 3/8 inch thick. <NEXT_STEP> Cut 24 cookies using a 2 1/4 inch hexagon cookie cutter working quickly so that the dough stays chilled. <NEXT_STEP> Place the cookies on ungreased baking sheets leaving about 1 inch between them. <NEXT_STEP> Lightly dust off any excess flour with a dry pastry brush. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate the formed cookies for at least 30 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Bake the cookies until the bottoms are golden about 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool on the baking sheets until firm enough to transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> If not using right away cookies can be stored in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 1 week. <NEXT_STEP> For the decorative cookie border To create the honeycomb shapes on your sugar cookies roll the yellow fondant out and cut out 24 hexagon shapes with a 2 1/4 inch hexagon cutter. <NEXT_STEP> Place a 1 1/4 inch hexagon cutter in the center of your existing fondant hexagon shape and press. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the center piece. <NEXT_STEP> Thinly frost the cookies with some buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> Place a cut out hexagon fondant border on each cookie. <NEXT_STEP> Mix the clear and yellow sanding sugars together and then fill the inner space of the cookies with the mixed sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Flip the cookies over to shake out any excess sanding sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Reserve the remaining sugar mixture for the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble the cupcakes Frost the vanilla mini cupcakes with some buttercream using a pastry bag fitted with a star tip. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle with some of the sanding sugar mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Garnish 12 of the mini cupcakes with 1 almond bee. <NEXT_STEP> Reserve the additional 6 bees to garnish the honeycomb cookie cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Frost the standard size frangipane cupcakes with some buttercream using a mini offset spatula. <NEXT_STEP> Dip the outside edges of the frosted cupcakes into the mixed sanding sugar and place the hexagon sugar cookies on top. <NEXT_STEP> To build the honeycomb structure Place 14 of the standard size cupcakes in a hexagonal honeycomb pattern. <NEXT_STEP> Stack 7 more cupcakes making a second tier in the honeycomb pattern saving 3 cupcakes to put on the top tier. <NEXT_STEP> Scatter 20 mini cupcakes around the base of the honeycomb structure. <NEXT_STEP> Garnish the structure with the remaining 4 mini cupcakes with almond bees. <NEXT_STEP> Then arrange the remaining 6 bees on the tops of the hexagon cookies. <NEXT_STEP> Preheat the oven to 350 F and position a rack in the middle of the oven. <NEXT_STEP> Line one 12 cup standard muffin tin or two 24 cup mini muffin tins with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the flour baking powder and salt together in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> In another medium bowl beat the eggs and sugar with an electric mixer until light and foamy about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> While beating gradually pour in the butter and then the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> While mixing slowly add half the dry ingredients. <NEXT_STEP> Then add all the milk and follow with the rest of the dry ingredients. <NEXT_STEP> Take care not to overmix the batter. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter evenly in the prepared tin. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a tester inserted in the center of the cakes comes out clean rotating the tin about halfway through 18 to 20 minutes . <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes on a rack in the tin for 10 minutes and then remove from the tin. <NEXT_STEP> Cool on the rack completely. <NEXT_STEP> Decorate as desired. <NEXT_STEP> Bring a few inches of water to a boil in a saucepan that can hold a heatproof stand mixer s bowl above the water. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sugar lemon juice salt and egg whites to the mixing bowl and whisk together by hand. <NEXT_STEP> Set the bowl above the boiling water and whisk until the mixture is warm to the touch and the sugar completely dissolves. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer to the stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment and beat at medium high speed until cool and the whites hold stiff peaks 10 to 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Toss in a couple of chunks of butter at a time making sure the pieces are incorporated before adding more. <NEXT_STEP> After all the butter is added continue whisking on medium high speed. <NEXT_STEP> The mixture will deflate and appear curdled. <NEXT_STEP> Continue whisking until the buttercream comes back together to form a smooth and spreadable consistency. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly drizzle in the optional flavoring while beating until smooth and light. <NEXT_STEP> Chocolate Remove the buttercream from the stand mixer into a large bowl and in three batches fold in 6 ounces melted and cooled bittersweet chocolate. <NEXT_STEP> Citrus Stir in the zest of half a lemon or orange. <NEXT_STEP> Boozy Stir in 2 tablespoons coffee flavored liqueur and 1 tablespoon vodka. <NEXT_STEP> Pulse 4 tablespoons soft unsalted butter 1 large egg 3 tablespoons each almond paste sugar and cake flour and 1/2 teaspoon almond extract in a food processor until very smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape out into a small baking dish and spread into an even layer. <NEXT_STEP> Freeze until firm about 1 hour. <NEXT_STEP> Scoop 12 slightly heaping tablespoonfuls and roll into balls. <NEXT_STEP> Return to the freezer until firm again about 30 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Make batter for Go To Vanilla Cupcakes and fill the bottom of each liner with a heaping tablespoonful of batter. <NEXT_STEP> Place 1 ball of frangipane in the center of each and divide the remaining batter among the liners to top. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean 20 to 22 minutes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Honeycomb Cupcakes Centerpiece <TITLE_END> <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 10 egg yolks at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 cups heavy whipping cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon unsalted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups granulated sugar <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cake batter Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F line cupcake pans with 24 cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Put the butter in the bowl of a stand mixer with a paddle attachment and beat slowly until it is smooth and creamy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the granulated sugar and salt and cream at moderate speed until the mixture is light and fluffy 8 to 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs and egg whites together a little at a time beating after each addition until the eggs are absorbed before adding more. <NEXT_STEP> Mix until light and fluffy scraping down the sides of the bowl to insure even mixing about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Sift together the cake flour and baking powder in a medium bowl and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Mix the milk and vanilla together in a separate bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Add one quarter of the flour mixture to the butter and egg mixture and beat just until blended in. <NEXT_STEP> Add one third of the milk mixture and beat just until blended in. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with the remaining ingredients alternating the flour with the milk until all the ingredients are used. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl occasionally for even mixing. <NEXT_STEP> Scoop some batter into each liner and bake until an inserted toothpick comes out clean 20 to 22 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool completely before frosting. <NEXT_STEP> For the custard frosting Using an electric mixer with a whip attachment whip the cornstarch and egg yolks in a stainless steel bowl until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Warm the whipping cream and confectioners sugar in a saucepan over medium heat. <NEXT_STEP> When the cream mixture reaches about 100 degrees F add about half of it to the egg yolks whisking and then transfer the mixture back to the saucepan. <NEXT_STEP> Continue cooking the yolk and cream mixture until it reaches a boil . <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat immediately and pour into a clean stainless steel bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Whip in the butter and vanilla until smooth and creamy. <NEXT_STEP> For the brulee sugar mixture Mix together the brown sugar and granulated sugar in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Top each cupcake with 1 1/2 ounces of the custard frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle on some of the brulee sugar mixture and torch. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat several times to desired thickness. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Creme Brulee Cupcake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> strawberry <NEXT_INPUT> mascarpone <NEXT_INPUT> italian processor combine the mascarpone cheese strawberries 1/4 cup sugar and lemon juice. <NEXT_STEP> Process the mixture until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the strawberry mixture to a pastry bag fitted with a small tip. <NEXT_STEP> Push the tip gently into the bottom of a cupcake and squeeze in the strawberry mixture until the cupcake plumps. <NEXT_STEP> Continue with the remaining cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> In a small saucepan bring the 1/2 cup sugar water and vanilla extract to a simmer over medium heat. <NEXT_STEP> Simmer until the sugar is dissolved. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium bowl combine the vanilla syrup with the confectioner s sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Stir until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Working quickly use a rubber spatula spread the icing on the top of the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> If the icing the vanilla extract. <NEXT_STEP> Measure the milk and half and half into a third bowl. <NEXT_STEP> In a 5 quart mixer with a paddle attachment cream the butter until fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Stop the mixer edible paint will dry leaving behind the gold dust. <NEXT_STEP> In a 5 quart mixer with the paddle attachment cream the butter and shortening together. <NEXT_STEP> On first speed add the sifted powdered sugar to the bowl in 3 parts. <NEXT_STEP> Let each part incorporate into the butter mixture before adding the next. <NEXT_STEP> After adding all the sugar put the mixer on the fourth speed and mix for 8 to 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> The buttercream will begin to gain volume and look white and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Once you bring the buttercream to full volume add the extracts and the mocha paste. <NEXT_STEP> Lastly add the liqueurs and vodka and incorporate completely. <NEXT_STEP> In a 5 quart mixer with the paddle attachment add the heavy cream and whip to full volume. <NEXT_STEP> Add the Irish liqueur and on first speed fold in the liqueur until completely incorporated. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> White Russian Cupcake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> walnut <NEXT_STEP> To pipe the flower Place the grapefruit tinted frosting in a pastry bag with a 10 round tip. <NEXT_STEP> Hold the bag straight above the cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> To create a 5 petal flower start 1/2 inch from the edge and squeeze and release while dragging toward the center of the cupcake to create a tear shaped petal. <NEXT_STEP> Rotate the cupcake slightly after each petal. <NEXT_STEP> Place the egg yolk tinted frosting in a pastry bag with a 2 small round tip. <NEXT_STEP> Hold the bag straight up and pipe a small dot into the center of the flower. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with the remaining cupcakes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Whimsical Flower Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> strawberry <NEXT_INPUT> neapolitan <NEXT_INPUT> buttercream <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 24 servings <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 2 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 pound butter cut up and softened slightly <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon almond extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup unsalted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 teaspoons vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 cups sifted cake flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Edible pearlized fondant balls <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Make the White Buttercream Put the sugar in a saucepan fitted with a candy thermometer and pour the water down the walls of the pan to moisten the sugar without letting sugar crystals wash up on the walls of the pan. <NEXT_STEP> Run your finger through the center making an X to allow the water to seep into the sugar if it hasn t already. <NEXT_STEP> Bring the sugar to a boil over high heat and continue cooking to the softball stage . <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile in a standing mixer fitted with the whip attachment whip the egg whites to soft peaks and hold them on low speed until the sugar is ready. <NEXT_STEP> When the sugar syrup is has reached the softball stage turn the mixer up to high and slowly pour the syrup down the side of the mixer. <NEXT_STEP> Let it continue to whip to cool down. <NEXT_STEP> When it s feeling somewhat cooled but still a little warm start adding the butter a few pieces at a time until you have a smooth whipped butter cream. <NEXT_STEP> Add the almond extract. <NEXT_STEP> Use right away or cover and chill. <NEXT_STEP> Re warm or let sit out to warm up to room temperature to use. <NEXT_STEP> Make the Cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. In a mixer with a whip attachment cream the butter until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sugar and continue to cream. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually add the vanilla and eggs and mix in well. <NEXT_STEP> Sift together the dry ingredients then mix into the butter mixture alternating with the milk. <NEXT_STEP> Pour batter into cupcake paper lined muffin tins filling them 3/4 full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until puffed and firm in the center and light golden brown on top about 20 to 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool. <NEXT_STEP> Decorate and Assemble the Cupcakes Using a small spatula frost the tops of the cooled cup cakes with the buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> Decorate each with a few pearls of fondant. <NEXT_STEP> Tie the cake pull charms to the ends of the ribbons. <NEXT_STEP> Arrange some of the cupcakes on the largest cake stand leaving the center empty for the base of the next cake stand. <NEXT_STEP> Tuck some of the cake pull charms under some of the cupcakes dangling the ribbons off the edge of the cake stand. <NEXT_STEP> Place the next cake stand in the center and repeat. <NEXT_STEP> Make as many tiers as you need. <NEXT_STEP> Finish the top with flowers if you d like. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> The Perfect Yellow Cupcake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> lemon <NEXT_INPUT> zest <NEXT_INPUT> juice <NEXT_INPUT> triple <NEXT_INPUT> strand <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 1/4 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup sliced almonds <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup buttermilk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon finely grated lemon zest <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup plus 1/4 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 large egg whites at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 sticks unsalted butter cut into pieces at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 drops yellow food coloring <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon finely grated lemon zest <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup fresh lemon juice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 lemons <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup sugar <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Make the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and line a muffin pan with 12 cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the flour and almonds in a food processor and pulse until the almonds are finely ground about 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Add the baking powder baking soda and salt and pulse to combine. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the eggs sugar buttermilk vegetable oil and lemon zest and juice in a large bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Add the flour mixture and whisk until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter among the muffin cups filling them three quarters of the way. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted into the centers comes out clean 16 to 18 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool in the pan 5 minutes remove to a rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Make the frosting Combine 2/3 cup sugar and 1/4 cup water in a small saucepan cook over medium high heat until a candy thermometer registers 240 degrees F about 12 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the egg whites in a large bowl with a mixer on medium speed until foamy increase the speed to medium high and beat until soft peaks form 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle in the remaining 1/4 cup sugar and beat until stiff peaks form 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer running slowly pour in the sugar syrup and beat until cool and glossy 8 to 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter a little at a time beating until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the food coloring then add the lemon zest and juice and beat until smooth 2 more minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Make the candied zest Remove the lemon zest with a vegetable peeler and slice into thin strands. <NEXT_STEP> Place in a small saucepan cover with water and bring to a simmer over high heat. <NEXT_STEP> Drain the zest and return it to the saucepan cover with water and repeat 2 more times. <NEXT_STEP> Bring the sugar and 3/4 cup water to a bare simmer in a separate saucepan stirring until the sugar dissolves. <NEXT_STEP> Add the lemon zest strands and cook over low heat 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Drain the zest and arrange in clusters on a parchment lined baking sheet let dry. <NEXT_STEP> Frost the cupcakes and top with the candied lemon zest. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Triple Lemon Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> crab <NEXT_INPUT> high speed until smooth about 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Add the granulated sugar and beat until light and creamy about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the eggs 1 at a time then beat in the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the flour mixture in 3 batches on low speed alternating with the milk in 2 additions then beat on medium high speed until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter among the macaron for the crab claws. <NEXT_STEP> Press 3 licorice pieces under each claw for the crab legs. <NEXT_STEP> Spread a 1/2 to 1 teaspoon dollop of frosting on top to adhere the appendages and sandwich the macaroon back together. <NEXT_STEP> Make sure the claws and legs are stuck into the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Glue 2 small round red gummy candies to the top of each macaron using a little more frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Stick an eye on top of each red gummy candy with a little more frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Press a macaron crab on top of each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> For the beach Spread the turbinado sugar on a serving tray to resemble sand. <NEXT_STEP> Line the rock candy along one edge to resemble the surf. <NEXT_STEP> Stick the crabs in the sand adding the gummy sea creatures to the surf and sand. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Crab Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> rum <NEXT_INPUT> lime <NEXT_INPUT> mojito <NEXT_INPUT> mint <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <INPUT_END> <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cake batter Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a standard muffin pan or cupcake pan with 12 cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the buttermilk and the mint extract in a bowl and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium bowl sift together the flour baking powder and salt and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Using a stand mixer on medium high speed beat the granulated sugar and butter together until pale light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a carefully add the rum and mix until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Add the mint extract and lime zest and mix until combined. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting Using a stand mixer beat the confectioners sugar and butter together until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the rum lime juice and salt and mix on medium high speed until incorporated and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Brush the mojito syrup onto the cupcakes with a pastry brush or drizzle over the cupcakes using a spoon. <NEXT_STEP> Allow the cupcakes to cool completely and absorb the syrup before topping with the frosting. <STEP_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Place an oven rack in the center of the oven and preheat to 350 degrees F. beat the butter in a large bowl until fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the brown sugar and beat until blended. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the eggs one at a time. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in half of the dry ingredients then the applesauce and apple juice. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the remaining dry ingredients. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in the currants and grated carrot. <NEXT_STEP> Drop 1 well rounded tablespoon of batter into each Line a standard muffin pan with 12 cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the flour sugar baking powder salt and eggs into the bowl of an electric stand mixer. <NEXT_STEP> Whip the ingredients for 8 minutes on high speed. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the bowl and add the liquid shortening and milk. <NEXT_STEP> Mix 8 more minutes at medium speed. <NEXT_STEP> Gently fold in the instant espresso granules. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners three quarters full with batter and bake until golden brown and baked through about 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the caramel filling Stir the dulce de leche toffee bits and instant espresso granules together until fully combined. <NEXT_STEP> Place in a pastry bag with a round tip large enough to allow the toffee bits to pass through without becoming lodged. <NEXT_STEP> For the buttercream Bring the sugar and 2 ounces water to a boil in a medium saucepot. <NEXT_STEP> Place the egg whites into the bowl of an electric stand mixer. <NEXT_STEP> When sugar syrup reaches 238 degrees F on a candy thermometer begin whipping the egg whites. <NEXT_STEP> Cook the sugar syrup to 250 degrees F and slowly pour the syrup into the whipped meringue. <NEXT_STEP> Whip on high speed until the meringue cools and stiff peaks are formed. <NEXT_STEP> Mix in the softened butter and coffee extract. <NEXT_STEP> Place into a piping bag fitted with a large star tip. <NEXT_STEP> For the pipettes Bring the sugar and 2 ounces water to a gentle simmer. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat and stir in the instant espresso granules. <NEXT_STEP> Fill 12 chemistry pipettes with the syrup. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Using an apple corer remove the center core of the baked cupcakes and fill with coffee toffee Cuban caramel filling. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe espresso swirl buttercream generously on top of the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle coffee and milk crispies on top of the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Insert 1 Cuban coffee syrup pipette into each cupcake and place a chocolate plaque on top. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Cuban Coffee Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> carrot <NEXT_INPUT> raisin <NEXT_INPUT> walnut <NEXT_INPUT> grated <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 22 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 2 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/3 cups vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 cups grated carrots <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup raisins <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup chopped walnuts <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 pound cream cheese at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 pound unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 pound confectioners sugar <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. cinnamon baking soda and salt. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on low speed add 1/2 of the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients. <NEXT_STEP> Add the grated carrots raisins and walnuts to the remaining flour mix well and add to the batter. <NEXT_STEP> Mix until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> Line muffin pans with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Scoop the batter into 22 muffin cups until each is 3/4 full. cactus <NEXT_INPUT> shade <NEXT_INPUT> frosting <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 decorated cupcakes (plus 6 additional plain cupcakes) <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 1/2 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 stick unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup champagne <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 sticks unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch kosher salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 to 2 tablespoons milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Green and pink gel food coloring as needed <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Graham cracker crumbs for topping <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Gum paste tinted green for topping <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line 18 cups of two 12 cup muffin pans with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Sift together the flour baking powder and salt in a medium bowl set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of stand mixer cream the granulated sugar and butter until fluffy about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time beating well after each addition and scraping down the bowl as needed. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the mixer speed to medium low. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in half of the flour mixture then all of the milk then the remaining flour mixture and finally the champagne. <NEXT_STEP> Mix until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> Using an ice cream scoop fill each muffin cup two thirds full with batter. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until the tops of the cupcakes spring back when gently pressed 18 to 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the pan to a rack and let cool 5 minutes then remove the cupcakes to the rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the buttercream frosting Combine the confectioners sugar butter and salt in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment. <NEXT_STEP> Mix on low speed until mostly incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla increase the speed to medium high and mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Adjust the consistency with milk as desired. <NEXT_STEP> Put 1/2 cup of the frosting in a one small bowl and another 1/2 cup in a second small bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Tint the first bowl a light shade of green and the second bowl a darker shade of green. <NEXT_STEP> Add 1/4 cup of plain frosting to a third small bowl and tint it pink. <NEXT_STEP> Add 1/4 cup of plain frosting to a fourth small bowl and leave it plain. <NEXT_STEP> Add enough of the green food coloring to the remaining plain frosting in the mixer bowl to tint it dark green . <NEXT_STEP> For decorating Frost the top of 12 of the cupcakes with an even layer of the darkest green frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Place the graham cracker crumbs in a small bowl and dip the edges of the cupcake in the crumbs rotating to coat the edges. <NEXT_STEP> Make aloe plants by forming 12 teardrop shaped pieces of green gum paste. <NEXT_STEP> Using scissors snip the pointed end of each teardrop halfway to the bottom in one direction then across in the opposite direction. <NEXT_STEP> Spread the tips gently and place one aloe plant onto each of the frosted cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Fill a pastry bag fitted with a large open star tip with one of the lighter shades of green frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Fit a second pastry bag fitted with a large closed star tip with the other lighter green frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Fill a pastry bag fitted with a small star tip with the pink frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Fill a pastry bag fitted with a small round tip with the white frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe cacti onto the cupcakes using the 2 shades of green frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe cactus flowers with the pink frosting and finish by piping small white dots on the cacti for the needles. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Champagne Cupcakes low and slowly add the powdered sugar vanilla and almond extract. <NEXT_STEP> Once the ingredients are all incorporated turn the mixer to high and beat for 1 additional minute. <STEP_END> coconut palm sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 sticks unsalted butter room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup honey <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon lemon oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon fine sea salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup lemon juice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup grated lemon zest <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces white chocolate chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 16 ounces whipped cream cheese room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 stick unsalted butter room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon lemon oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon fine sea salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 18 edible flowers for garnish <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. For the lavender sugar Put the lavender in a food processor or blender on high speed process until finely ground. <NEXT_STEP> Remove 1 tablespoon of the lavender and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Add the palm sugar to the remaining lavender and process to a very fine powder. <NEXT_STEP> Store in an airtight container until ready to use. <NEXT_STEP> For the cupcakes In a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment cream together the butter honey and 6 tablespoons of the lavender sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Add in the eggs and lemon oil and mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> In a bowl whisk together the flour baking soda sea salt and the 1 tablespoon reserved ground lavender. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on low speed slowly incorporate half of the flour mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Next mix in the lemon juice. <NEXT_STEP> Mix in the remaining flour mixture and then the milk and lemon zest. <NEXT_STEP> Continue mixing until the batter is totally smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Double line 1 1/2 standard nonstick cupcake tins with liners. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the liners with a heaping 1/4 cup of the batter. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cupcakes comes out clean 16 to 18 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the oven and let cool until easy to handle. <NEXT_STEP> While still slightly warm dip the tops of the cupcakes in another 6 tablespoons lavender sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Place on baking sheet and let cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the lemon frosting Melt the white chocolate over a double boiler. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to cool slightly but don t let the chocolate set. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the whip attachment whip together the cream cheese butter lemon oil and sea salt. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly add in the melted white chocolate and mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon the frosting into a pastry bag fitted with a large star tip and refrigerate until set. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the frosting onto the cupcakes and garnish with the edible flowers. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Lemon Lavender Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> graham <NEXT_INPUT> cracker <NEXT_INPUT> cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> crumb <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <INPUT_END> <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup graham cracker crumbs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup unsalted butter melted <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 package cream cheese room temperature electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment beat the butter on medium speed until creamy. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually add the sugar and beat about 3 minutes more or until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> pan or regular size cupcake pan. <NEXT_STEP> Bake 22 minutes for mini cupcakes or 27 minutes for regular size cupcakes or until a cake tester comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes completely before frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the graham cracker crumbs and brown sugar in a small bowl and pour in the melted butter. <NEXT_STEP> Stir until combined and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment beat together the cream cheese and butter on medium speed until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the vanilla extract cinnamon and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the speed to low and add the confectioners sugar until well blended. <NEXT_STEP> Increase the speed to high and beat about 3 minutes more or until light and creamy. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in the graham cracker brown sugar mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Place the icing in pastry bag fitted with a pastry tip. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the icing on the cooled cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Garnish the cupcakes with graham cracker crumbs a piece of cinnamon sugar graham cracker and a sprinkling of cinnamon. <NEXT_STEP> Yield approximately 3 1/2 cups <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Cinnamon Sugar Graham Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Freeze dried chocolate chip ice cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Miniature chocolate chips <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. <NEXT_STEP> Cream on medium high speed until the mixture is light and fluffy about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the bowl and add the egg and banana puree. <NEXT_STEP> Cream for an additional 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the bowl and then add the flour baking powder baking soda cinnamon and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Mix for 30 seconds on low speed. <NEXT_STEP> Add the toffee bits and buttermilk. <NEXT_STEP> Stir on low speed until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the prepared cupcake liners three quarters full with batter and bake until golden brown and baked through about 25 minutes. enough to allow the toffee bits to pass through without becoming lodged. <NEXT_STEP> For the icing In a bowl of an electric mixer fitted with a paddle beat the butter on medium high speed until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the cream cheese and mix on medium high speed until well combined and lump free. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the mixer bowl and add the powdered sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Stir on low speed until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla extract and beat on medium high speed for 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the mixer and stir in the dulce de leche in by hand to create a marbled appearance. <NEXT_STEP> Place in a pastry bag fitted with a large round tip. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Using an apple corer remove the center core of the cupcakes and fill with dulce de leche toffee filling. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the caramel cream cheese icing generously on top of each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Using a paring knife gently poke the freeze dried ice cream to create separated chunks. <NEXT_STEP> Place 4 chunks on top of each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Dredge the outer rim of each cupcake in the miniature chocolate chips. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Banana Toffee Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> fondant <NEXT_INPUT> butterfly <NEXT_INPUT> pair <NEXT_INPUT> licorice <NEXT_INPUT> antenna <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 butterfly cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> Confectioners sugar for dusting <NEXT_INGREDIENT> About 6 ounces yellow tinted fondant <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Black licorice spirals such as Haribo <NEXT_INGREDIENT> About 4 ounces green tinted fondant <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 24 yellow flat round sprinkles <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons multicolored flat round sprinkles <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon semisweet chocolate chips <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 Go To Vanilla Cupcakes link below <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups Cream Cheese Frosting link below <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the wings Dust the work surface lightly with confectioners sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Roll the yellow fondant out to a thickness of 1/8 inch moving the fondant occasionally as you roll to make sure it does not stick. <NEXT_STEP> Cut out 24 hearts with a 2 inch heart cookie cutter. <NEXT_STEP> Arrange the pencils pens or chopsticks on the work surface. <NEXT_STEP> Pair hearts together by overlapping their points by an inch. <NEXT_STEP> With a small brush dab a little water on the overlapping area between the 2 fondant pieces and press gently to adhere. <NEXT_STEP> Drape each pair of wings over a pencil to shape the butterfly. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to dry until stiff about 2 hours. <NEXT_STEP> For the antennae Unroll the licorice and cut into twelve 1 1/4 inch long pieces. <NEXT_STEP> Separate the two strands of each licorice piece leaving them attached at one end. <NEXT_STEP> Roll 2 small balls of green fondant for each pair of antennae and attach the balls to one end of the licorice. <NEXT_STEP> Enclose the remaining fondant in plastic wrap so it does not dry out. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with the remaining pairs of antennae. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside to dry. <NEXT_STEP> For the bodies Shape about 2 teaspoons green fondant into a butterfly body about 2 inches long with a head at one end and the other end tapering to a point. <NEXT_STEP> Attach a pair of antennae by sticking the licorice into the head. <NEXT_STEP> Using a small brush moisten the front of the body with a little water and attach 2 yellow sprinkles for eyes. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble and decorate When the wings are dry turn them over and place between 2 pencils for support. <NEXT_STEP> Brush the center of each with a little water add a body and press gently to adhere. <NEXT_STEP> Brush the wings lightly with water and stick on the multicolored sprinkles to decorate. <NEXT_STEP> Let dry 30 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Melt the chocolate. <NEXT_STEP> Add pupils to the eyes by dipping a skewer into the melted chocolate and making a small dot on each yellow sprinkle. <NEXT_STEP> Frost each cupcake with about 2 tablespoons buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> Top each cupcake with a butterfly and press them gently into the frosting to adhere. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Butterfly Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> lemon <NEXT_INPUT> coconut <NEXT_INPUT> whipped <NEXT_INPUT> olive <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 14 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> One 13.5 ounce can of coconut milk such as Thai Kitchen brand or Whole Foods 365 brand chilled in the refrigerator overnight <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Nonstick cooking spray for spraying the cupcake liners <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup extra virgin olive oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup maple syrup <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons lemon zest plus 1/4 cup lemon juice plus additional zest for garnish <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon lemon extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Fresh berries and mint leaves for garnish <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Fresh berries and mint leaves for garnish <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the coconut whipped cream Chill the bowl and whisk of a stand mixer in the freezer for about 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> If they are not very cold the cream will not whip properly. <NEXT_STEP> Skim the solidified coconut cream from the chilled can of coconut milk and transfer the solids to the bowl of the stand mixer. <NEXT_STEP> Do not include any of the coconut water even if you have to leave behind a little margin of coconut cream . <NEXT_STEP> Add the powdered sugar and whip for a few minutes until the mixture begins to stiffen and turn into whipped cream. <NEXT_STEP> Chill the whipped cream in a covered container in the refrigerator. <NEXT_STEP> It should firm up even more as it sits in the refrigerator for the next few hours or overnight. <NEXT_STEP> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line two 12 cup muffin pans with 14 cupcake liners and spray the liners with cooking spray. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl whisk together the flour baking soda baking powder and salt. <NEXT_STEP> In a separate bowl whisk together the oil maple syrup lemon zest and juice lemon extract and 3/4 cup water. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the wet mixture into the dry mixture and whisk until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> Do not overmix. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners evenly with the batter. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for about 18 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the cupcakes comes out dry with a few crumbs clinging to it. <NEXT_STEP> Rotate halfway through the baking time. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes completely before unmolding. <NEXT_STEP> To serve Top each cupcake with some coconut whipped cream. <NEXT_STEP> Garnish each cupcake with fresh berries mint leaves and/or lemon zest. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Lemon-Olive Oil Cupcakes with Coconut Whipped Cream <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> beat <NEXT_INPUT> speed <NEXT_INPUT> marshmallow <NEXT_INPUT> mixer <NEXT_INPUT> white <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 servings <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 1/2 cups cake flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup milk at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 stick unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large egg whites at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 tablespoons unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/2 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup marshmallow cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Rainbow sprinkles for topping <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 F. Line one 12 cup standard muffin tin with paper cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Sift the flour baking powder and salt together into a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Stir the milk and vanilla together in a small bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the butter on low speed in a large bowl using an electric mixer until smooth about 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually beat in 1/2 cup of the granulated sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Increase the speed to high and beat until light and fluffy scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the mixer speed to low. <NEXT_STEP> Add about one third of the flour mixture and beat until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add half the milk mixture and beat until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat adding flour then milk and then the rest of the flour stopping and scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed. <NEXT_STEP> Increase the mixer speed to medium and beat briefly to make a smooth batter. <NEXT_STEP> Clean the medium bowl and the mixer beaters. <NEXT_STEP> Put the egg whites in the clean medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Whip on high speed with the electric mixer until foamy. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually add the remaining 1/4 cup granulated sugar whites. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the cake batter evenly between the liners. <NEXT_STEP> Clean the large bowl and the mixer beaters. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a tester inserted in the center of the cakes comes out clean rotating the tin about halfway through about 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes on a rack in the tin for 10 minutes and then remove from the tin. <NEXT_STEP> Cool on the rack completely. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the butter and confectioners sugar in the clean large bowl with the electric mixer on medium high speed until light and fluffy scraping the sides of the bowl occasionally 5 to 7 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the marshmallow milk vanilla and salt and beat on low speed until blended. <NEXT_STEP> Increase the mixer speed to high and beat until fluffy and thick 1 to 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe or spread the frosting on the tops of the cupcakes and top with sprinkles. <NEXT_STEP> Copyright 2016 Television Food Network G.P. <NEXT_STEP> All rights reserved. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> White Cupcakes with Marshmallow Frosting <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> fin <NEXT_INPUT> melt <NEXT_INPUT> candy <NEXT_INPUT> shark <NEXT_INPUT> beat <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 cup all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup unsweetened Dutch process cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup boiling water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup sour cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup white candy melts <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 black candy melts <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 sticks salted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Blue gel food coloring <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Make the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 F. Line a 12 cup muffin pan with foil or paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the flour salt baking soda and baking powder in a small bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the cocoa powder and boiling water in a medium bowl and whisk well. <NEXT_STEP> Let stand 5 minutes then whisk in the sour cream and vanilla set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the eggs and granulated sugar in a large bowl with a mixer on medium high speed until light and slightly thickened 2 to 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the speed to medium low beat in the vegetable oil until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the flour mixture in two batches alternating with the cocoa mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Finish mixing with a rubber spatula. <NEXT_STEP> Divide among the prepared muffin cups. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until the tops spring back when pressed 16 to 22 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the pan to a rack and let cool 5 minutes then remove the cupcakes to the rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Make the fins Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the white and black candy melts in a microwave safe bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Microwave in 30 second intervals stirring until melted. <NEXT_STEP> Let the candy melts cool slightly then transfer to a resealable plastic bag. <NEXT_STEP> Snip off a corner and pipe 12 fin shapes 1 1/2 to 2 inches high on the baking sheet. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate until hardened about 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Make the frosting Beat the butter and confectioners sugar in a large bowl with a mixer on medium speed until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla beat on medium high until creamy 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the milk and beat until fluffy about 1 more minute. <NEXT_STEP> Tint with blue gel food coloring until the frosting is swirled. <NEXT_STEP> Spread the frosting on the cupcakes and top each with a candy melt fin. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Shark Fin Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> blueberry <NEXT_INPUT> lemon <NEXT_INPUT> cheese <NEXT_INPUT> <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup unsalted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces cream cheese <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 7 1/2 cups powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon salt <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Fill the cupcake pan with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the granulated sugar and butter until light and fluffy in a standing mixer. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the eggs. <NEXT_STEP> Add the lemon zest and juice and beat until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Sift the flour baking powder baking soda and salt in a separate bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Alternately add the buttermilk and flour mixture to the standing mixer beating well between each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners two thirds full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake the cupcakes until a toothpick inserted comes out clean 18 to 22 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate the cupcakes until they are completely cooled. <NEXT_STEP> For the filling Cook 1/3 cup water 1 cup of the blueberries and granulated sugar over medium heat for 10 minutes stirring frequently. <NEXT_STEP> Once the blueberries begin to burst add the remaining 1 cup blueberries and cook on medium heat 8 to 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> The filling is done when it coats the back of a metal spoon. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting Beat the butter and cream cheese until light and fluffy in a standing mixer. <NEXT_STEP> Add the powdered sugar vanilla and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Beat until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Core the cupcakes using an apple corer. <NEXT_STEP> Fill each cupcake core with the blueberry compote filling and top with the cream cheese frosting. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Lemon Cupcakes with Blueberry Compote Filling and Cream Cheese Frosting <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> raspberry <NEXT_INPUT> rosewater <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> filling <NEXT_INPUT> slit <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 1/3 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 stick unsalted butter melted <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup sour cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups raspberries <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup plus 1 tablespoon water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons cornstarch <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon rosewater <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 large egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 sticks unsalted butter cut into pieces at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 to 1 teaspoon rosewater <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Coarse sugar for decorating <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Make the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a 12 cup muffin pan with liners. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the flour baking powder baking soda and salt in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the melted butter sugar sour cream eggs and vanilla in a large bowl until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add the flour mixture and whisk until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter among the prepared muffin cups filling each about two thirds of the way. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until the tops of the cupcakes are golden and spring back when gently pressed 18 to 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool 5 minutes in the pan then transfer to a rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile make the filling Combine the raspberries 1 cup water and the sugar in a medium saucepan and bring to a boil stirring occasionally. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the heat to a simmer and cook until reduced by half about 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the cornstarch rosewater and 1 tablespoon water in a small bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Add to the raspberries and continue to cook stirring until thickened 2 to 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Strain the sauce through a fine mesh sieve into a bowl pressing on the solids with a rubber spatula. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool about 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile make the frosting Put the sugar and egg whites in the bowl of a stand mixer set the bowl over a saucepan of simmering water . <NEXT_STEP> Whisk until the mixture is warm and the sugar dissolves 3 to 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the bowl to the stand mixer beat with the whisk attachment on medium high speed until stiff glossy peaks form 6 to 8 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Switch to the paddle attachment. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on medium high speed beat in the butter a few pieces at a time making sure the pieces are incorporated before adding more. <NEXT_STEP> Once all the butter is added continue beating until the frosting is smooth 1 to 2 more minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add 3 to 4 tablespoons of the raspberry filling and the rosewater and beat until thick and smooth. <NEXT_STEP> With a paring knife cut a 3/4 inch deep slit across the top of each cupcake nearly edge to edge gently squeeze the sides of the cupcake so the slit opens. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon about 1 teaspoon of the raspberry filling into each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Let stand 5 minutes then spoon the remaining filling into the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Spread the frosting on the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle with coarse sugar. <STEP_END> Line cupcake or muffin pans with 24 cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Sift the flour baking powder and salt and set aside in a bowl. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of electric stand mixer with a paddle attachment cream the butter and granulated sugar together for about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Then scrape down the bowl and add the eggs one at a time. <NEXT_STEP> After adding all the eggs scrape down bowl and add the milk and dry ingredients. <NEXT_STEP> Mix on low until well incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the bowl again and hike up from low speed to medium speed for about 20 seconds and then scrape down the bowl for the last time. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners three quarters full with batter. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 20 to 22 minutes rotating the cupcakes after 12 minutes and bake until the zest until well incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the bowl and mix on low speed. <NEXT_STEP> Then hike up to medium to high speed for about 2 minutes until creamy and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> For the curd Whisk the eggs sugar and key lime juice in a steel bowl and set aside while you prepare a double boiler. <NEXT_STEP> Put a small pot half full with water on the stove over medium to high heat. <NEXT_STEP> Place the steel bowl with the whisked eggs on top of the pot and mix with a spatula until your mixture has become creamy like sour cream 6 to 8 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the mixture and strain getting rid of excess egg particles. <NEXT_STEP> Grab a second steel bowl and dump your egg mixture inside adding your zest and cold butter. <NEXT_STEP> Mix until well incorporated and place in the fridge until it slightly thickens 10 to 15 minutes . <NEXT_STEP> Hollow out the middle of the cooled cupcakes with an apple corer or melon ball scooper and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcakes with the curd. <NEXT_STEP> Put the frosting into a pastry bag and cut 1/2 inch off the tip. <NEXT_STEP> Swirl on the frosting and then edge the sides in pop rock candies. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Key <NEXT_INPUT> gluten <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 2 dozen cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 420 grams All Purpose Gluten Free Flour Mix recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons psyllium husks <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 345 grams unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 egg yolks <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup buttermilk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 400 grams millet flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 300 grams sweet rice flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 300 grams potato starch <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preparing to bake Heat the oven to 375 degrees F. Grease two 12 cup muffin tins. <NEXT_STEP> Combining the dry ingredients Whisk together the flour mix the psyllium baking powder baking soda and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Creaming the butter and sugar Put the butter into the bowl of a stand mixer. <NEXT_STEP> Using the paddle attachment at medium speed whirl the butter and sugar together until they are thoroughly combined creamy and fluffy about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Be sure to scrape down the sides of the bowl with a rubber spatula once in a while. <NEXT_STEP> Combining the wet ingredients Whisk together the eggs egg yolks and vanilla extract. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Finishing the batter With the stand mixer running add the egg mixture one tablespoon at a time to the creamed butter and sugar. <NEXT_STEP> When the entire mixture is incorporated into the butter and sugar mixture add 1/3 of the dry ingredients to the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> When there is no visible sign of flour add 1/2 of the buttermilk. <NEXT_STEP> When that is incorporated repeat this process ending with the dry ingredients. <NEXT_STEP> Baking the cupcakes Using a small ice cream scoop spoon enough cake batter into the prepared muffin tins to fill each one 2/3 of the way. <NEXT_STEP> Put the tin into the oven and bake until the cupcakes are slightly firm to the touch and a toothpick inserted into the cupcakes comes out clean 20 to 30 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Allow the cupcakes to cool in the tins for 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Run a butter knife around the edges of the cupcakes then turn them onto a cooling rack. <NEXT_STEP> Pour all the flours into a large container. <NEXT_STEP> Shake and shake and shake harder until all the flours have become one color. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Gluten-Free Yellow Cupcakes <TITLE_END> and reduce to 1/4 cup. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat and let cool before adding to the buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the butter and cream cheese in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment and whip until light and fluffy scraping the sides and bottom of the bowl once. <NEXT_STEP> Add 3 cups of the powdered sugar and whip until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the beat the egg whites at medium high speed until foamy about 30 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> With the machine running gradually add the remaining 1/4 cup sugar continue to beat until stiff peaks just form 30 to 60 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer to a separate bowl and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Wash the bowl and dry. <NEXT_STEP> Add the flour mixture to the now empty mixing bowl fitted with whisk attachment. <NEXT_STEP> With mixer running at low speed gradually pour in the butter mixture and mix until almost incorporated about 15 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Stop the mixer and scrape the whisk and sides of the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Return the mixer to medium low speed and beat until smooth and fully incorporated 10 to 15 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Using a rubber spatula stir 1/3 of the whites into the batter to lighten and then add the remaining whites and gently fold into the batter until no white streaks remain. <NEXT_STEP> Quickly fold in the reserved raisins. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake molds 7/8 full and bake until just firm about 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool in the pan set on a baking rack for 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the cupcakes from the tins and let cool completely on the racks. loosened 20 to 30 seconds and whisk until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Beat together the sugar and eggs in another medium bowl with an electric mixer until light and foamy about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> While beating gradually pour in the butter and then the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> While mixing slowly add half the dry ingredients and then all of the milk. <NEXT_STEP> Follow with the rest of the dry ingredients taking care not to over mix the batter. <NEXT_STEP> Remove 2 cups of the batter and stir in the grape jelly. <NEXT_STEP> Evenly fill the liners about two thirds full decorating icing with a leaf or ribbon tip to dot bits of green grass poking through the dirt around the graveyard and pumpkins. <NEXT_STEP> To make a border Use 6 pieces of the licorice trimming to fit to make a border around the cake leaving the middle of the front side open. <NEXT_STEP> Bend the seventh piece into an upside down U and stick into 2 cupcakes in the front to make an arched gateway. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Pull-Apart Graveyard Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> peanut <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> beat <NEXT_INPUT> one granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup buttermilk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup creamy peanut butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 cups sifted confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 ounces semisweet chocolate roughly chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup hot strong coffee <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup roasted peanuts chopped <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Line one 12 cup and one 6 cup muffin pan with paper or foil cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Make the cupcakes Sift the cake flour cocoa powder baking soda baking powder and salt together three times. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the butter and sugar with an electric mixer at high speed for 15 seconds until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time beating until each is incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Continue beating until light and fluffy about 6 more minutes. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer at its lowest speed beat in one third of the flour mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the buttermilk and vanilla then another one third of the flour mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the coffee and then the remaining flour mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the muffin cups halfway and bake for 25 minutes or until the centers spring back when lightly pressed. <NEXT_STEP> Set the pans on a rack to cool. <NEXT_STEP> Make the peanut butter filling Beat the butter and peanut butter with an electric mixer at medium speed until blended. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the speed to low and gradually beat in the confectioners sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Increase the speed to high and beat for 3 to 5 minutes until smooth and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon the filling into a pastry bag fitted with a medium plain tip. <NEXT_STEP> Insert the tip into the top of each cooled cupcake and squeeze approximately 1 1/2 tablespoons filling into each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Make the ganache frosting Place the chocolate in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Heat the cream in a small saucepan until scalding. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the cream over the chocolate and let sit 1 minute then whisk until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Let sit 10 minutes until thick but still pourable. <NEXT_STEP> Dunk the tops of the cupcakes into the frosting to coat then place on a rack and sprinkle with the chopped peanuts. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer to the refrigerator for 20 minutes to set. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Peanut Butter Cream-Filled Devil's Food Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 large eggs at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup sour cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Buttercream Icing recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 48 large candy eyes <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 24 gummy candy peaches trimmed into even round circles plus 6 for the ears <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 soft black licorice sticks trimmed into 2 inch pieces <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups mixed color jelly beans <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups mini marshmallows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 sticks unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 pounds confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 to 4 tablespoons milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pink food coloring optional <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line two 12 cup muffin tins with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl whisk to combine the flour baking powder and salt set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment cream the butter and granulated sugar together on medium high speed until light and fluffy scraping the sides of the bowl with a rubber spatula periodically 3 to 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time beating well after each addition followed by the sour cream and vanilla extract mix to combine. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the speed down to low and add the flour mixture and milk in 3 additions starting and ending with the flour. <NEXT_STEP> Use a rubber spatula to scrape down the sides of the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter evenly among the muffin cups filling each about two thirds full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted in the center of a cupcake comes out clean 18 to 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool completely on wire racks then decorate. <NEXT_STEP> To decorate To make a cow frost the cupcakes with white icing. <NEXT_STEP> Place 2 candy eyes in the center of the icing then place a round gummy peach below the eyes. <NEXT_STEP> Use soft black licorice sticks to make ears and 2 jelly beans to make horns at the top of the head. <NEXT_STEP> To make a pig frost the cupcakes with pink icing. <NEXT_STEP> Place 2 candy eyes in the center of the icing then place a round gummy peach below the eyes. <NEXT_STEP> Cut a gummy peach into triangles and use 2 pink pieces for the ears. <NEXT_STEP> To make a sheep frost the cupcakes with white icing. <NEXT_STEP> Place 2 eyes in the center of the icing. <NEXT_STEP> Cut a gummy peach into triangles and use 2 orange pieces for the ears. <NEXT_STEP> Place 1 jelly bean in the center of the cupcake below the eyes to make a nose. <NEXT_STEP> Place mini marshmallows all over the remainder of the icing pressing gently to adhere. <NEXT_STEP> To make a chicken frost the cupcakes with white icing. <NEXT_STEP> Place 2 candy eyes in the center of the icing. <NEXT_STEP> Place a jelly bean below the eyes for the nose and a red jelly bean at the bottom of the cupcake for the wattle. <NEXT_STEP> Place 3 jelly beans in a straight line at the top of the cupcake to make the comb on its head. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment beat the butter on medium speed until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the speed to medium low and add the confectioners sugar about a cup at a time mix until completely combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the milk and vanilla extract and beat until smooth and spreadable. <NEXT_STEP> Place 2 cups icing in a separate bowl and add 2 to 3 drops pink food coloring if using. <NEXT_STEP> Stir to incorporate. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Barnyard Vanilla Cupcakes electric hand mixer. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time beating until each is incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce to a low speed. <NEXT_STEP> Add the flour mixture in incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Put in the refrigerator for 1 to 1 1/2 hours to cool and thicken. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting In a mixing bowl cream the butter and cocoa powder with an electric hand mixer more milk as needed until you reach the desired consistency. <NEXT_STEP> Add the frosting to a piping bag fitted with a large star tip. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble pull out the centers of the cooled cupcake with a cupcake corer. <NEXT_STEP> Fill with the coconut pecan filling. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the frosting onto each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Place a small amount of coconut pecan filling on top for <INPUT_START> mini <NEXT_INPUT> divided <NEXT_INPUT> flavored <NEXT_INPUT> buffet <NEXT_INPUT> corresponding <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 72 mini cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 box white cake mix divided <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 egg whites divided <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 9 tablespoons vegetable oil divided <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup plus 1 tablespoon blueberry juice divided <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup plus 1 tablespoon pineapple juice divided <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup plus 1 tablespoon cherry juice divided <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 sticks butter softened <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces cream cheese softened slightly <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Red blue and yellow food coloring <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 24 fresh blueberries for garnish <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 pieces dried pineapple sliced in half for garnish <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 maraschino cherries stems removed and sliced in half for garnish <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 mini cupcake tins <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 72 mini cupcake papers <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 resealable zip top bags <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Cook s Note If you only have 1 mini cupcake tin it is recommended that you mix up one batch of batter at a time and bake it off individually before mixing the next batter. <NEXT_STEP> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line 3 mini cupcake tins with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Evenly divide the cake mix into 3 medium bowls. <NEXT_STEP> In each bowl add 1 egg white 3 tablespoons oil and 1/3 cup of one of the juices. <NEXT_STEP> Mix each for 2 minutes until the batter is well incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Scoop the batter into muffin cups using a mini ice cream scoop or tablespoon measure filling each a little more than half full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted in the center of a cupcake comes out clean 10 to 12 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the oven. <NEXT_STEP> When cool enough to handle place the cupcakes on a wire rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium bowl beat together the butter with the softened cream cheese until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly add in the powdered sugar until completely incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Evenly divide the frosting between 3 bowls. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of one of the juices to each and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add a couple drops red food coloring to the cherry flavored a couple drops blue food coloring to the blueberry flavored and a couple drops yellow food coloring to the pineapple flavored. <NEXT_STEP> Mix until well combined Place each icing into a resealable bag and snip off 1/4 inch from the bottom corners of each bag. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe each flavored frosting atop its corresponding cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> If the frosting becomes too soft chill in the refrigerator until it firms up enough for piping. <NEXT_STEP> Garnish the top of each cupcake with its corresponding garnish. <STEP_END> flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup warm water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/8 cup vodka <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 stick unsalted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 cups powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup raspberry preserves <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons vodka <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. In a large mixing bowl combine flour sugar cocoa powder baking soda and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Add remaining ingredients . <NEXT_STEP> Beat with electric mixer for 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Stop the mixer and scrape down the sides and bottom of mixing bowl with rubber spatula making sure to incorporate all ingredients. <NEXT_STEP> Add warm water and vodka slowly while mixing for one more minute or until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Line 12 cup cupcake or muffin pan 3/4 full with batter. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until the cupcakes are puffed and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean about 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes completely. <NEXT_STEP> Melt butter and stir in cocoa in a mixing bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Alternately add powdered sugar and milk beating on medium speed to spreading consistency. <NEXT_STEP> Add more milk if needed. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in vanilla extract. <NEXT_STEP> Mix raspberry preserves and vodka to an even consistency. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Core the cupcakes and add raspberry filling to top. <NEXT_STEP> Generously frost each cupcake with pastry bag and cut 1/2 inch off the tip. <NEXT_STEP> Add fresh raspberries to top if desired. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate Vodka Raspberry Rock Star Cupcake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> peanut <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> whip <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> granulated <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 24 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 10 ounces cream cheese at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 ounces peanut butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/4 cups cake flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 cups granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 eggs separated <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/3 cups whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 cups heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Line cupcake pans with cupcake liners . <NEXT_STEP> For the peanut butter filling In the bowl of a stand mixer with a paddle attachment beat the cream cheese and peanut butter until smooth and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the granulated sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the vanilla and eggs scrape down the sides of the bowl and continue to mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> For the chocolate cupcake batter In a medium sized mixing bowl sift together the cake flour cocoa powder baking soda and salt. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer with a paddle attachment cream 1 cup of the granulated sugar with the oil. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly add the vanilla extract and egg yolks to the creamed sugar while mixing and beat until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> In a large mixing bowl using an electric mixer with a whisk attachment whip the egg whites and remaining 1/4 cup granulated sugar until firm peaks form. <NEXT_STEP> Do not over whip. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the stand mixer on the lowest speed. <NEXT_STEP> Add the dry ingredients and milk alternating between the two and scraping down the sides after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Mix on medium for 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Using a rubber spatula gently fold the whipped egg whites into the chocolate batter in three parts. <NEXT_STEP> Scoop one scoop of the chocolate cupcake batter into each cupcake liner. <NEXT_STEP> Top with one scoop of the peanut butter filling. <NEXT_STEP> The liners will be about two thirds full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until the cupcakes are nicely domed and the chocolate bounces back from gentle pressure about 22 minutes the peanut butter filling will not be firm. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the pans and cool. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting In the bowl of a stand mixer with a whisk attachment whip the cream confectioners sugar and vanilla on medium speed until stiff peaks form. <NEXT_STEP> Be careful not to over whip the cream. <NEXT_STEP> Ice the cooled cupcakes with the frosting using a pastry bag fitted with the desired tip. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Peanut Butter Filled Chocolate Cupcake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pineapple <NEXT_INPUT> goat <NEXT_INPUT> strawberry the vanilla extract and vanilla paste. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment cream the butter and sugar about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs 1 at a time <YIELD_START> 24 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 3 cups cake flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups blue cornmeal <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/4 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup blueberry puree <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup buttermilk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 9 ounces unsalted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/4 cups granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 egg yolks <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 ounces blueberry puree <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 ounce lemon juice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 ounces cream cheese <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 pinch salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup bleu cheese crumbles <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces unsalted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 tablespoons blue agave nectar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Large bleu cheese crumbles <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Sugar as needed <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Use a 24 socket cupcake pan and line with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Set the pan aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium bowl whisk together the flour cornmeal baking powder baking soda and salt. <NEXT_STEP> In a liquid measure mix together the blueberry puree and buttermilk. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl of an electric stand mixer using a paddle attachment combine the butter and granulated sugar mixing until blended. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs and egg yolks and beat on low speed until all the ingredients are smooth and blended. <NEXT_STEP> Decrease the speed of the mixer to slow and add one fourth of the dry ingredients. <NEXT_STEP> Mix for 1 minute scraping the sides of the bowl occasionally. <NEXT_STEP> In two separate additions add the liquid mixture to the batter beating for 30 seconds after each addition alternating with the dry ingredients ending with the dry ingredients. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter evenly into the prepared cupcake liners and bake on the center rack until a cake tester inserted into the center of each cake comes out clean 20 to 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cakes in the pans for 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the pans and cool the cakes completely on wire racks about 30 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> For the blueberry caramel Heat together the sugar and 1/4 cup water cooking until a medium caramel stage. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly add the blueberry puree lemon juice and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Continue to cook together until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> For the blue Devonshire cream Mix together the cream cheese with the granulated sugar and salt with the paddle attachment in an electric mixer. <NEXT_STEP> Once thoroughly combined slowly add the heavy cream. <NEXT_STEP> Continue to mix until evenly distributed and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in the bleu cheese crumbles. <NEXT_STEP> For the blue agave icing Mix together the butter powdered sugar and salt with the paddle attachment in an electric mixer. <NEXT_STEP> Once thoroughly combined slowly add the blue agave nectar. <NEXT_STEP> Continue to mix until evenly distributed and smooth. <NEXT_STEP> For the bleu cheese brulee Place the bleu cheese crumbles into the freezer for about 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the freezer and working on a metal surface generously cover with sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Using a blow torch quickly brulee the tops of each bleu cheese crumble. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to come to room temperature. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Core each cupcake and drizzle a teaspoon of the blueberry caramel into the core. <NEXT_STEP> Generously fill each cupcake with the bleu Devonshire cream. <NEXT_STEP> Using a round tip and pastry bag ice each cupcake with blue agave icing encasing the generous amount of Devonshire cream creating a combination of shells on top. <NEXT_STEP> Use blueberry caramel as a drizzle on top of cupcakes and place a bleu cheese brulee as garnish on top. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Blue Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> yellow
