<STEP_START> For the cupcakes Line two 12 cup muffin pans with cupcake liners fill 9 with yellow liners and 15 with blue liners. <NEXT_STEP> Prepare the cupcakes according to the package directions. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer to cooling racks and cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting Color 3 cups of the frosting with blue gel food coloring until sea blue . <NEXT_STEP> Color 2 cups of the frosting with yellow food coloring until pale yellow . <NEXT_STEP> Keep the remaining 1 cup frosting white and transfer to a pastry bag fitted with a medium petal tip. <NEXT_STEP> Arrange the cupcakes in a 4 by 6 grid on a cutting board or a flat square serving platter keeping the yellow liners together to make the sandy beach and the blue liners together to make the water. <NEXT_STEP> There will be 1 yellow liner in the row where the blue and yellow meet keep it to the far left. <NEXT_STEP> With an ice cream scoop scoop balls of blue frosting on the blue lined cupcakes and yellow frosting on the yellow lined cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Smooth the frosting across the cupcakes with an offset spatula so the blue and yellow almost meet the line where they touch should be a gradual diagonal that looks like the shoreline when a wave comes in. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside 6 teddy bears. <NEXT_STEP> Put the rest in a food processor and process to crumbs. <NEXT_STEP> Reserve about 1/4 cup or so of the crumbs to anchor the palm trees later. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle the remainder over the yellow frosting to make sand. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe waves of white frosting along the shoreline where the sand meets the surf. <NEXT_STEP> Break off one end of the pretzel rods to make two 5 inch rods discard the smaller pieces from each rod. <NEXT_STEP> Cut the spearmint leaves in half crosswise and roll them out to flatten slightly. <NEXT_STEP> Press 3 leaf pieces into the broken end of each pretzel rod to resemble palm tree leaves. <NEXT_STEP> . <NEXT_STEP> Press 2 chocolate covered peanuts on top of the leaves to make coconuts. <NEXT_STEP> Stick the trees into the sand in the spaces where the cupcakes meet. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon the remaining graham cracker crumbs around the bottoms of the trees to anchor them. <NEXT_STEP> Add a chocolate covered peanut under each as a dropped coconut. <NEXT_STEP> Cut the sour candy strip into 4 equal pieces. <NEXT_STEP> Arrange on the sand for beach towels and lay a bear on top of each one. <NEXT_STEP> For the surfboards unwrap and flatten the fruit roll up rounds. <NEXT_STEP> Fold each into quarters and press to adhere. <NEXT_STEP> Cut a 2 1/2 inch oval surfboard shape from each. <NEXT_STEP> Cut the black licorice into strips for lines on the surfboards but don t stick them on yet. <NEXT_STEP> Place the surfboards on a piece of parchment and microwave just until warm about 10 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Press on the licorice lines and microwave just until they stick about 5 seconds more. <NEXT_STEP> Press a standing bear on each for a surfer and let cool. <NEXT_STEP> Place the surfing bears on the water. <NEXT_STEP> Place the sharks on the water. <NEXT_STEP> With the remaining white frosting pipe waves in front of the boards and in random spots around the rest of the ocean. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Shark Beach Pull-Apart Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cheesecake <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> ganache <NEXT_INPUT> cook for 1 to 2 minutes until very crisp. <NEXT_STEP> Using a small strainer remove the vegetables and immediately plunge into a bowl of iced water. <NEXT_STEP> Drain and use. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> and salt in a bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the butter in a separate bowl with a electric mixer on medium high speed until smooth 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Add the granulated sugar and beat until light and creamy about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the eggs 1 at a time then beat in the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the flour mixture in 3 batches on low speed alternating with the milk in 2 additions then beat on medium high speed until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> Spread half of the batter in the cake pan and divide the remaining half among the paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until the tops spring back and a tester inserted in the centers comes out clean 20 to 25 minutes for the cupcakes and 30 to 35 minutes for the cake layer. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool 5 minutes in the pans then remove to a baking rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the buttercream Beat the butter in a bowl with an electric mixer on medium high until light about 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Add the confectioners sugar vanilla and salt and beat on low to combine then increase the speed to medium high and beat until light and creamy about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the milk a tablespoon at a time to make a spreadable frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Add the food coloring a drop at a time to make a medium blue color. <NEXT_STEP> Frost the cupcakes with about half of the buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> Halve the cake layer crosswise. <NEXT_STEP> Cut a small V from the middle of the flat side of one piece to make a fish tail. <NEXT_STEP> Frost both layers with the remaining buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> For the decoration Shingle the M Ms on one half of each cupcake to make the fish scales . <NEXT_STEP> Add a candy eyeball to each. <NEXT_STEP> Insert 2 red cinnamon candies on the opposite side from the scales to make fish lips. <NEXT_STEP> Halve 6 of the white gumdrops crosswise then halve those pieces lengthwise to make half moons. <NEXT_STEP> Stick 2 pieces of white gumdrop at the top and bottom of each cupcake for the fins. <NEXT_STEP> Stick a white gumdrop near the top of the cake fish head. <NEXT_STEP> Top with a black M M using a little frosting to make it adhere. <NEXT_STEP> Halve the red gumdrop crosswise. <NEXT_STEP> Halve one piece lengthwise to make half moons and stick to the rounded side of the cake fish head for lips. <NEXT_STEP> Set the head at the left side of your serving tray. <NEXT_STEP> Follow the head with the cupcakes to make the fish body. <NEXT_STEP> Fit the tail on the tray at the end. <NEXT_STEP> Shingle the remaining M Ms on the tail in stripes to make fish scales. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> School-of-Fish Cupcake Cake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> coconut <NEXT_INPUT> pineapple <NEXT_INPUT> mango <NEXT_INPUT> orange <NEXT_INPUT> assembling <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1/2 cup cream of coconut stirred before measuring <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon coconut extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 egg whites lightly beaten <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 egg <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup sweetened shredded coconut coarsely ground in a food processor <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 tablespoons unsalted butter softened and cut into tablespoons <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 cups thick mango juice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 egg yolks <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon cornstarch <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch kosher salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Orange Cream Cheese Icing <NEXT_INGREDIENT> One 8 ounce package cream cheese softened <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 stick butter softened <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 to 3 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon finely grated orange zest <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 thin squares fresh pineapple <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Granulated sugar for sprinkling <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup sweetened flaked coconut <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the coconut cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a 12 cup muffin pan with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk 1/4 cup water the cream of coconut coconut extract vanilla extract egg whites and egg in a large bowl until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Mix the flour shredded coconut granulated sugar baking powder and salt in a large bowl with an electric mixer on low speed until combined about 15 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter 1 tablespoon at a time continuing to beat on low speed until the mixture forms a ball about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Stop the mixer and add half the cream of coconut mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Beat on low speed until the flour mixture is moistened about 15 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Increase the mixer speed to medium and beat until the batter is light and fluffy about 45 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer still running slowly add the remaining cream of coconut mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Stop the mixer and scrape the sides and bottom of the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Beat on medium speed for 30 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the muffin cups two thirds full with batter. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted in centers of cupcakes comes out clean 18 to 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes in the pan for 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer to a cooling rack to cool completely before filling and frosting. <NEXT_STEP> For the mango filling Whisk 1/4 cup juice egg yolks and cornstarch until smooth in a small bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Boil the remaining 1 cup juice granulated sugar and salt over medium high heat in a saucepan. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly add half the hot liquid to the egg yolk mixture whisking constantly. <NEXT_STEP> Add the egg yolk mixture back into the saucepan and reduce the heat to medium. <NEXT_STEP> Cook until the filling thickens and boils stirring constantly. <NEXT_STEP> Strain the filling through a fine mesh sieve. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the filling before assembling the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Yield about 1 1/4 cups. <NEXT_STEP> For the orange cream cheese icing Beat the cream cheese and butter in a large bowl with an electric mixer at medium speed until creamy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the confectioners sugar 1/2 cup at a time to desired consistency. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the bottom and sides of the bowl as necessary. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the orange zest and vanilla extract until fully incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Yield 3 cups. <NEXT_STEP> For the garnish Generously sprinkle the pineapple with sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Use a blow torch to caramelize the pineapple or broil in the oven on low for 1 to 2 minutes watching carefully so the sugar does not burn. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the pineapple before assembling the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Cook the sweetened flaked coconut in a dry saute pan over low heat stirring often until the coconut browns slightly and smells fragrant. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the coconut before assembling the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Dig a small hole inside each of the cupcakes using a teaspoon. <NEXT_STEP> Fill each hole with the mango filing. <NEXT_STEP> Top with the orange cream cheese icing. <NEXT_STEP> Garnish with the caramelized pineapple and toasted coconut. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Tropical Honeymoon Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> amaranth <NEXT_INPUT> tablespoons whipped cream cheese <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons confectioners sugar <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Place rack in center of oven and preheat oven to 350 degrees F. a small bowl and reserve. <NEXT_STEP> Combine butter oil and brown sugar in the bowl of a stand mixer and mix on high speed scraping down sides of bowl until sugar has dissolved and mixture is light in color about 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Add egg and egg white and beat an additional 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Add 1/3 of flour cocoa mixture then 1/3 sour cream buttermilk mixture mixing well after each approximately 10 to 15 seconds until cream cheese is melted but before it begins to bubble. <NEXT_STEP> Add confectioners sugar and stir until sugar is dissolved. <NEXT_STEP> Let mixture cool slightly and transfer to a small plastic bag. <NEXT_STEP> Snip just the very bottom corner of the bag then force icing to bottom of bag. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe a squiggle of icing down the center of each cupcake. until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Spray the muffin tin with pan release and fill the compartments 3/4 of the way. <NEXT_STEP> Bake the cupcakes until the tops are golden and the cupcakes spring back to <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> peach <NEXT_INPUT> meringue <NEXT_INPUT> champagne <NEXT_INPUT> mimosa <NEXT_INPUT> ounce <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 24 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 7 ounces unsalted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 ounces granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 1/2 ounces egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 13 ounces cake flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 ounce baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons peach syrup <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/8 cup buttermilk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 peaches chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 7 ounces granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 1/2 ounces egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon cream of tartar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup Champagne <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the peach mimosa cupcakes Preheat the oven to 275 degrees F on the convection setting. <NEXT_STEP> Line a cupcake pan with 24 cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> In a mixer with a paddle attachment cream the butter on medium for 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually add in the sugar and mix for 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape the bowl and add all of the egg whites and mix for 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the cake flour and baking powder in a medium bowl and whisk. <NEXT_STEP> In another bowl add the peach syrup to the buttermilk. <NEXT_STEP> Add in one third of the dry mixture and then add one third of the buttermilk mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Continue this process until all ingredients are incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in the peaches. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the prepared cupcake pan three quarters full with the cupcake batter. <NEXT_STEP> Then bake until the top springs back to the touch about 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let the cupcakes cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the meringue Bring a small amount of water in a medium double boiler pot to a simmer. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium bowl mix the sugar and egg whites with a whisk until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Place the bowl on top of the double boiler and whisk constantly until the temperature reads 140 degrees F on a candy thermometer. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat and transfer to a mixer. <NEXT_STEP> Mix on high speed with a whisk attachment for 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the cream of tartar. <NEXT_STEP> Mix for 2 more minutes and slowly add in the Champagne until completely combined. <NEXT_STEP> Mix the meringue until it is shiny and stiff peaks form. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Top the cooled cupcakes with the meringue and torch until slightly browned. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Peach Mimosa Cupcakes with Champagne Meringue <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 large egg whites at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup semisweet chocolate chips melted <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon vegetable oil <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes arrange an oven rack in the center of the oven and preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a 24 count mini muffin pan with 1.25 inch diameter paper liners and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium bowl using an electric hand mixer beat the egg yolks vegetable oil 1/3 cup of the sugar cocoa powder vanilla extract cinnamon and salt at high speed until smooth about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Mix in the melted chocolate chips and stir until smooth . <NEXT_STEP> In a separate bowl using an electric hand mixer beat the egg whites at high speed until they hold soft peaks about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> With the machine running gradually add the remaining 1/3 cup sugar and continue to beat chocolate mixture over the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Allow the topping to harden for at least 1 1/2 hours at room temperature before serving. <NEXT_STEP> Store at room temperature in an airtight <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/4 cups granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Dark Chocolate Ganache recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Chocolate Mascarpone Frosting recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces dark chocolate chips <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons butter melted <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces mascarpone cheese <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 stick salted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 cups powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 tablespoons milk plus more if needed <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Line 2 muffin pans with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium bowl sift together the flour cocoa powder baking soda baking powder and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Place the chopped chocolate in a small heat safe bowl and pour the boiling water over it. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk until the chocolate is melted and then let it cool for 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> In a small bowl or large measuring cup combine the buttermilk and vanilla extract. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer with the whisk attachment whisk the eggs on high speed until foamy about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the speed to low and slowly pour in the oil whisking until it is combined about 30 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Next slowly pour in the cooled melted chocolate. <NEXT_STEP> Add the buttermilk mixture and then pour in the granulated sugar and whisk the batter until it is smooth and liquid about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Stop the mixer remove the bowl and add the sifted dry ingredients. <NEXT_STEP> Mix by hand just until the dry ingredients are incorporated lifting and folding in from the bottom center. <NEXT_STEP> Using a rubber spatula scrape down the sides of the bowl and mix again just briefly the batter will look very lumpy but stop mixing. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the batter through a medium mesh sieve into a large bowl to remove any lumps. <NEXT_STEP> Press against the batter in the sieve with the spatula to push through as much batter as possible. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners half full with batter and bake until a wooden toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean 20 to 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the pans to wire racks to cool completely before filling and frosting. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Core the center of each cooled cupcake using an apple corer. <NEXT_STEP> Place the cooled thickened Dark Chocolate Ganache in a pastry bag. <NEXT_STEP> Cut a small bit off the bottom of the bag and fill each cupcake by inserting the tip of the pastry bag into the cored cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Generously frost the top of each cupcake with the Chocolate Mascarpone Frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Place the chocolate chips in a heat safe bowl. <NEXT_STEP> In a small saucepan heat the heavy cream until you see tiny bubbles around the edges. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the heavy cream over the chocolate and leave it alone for 5 to 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter and vanilla extract to the melted chocolate and whisk everything together until it has a smooth consistency. <NEXT_STEP> Let the ganache cool to room temperature the ganache will thicken upon standing. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer with the paddle attachment combine the mascarpone cheese cocoa powder butter and vanilla extract. <NEXT_STEP> Beat on medium speed until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually add 2 cups of the powdered sugar beating well. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the milk. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl and then gradually beat in the remaining powdered sugar. <NEXT_STEP> If necessary beat in additional milk 1 teaspoon at a time to reach desired consistency. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Death by Chocolate Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> Line a 12 cup muffin tin with cupcake liners and lightly coat with cooking spray. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk together the flour baking soda salt and baking powder in a medium bowl set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Bring the cocoa powder milk and 1/2 cup water to a simmer in a small saucepan over medium heat and whisk until the cocoa dissolves into a smooth thicker mixture about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the vanilla and set aside until just slightly warm to the touch. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the butter and sugar on medium high speed with an electric mixer until combined and fluffy about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs and egg yolks one at a time beating to incorporate after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Continue to beat while slowly pouring the cocoa mixture into the bowl just until incorporated scraping down the side of the bowl as needed. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the speed to medium add the flour mixture and beat until just incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Finish stirring by hand to avoid overmixing. <NEXT_STEP> plug the holes back up. <NEXT_STEP> For the glaze Combine the butter chocolate honey and salt in a small microwave safe bowl cover with plastic wrap and poke a hole in it to vent. <NEXT_STEP> glaze and let it set up about 30 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> For the icing Put the filled and glazed cupcakes on a rack set over a baking sheet or piece of parchment. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the confectioners sugar butter and 2 tablespoons water together in a small bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Top each cupcake with a drizzle of icing let harden about 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Put the finished cupcakes in fresh liners. <NEXT_STEP> The cupcakes can be baked filled glazed and iced a day ahead and stored in an airtight container at room temperature. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Cream-Filled Devil's Food Cupcakes vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 stick unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup prepared caramel sauce <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 to 2 Line a standard muffin pan or cupcake pan with 12 cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Mix the coffee extract into the brewed coffee. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside and allow to cool slightly. <NEXT_STEP> In a bowl of a stand mixer sift together the flour granulated sugar brown sugar cocoa baking powder baking soda and salt and mix to combine. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter vanilla and eggs and beat on medium speed until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add half of the coffee and beat for 20 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape the sides of the bowl and add the remaining coffee. <NEXT_STEP> Beat for another 20 seconds until the batter is smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter among the cupcake liners filling them three quarter full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a tester inserted into the centers comes out clean about 18 minutes. dissolved. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the pan from the heat and add the chocolate whisking until the chocolate is melted. <NEXT_STEP> Add the coffee extract and whisk until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter and whisk until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the ganache to a bowl to cool. <NEXT_STEP> For the salted caramel coffee frosting If using the espresso powder mix the espresso powder and the vanilla together in a small bowl until dissolved and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Using a stand mixer with a whisk attachment whip the butter on medium high speed until creamy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the caramel and beat until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the speed to low add half of the confectioners sugar and mix until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Add the rest of the confectioners sugar and mix until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the coffee extract and vanilla and continue to mix at medium high speed until completely incorporated scraping the sides as necessary. <NEXT_STEP> Whip the frosting until fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> If necessary use 1 to 2 tablespoons milk to loosen the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Cut a small and shallow hole in each cupcake and fill with the ganache. <NEXT_STEP> Frost the cupcakes with the salted caramel coffee frosting and sprinkle with a few granules of fleur de sel. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Salted Caramel Mocha Cupcake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> 1/2 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 stick unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon finely grated red grapefruit zest <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 stick unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 drops red food coloring <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon finely grated red grapefruit zest plus segments for topping <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons elderflower liqueur <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Make the candied zest Remove the grapefruit zest with a vegetable peeler and slice into thin strands. <NEXT_STEP> Place in a saucepan cover with water and bring to a simmer. <NEXT_STEP> Drain the zest and return to the saucepan cover with water and repeat 2 more times. <NEXT_STEP> Set the zest aside. <NEXT_STEP> Juice the grapefruit into the saucepan reserving 1 tablespoon for the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Add the liqueur and granulated sugar bring to a simmer over medium high heat stirring to dissolve the sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Add the zest reduce the heat to low and simmer 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove with a slotted spoon set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Reserve the syrup. <NEXT_STEP> Make the cupcakes Preheat the oven speed to medium and add the flour mixture in 3 additions alternating with the milk beginning and ending with the flour mixture beat until the batter just comes together. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter among the muffin cups filling each two thirds of the way. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted into the centers comes out clean 18 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Poke a few holes in each cupcake with a toothpick. <NEXT_STEP> Reheat the grapefruit syrup brush generously over the cupcakes . <NEXT_STEP> Remove the cupcakes to a rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Make the frosting Beat the butter in a large bowl with a mixer on medium high speed until fluffy about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the confectioners sugar food coloring grated grapefruit zest liqueur and the reserved 1 tablespoon grapefruit juice beat until smooth about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Spread the frosting on the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Dip grapefruit segments in the remaining syrup and set on the cupcakes top with the candied zest. another large bowl whisk together the vegetable oil crushed pineapple eggs sugar vanilla extract and carrots. <NEXT_STEP> Then slowly add the flour mixture and beat with an electric hand mixer until them from the muffin tins and let cool completely on wire racks before frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Garnish with crystallized ginger. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl add the cream cheese butter vanilla and ginger. <NEXT_STEP> Blend thee ingredients with an electric hand mixer until a creamy consistency is reached while slowly adding the powdered sugar. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Five Spice Pineapple 1/4 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 large egg <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons mini chocolate chips <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 ounces milk chocolate chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 sticks unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup sweetened condensed milk plus more for topping <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch of <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter among the prepared muffin cups filling each about three quarters of the way sprinkle the mini chocolate chips on top. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until the tops of the cupcakes are chocolate in a microwave safe bowl and microwave in 30 second intervals stirring until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool slightly. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the butter melted chocolate 1/4 cup condensed milk and the salt in a food processor and process until smooth scraping down the sides occasionally. <NEXT_STEP> Add the confectioners sugar and process until smooth about 1 more minute. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer to a bowl and refrigerate until firm but still spreadable about 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Spread the frosting on the cupcakes making a small well in the middle fill each with 1/2 to 3/4 teaspoon condensed milk. <NEXT_STEP> Top with cookies. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Milk-and-Cookies Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> matcha <NEXT_INPUT> tea <NEXT_INPUT> green butter softened <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon kosher salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 72 M M s <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line 24 muffin cups with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> To a medium bowl add the cake mix eggs yogurt flour and 1 cup water. <NEXT_STEP> Using a hand held mixer beat the mixture until completely smooth and fluffy about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove half of the batter to a separate bowl. <NEXT_STEP> To one of the bowls of batter add 1/4 cup of the cocoa powder and continue to mix until combined about a minute more. <NEXT_STEP> Using a 1 tablespoon ice cream scoop scoop 1 heaping tablespoon of the vanilla batter onto one side of all of the muffin cups. <NEXT_STEP> Scoop a heaping tablespoon of the chocolate batter right next to the vanilla scoop so it is half chocolate half vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted in the middle of a cupcake comes out clean about 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool for 5 minutes in the tin and then remove the cupcakes to a wire rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile place the butter confectioners sugar vanilla and salt in a large bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Using a hand held mixer beat the mixture on medium high speed for 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove half of the frosting from the bowl and reserve as vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Fold the remaining 1/2 cup cocoa powder into the remaining half of the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Using a rubber spatula spoon the vanilla frosting into a resealable plastic baggie or a pastry bag. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon the chocolate into a separate bag. <NEXT_STEP> Snip the tips of the bags and pipe the frosting in two spirals on top of the cooled cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Swirl the tops with a spoon. <NEXT_STEP> You should get a little of each flavor on each cupcake Top each cupcake with 3 M M s. Line the cups of two 12 cup muffin tins with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk together the flour baking powder salt and baking soda in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Put the chocolate in a microwave safe bowl and microwave stirring every 30 seconds until melted about 1 1/2 minutes . <NEXT_STEP> Put the granulated sugar brown sugar and butter in the bowl of a stand mixer and beat until light and fluffy about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the melted chocolate and beat to combine. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time beating well after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Add the flour mixture in 3 batches alternating with the milk and beat on low until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter evenly among the cupcake liners about 1/4 cup batter in each. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until the cupcakes are domed slightly and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean about 18 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool completely on a rack. <NEXT_STEP> For the icing Make the icing right before you are ready to frost the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the granulated sugar buttermilk butter baking soda and vanilla in a medium to large heavy bottomed saucepan . <NEXT_STEP> Insert a candy thermometer bring to a boil and boil over medium high heat until the mixture reaches soft ball stage 10 to 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat as it hits the soft ball stage to avoid over caramelizing. <NEXT_STEP> Working very quickly but carefully pour the caramel into the bowl of a stand mixer and beat on medium high speed until cooled to warm about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Working quickly spoon about a tablespoon of the caramel icing onto each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Let stand until set about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Decorate with edible silver dragees. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 tablespoons unsalted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 7 ounces milk chocolate chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 ounces bittersweet chocolate chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 teaspoon fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup malted milk powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup Dutch process cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/3 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 stick unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 large eggs at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 3/4 cups half and half <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups crispy rice cereal <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Make the frosting Sprinkle the sugar evenly in a large skillet and add the corn syrup. <NEXT_STEP> Bring to a boil over medium heat stirring once or twice. <NEXT_STEP> Continue to boil swirling the pan but not stirring until the caramel is amber. <NEXT_STEP> Carefully pour in the heavy cream and add the butter. <NEXT_STEP> Simmer whisking constantly until the caramel is smooth about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Combine both chocolates and the salt in a medium heatproof bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the hot caramel over the chocolate and let stand until melted about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk until smooth and shiny then cover and refrigerate until set at least 4 hours or overnight. <NEXT_STEP> Make the cupcakes Position a rack in the middle of the oven and preheat to 375 degrees F. beating well after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on low speed add the flour mixture in three parts alternating with the half and half in two parts beginning and ending with flour. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter evenly among the prepared cups filling each about three quarters of the way. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted into a cupcake comes out clean 15 to 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool in the pans 10 minutes then transfer the cupcakes to racks to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the chilled frosting with a mixer or whisk until thick about 2 minutes but don t overwhip. <NEXT_STEP> Spread on the cupcakes or transfer to a pastry bag with a star tip and pipe on top. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate until ready to serve then sprinkle with the cereal. <STEP_END> butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup sour cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 sticks unsalted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons light corn syrup <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 tablespoons jarred dulce de leche <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Position an oven rack in the center of the oven and preheat to 350 degrees F. Line a 12 cup muffin tin with paper liners and coat the liners and the top of the tin with cooking spray. <NEXT_STEP> Spread the pecans out on a baking sheet and bake until nicely toasted about 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside 12 nice halves as garnish then pulse the remaining pecans in a food processor until finely ground. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the ground pecans to a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Add the flour baking powder baking soda and salt and whisk to combine set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the butter and granulated sugar in a large bowl with an electric mixer on medium high speed until light and fluffy about 4 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs 1 at a time beating to incorporate after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the side of the bowl once or twice as halfway through. <NEXT_STEP> Let the cupcakes cool in the tin for a few minutes then transfer to a rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium low heat swirling occasionally until the milk solids have turned golden brown and the butter smells toasty about 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the butter into a shallow baking dish and refrigerate until it s solid but still soft enough that your finger leaves an indentation about 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape the cooled butter into a large bowl and beat with an electric mixer on medium high speed until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> While continuing to beat add the corn syrup and beat until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the side of the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Adjust the speed to medium low add the confectioners sugar and salt and beat until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Use right away or keep for up to 2 hours at room temperature in an airtight container. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Divide the frosting evenly among the cupcakes and use a small offset spatula or the back of a spoon to swirl. <NEXT_STEP> Top each cupcake with a teaspoonful of dulce de leche and 1 of the reserved toasted pecans. Beat in the coffee and then the remaining flour. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the sections of the muffin tin 1/2 full and bake for 15 minutes or until the centers spring back when lightly pressed. <NEXT_STEP> Set pan on a rack to cool. <NEXT_STEP> Peanut Butter Buttercream Filling Beat the butter and peanut butter at medium speed in a mixing bowl until blended. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce speed to low and gradually beat in the confectioners sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Increase speed to high and beat for 3 to 5 minutes until smooth and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Fill a pastry bag fitted with a medium plain tip with filling. <NEXT_STEP> Insert tip into each cooled cupcake and squeeze approximately 3 tablespoons of filling into each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Ganache Frosting Place chocolate in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Bring the cream to a scald in a small saucepan. <NEXT_STEP> Pour cream over chocolate and let sit 1 minute then whisk until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Let sit for 10 minutes until thick but still pourable. <NEXT_STEP> Dunk the top half of the cupcakes into the frosting to coat then place on a rack and sprinkle with the chopped peanuts. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer to the refrigerator for 20 minutes to set. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Cream Filled Devil's Food Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> champagne <NEXT_INPUT> white <NEXT_INPUT> italian <NEXT_INPUT> buttercream <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 24 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 4 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 cups white sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 2/3 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup shortening <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup Champagne <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 large egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 cups unsalted butter cubed at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon vanilla extract <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. <NEXT_STEP> Beat on low to medium speed for about 30 seconds or until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> Scraping the bowl constantly beat on medium speed for 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the egg whites and beat for 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners half full with batter and bake until the center springs back when touched about 12 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool before frosting. <NEXT_STEP> For the buttercream Put the egg whites in the large mixing bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment. <NEXT_STEP> Put 1 1/2 cups sugar and 1/2 cup water in a heavy saucepan and bring to a boil over medium to high heat. <NEXT_STEP> Bring to a soft ball stage 4 to 7 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile whip the egg whites at high speed until soft peaks form. <NEXT_STEP> With the motor running gradually add the remaining 1/2 cup sugar continuing to whip until medium peaks form. <NEXT_STEP> When the sugar water reaches 240 degrees F raise the speed to high and gradually add in the sugar water to the egg whites in a thin stream to avoid cooking the egg whites. <NEXT_STEP> Leave the mixer on high for 2 minutes and then reduce the speed to medium until the mixture has cooled to room temperature 5 to 8 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Once cooled add the butter in increments scraping the sides of the bowl with a rubber spatula. <NEXT_STEP> Add in the vanilla and whip. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the antennae. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside to dry. <NEXT_STEP> For the legs Cut more licorice into 2 1/2 inch segments. <NEXT_STEP> Separate the strands from each other to make 72 legs. <NEXT_STEP> Roll 72 small balls of yellow fondant to make a foot for each leg. <NEXT_STEP> Attach a foot to the end of each leg. <NEXT_STEP> Set all the legs aside to dry. <NEXT_STEP> For the bodies Shape about 2 teaspoons of red fondant into a ladybug body the size of a small walnut. <NEXT_STEP> Make a line in the back of the body with a small knife. <NEXT_STEP> Roll a small ball of black fondant about 3/4 inch in diameter for the head. <NEXT_STEP> Attach a pair of antennae by sticking the licorice into the head. <NEXT_STEP> Using a small brush with a little water moisten the front of the head and attach 2 yellow sprinkles for eyes. <NEXT_STEP> Roll enough 1/4 inch balls of black fondant for spots and flatten them slightly. <NEXT_STEP> Moisten the backs of the ladybugs and attach the black spots. <NEXT_STEP> Attach 3 legs to each side of the body by pressing them in. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Attach each head to a body by brushing the surface of the body with a little water and gently pressing the head on to adhere. <NEXT_STEP> Add pupils to the eyes by dipping a skewer into the melted chocolate and making small dots on the yellow sprinkles. <NEXT_STEP> Frost each cupcake with about 2 tablespoons buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> Place the ladybug in the middle and press gently into the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with the remaining elements. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Ladybug Cupcakes <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Crushed lemon drops <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Multicolored jimmies or nonpareils <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Mini white and dark chocolate chips <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Small chocolate candies <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Colored decorating sugars <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Cereals such as corn pops fruit rings or graham cracker cereal squares <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 sticks unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 tablespoons whole milk at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Food coloring such as yellow blue and red or your favorite if desired <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 F. Line two 12 cup standard muffin tins with paper cupcake liners and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a bowl using an electric mixer mix the cake mix 1 1/3 cups water oil and eggs on medium speed until moistened and smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in 3/4 cup chocolate chips. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter evenly among the muffin cups stirring it occasionally to redistribute the chocolate chips. <NEXT_STEP> The batter will nearly fill each liner to the top. <NEXT_STEP> Evenly sprinkle the remaining 1/4 cup chocolate chips over the tops of the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until the cupcakes spring back when lightly touched or a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean about 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer to a rack to cool. <NEXT_STEP> When cool put the White Faux Buttercream out with spoons or until very soft. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile place a large sheet of parchment paper on a work surface. <NEXT_STEP> Using a large sifter sift the confectioners sugar onto the parchment. <NEXT_STEP> This helps prevent clumping and makes the mixing easier. <NEXT_STEP> Lower the speed of the mixer and using the parchment as a funnel pour half the sugar into the bowl and mix slowly until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the milk and mix until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Once combined add the remaining sugar with the vanilla and mix. <NEXT_STEP> Once it is combined turn the mixer speed up and beat the icing until very light and fluffy 3 to 4 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> If desired divide the icing into smaller batches and color with food coloring. <NEXT_STEP> Spread the icing on cooled cupcakes while at room temperature. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate any leftover icing but be sure to let it come back to room temperature before using. <NEXT_STEP> Re whip the icing to make it fluffy again. <NEXT_STEP> Makes 4 cups . <NEXT_STEP> Yield about 8 cups enough for at least 6 dozen cupcakes Prep Time 10 minutes Ease of preparation easy <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Quick Double Chocolate Cupcakes <TITLE_END> strawberries <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup extra dry champagne <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup butter melted <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 cups heavy whipping cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 large marshmallows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cups powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Champagne Simple Syrup recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup extra dry champagne <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup sugar <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line 2 muffin pans with 18 to 19 cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Sift together the flour sugar baking powder and salt in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Place the strawberries in a food processor and process until pureed. <NEXT_STEP> Measure out 1/2 cup of the puree and reserve the extra for the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer with a paddle attachment mix the strawberry puree eggs Champagne butter and vegetable oil on medium speed until incorporated about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the mixer to medium low speed and add the dry ingredients a little bit at a time making sure to scrape down the sides of the bowl if necessary. <NEXT_STEP> Mix until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners 3/4 of the way full and bake until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting In the bowl of a stand mixer with a whisk attachment whip the heavy whipping cream on high speed until soft peaks form about 4 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> While the cream is whipping melt the marshmallows in a heat proof bowl in the microwave on high for 15 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Stir with a rubber spatula and plop the melted marshmallows into the whipping cream once the soft peaks are reached. <NEXT_STEP> Continue to whip until stiff peaks are formed. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the speed to medium and add the sugar and 1/4 cup reserved strawberry puree. <NEXT_STEP> Whip until all the ingredients are incorporated about 30 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble With a pastry brush brush the tops of the cooled cupcakes with the Champagne Simple Syrup. <NEXT_STEP> Place the frosting in a piping bag with a tip of your choice and pipe a large dollop or multiple swirls on the tops of the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium saucepan over medium high heat stir the Champagne and sugar together with a wooden spoon until the sugar has completely dissolved. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the heat to medium and continue to cook until the mixture has reduced to about half and can line the back of the spoon about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to cool slightly. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Pretty in Pink Strawberry Champagne Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> white <NEXT_INPUT> meringue <NEXT_INPUT> hold <NEXT_INPUT> speed <NEXT_INPUT> bowl <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 servings <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 1/2 cups cake flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup milk at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 stick unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large egg whites at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 large egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon lemon juice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch of cream of tartar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch of fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 to 3 drops liquid food coloring <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a 12 cup standard muffin tin with paper cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Sift the flour baking powder and salt into a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Stir the milk and vanilla together in a small bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the butter in a large bowl using an electric mixer on low speed until smooth about 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually beat in 1/2 cup of the sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Increase the speed to high and beat until light and fluffy about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the mixer speed to low. <NEXT_STEP> Add about one third of the flour mixture and beat until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add half the milk mixture and beat until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat adding flour then milk and then the remaining flour stopping and scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed. <NEXT_STEP> Increase the mixer speed to medium and beat briefly to make a smooth batter set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Put the egg whites in a clean bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Whip with an electric mixer on high speed until foamy. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually add the remaining 1/4 cup sugar and continue to beat until the egg whites are glossy and hold stiff peaks about 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Fold one third of the whites into the batter to lighten it and then fold in the remaining whites. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the cake batter evenly between the cups of the prepared muffin tin. <NEXT_STEP> Bake rotating the tin halfway through until a tester inserted in the center of the cakes comes out clean about 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes on a rack in the tin for 10 minutes then remove from the tin and cool completely on the rack. <NEXT_STEP> Bring a few inches of water to a boil in a saucepan. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk together the egg whites sugar lemon juice cream of tartar and salt in a medium heat safe bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Set the bowl over the saucepan making sure the bottom of the bowl does not touch the water. <NEXT_STEP> Continue whisking until the mixture is hot to the touch and the sugar dissolves about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the bowl from the water and whip with an electric mixer at medium high speed until the meringue is cool and holds a soft peak about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add a few drops of desired food coloring to tint the frosting and continue beating until it holds stiff peaks. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon or pipe the frosting decoratively and generously on the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Copyright 2016 Television Food Network G.P. <NEXT_STEP> All rights reserved <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> White Cupcakes with Meringue Frosting speed to medium high and beat until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the orange zest and liqueur beating steadily until mixed. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate the frosting for 30 to 60 minutes to firm. <NEXT_INPUT> interval <NEXT_INPUT> double <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 30 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> One Bowl Chocolate Cake Batter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Cooking spray <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 ounces white chocolate chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 ounces semisweet chocolate chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 8 ounce packages cream cheese at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 sticks unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 1/2 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Make One Bowl chocolate in the microwave in 30 second intervals stirring until smooth then pour into the prepared pan. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate until just beginning to set about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Melt the semisweet chocolate in the microwave in 30 second intervals stirring until smooth then pour over the white chocolate. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate until both layers are firm about 30 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the layered chocolate from the dish and let sit at room temperature 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Using a vegetable peeler shave from the side to create brown and white curls. <NEXT_STEP> Make the water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 tablespoons all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 egg yolks <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 tablespoons unsalted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 24 whole fresh blackberries for garnish <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Line a cupcake or muffin pan with 24 regular size cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Place the oil buttermilk eggs vinegar vanilla and sugar in the bowl of an electric stand mixer and beat with the paddle attachment until thoroughly mixed. <NEXT_STEP> Sift the flour baking soda salt and cocoa powder together and slowly add to the mixer on low speed. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the bowl thoroughly as needed. <NEXT_STEP> Add the food colorings in a steady stream until desired shade is achieved it should appear bluish purple. <NEXT_STEP> Beat for another 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape the bowl one last time and mix for 30 seconds by hand. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners two thirds full with batter and bake until they form a semi hard crust on top about 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Immediately remove the cupcakes from their pan and place on a cooling rack. <NEXT_STEP> For the blackberry curd filling Bring the blackberries and water to a boil in a medium size saucepan. <NEXT_STEP> Turn down the heat to low and simmer until the blackberries are soft and separate easily about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the mixture to a sieve and pass through using a spoon to help mash the blackberries. <NEXT_STEP> Discard the pulp and reserve the juice. <NEXT_STEP> Place the flour and sugar in a clean saucepan and slowly pour in the blackberry juice reserving 2 tablespoons. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk constantly. <NEXT_STEP> When thoroughly combined add the whole eggs and egg yolks whisking and cooking until the mixture thickens. <NEXT_STEP> When the curd has formed after about 7 minutes remove from the heat and stir in the butter. <NEXT_STEP> Cover tightly and place in the refrigerator until fully chilled. <NEXT_STEP> For the cream cheese frosting Beat the cream cheese and butter together in the bowl of an electric stand mixer until pale and creamy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the blackberry juice and lemon zest and continue to beat until the color is even. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the speed to low and slowly begin adding the confectioners sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Keep adding until the frosting has a medium stiff consistency. <NEXT_STEP> You may not require the full 5 cups sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Beat on high speed for a further 2 minutes scraping down the bowl as needed. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Remove the center of each cupcake using an apple corer. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cavity with the blackberry curd until it is level with the top of the cake. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the frosting on top using a plain pastry tip. <NEXT_STEP> Crumble one of the cakes into small pieces and scatter a few crumbles on top of each cake so that it adheres to the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Garnish with a whole fresh blackberry if desired. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Blue Velvet, Blackberry Curd, and Blackberry Lemon Cream Cheese the sides of the bowl one more time and then drizzle in the chocolate. <NEXT_STEP> Pulse until the frosting is creamy about 15 seconds. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Mini Vanilla Bean Yellow Cupcakes with the oven to 350 degrees F. Line two standard muffin pans with 24 cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> For the salted caramel Combine the sugar 1/3 cup water and the corn syrup in a small saucepan. <NEXT_STEP> Stir with a wooden spoon and bring to a simmer over medium heat. <NEXT_STEP> Simmer swirling the pot occasionally until the mixture is a beautiful amber color . <NEXT_STEP> Once the desired color is reached immediately add the butter and stir with a wooden spoon until completely incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat. <NEXT_STEP> Add the heavy cream and stir to incorporate. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the coarse salt. <NEXT_STEP> Pour 1/2 cup of the salted caramel into a small bowl or measuring cup and the remainder into another bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Cool completely stirring occasionally. <NEXT_STEP> For the brittle Butter a small baking sheet and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a small but deep saucepan combine the sugar corn syrup butter and 2 tablespoons water. <NEXT_STEP> Bring to a full boil over high heat and boil until a candy thermometer reaches 280 degrees F. set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the milk and vanilla and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of an electric stand mixer with the paddle attachment cream the butter and sugar at medium speed until light and fluffy about 5 minutes scraping down the sides of the bowl as necessary. <NEXT_STEP> Once incorporated add the eggs one at a time at low speed. <NEXT_STEP> Be sure to incorporate after each addition scraping down the sides of the bowl as necessary. <NEXT_STEP> Do not over beat. <NEXT_STEP> Once incorporated add the flour mixture and the milk mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Alternate with three parts flour and two parts milk being sure to scrape down the sides of the bowl as necessary . <NEXT_STEP> Using a 1/4 cup ice cream scoop fill each cupcake liner with batter. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a completely before filling and frosting. <NEXT_STEP> While the cupcakes are baking make the buttercream Combine the sugar and egg whites in the bowl of a stand mixer. <NEXT_STEP> Place the bowl over simmering water and whisk continuously until the sugar is melted. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat place under the mixer with a whisk attachment and whisk at medium high speed until soft peaks form and it cools to room temperature. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter and beat until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer running slowly beat in the 1/2 cup reserved salted caramel until the mixture is homogenous. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside at cool room temperature until you are ready to frost the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Use a small serrated knife core each cupcake about 1 1/4 inches wide at the top and halfway into the cake. <NEXT_STEP> Fill each with about 1 tablespoon of the remaining salted caramel. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle with about 1/4 teaspoon coarse salt. <NEXT_STEP> Frost each cupcake with a generous amount of caramel Swiss buttercream and garnish with crumbled pecan coconut brittle. <NEXT_STEP> Eat. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Salted Caramel Cupcakes with Pecan Coconut to 325 degrees F and line muffin pans with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Sift the cake flour granulated sugar baking soda and salt into a large bowl. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment combine the buttermilk oil vanilla and eggs. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly add the sifted ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in the orange quarters full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake 17 to 19 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> When cool enough to handle transfer the cupcakes to a sheet pan and place in the fridge while you prepare the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> For vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly add the powdered sugar and beat until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Frost each cupcake with the ricotta cheese frosting. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Cannoli Cupcakes with Ricotta and salt and vanilla extract and stir until blended. <NEXT_STEP> To make Chocolate Ganache Combine the chocolate butter hot espresso and corn syrup in a microwave safe bowl and heat 20 seconds at a time until the chocolate is melted stir until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Drizzle the chilled marshmallow frosted cupcakes with tepid ganache. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate Marshmallow Cupcake <TITLE_END> <TITLE_START> Cardamom Rhubarb Cupcake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pumpkin <NEXT_INPUT> pepitas <NEXT_INPUT> puree <NEXT_INPUT> shimmery <NEXT_INPUT> cheese <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 24 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 2 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon pumpkin pie spice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 pound pumpkin puree <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 ounces cream cheese <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 cups powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup pumpkin puree <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 tablespoons butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup pecans chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup raw pepitas <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons light brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 tablespoons crystallized ginger <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Shimmery blue and chocolate jimmies for sprinkling <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Use a 24 socket cupcake pan and line with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Set the pan aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium bowl whisk together the flour pumpkin pie spice baking powder baking soda and salt. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl of an electric stand mixer using a paddle attachment combine the butter and both sugars mixing until blended. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs and beat on low speed until all the ingredients are smooth and blended. <NEXT_STEP> Decrease the speed of the mixer to slow and add half of the dry ingredients. <NEXT_STEP> Mix for 1 minute scraping the sides of the bowl occasionally. <NEXT_STEP> Add the pumpkin puree to the batter beating for 30 seconds and then add the rest of the dry ingredients. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter evenly into the prepared cupcake liners and bake on the center rack until a cake tester inserted into the center of each cake comes out clean 20 to 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cakes in the pans for 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the pans and cool the cakes completely on wire racks about 30 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> For the pumpkin cream cheese Mix together the cream cheese and butter with the powdered sugar using a paddle attachment in an electric mixer. <NEXT_STEP> Once thoroughly combined add the cinnamon and nutmeg. <NEXT_STEP> Once creamed together well slowly add the pumpkin puree. <NEXT_STEP> Continue to mix until evenly distributed and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> For the crunch topping Melt the butter over medium heat in a small saucepan. <NEXT_STEP> Add the pecans and pepitas and continue to cook until the pepitas pop and are toasted. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle the brown sugar and salt over the topping and continue to cook until glazed. <NEXT_STEP> Add the ginger and toss until even. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Using a round tip and pastry bag ice each cupcake with a thin layer of the pumpkin cream cheese. <NEXT_STEP> Roll into the pepita mixture and ice with more of the pumpkin cream cheese creating a swirl on top. <NEXT_STEP> Use shimmery blue and chocolate jimmies as a roll in topping and garnish with 3 blue men heads on top. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Pumpkin Pepitas Cupcakes <TITLE_END> Line a standard muffin pan or cupcake pan with 12 cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> In a small mixing bowl combine the graham cracker crumbs butter granulated sugar and salt and mix well with a fork. <NEXT_STEP> Drop about 1 tablespoon of the graham cracker mixture into the bottom of each cupcake liner and press down to line the bottom. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the oven but keep the oven on. <NEXT_STEP> For the cake batter In a saucepan melt the butter over medium low heat. <NEXT_STEP> Continue to cook swirling occasionally until the butter turns golden brown and there are little burnt bits at the bottom of the pan. <NEXT_STEP> Skim the foam from the top and pour it into a bowl to stop the cooking. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool to room temperature. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium bowl sift together the flour baking powder cinnamon baking soda and salt and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer with a paddle attachment cream together the brown sugar and browned butter on medium high speed until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the eggs and then scrape down the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Mix in the sweet potato puree and vanilla extract beating until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the mixer speed to low and add in the dry ingredients mixing until just incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter among the cupcake liners with the graham cracker crust filling them three quarters full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a tester inserted into the centers comes out clean about 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Set the pan on a rack to cool. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting In a large mixing bowl beat the cream cheese butter maple syrup and maple extract together until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add the confectioner sugar and beat on low speed until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Increase the speed to high and mix until very light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the salt and mix to incorporate. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Use a piping bag to frost the cooled cupcakes generously. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Sweet Potato Cupcake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> buttermilk <NEXT_INPUT> tartar <NEXT_INPUT> paper <NEXT_INPUT> cold <NEXT_INPUT> let <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 24 servings <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 2 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup unsalted butter slightly softened <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Sift together the flour and baking soda and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a mixer with a whip attachment cream the butter until light and fluffy then add the sugars and continue mixing to cream them together. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs gradually and let them thoroughly mix in. <NEXT_STEP> Then add the melted unsweetened chocolate and mix in well. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla and 1/3 of the buttermilk and mix then add 1/2 of the dry ingredients and mix in well. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat alternating wet and dry ending with wet. <NEXT_STEP> Place un waxed paper cups on a sheet pan and fill them 3/4 full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until firm to the touch on the top of the cupcakes 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Make the frosting Off the heat combine the egg whites cold water sugar and cream of tartar in the cup sour cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Finely grated key lime zest for garnish <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. 1 at a time scraping down the bowl after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla extract key lime zest and juice and mix well. <NEXT_STEP> In a separate bowl sift together the flour baking powder <NEXT_STEP> Fold the coconut into the cupcake batter. <NEXT_STEP> Line a muffin pan with paper liners and fill each liner almost to the top with batter. <NEXT_STEP> A spring loaded 1/4 cup ice cream scoop works great for this and ensures the cupcakes are all the same size. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 25 minutes or until the tops begin to brown and a toothpick comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Remove cupcakes the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment beat the butter until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on low gradually add the powdered sugar until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the salt vanilla extract key lime juice and sour cream and mix until very smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add the melted white chocolate and mix just until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Frost the cupcakes and garnish with a bit of grated key lime zest. <NEXT_STEP> Enjoy A viewer who may not be a professional cook provided this recipe. <NEXT_STEP> The Food Network Kitchens chefs have not tested this recipe and therefore we cannot make representation as to the results. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Key Lime Coconut Cupcakes with White Chocolate Frosting <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 14 tablespoons unsalted butter softened to room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup powdered sugar <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a large mixing bowl cream the shortening butter and sugar until light and fluffy on medium speed add egg yolks 1 at a time beating until all the yellow disappears. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Sift together the flour baking soda and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Add alternately with the buttermilk to the creamed mixture beginning and ending with the flour. <NEXT_STEP> In a small bowl beat the egg whites on high speed until stiff peaks form. <NEXT_STEP> Fold into cake batter. <NEXT_STEP> Fill standard paper lined muffin cups 3/4 full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool in pan for 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer cupcakes to wire rack that has been placed over a baking sheet to cool. <NEXT_STEP> While cupcakes are still warm stir together the evaporated milk sweetened condensed milk and the coconut milk. <NEXT_STEP> Using a meat injector needle inject each cupcake in several different spots with about 1/2 to 3/4 ounce of the mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Or poke several holes in the top of each of the cupcakes with a 1/4 inch wooden skewer. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the milk mixture over each cupcake while they are still warm filling each hole. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate for 2 hours or overnight before icing. <NEXT_STEP> For the Buttercream Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. water into the roasting pan to a depth of about halfway up the pie plate. <NEXT_STEP> Place in oven and bake for 1 hour 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from oven and let cool. <NEXT_STEP> Stir until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Place egg yolks in a medium mixing bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Stir the sugar cornstarch and salt together in a small heavy saucepan. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk in the water first then the dulce de leche and bring to a boil over medium heat. <NEXT_STEP> Boil for 1 minute whisking constantly. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from heat. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually whisk the dulce de leche mixture into the 2 egg yolks. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Strain through a wire mesh strainer into a small bowl and set aside to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the butter on high speed in a large mixing bowl until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the cooled dulce de leche mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the 1 cup powdered sugar until smooth and spreadable. <NEXT_STEP> Frost each cupcake with a generous amount of dulce de leche buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate any remaining buttercream for another use. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle each cupcake with toasted coconut. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Tres <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup cake flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 3.9 ounce box instant vanilla pudding mix <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon potato starch <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon cinnamon <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 stick unsalted butter at room temperature butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Poppy seeds for garnish <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Prepare the cake batter according to the package directions to make cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the lemon zest and poppy seeds pour the batter into cupcake tins and bake according to the package directions. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting Warm the honey in a small saucepan over low heat. <NEXT_STEP> Add the saffron turn off the heat and let sit until the honey is room temperature. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl beat together the cream cheese butter and confectioners sugar with an electric mixer until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer running slowly pour in the cooled honey until fully blended. <NEXT_STEP> Frost the cupcakes with the cream cheese frosting and garnish them with a sprinkle of poppy seeds. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Popping Poppy Seed Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> easter <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> orange <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> frosting <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes, 2 cups frosting <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 2/3 cup white chocolate chips <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons vegetable shortening <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 package cream cheese room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons orange juice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 stick butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 large egg <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 egg yolks <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup sour cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 orange zested <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 orange juiced <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Assorted toppings such as blueberries candy coated chocolate eggs jelly beans rainbow cereal puffs licorice string and chocolate covered graham crackers <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line 3 muffin pans with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Frosting Put the chocolate chips and shortening in a medium microwavable bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Microwave on high stirring halfway between cooking time until the chocolate is melted about 40 to 50 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Stir until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> With an electric mixer on low speed beat the cream cheese in a medium bowl until smooth about 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the melted chocolate orange juice vanilla and salt until blended. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on low speed beat in the confectioners sugar 1/2 cup at a time until smooth about 2 to 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cover with plastic wrap and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Cupcakes Whisk together the flour baking powder and salt in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> With an electric mixer on high speed beat the butter sugar vanilla and salt in a large bowl until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the egg and egg yolks 1 at time beating well after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on medium speed beat in the sour cream zest and juice until blended. <NEXT_STEP> Add the flour mixture on low speed and beat until just blended. <NEXT_STEP> Fill each muffin cup 2/3 full with the batter. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean 17 to 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool in the pan on a rack for 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the cupcakes from the pan and let cool completely on a rack. <NEXT_STEP> With a small metal spatula spread the frosting over the tops of the cooled cupcakes use assorted fruit and candies to decorate the cupcakes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Easter Cupcakes with White Chocolate Frosting <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> peanut <NEXT_INPUT> fashioned <NEXT_INPUT> old <NEXT_INPUT> frosting <NEXT_INPUT> butter <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 1/2 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup butter softened <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 cups cake flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 cups milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup softened <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup creamy peanut butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 cups confectioner s sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup milk plus as needed <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Rainbow sprinkles for garnish <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Fill a 12 count muffin tin with liners and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> With an electric mixer cream together the sugar and butter until fluffy about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time beating well after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Sift the flour baking powder and salt together then add alternately with the milk beginning and ending with flour mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla and mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter evenly among the prepared muffin tin cups filling about three quarters of the way up. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 18 to 20 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Turn out cupcakes onto a cooling rack to cool completely before frosting. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting With an electric mixer beat the butter and peanut butter together until fluffy about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly add 1 1/2 cups of the confectioner s sugar the milk and the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the remaining 1 1/2 cups confectioner s sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Mix in additional milk 1 tablespoon at a time until the frosting is a creamy spreadable consistency. <NEXT_STEP> Generously frost the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Garnish with sprinkles. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Old-Fashioned Cupcakes with Peanut Butter Frosting <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> bacon <NEXT_INPUT> dripping <NEXT_INPUT> bacony <NEXT_INPUT> chive <NEXT_INPUT> pancake <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> Canola oil spray <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 thick cut slices good quality bacon <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 tablespoons chopped fresh chives <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 cups prepared pancake batter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces mascarpone <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons maple syrup <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F. Mix the chives into the pancake batter and pour into the cupcake tins so that they are 3/4 full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 12 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile in a medium bowl add the mascarpone confectioners sugar maple syrup and the reserved bacon drippings. <NEXT_STEP> Stir well to combine and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Crumble the cooked bacon and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the cupcakes from the oven and let cool on a cooling rack about 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Frost each cupcake with the bacon icing and sprinkle with the crumbled bacon. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Bacony Breakfast Cupcake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cajeta <NEXT_INPUT> mexican <NEXT_INPUT> crema <NEXT_INPUT> extra <NEXT_INPUT> world <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 1/2 cups all purpose flour plus extra for dusting pan <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup unsalted butter at room temperature plus extra for greasing pan <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup cajeta <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Mexican Vanilla Buttercream Frosting <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 cups powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons Mexican crema or sour cream plus extra as needed <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
