flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 sticks butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups buttermilk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 10 ounces bittersweet chocolate chips or chunks <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 cups whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup cornstarch <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 large egg yolks <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup peanut butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup heavy cream whipped to soft peaks <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F and line muffin pans with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> In medium bowl combine the bananas and lemon juice. <NEXT_STEP> Sift together the flour baking soda salt and cinnamon. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the eggs and vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Add the buttermilk and flour mixture alternately. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the liners about three quarters of the way full and bake 17 to 19 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> For the filling In a small saucepan heat the heavy cream until it just reaches a boil. <NEXT_STEP> Pour into a medium mixing bowl over the bittersweet chocolate and let sit for 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Stir the mixture and let come to room temperature. <NEXT_STEP> For the pastry cream In medium saucepan over medium heat combine 2 1/2 cups of the milk the sugar and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Cook until all the sugar dissolves and then add the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the remaining 1/2 cup milk with the cornstarch flour and egg yolks. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk some of the hot milk mixture into the egg yolk mixture to be sure to not scramble the eggs. <NEXT_STEP> When tempered add the yolk mixture back to the saucepan. <NEXT_STEP> Keep stirring with a whisk until the mixture is thick enough to coat the back of a wooden spoon. <NEXT_STEP> Strain through a mesh strainer to remove any lumps. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the peanut butter and butter. <NEXT_STEP> Cover the top with plastic wrap and refrigerate until completely cool. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in the whipped cream. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Core out the cupcakes and fill with pastry cream. <NEXT_STEP> Dip the tops of the cupcakes into chocolate ganache. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Banana, Chocolate, Peanut Butter Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cranberry <NEXT_INPUT> cream <NEXT_INPUT> sauce <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> corn <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 15 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 3/4 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 teaspoon kosher salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 tablespoons heavy cream at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup corn kernels thawed if frozen <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 tablespoons sour cream at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup refined coconut oil soft but not melted <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla bean paste or extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup cranberry sauce <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup cream cheese at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 cups powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch kosher salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla bean paste or extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> About 2/3 cup thick cranberry sauce <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Sliced fresh cranberries for decorating <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Fresh rosemary sprigs for decorating <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line two cupcake pans with 15 cupcake liners spacing them out evenly between the two pans. <NEXT_STEP> Sift together the flour and baking powder in a medium bowl then lightly stir in the salt and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the heavy cream and 1/2 cup corn in a food processor and puree until smooth being careful not to overblend so the cream doesn t turn into butter. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sour cream and blend just to combine then set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Cream together the butter coconut oil and granulated sugar in a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment on medium high speed scraping down the sides occasionally with a rubber spatula to make sure everything is incorporated evenly until light and fluffy 3 to 4 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time beating well after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the mixer to medium low and add the dry mixture and corn puree mixture in 3 alternating additions then fold in the remaining 1/2 cup corn kernels with a rubber spatula. <NEXT_STEP> Using an ice cream scoop distribute the batter evenly among the cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 10 minutes then rotate the pans and continue to bake until the cupcakes are thinking about starting to turn brown and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out with a few crumbs on it 6 to 10 minutes more. <NEXT_STEP> If the cupcakes need more time continue to bake and check them frequently . <NEXT_STEP> Let them cool in the pans for 10 minutes then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the buttercream If desired press the cranberry sauce through a fine mesh sieve to get rid of the cranberry skins which will yield a smoother buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> This step is not necessary though. <NEXT_STEP> Beat together the cranberry sauce butter and cream cheese in a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add the powdered sugar salt and vanilla and continue beating until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the heavy cream. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer to a piping bag. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Use an apple corer to extract the centers of the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the thick cranberry sauce to a piping bag or resealable plastic bag with the corner snipped off then pipe it into the centers of the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe a blob of frosting onto the cupcakes and decorate with sliced cranberries and rosemary sprigs. <NEXT_STEP> Enjoy These are best enjoyed within a day or two. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Cranberry Stuffed Cupcakes with Cranberry Cream Cheese Frosting <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> lemon <NEXT_INPUT> meringue <NEXT_INPUT> limoncello <NEXT_INPUT> glaze <NEXT_INPUT> juice <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 3/4 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 3/4 cups granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Finely grated zest of 2 lemons <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup light corn syrup <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/2 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup fresh lemon juice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon limoncello or other lemon flavored liqueur <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 to 7 drops yellow food coloring <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Make the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and line a 12 cup muffin pan with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the flour baking powder baking soda and salt in a bowl until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the eggs granulated sugar milk vegetable oil lemon zest lemon juice and vanilla in a large bowl until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the flour mixture into the egg mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter evenly among the prepared muffin cups filling them to just below the rim. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted into the center of a cupcake comes out clean 25 to 30 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool 15 minutes in the pan then transfer to a rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Make the meringue Beat the egg whites and salt in a large bowl with a mixer on medium speed until foamy about 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Increase the mixer speed to high and gradually beat in 2 tablespoons granulated sugar beat until stiff shiny peaks form about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the remaining 6 tablespoons granulated sugar the corn syrup and 1/4 cup water in a saucepan over medium high heat. <NEXT_STEP> Cook until the mixture registers 245 degrees F on a candy thermometer about 6 minutes remove from the heat. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on medium speed slowly pour the hot sugar syrup into the egg whites increase the speed to high and beat until the meringue is fluffy and cool about 6 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the meringue to a pastry bag fitted with a large round tip and pipe onto the cupcakes set aside at room temperature to firm up about 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile make the glaze Whisk the confectioners sugar lemon juice limoncello and food coloring in a microwave safe bowl until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Microwave 1 minute then whisk again until the sugar dissolves let cool about 5 minutes stirring occasionally. <NEXT_STEP> Dip the meringue covered tops of the cupcakes into the glaze letting the excess drip off. <NEXT_STEP> If the glaze gets too thick microwave 20 seconds. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Lemon Meringue Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> hazelnut <NEXT_INPUT> liquor <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> handsome <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 24 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 1/2 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup hazelnut liquor <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup butter room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup dark brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup buttermilk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups whole hazelnuts <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup hazelnut spread <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 to 4 tablespoons hazelnut liquor <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup flour for coating <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Chocolate Ganache recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup semisweet chocolate chips <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon espresso powder optional <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vegetable oil optional <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line 2 muffin pans with 24 cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Sift together the flour baking powder baking soda and salt in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the hazelnut liquor and cocoa powder together until combined. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer with a paddle attachment cream the butter and sugars together on medium high speed until light and fluffy 2 to 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs 1 at a time until each has been incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Add the buttermilk and vanilla extract and mix until fully combined. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the mixer to low and add the flour and cocoa mixture alternating between the 2 beginning and ending with the flour. <NEXT_STEP> Mix until just combined and no streaks remain. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside while you prepare the filling. <NEXT_STEP> For the filling In the bowl of a food processor grind the hazelnuts until they reach a very fine sand consistency. <NEXT_STEP> Add the hazelnut spread and process until the mixture begins to clump. <NEXT_STEP> Add the hazelnut liquor 1 tablespoon at a time or until the mixture is able to ball easily in your hand. <NEXT_STEP> With your hands form the paste into balls about the size of a very large cherry. <NEXT_STEP> Roll the balls lightly in the flour to absorb any excess liquid. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Fill the cupcake liners about 1/4 of the way full with the cupcake batter. <NEXT_STEP> Place 1 ball of filling in each liner and then cover the filling with the remaining batter so each cupcake is about 3/4 of the way full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes completely. <NEXT_STEP> Dip each cupcake top into the Chocolate Ganache forming an even layer and allow to cool. <NEXT_STEP> In a heat proof bowl microwave the heavy cream on high for 1 to 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> The cream should be very hot to the touch. <NEXT_STEP> While the cream is being heated place the chocolate chips and espresso powder in a medium heat proof bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Once the cream is ready pour it on top of the chocolate chips and whisk until the chocolate is completely melted and the mixture has thickened. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk in the vegetable oil for extra shine. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Tall, Dark, and Handsome Chocolate Hazelnut Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cream <NEXT_INPUT> coffee <NEXT_INPUT> cheese <NEXT_INPUT> stuffed <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 24 servings <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1/2 cup butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups superfine sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup sour cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon instant coffee crystals <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Confectioners sugar as needed <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 ounces cream cheese <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 egg <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup semi sweet chocolate chips <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups hot water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons white vinegar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon instant coffee crystals <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Regular or silver cupcake paper liners <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Make the Fudgy Frosting Melt the butter in a large saucepan. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the sugar cocoa and salt. <NEXT_STEP> In a bowl combine the cream sour cream and coffee. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk into the cocoa mixture and continue heating on low while stirring to dissolve the sugar grains. <NEXT_STEP> The mixture should get hot to the touch but never simmer or boil. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat and stir in the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool until it thickens and becomes spreadable about 3 hours. <NEXT_STEP> If too thin stir in some confectioners sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Make the Filling In a standing mixer fitted with a paddle attachment cream the cream cheese. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sugar egg and vanilla and blend. <NEXT_STEP> Add the chips and mix a few seconds on low to just fold in. <NEXT_STEP> Make the Cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. In a large bowl whisk together the dry ingredients. <NEXT_STEP> In a large measuring cup combine the water oil vinegar instant coffee and vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk it into the dry ingredients until just combined and don t worry if there are a few lumps. <NEXT_STEP> Line 2 muffin tins with cupcake papers and fill each 2/3 full of batter. <NEXT_STEP> Drop a heaping teaspoon of the filling into the center of each. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 30 to 35 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes completely. <NEXT_STEP> Frost the cupcakes with the frosting. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Cream Cheese Stuffed Chocolate Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> meringue <NEXT_INPUT> lemon <NEXT_INPUT> hold <NEXT_INPUT> easter <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 1/2 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup unsalted butter melted <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 large egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon lemon juice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon finely grated lemon zest <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch cream of tartar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 to 2 drops pastel food coloring <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. a small saucepan and cook until the sugar has melted and the mixture thickens slightly. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from heat and infuse for 30 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove ginger just before using. <NEXT_STEP> salt ginger cinnamon and cloves into a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk together the melted butter brown sugar eggs and molasses in a large bowl until blended. <NEXT_STEP> Add some of the water to batter then some of the dry ingredients to the batter. <NEXT_STEP> Continue alternating with the water and flour until everything is added and smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Fill each paper liner with 1/3 cup of the batter about 1/4 inch below the top of the liner. <NEXT_STEP> Place into preheated oven and bake just until the tops feel firm and a toothpick inserted into the center come out clean about 15 to 18 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the oven and brush the tops liberally with some of the ginger syrup. <NEXT_STEP> Allow cupcakes to cool prior to frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Heat 2 tablespoons of butter in large saute pan over high heat. <NEXT_STEP> Add the honey and the mangoes and cook until caramelized and soft. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer to a food processor and process until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Pass mixture through a medium mesh strainer into a bowl. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a wire whip attachment beat the egg yolks at medium high speed until creamy and pale yellow about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> In a nonstick saucepan combine the sugar and corn syrup. <NEXT_STEP> Place over medium high heat and bring to a full rolling boil without stirring and cook until it reaches soft ball stage on a candy thermometer. <NEXT_STEP> Immediately pour the mixture into a buttered measuring cup to halt the cooking. <NEXT_STEP> Add a small amount of the syrup to the beaten egg yolks turn on the mixer to high speed and beat for about 5 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Continue stopping the mixer adding syrup and beating in the same manner until all of the syrup is incorporated and the mixture is cooled completely. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter 1 piece at a time and beat until incorporated before adding the next piece. <NEXT_STEP> When all of the butter has been blended in add the vanilla and slowly add the mango puree. <NEXT_STEP> Continue beating until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Frost each gingerbread cupcake with the caramelized mango buttercream and sprinkle with the candied ginger. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Gingerbread Cupcakes with Caramelized Mango Buttercream <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> banana <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> ganache Italian Meringue Buttercream Frosting recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 egg yolks <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/2 sticks butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 ripe banana pureed <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 pound chocolate chips <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 ounces heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon cream of tartar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 sticks butter cubed <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 tablespoons chocolate ganache <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a cupcake or muffin pan with 24 regular size cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Measure all the ingredients accurately. <NEXT_STEP> Bring all the ingredients to room temperature. <NEXT_STEP> Place the butter in the mixing bowl. <NEXT_STEP> With the paddle attachment beat the butter slowly until it is smooth and creamy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the brown sugar cream the mixture at moderate speed until the mixture is light and fluffy 8 to 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time. <NEXT_STEP> After each addition beat until the eggs are incorporated before adding more. <NEXT_STEP> After the eggs are fully incorporated mix until light and fluffy about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile sift the cake flour baking powder salt baking soda and nutmeg together. <NEXT_STEP> Be sure to scrape down the sides of the bowl to ensure even mixing. <NEXT_STEP> Then add one quarter of the sifted dry ingredients to the butter mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Mix just until blended. <NEXT_STEP> Mix the milk and banana puree. <NEXT_STEP> Add approximately one third of the liquids. <NEXT_STEP> Mix just until blended in. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat until all ingredients are incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners half full with batter and bake until golden and baked through about 35 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes completely. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Cut the center out of each cupcake and fill with the French Banana Buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> Dip the top of the cupcake in the Chocolate Ganache. <NEXT_STEP> Generously frost the top of each cupcake with the Italian Meringue Buttercream Frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the sugar and 1/4 cup water in a saucepan. <NEXT_STEP> Dissolve the sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Boil until it reaches 240 degrees F. While the syrup is boiling bet the yolks with an electric mixer with a wire whip until thick and light. <NEXT_STEP> When the syrup reaches temperature pour it very slowly into the beaten yolks while whipping constantly. <NEXT_STEP> Continue to beat until the mixture is completely cool and the yolks are very thick and light. <NEXT_STEP> Whip in the butter a little at a time adding it just as fast as it s absorbed by the mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the vanilla and banana puree. <NEXT_STEP> If the icing is too soft refrigerate until it is firm enough to spread. <NEXT_STEP> Put the chocolate chips in a heatproof bowl. <NEXT_STEP> In a saucepan heat the heavy cream to a simmer. <NEXT_STEP> Once a simmer is reached pour over the chocolate chips. <NEXT_STEP> Using a whisk whip until smooth and creamy. <NEXT_STEP> Combine 1 cup sugar and 1/2 cup water in a saucepan. <NEXT_STEP> Boil to reach 230 degrees F. Leave it alone. <NEXT_STEP> Cook over medium heat. <NEXT_STEP> While the syrup is boiling using a whip attachment start beating the egg whites and cream of tartar in a mixing bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Once peaks begin to form add the remaining 1/4 cup sugar to make the peaks stiff. <NEXT_STEP> When the syrup reaches temperature slowly pour it into the beaten egg whites while whipping constantly with the mixer on the lowest speed. <NEXT_STEP> Beat on high until cool about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Turn down to medium low speed and add the butter on the sides and scrape. <NEXT_STEP> Turn to high and beat until you have a smooth texture. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla and chocolate ganache. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate Banana Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> hazelnut <NEXT_INPUT> ice <NEXT_INPUT> coconut <NEXT_INPUT> freeze <NEXT_INPUT> cream <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 6 servings <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1/2 cup blanched hazelnuts plus chopped nuts for topping <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup packed sweetened shredded coconut <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup crispy rice cereal <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup sweetened condensed milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Cooking spray for the pan <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 pint coconut or vanilla ice cream slightly softened <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 pints chocolate ice cream <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. white or apple cider vinegar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup pureed sweet potato <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Two 13.5 ounce cans of coconut milk such as Thai Kitchen brand or Whole Foods 365 brand chilled in the refrigerator overnight <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Chocolate shavings for garnish optional <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Ground cinnamon for garnish optional <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line two 12 cup cupcake pans with 14 cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl whisk together the flour sugar cocoa baking soda and salt. <NEXT_STEP> In a separate bowl whisk together the water oil vinegar vanilla and sweet potato until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the wet mixture into the dry mixture and mix until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> Do not overmix. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners about two thirds full with the batter. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center of a cupcake comes out clean with a few crumbs clinging to it. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes completely before frosting. <NEXT_STEP> For the coconut whipped cream Chill the bowl and whisk of a stand mixer in the freezer for about 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> If they are not very cold the cream will not whip properly. <NEXT_STEP> Skim the solidified coconut cream from the chilled can of coconut milk and transfer the solids to the bowl of the stand mixer. <NEXT_STEP> Do not include any of the coconut water even if you have to leave behind a little margin of coconut cream . <NEXT_STEP> Add the powdered sugar and whip for a few minutes until the mixture begins to stiffen and turn into whipped cream. <NEXT_STEP> Chill the whipped cream in a covered container in the refrigerator. <NEXT_STEP> It should firm up even more as it sits in the refrigerator for the next few hours or overnight. <NEXT_STEP> To serve Top each cupcake with whipped cream. <NEXT_STEP> Garnish each cupcake with chocolate shavings or a dash of ground cinnamon. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate Sweet until the garlic is golden about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove and discard the garlic. <NEXT_STEP> Lower the heat to medium and add the basil. <NEXT_STEP> Cook just until the basil wilts then add the wine. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the beef and vegetable bouillon pastes then add the tomatoes and carrots. <NEXT_STEP> Simmer the sauce stirring occasionally until the carrots are soft and the sauce sweet <INGREDIENT_START> 4 eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup hazelnut liqueur such as Frangelico <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 1/3 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 3/4 cups granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup hazelnut meal <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 ounces butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup sour cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 ounces unsalted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 tablespoons torrone flavored paste <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 pound 4 ounces unsalted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup corn syrup <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 10.6 ounces chocolate hazelnut spread such as Nutella <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Use a 24 socket cupcake pan and line with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Set the pan aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium bowl whisk together the eggs and liqueur until blended and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl of an electric stand mixer on low speed gently combine the flour granulated sugar hazelnut meal baking powder baking soda and salt until blended. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter and sour cream and beat on low speed until the dry ingredients are moistened. <NEXT_STEP> Increase the speed to medium and beat for 2 1/2 minutes scraping the sides of the bowl occasionally. <NEXT_STEP> In three separate additions add the egg mixture to the batter beating for 30 seconds after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter evenly into the prepared cupcake liners and bake on the center rack until a cake tester inserted into the center of each cake comes out clean 20 to 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cakes in the pans for 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the pans and cool the cakes completely on wire racks about 30 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> For the torrone filling Mix together the butter and powdered sugar with the paddle attachment in an electric mixer. <NEXT_STEP> Once thoroughly combined add the torrone paste. <NEXT_STEP> Continue to mix until evenly distributed. <NEXT_STEP> For the chocolate hazelnut fudge In a food processor place the powdered sugar cocoa and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Blend to remove any lumps. <NEXT_STEP> Add in the butter and blend until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add the corn syrup. <NEXT_STEP> Process just until combined and then scrape down the sides. <NEXT_STEP> Pulse. <NEXT_STEP> Add the chocolate hazelnut spread and then pulse until completely combined smooth and creamy. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Core each cupcake and then fill with the torrone filling. <NEXT_STEP> Using a round tip and pastry bag ice each cupcake with chocolate hazelnut fudge creating a swirl on top. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate Hazelnut Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> popcorn <NEXT_INPUT> idol <NEXT_INPUT> kernel <NEXT_INPUT> square <NEXT_INPUT> marker <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 24 mini cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> Nonstick oil spray <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/2 cups cake flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 stick butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup vegetable shortening <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 3/4 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 large egg at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 large egg whites at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 ounces white chocolate coarsely chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups half and half <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cups low fat milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 sticks salted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/3 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup cream soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 tablespoons corn syrup <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/8 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 tablespoons oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup popcorn kernels <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons butter optional <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Salt such as grated Himalayan <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 black edible ink markers <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 sheet red fondant paper <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 sheet white fondant paper <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line two 2 dozen mini cupcake pans with paper liners and spray with oil spray. <NEXT_STEP> Sift the flours baking powder baking soda and salt into a bowl and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of an upright mixer fitted with the paddle attachment cream the butter and shortening on medium speed about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sugar and vanilla and beat on medium until fluffy 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the bowl and add the whole egg and egg whites and beat until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the mixer to low. <NEXT_STEP> Add the flour mixture alternating with the water in three additions beginning and ending with the flour mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the bowl then mix on low. <NEXT_STEP> Using a small ice cream scoop fill the prepared pans three quarters of the way full with batter and bake until baked through about 9 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes completely. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside for assembly. <NEXT_STEP> For the buttercream To melt the chocolate place it in a double boiler over simmering water on low heat for 5 to 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Stir occasionally until completely smooth and no pieces of chocolate remain. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat and let cool until lukewarm 5 to 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium heavy bottomed pot whisk the sugar and flour together. <NEXT_STEP> Add the half and half and milk and cook over medium heat whisking occasionally until the mixture comes to a boil and has thickened about 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the mixture to the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment. <NEXT_STEP> Beat on high speed until cool. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the speed to low and add the butter mix until thoroughly incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Increase the speed to medium high and beat until the frosting is light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla and white chocolate and continue mixing until combined. <NEXT_STEP> If the frosting is too soft put the bowl in the refrigerator to chill slightly and then beat until it is the proper consistency. <NEXT_STEP> If the frosting is too firm set the bowl over a pot of simmering water and beat with a wooden spoon until it is the proper consistency. <NEXT_STEP> For the meringue Place the sugar cream soda corn syrup salt and egg whites in the top of a double boiler. <NEXT_STEP> Beat with a handheld electric mixer for 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Place the pan over boiling water being sure that the boiling water does not touch the bottom of the top pan. <NEXT_STEP> Beat constantly on high speed with electric mixer for 7 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> For the popcorn Heat the oil in a 3 quart saucepan on medium high heat. <NEXT_STEP> Put 3 popcorn kernels into the oil and cover the pan. <NEXT_STEP> When the kernels pop add the rest of the popcorn kernels in an even layer. <NEXT_STEP> Cover remove from the heat and count 30 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Return the pan to the heat. <NEXT_STEP> The popcorn should begin popping soon and all at once. <NEXT_STEP> Once the popping starts in earnest gently shake the pan by moving it back and forth over the burner. <NEXT_STEP> Try to keep the lid slightly ajar to let the steam from the popcorn release . <NEXT_STEP> Once the popping slows to several seconds between pops remove the pan from the heat remove the lid and dump the popcorn immediately into a wide bowl. <NEXT_STEP> If you are adding butter you can easily melt the butter in the microwave for 30 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Then toss the popcorn in the butter and add salt to taste. <NEXT_STEP> For the idol envelopes With the edible ink marker print on the white fondant paper the words the winner is in 1 inch squares. <NEXT_STEP> With scissors cut out the squares and reserve to the side for assembly. <NEXT_STEP> Measure the red fondant with a ruler into 1 inch squares trace and cut. <NEXT_STEP> With the marker draw a triangle from the top left corner to the center to the top right corner to give the appearance of a fold in an envelope. <NEXT_STEP> With a moist paper towel wet the back of the red square without the marked fold. <NEXT_STEP> Then stick the white square to the red square with the writing facing out. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Fill each cupcake with the buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> Generously frost the top of each cupcake with Swiss meringue. <NEXT_STEP> Adorn with freshly popped popcorn and an idol envelope. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Matinee Idol Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cranberry <NEXT_INPUT> rosemary <NEXT_INPUT> sugared <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> molasses <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 24 cranberries <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup molasses <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup boiling water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 large egg lightly beaten <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 large egg whites at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 sprigs rosemary <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 sticks unsalted butter cut into cubes at room temperature <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Make the sugared cranberries Put the cranberries in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Bring 1/2 cup sugar and the water to a simmer in a small saucepan over medium high heat cook stirring until the sugar dissolves about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Pour over the cranberries and set aside 1 hour. <NEXT_STEP> Drain the cranberries then toss with the remaining 1/4 cup sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Spread the cranberries and sugar on a baking sheet and set aside to dry rolling occasionally in the sugar to coat 2 to 3 hours. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile make the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a 12 cup muffin pan with liners. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the flour cocoa powder allspice cloves and salt in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the molasses sugar vegetable oil and vanilla in a large bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Dissolve the baking soda in the boiling water in a liquid measuring cup then whisk into the molasses mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk in the flour mixture then the egg until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool 5 minutes in the pan then transfer to a rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Make the frosting Beat the egg whites in a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment on medium high speed until soft peaks form. <NEXT_STEP> Put 1/4 cup sugar on a large plate set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the remaining 1 cup sugar the water and rosemary sprigs in a small saucepan over medium heat cook stirring until the sugar dissolves. <NEXT_STEP> Increase the heat to medium high and bring to a boil. <NEXT_STEP> Cook until the syrup registers 235 degrees F on a candy thermometer about 5 minutes remove from the heat. <NEXT_STEP> Working quickly remove the rosemary with tongs and transfer to the plate with the sugar toss to coat then set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the mixer on high and slowly drizzle the hot syrup into the bowl with the egg whites aiming the syrup between the side of the bowl and the beater. <NEXT_STEP> Continue beating until both the bowl and the mixture are cool to the touch 12 to 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Switch to the paddle attachment and beat in the butter on medium speed 1 piece at a time until the frosting is smooth and thick. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the frosting to a piping bag fitted with a large round tip pipe onto the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Top each with a few candied rosemary needles and 2 sugared cranberries. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Spice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup sugar <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the chocolate cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line the cupcake pans with 24 liners. <NEXT_STEP> Bring a small pot of water to a boil. <NEXT_STEP> In a large mixing bowl of a stand mixer whisk together the flour sugar cocoa powder baking powder baking soda and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Add the milk butter vanilla extract and eggs and mix for 2 minutes on medium speed. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk in 1 cup boiling water last. <NEXT_STEP> Batter will be very thin. <NEXT_STEP> Pour evenly into the prepared cupcake pans until about two thirds full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted into the middle of the cupcake comes out clean 18 to 21 minutes. and stir to combine. <NEXT_STEP> Heat over medium high heat. <NEXT_STEP> Continue to stir to avoid burning. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the beer and sugar until it begins to thicken slightly and resemble syrup 5 to 7 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat and set aside to cool completely. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Celebratory Chocolate Beer Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> banana <NEXT_INPUT> nutella <NEXT_INPUT> hazelnut <NEXT_INPUT> praline <NEXT_INPUT> buttercream <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 cup hazelnuts peeled and chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons corn syrup <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup banana chips crushed <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon kosher salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 large not overripe bananas <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 cups canola or grapeseed oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups all purpose flour sifted <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon kosher salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 large eggs beaten <NEXT_INGREDIENT> French Buttercream recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup Nutella <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup Dutch process cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons corn syrup <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon cream of tartar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 egg yolks <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 whole egg <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/8 teaspoon xanthan gum <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 pounds cold butter <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Banana Hazelnut Praline Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a large heavy skillet over medium heat toast the hazelnuts until fragrant about 4 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Immediately remove from the pan onto a dish wipe the pan clean with a dry towel. <NEXT_STEP> Place the water granulated sugar and corn syrup in the pan stir to combine and return to the stove. <NEXT_STEP> Increase the heat to medium high. <NEXT_STEP> Cook without stirring until the sugar begins to turn a golden caramel. <NEXT_STEP> Immediately turn the heat to low and add the hazelnuts banana chips and salt and stir to coat. <NEXT_STEP> Spread the praline on the parchment lined baking sheet to cool. <NEXT_STEP> When cool break the praline into pieces with your hands or pulse into small pieces in a food processor. <NEXT_STEP> Banana Cake Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line cupcake pans with 24 baking cups. <NEXT_STEP> In a stand mixer with the paddle attachment combine the bananas granulated sugar and brown sugar and mix on medium low until well combined about 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer running slowly pour in the oil and vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Continue mixing until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Stop the mixer remove the bowl and paddle and use the paddle to scrape the inside of the bowl making sure everything is fully incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Sift together the flour baking powder baking soda salt cinnamon and nutmeg and add to the batter. <NEXT_STEP> Reattach the bowl and paddle to the mixer and mix on medium until just combined then add the eggs and continue mixing until the batter is smooth about 10 to 20 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the bowl and paddle from the mixer and once again use the paddle to scrape the bottom and sides of the bowl ensuring that everything is well mixed. <NEXT_STEP> Scoop the batter into the prepared baking cups filling them 2/3 of the way. <NEXT_STEP> Bake in the middle of the oven for 20 to 25 minutes rotating the pan halfway through. <NEXT_STEP> The cupcakes are done once the centers spring back when you touch them. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the cupcakes from the oven and let cool completely while you make the buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> Nutella Buttercream For French Buttercream Prepare the recipe as directed below. <NEXT_STEP> Once the butter is added add the Nutella and cocoa powder and mix on high to combine. <NEXT_STEP> Assembly Fill a pastry bag fitted with a fluted tip with the Nutella buttercream and pipe onto each banana cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Place pieces of banana hazelnut praline on the top of each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Shortcut Skip the praline. <NEXT_STEP> If you still want a crunchy top you can sprinkle some crushed banana chips roasted hazelnuts or a mixture of the two on top. <NEXT_STEP> This is it the star of the show the main event the most important part of our cupcakes buttercream As this is French buttercream this is tres tres serious. <NEXT_STEP> You will pay attention follow along and execute these directions C est serieux Now let s do this In a heavy nonreactive saucepan add water sugar corn syrup and cream of tartar. <NEXT_STEP> The last two help keep the sugar from crystallizing. <NEXT_STEP> Put the pan on high heat. <NEXT_STEP> It s going to be there for a while. <NEXT_STEP> Be patient and keep your eye on it. <NEXT_STEP> Don t go walking away and watch TV or something. <NEXT_STEP> Put yolks and egg in a stand mixer with the whisk attachment and turn to high. <NEXT_STEP> Just let it go Eggs will triple in volume and go to the ribbon stage. <NEXT_STEP> You can t overwhip Wait on the sugar you re looking for 235 degrees F aka soft ball stage. <NEXT_STEP> When it happens be ready to move quickly. <NEXT_STEP> Turn off the mixer and add xanthan gum then turn back on to medium speed. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the thermometer from hot sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Lift pan with two hands. <NEXT_STEP> Rest the lip of the saucepan on the edge of the mixer bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly tilt and pour sugar in a sloooow steady stream down the side of the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Don t go too fast If you do there will be chunks of scrambled eggs in your buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> Once sugar is all in turn the mixer to high. <NEXT_STEP> Beat til cool. <NEXT_STEP> Gauge this by putting the inside of your wrist on the outside of the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> It s more accurate than your hands. <NEXT_STEP> Switch out the whisk for the paddle. <NEXT_STEP> Next we re adding the butter. <NEXT_STEP> It s too heavy for the whisk and you ll end up breaking your stand mixer if you stay with the whisk. <NEXT_STEP> Start cutting the butter into thin pieces you could shave it with a cheese slicer if you d like. <NEXT_STEP> Add butter piece by piece pain in the derriere yes but we re making an emulsion. <NEXT_STEP> See if you dump all the butter in at once the butter and eggs will never combine properly and you ll have a broken buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> You ll be able to identify this easily it ll be a chunky watery hot mess. <NEXT_STEP> If your buttercream does break you can fix it Turn to medium high then add a little more butter piece by piece til fixed. <NEXT_STEP> Or try adding a little guar gum This is very strong so only add a pinch and beat for a minute then check. <NEXT_STEP> Once your butter is added turn the mixer to medium high to add some air 10 or 20 seconds at most. <NEXT_STEP> Quelle magnifique It should be fluffy and make you want to eat it with your fingers. <NEXT_STEP> Once you have your base there are so many ways to flavor it Coffee powder Vanilla beans Dutch cocoa Peanut butter Caramel Ham Congratulations You did it You made French buttercream <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Banana Nutella Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> caramel <NEXT_INPUT> pot <NEXT_INPUT> heat <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> increment <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 1/4 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 tablespoons unsalted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon instant espresso <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup buttermilk at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 whole eggs at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup chopped chocolate <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon coffee liqueur optional <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Salted Caramel Buttercream recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 pinch sea salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 sticks unsalted butter <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 345 degrees F. Line a cupcake pan with liners. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the sugar flour cocoa powder baking powder and baking soda in a bowl. <NEXT_STEP> In a small pot over low heat warm up 1 cup water the butter and espresso. <NEXT_STEP> Do not boil Just melt the butter. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside to cool. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the buttermilk eggs and coffee mixture in a second bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the wet ingredients with the dry ingredients and mix with a whisk until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Scoop the batter into the cupcake liners and bake for 10 to 12 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Check for doneness by inserting a toothpick into the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> If it comes out clean they are done. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to cool. <NEXT_STEP> For the ganache In a small pot over low heat mix the chocolate and cream until combined and smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Take off the heat. <NEXT_STEP> Add the coffee liqueur if using and mix. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Using a apple corer or a small spoon scoop a small well halfway through in the center of the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon 1 teaspoon of the ganache into the well as well as brush some over the top of the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Fill a pastry bag with piping tip of your choice with Salted Caramel Buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the buttercream directly on top of the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Garnish as you please. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly heat the cream in a small pot over low heat. <NEXT_STEP> While heating up the cream in another pot over medium heat add one third of the sugar and the salt and mix with a wooden spoon until liquid. <NEXT_STEP> Continue to add the remainder of the sugar in one third increments. <NEXT_STEP> Once all the sugar is dissolved continue to mix the caramel until it reaches a slightly darker brown color. <NEXT_STEP> Turn off the heat and add the hot cream very slowly in increments while stirring. <NEXT_STEP> Be very careful to not burn yourself Caramel is ready once the cream and caramel are smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer to a bowl for cooling. <NEXT_STEP> Allow 1 hour to cool at room temperature. <NEXT_STEP> Add the cooled caramel mixture to a mixing bowl and with a paddle attachment on medium speed add the butter in increments. <NEXT_STEP> Once the buttercream is smooth it is ready to be used. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate Salted Caramel Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> tree <NEXT_INPUT> malted <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 cup 2 tbsp raw sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup hot brewed espresso <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tbsp rum <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 eggs at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 tsp sea salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup unsalted butter melted <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups mascarpone cheese <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup icing sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 oz 70 per cent dark chocolate shaved <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> ESPRESSO GLAZE Add 2 tablespoons of raw sugar to the hot espresso and stir to dissolve. <NEXT_STEP> Add 1 tablespoon of rum and mix. <NEXT_STEP> Cover and refrigerate until cool. <NEXT_STEP> CUPCAKE MIXTURE Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and position a rack in the center of the oven. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl beat the eggs with a hand mixer until they re foamy. <NEXT_STEP> Continue to beat the eggs while adding 1 cup of raw sugar in a slow and steady stream. <NEXT_STEP> Add 1 tablespoon of rum and continuously beat the egg mixture for 6 minutes until pale and shiny. <NEXT_STEP> In another large bowl use a wire mesh sieve to sift together the all purpose flour and sea salt. <NEXT_STEP> Fold one third of the fl our mixture into the egg mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat two more times until all the flour is incorporated into the egg mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Delicately fold in the melted unsalted butter. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter equally among 12 lined muffin cups. <NEXT_STEP> Cook for 15 to 20 minutes or until the cupcakes are slightly golden around the edges and an inserted toothpick comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the cupcakes from the oven and cool them on a rack. <NEXT_STEP> When the cupcakes have cooled slightly brush each one generously with the espresso glaze. <NEXT_STEP> ESPRESSO MASCARPONE ICING In a medium sized bowl combine the mascarpone icing sugar and the rest of the espresso glaze. <NEXT_STEP> Beat with a hand mixer until the icing is stiff. <NEXT_STEP> Using a pastry bag with a round nozzle ice each cupcake with about 1/4 cup of the icing. <NEXT_STEP> Garnish each cupcake with 1 teaspoon of shaved dark chocolate. <NEXT_STEP> Place in the fridge for 1 hour to set. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Tiramisu Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> lollipop <NEXT_INPUT> drop <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> stick <NEXT_INPUT> bag <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 24 mini cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 3/4 cup all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/8 teaspoon fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 tablespoons unsalted butter softened <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 large egg at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup whole milk at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 sticks unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 cups confectioners sugar sifted <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 to 2 tablespoons whole milk at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 drops bright yellow gel food coloring <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 to 5 drops leaf green gel food coloring <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 to 5 drops sky blue gel food coloring <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 to 3 drops violet gel food coloring <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 drops neon pink gel food coloring <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 24 spice drops or gumdrops <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line two 12 cup mini muffin pans with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the flour baking powder and salt together in a small bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the butter and granulated sugar together in a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment on medium high speed until light and fluffy scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed about 4 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the egg scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the speed to medium low beat in half the flour mixture then all of the milk then the remaining flour mixture until just combined scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter evenly among the muffin cups filling each about three quarters full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted in the center of the cupcakes comes out clean 10 to 12 minutes rotating the pans halfway through the baking time. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the pans to a cooling rack and cool for 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the cupcakes from the pans and let them cool completely on the rack. <NEXT_STEP> For the buttercream Combine the butter confectioners sugar and salt in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment. <NEXT_STEP> Mix on low speed until smooth about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla and increase the speed to medium high. <NEXT_STEP> Mix until light and fluffy scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed about 2 minutes more. <NEXT_STEP> Add 1 tablespoon of milk and mix to combine. <NEXT_STEP> Add more milk a 1/2 tablespoon at a time until the buttercream is firm but spreadable. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the buttercream evenly among 5 bowls about a heaping 1/3 cup in each. <NEXT_STEP> Add the yellow gel food coloring to one bowl and mix until no streaks remain. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with the remaining bowls of buttercream and the green blue violet and pink food colors. <NEXT_STEP> Scoop each color into a separate disposable piping bag with no tip then snip off the tip of each bag so there is a hole about the size of a penny. <NEXT_STEP> Prepare a sixth piping bag fitted with a medium sized round piping tip this will be your decorating bag. <NEXT_STEP> Holding the decorating bag in one hand and the yellow buttercream bag in the other pipe the yellow buttercream into the decorating bag making in a vertical stripe about 1 inch thick. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with the remaining colors working around the edge of the decorating bag to create stripes of each color and leaving at least 5 inches at the top so you can seal the bag. <NEXT_STEP> Be sure not to overfill the bag you can repeat piping in the colored stripes if necessary. <NEXT_STEP> Once the cupcakes are completely cool attach them to the lollipop sticks by poking small holes just big enough to fit a lollipop sticks in the bottom of each cupcake with the tip of a paring knife poking through the paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Slice 1/8 inch off the bottom of each spice drop with a paring knife. <NEXT_STEP> Insert a lollipop stick through the domed top of a spice drops and slide it down so there is about 3/4 inch of the stick above the spice drop. <NEXT_STEP> This is where the cupcake will sit. <NEXT_STEP> Next poke the lollipop stick into the hole in the bottom of a cupcake and slide the bottom of the cupcake down so it rests on the flat sticky side of the spice drop. <NEXT_STEP> The lollipop stick should not poke through the top of the cupcake if the cupcake seems wobbly slide the gumdrop down a bit further and press the cupcake onto the stick a bit more. <NEXT_STEP> Anchor the assembled lollipop cupcakes in a Styrofoam board or stick them in tall containers filled with sugar or sprinkles. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with the remaining lollipop sticks spice drops and cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Holding a cupcake in one hand and the decorating bag in the other starting in the center of the cupcake pipe the frosting in a swirl over the top of the cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Stick the frosted cupcake back into the Styrofoam to hold it upright. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with the remaining cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Serve immediately or refrigerate for up to 2 days remove from the refrigerator 1 hour before serving. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Cupcake Lollipops <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> lavender <NEXT_INPUT> purple <NEXT_INPUT> feather and eggs in a small bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the hot cocoa mixture into the dry ingredients. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the sour cream mixture just to combine . <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter evenly in the on a rack in the tin for 10 minutes and then remove from the tin. <NEXT_STEP> Cool on the rack completely. <NEXT_STEP> Decorate as desired. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Gluten-Free Chocolate Cupcakes butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup light brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 16 ounces unsalted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 tablespoons Cider Caramel Reduction <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 16 ounces marshmallow creme <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup pecans coarsely chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons salted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon salt <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line regular sized cupcake pans with 24 liners. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the butter and sugar at medium speed with an electric mixer fitted with a whisk attachment until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs 1 at a time beating after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> In a food processor combine the sweet potatoes apple cider and vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Blend until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Put aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a bowl combine flour with remaining dry ingredients. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk until blended. <NEXT_STEP> Add the flour mixture to the sugar mixture alternating with the sweet potato mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Beat at low speed just until blended after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners three quarters full with batter. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until golden brown 22 to 24 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the pan immediately. <NEXT_STEP> Cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the cider reduction In a medium saucepan bring the cider to a boil add the vanilla bean and cook until the cider reduces to about 2 cups 20 to 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter and sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Cook until the cider reduces to about 1 1/2 cups stirring occasionally about 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the mixture to glass bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Cover. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate for at least 3 hours or until reduction is cooled completely. <NEXT_STEP> Can be made up to 3 days in advance. <NEXT_STEP> Reserve half for the Marshmallow Cream Frosting and half for assembling the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> For the marshmallow frosting In a mixer fitted with a paddle attachment beat the butter until smooth and creamy scraping down the bowl occasionally about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the Caramel Cider Reduction and beat until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the bowl from the mixer and fold in the marshmallow creme until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> For the pecans Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. plastic wrap to avoid a skin from forming. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate until chilled and firm about 30 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> For the cupcakes Set racks on the upper and lower thirds of the oven and preheat to 350 degrees F. form. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Use a small spoon to make a shallow indentation in the center of each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Fill each indentation with 1 teaspoon of the lemon curd. <NEXT_STEP> Use a spatula or piping bag to swirl a generous dollop of frosting over the top of each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Decorate with sprinkles or sanding sugar. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Lemon Angel Food Cupcakes with <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Raspberry Creme Fraiche Filling recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> French Chocolate Mousse recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Gold leaf flakes for garnish <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 3/4 cups port wine <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/8 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup creme fraiche <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup seedless raspberry preserves <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 ounces chocolate chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 tablespoons unsalted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon cream of tartar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup heavy cream COLD <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Line cupcake tins with 24 cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk together the buttermilk oil vanilla and eggs. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the sugar flour cocoa powder baking soda baking powder and salt and add into the wet mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the batter together until almost all the lumps are gone. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape the bowl then mix again briefly. <NEXT_STEP> Add in a small amount of the port wine to help thin the batter. <NEXT_STEP> Once it is incorporated slowly add in the remaining wine whisking continuously. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape the bottom of the bowl and make sure that there are no lumps. <NEXT_STEP> Scoop into the prepared cupcake liners using a number 16 scoop. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted in the middle of a cupcake comes out clean about 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Allow the cupcakes to fully cool. <NEXT_STEP> Using an apple corer remove a piece of the cupcake from the center. <NEXT_STEP> Drizzle with 1 teaspoon Port Wine Reduction Syrup. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake with 1 teaspoon Raspberry Creme Fraiche Filling. <NEXT_STEP> Using a large star tip pipe the chilled French Chocolate Mousse onto the cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Garnish with the gold leaf flake. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the wine sugar and salt in a saucepan over a low flame. <NEXT_STEP> Simmer until reduced to 3 1/2 ounces liquid. <NEXT_STEP> Place the chocolate and butter in a heatproof bowl and place over a saucepan containing barely simmering water . <NEXT_STEP> Melt the chocolate and butter together and stir with a wooden spoon until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat and cool slightly. <NEXT_STEP> Add the egg yolks to the chocolate 1 by 1 beating with a whisk until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In another bowl beat the egg whites until foamy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the cream of tartar and continue to beat. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually whisk in 1/4 cup sugar and continue beating until stiff peaks form. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the heavy cream in a chilled bowl until it begins to foam and thicken up. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining 2 tablespoons sugar and the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Continue to whip the cream until it holds soft peaks. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually and gently fold the egg whites into the chocolate mixture to lighten it. <NEXT_STEP> Then delicately fold in the whipped cream. <NEXT_STEP> Take care not over work the mousse. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the creme fraiche with the raspberry preserves to combine. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Standing Ovation: Sweet Chocolate Port Cupcakes, Port Wine Reduction Syrup, Raspberry Creme Fraiche Filling, French Chocolate <INGREDIENT_START> 10 strawberries hulled <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups strawberry jam <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 vanilla cupcakes store bought or homemade <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Prepare a grill for medium high heat. <NEXT_STEP> Thread the strawberries onto two skewers and brush with vegetable oil. <NEXT_STEP> Grill on all sides 3 to 5 minutes total. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside to cool. <NEXT_STEP> Pull the strawberries off the skewers cut half into small dice . <NEXT_STEP> Stir the diced strawberries together with the strawberry jam then add to a pastry bag fitted with a medium piping tip. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Whip the heavy cream and powdered sugar to stiff peaks being careful not to overwhip. <NEXT_STEP> Add to a second pastry bag this one fitted with a star tip. <NEXT_STEP> Slice the remaining strawberries lengthwise either in half or quarters. <NEXT_STEP> strawberries before serving. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Grilled Strawberry Shortcake Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> hazelnut <NEXT_INPUT> brownie <NEXT_INPUT> crisco Pillsbury Family Size Chocolate Fudge Brownie Mix <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup Crisco Pure Vegetable Oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> em <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Brownies <NEXT_INGREDIENT> /em <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup chopped hazelnuts plus additional for garnish <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Hazelnut Buttercream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup Crisco All Vegetable Shortening <NEXT_INGREDIENT> or 1/4 stick Crisco Baking Sticks All Vegetable Shortening <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup butter softened <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup Jif Chocolate Flavored Hazelnut Spread <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 cups powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 tsp. vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/8 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 to 2 tbsps. milk <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For Brownies HEAT oven to 350 degrees F. Line 12 muffin cups with paper baking cups. <NEXT_STEP> Prepare brownie mix according to package directions using oil water and eggs. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in 1/2 cup of chopped hazelnuts. <NEXT_STEP> Divide batter evenly into baking cups. <NEXT_STEP> BAKE 30 to 32 minutes or until centers are set. <NEXT_STEP> Cool 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from pan. <NEXT_STEP> Cool completely on wire racks. <NEXT_STEP> For Frosting BEAT shortening butter and chocolate hazelnut spread in a large bowl with an electric mixer on medium speed until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add powdered sugar vanilla salt and 1 tablespoon milk. <NEXT_STEP> Beat slowly until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Beat on high 3 to 5 minutes adding an additional 1 tablespoon milk at a time to desired consistency. <NEXT_STEP> FROST cupcakes by placing frosting into corner of resealable plastic bag. <NEXT_STEP> Cut 1/2 inch off corner of bag. <NEXT_STEP> Starting at outside edge work in circular motion to build up frosting moving towards center creating a swirl effect. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle with reserved chopped hazelnuts. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Brownie Cupcakes with Hazelnut Buttercream <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 pounds plus 1 cup powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon Madagascar vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon sea salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup salted butter cut into 1/2 inch slices <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/4 cups shortening <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup heavy cream at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 1/2 tablespoons salted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon fine sea salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/2 cups buttercream base frosting <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup salted caramel <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the chocolate cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a 24 cup muffin pan with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Cream the granulated sugar butter and oil in a large bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the eggs one at a time until fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla and blend well. <NEXT_STEP> Sift the flour baking soda and sea salt and gradually add to the sugar mixture alternating with the milk. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the cocoa and water until smooth in a small bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Add to the mixture and continue beating until well blended. <NEXT_STEP> Fill each muffin cup three quarters full with batter. <NEXT_STEP> Bake the cupcakes until baked through the center about 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the cupcakes from the pan and cool on wire racks. <NEXT_STEP> For the chocolate fudge filling Melt the butter in a microwave safe bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the cocoa and water until smooth in a separate bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the cocoa mixture into the butter until blended and smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk in the powdered sugar until fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Yield 2 cups. <NEXT_STEP> For the buttercream base frosting Whip the powdered sugar milk vanilla and sea salt with a whisk attachment on low until smooth and creamy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter one slice at a time until well blended. <NEXT_STEP> Add the shortening and blend well. <NEXT_STEP> Whip on high until the mixture doubles 10 to 12 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Yield 8 cups. <NEXT_STEP> For the salted caramel Combine 1/4 cup room temperature water and the granulated sugar in a small saucepan. <NEXT_STEP> Cook over medium low heat until the sugar dissolves. <NEXT_STEP> Increase the heat to medium high and bring to a boil. <NEXT_STEP> Boil without stirring until the mixture is approximately 325 degrees F and a deep amber color 5 to 6 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the caramel from the heat and whisk in the cream. <NEXT_STEP> The caramel will bubble violently. <NEXT_STEP> Once smooth stir in the butter and fine sea salt. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the caramel to a heat safe container and allow cooling for 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cover and refrigerate for up to 2 weeks. <NEXT_STEP> Yield 1 1/2 cups. <NEXT_STEP> For the salted caramel frosting Whip 2 1/2 cups buttercream base frosting the powdered sugar and 1/2 cup salted caramel with a whisk attachment until fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Yield 3 cups. <NEXT_STEP> Once the cupcakes are cool cut out the center of each cupcake and fill with the chocolate fudge filling. <NEXT_STEP> Top each cupcake with the salted caramel frosting. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate Cupcakes with Salted Caramel Frosting and Chocolate Fudge soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon apple cider vinegar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon sea salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon European style salted butter chilled <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons whole milk chilled <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons heavy whipping cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon fresh tarragon leaves minced <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup fresh or frozen blackberries diced <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup fresh or frozen peaches diced <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup fresh or frozen strawberries diced <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup organic heavy whipping cream chilled <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 tablespoons powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Tarragon leaves for garnish <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a muffin pan with 12 regular size cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of an electric stand mixer with the paddle attachment mix the sugar oil salt and peaches on medium speed for 30 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs and continue mixing on medium speed for 30 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula and mix again on medium speed for 10 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Next in a blender or food processor combine the corn and whipping cream and blend for 20 seconds until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add this creamed corn mixture to the wet ingredients and mix on medium speed until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium bowl sift the flour and baking powder and stir in the cornmeal. <NEXT_STEP> Add to the wet ingredient mixture and mix on low speed until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Now add the baking soda followed by the vinegar for an immediate bubbling action. <NEXT_STEP> Add 1/4 cup cold water and mix on low speed for 5 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape the sides and bottom of the bowl one last time to be sure all the ingredients are fully incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners two thirds full with batter and bake for 18 to 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Rotate the pan 180 degrees after 9 minutes of baking. <NEXT_STEP> Oven heat and times may vary so bake until the tops are no longer wet and spring back upon touching. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes completely. <NEXT_STEP> Keep the oven on but increase the temperature to 400 degrees F. For the shortcakes In the bowl of an electric stand mixer with the paddle attachment add the flour sugar baking powder and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Next use your fingers to break the butter into pea size pieces and add to the dry ingredients. <NEXT_STEP> Mix on low speed for 30 seconds until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Add the milk cream tarragon and vanilla and continue mixing on low speed until the flour is fully incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. <NEXT_STEP> With a spoon drop heaping spoonfuls of batter onto the baking sheet 2 inches apart and bake for 12 to 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Oven heat and times may vary so bake the shortcakes until they are golden brown. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the shortcakes completely. <NEXT_STEP> With your fingers break each shortcake into 3 equal pieces and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> For the compote In a small bowl combine the blackberries peaches and strawberries. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sugar and gently fold into mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting In the bowl of an electric stand mixer with the paddle attachment whip the heavy cream on medium high speed for 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> In a small bowl sift the powdered sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sugar to the whipped cream mixture and mix on medium high speed until stiff peaks form. <NEXT_STEP> The frosting should be able to stand on its own. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Begin assembling the cupcakes by placing a spoonful of peach berry compote on top of each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Place the frosting in a piping bag with a round tip or in a gallon size plastic baggy and snip 1/2 inch off the corner. <NEXT_STEP> Next pipe frosting onto the compote. <NEXT_STEP> Place a piece of the tarragon shortcake on top of the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Finally top with another small spoonful of peach berry compote. <NEXT_STEP> With a tweezer or small tong delicately place a tarragon leaf on top. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Peach-Berry Shortcake Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 12 Go To Vanilla Cupcakes <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups Swiss Buttercream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup Grape Tinted Frosting <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup Egg Yolk Tinted Frosting <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup Avocado Tinted Frosting <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Frost the cupcakes with the buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> To pipe the flower Place the grape tinted frosting in a pastry bag with a 104 rose tip. <NEXT_STEP> Point the bag down at a 45 degree angle with the skinny end of the rose tip aimed towards the center of the flower. <NEXT_STEP> Squeeze and release while making 5 tear shapes in a circle to form a flower. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat piping on top with 4 more tear shapes in a tight circle. <NEXT_STEP> Place the egg yolk tinted frosting in a pastry bag with a 2 small round tip. <NEXT_STEP> Hold the bag straight up and pipe a small dot into the center of the flower. <NEXT_STEP> To pipe the leaf Place the avocado tinted frosting in a pastry bag with a 70 leaf tip. <NEXT_STEP> Point the bag down at a 45 degree angle with the tip lightly touching the surface of the cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Squeeze hard to build up the base and simultaneously lift the tip slightly. <NEXT_STEP> Relax the pressure as you pull the tip toward you drawing the leaf to a point. <NEXT_STEP> Stop squeezing and lift the tip away. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe a second leaf on the other side of the flower. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with the remaining cupcakes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Pansy Flower Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> zinfandel <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate the bowl over a pan of boiling water. <NEXT_STEP> Whisking constantly heat to 145 to 150 degrees F. Return the mixing bowl to the stand and whisk until stiff and the bottom of the bowl comes to room temperature about 8 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Change to the paddle attachment and turn the mixer to low speed. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter a few cubes at a time until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Mix at medium speed until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla and mix until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Use 4 cups for the flavored buttercreams in this recipe and reserve the remaining 4 cups for another use. <NEXT_STEP> For the chocolate mascarpone buttercream Fold the melted and cooled chocolate and the mascarpone cheese into 2 cups of the Swiss meringue buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> For the Zinfandel buttercream Blend the Zinfandel wine into 2 cups of the Swiss meringue buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon the mixture into a pastry bag fitted with a large straight pastry tip. <NEXT_STEP> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. beat the butter and salt until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add 1/2 the powdered sugar mixing until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add the chocolate and the remaining powdered sugar and mix until creamy. <NEXT_STEP>
