scoop. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick comes out clean about 9 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the cupcakes from the pans when cool to the touch. <NEXT_STEP> Heat the jalapeno jelly in small pot until melted. <NEXT_STEP> Using a pastry brush glaze the cupcakes with the jalapeno jelly making sure not to glaze the wrappers. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside until assembly. <NEXT_STEP> For the mousse In large bowl beat the cold cream cheese using a hand mixer until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add the tomato paste shrimp paste jalapeno sauce and black pepper to taste. <NEXT_STEP> Mix until thoroughly incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Taste and adjust the seasoning. <NEXT_STEP> Place in a pastry bag fitted with a small star tip and chill in the refrigerator until ready for assembly. <NEXT_STEP> For the tuiles Heat a large nonstick saute pan sprayed with a thin layer of oil spray on medium heat. <NEXT_STEP> With your fingers lay out in a single layer 1 inch diameter circles of the Parmesan. <NEXT_STEP> Heat until they bubble and are golden yellow around the edges. <NEXT_STEP> Carefully lift out of the pan with a spatula set off to a silicone baking mat and reserve until ready to garnish. <NEXT_STEP> For the candied jalapeno Combine 3 cups of the sugar and 1/2 cup water in a saucepan over high heat. <NEXT_STEP> Bring to a boil and cook until the temperature reaches 230 degrees F on a candy thermometer about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Wearing gloves cut the jalapenos lengthwise into 1/4 inch strips. <NEXT_STEP> Place in a medium pot and cover with 4 cups cold water. <NEXT_STEP> Heat on high until the water comes to a boil. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to boil until the peppers are vibrant green about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Using a slotted spoon transfer to the sugar syrup. <NEXT_STEP> Simmer until the jalapenos are tender to the bite blistered and emerald green about 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the syrup. <NEXT_STEP> Cover a baking sheet with the remaining 3 cups sugar and roll the jalapenos until covered in sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to dry in the sugar until hard. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside for assembly. <NEXT_STEP> For the shrimp Thaw rinse drain and pat the shrimp dry. <NEXT_STEP> Heat a large nonstick saute pan sprayed lightly with oil spray. <NEXT_STEP> Add the jalapeno jelly and heat until liquid. <NEXT_STEP> Add the shrimp and toss until warmed through and thoroughly glazed. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside to cool or they will melt the savory cream cheese mousse. <NEXT_STEP> Reserve for assembly. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Pipe the glazed cupcakes with cream cheese tomato shrimp mousse. <NEXT_STEP> Top with a cheese tuile sauteed glazed shrimp and finish with a candied jalapeno. <NEXT_STEP> Serve on a small clear plastic plate. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Jalapeno Shrimp Popper Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> goal <NEXT_INPUT> field <NEXT_INPUT> stick <NEXT_INPUT> jimmy <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 24 servings <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 3 1/4 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 sticks unsalted butter melted and cooled slightly <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 3/4 cups granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup sour cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup mini chocolate chips <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 sticks unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup creamy peanut butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/2 cups dark green jimmies <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 15 large marshmallows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons mini chocolate chips <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 chocolate cream covered cookie sticks such as Pocky sticks <NEXT_INGREDIENT> One 4.25 ounce tube white decorators icing <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 small chocolate chewy candies such as midgie size Tootsie Rolls unwrapped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 22 fruit flavored gummy candies in 2 different colors or 11 chocolate covered raisins or peanuts and 11 yogurt covered raisins or peanuts <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line two 12 cup standard muffin tins with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk together the flour baking powder baking soda and salt in a small bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the butter granulated sugar sour cream vanilla and eggs in a large bowl and whisk until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the flour mixture until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the chocolate chips. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter evenly among the muffin cups filling each about three quarters full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted in the center of a cupcake comes out clean 21 to 23 minutes rotating the pans once about halfway through baking. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes in the pans for 5 minutes and then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting Beat the butter peanut butter vanilla and salt using an electric mixer on medium speed until smooth and fluffy about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually beat in the confectioners sugar and continue to beat until smooth and fluffy about 2 minutes more. <NEXT_STEP> For the assembly and decorating Put 1 cup of frosting in a piping bag fitted with a large round tip and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Put the jimmies in a shallow bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Frost a cupcake using about 2 tablespoons of the remaining frosting per cupcake and then gently dipping the top into the jimmies turning the cupcake until the top is coated. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with the remaining cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Arrange the cupcakes in 4 rows on a large serving plate or cutting board. <NEXT_STEP> Fit a marshmallow between each cupcake 5 marshmallows per row to fill in the gaps between the cupcakes in the rows. <NEXT_STEP> Using the frosting in the piping bag pipe thick cross shapes between where the cupcakes meet one another and over the marshmallows so there are no visible gaps between the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle with jimmies to coat. <NEXT_STEP> To make goal posts for the cupcake field microwave the chocolate chips in a small microwave safe bowl until just melted 30 to 45 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Keep 2 cookie sticks whole for the bases of the posts. <NEXT_STEP> Cut off and discard the bottom third of the remaining cookie sticks. <NEXT_STEP> Dip the top of one of the longest cookie sticks into the melted chocolate and adhere it to the middle of one of the cut cookie sticks so that they form a capital T shape. <NEXT_STEP> Next dip the cut ends of two short sticks into chocolate and adhere them to either side of the cross on the T. Lay the goal post on a flat surface and repeat with the remaining 4 cookie sticks to make the second goal. <NEXT_STEP> Allow goals to fully harden 15 to 20 minutes or place in the refrigerator for 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Using the decorators icing pipe 10 lines across the cupcake field to represent yard lines. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe out the number 50 in the middle for the 50 yard line. <NEXT_STEP> Heat the Tootsie Rolls in the microwave on high in 5 second intervals until they are soft and pliable. <NEXT_STEP> Mash them together and form into a football. <NEXT_STEP> Use the icing to pipe the lacing on the football use a toothpick if necessary to help define the lacing. <NEXT_STEP> Place the football on the field. <NEXT_STEP> Place the gummy candies on the field to represent players and then stick the goal posts into cupcakes at each end of the field. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Pull Apart Touchdown Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> toffee <NEXT_INPUT> caramel follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Honey Goat Cheese Frosting recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup finely grated Parmesan <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 cups dark brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 black figs trimmed and roughly chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon orange zest <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 10 ounces goat cheese at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces cream cheese at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons honey <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line 2 muffin pans with 18 to 19 cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Sift together the flour sugar baking powder salt and orange zest in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer with a paddle attachment mix the eggs orange juice butter and vegetable oil on medium speed until incorporated about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the mixer to medium low speed and add the dry ingredients a little bit at a time making sure to scrape down the sides of the bowl if necessary. <NEXT_STEP> Mix until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners 3/4 of the way full and bake until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes completely. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Peel the cupcake away from its liner and place upside down on the top of a new fresh liner. <NEXT_STEP> The narrow end of the cupcake should be facing up at this point. <NEXT_STEP> Pour 2 to 3 tablespoons of the Brown Sugar Fig Sauce on top of each cupcake allowing the sauce and figs to drip down the sides. <NEXT_STEP> Fill a piping bag equipped with a star tip with the Honey Goat Cheese Frosting and pipe stars on the top of each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle the tops of the cupcakes with the Parmesan. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium saucepan bring the brown sugar and water to a boil over medium high heat. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the heat to medium stir in the figs butter and orange zest and heat until slightly thickened about 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the sauce from the heat and allow to cool. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer with a whisk attachment whisk the goat cheese cream cheese and butter on medium high speed until smooth and fluffy about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the speed to medium and gradually add the powdered sugar until incorporated scraping down the sides of the bowl if necessary. <NEXT_STEP> Add the honey and beat until incorporated. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> The Absurdist (Fruit and Cheese Platter Cupcakes) <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> storage <NEXT_INPUT> royal <NEXT_INPUT> icing <NEXT_INPUT> immediate <NEXT_INPUT> alton <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 3 1/2 cups <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 3 ounces pasteurized egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 cups confectioners sugar <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> In large bowl of stand mixer combine the egg whites and vanilla and beat until frothy. <NEXT_STEP> Add confectioners sugar gradually and mix on low speed until sugar is incorporated and mixture is shiny. <NEXT_STEP> Turn speed up to high and beat until mixture forms stiff glossy peaks. <NEXT_STEP> This should take approximately 5 to 7 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add food coloring if desired. <NEXT_STEP> For immediate use transfer icing to pastry bag or heavy duty storage bag and pipe as desired. <NEXT_STEP> If using storage bag clip corner. <NEXT_STEP> Store in airtight container in refrigerator for up to 3 days. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Royal Icing <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> orange <NEXT_INPUT> gelatin <NEXT_INPUT> passion <NEXT_INPUT> concentrate <NEXT_INPUT> strawberry <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 24 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 8 ounces salted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons vanilla bean paste <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon orange zest <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 2/3 cups gluten free all purpose baking mix <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup plus 1 tablespoon frozen orange juice concentrate thawed <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons powdered gelatin <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup heavy whipping cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 pound sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces egg whites at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon cream of tartar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 ounces salted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup strawberry puree <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup passion fruit puree <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cake batter Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Line two 12 cup muffin pans with cupcake liners and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer with a paddle attachment beat the butter on medium speed until light in color and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sugar and continue beating until uniformly incorporated into the butter stop the mixer and scrape down the sides of the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Restart the mixer on low speed and add the eggs one at a time waiting until each egg is fully incorporated before adding the next. <NEXT_STEP> Once all the eggs have been added stop the mixer and scrape down the sides of the bowl to insure that all the ingredients are incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla bean paste and orange zest and blend uniformly. <NEXT_STEP> Add the gluten free baking mix in three additions alternating with the milk in two additions fully incorporating each addition before moving to the next. <NEXT_STEP> If needed stop the mixer after each addition scrape down the sides of the bowl and resume mixing on low. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners two thirds full with the batter and bake until the top of each cupcake is slightly springy to the touch and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean 14 to 16 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Immediately turn the cupcakes out of the pans onto a cooling rack and let cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the orange mousse filling In a saucepot gently heat 1/2 cup of the orange juice concentrate and the sugar stirring just until the sugar is dissolved. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate until chilled. <NEXT_STEP> In a small bowl mix 2 tablespoons water with the remaining 1 tablespoon orange juice concentrate sprinkle the gelatin over the liquid and let the gelatin bloom and hydrate. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer whip the cream on high speed to medium firm peaks. <NEXT_STEP> Melt the bloomed gelatin in the microwave just until melted and clear 15 to 20 seconds do not overheat as this will kill the gelatin Stir the gelatin into the chilled orange juice mixture until combined and then pour the orange juice mixture into the whipped cream. <NEXT_STEP> Mix completely and refrigerate until ready to use. <NEXT_STEP> For the strawberry passion fruit Italian meringue buttercream Put the sugar and 1/3 cup water in a heavy saucepan and heat over high heat until the sugar mixture registers 250 degrees F on a candy thermometer 15 to 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> While the sugar is cooking whip the egg whites on medium speed in the bowl of a stand mixer to the soft peak stage being careful not to over whip. <NEXT_STEP> Add the cream of tartar and continue whipping. <NEXT_STEP> While the egg whites are whipping on medium speed gently pour the sugar syrup down the side of the mixing bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the speed up to high and whip until the mixing bowl no longer feels warm to the touch about 7 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the mixer speed back to medium add the butter in small chunks and mix until completely incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Stop the mixer scrape down the sides of the bowl and add the strawberry and passion fruit purees. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the mixer back to medium low speed and mix until the purees have been incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Fit an 18 inch piping bag with a round tip and twist and hold the bag right by the tip to prevent the buttercream from leaking out. <NEXT_STEP> Fold the top of the piping bag over your hand and spoon the buttercream into the bag. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Use an apple corer or knife to core out the center of each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Fill each cupcake with some of the orange mousse filling and frost the top of each with some of the strawberry passion fruit Italian meringue buttercream. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Malibu Barbie's California Sunset Cupcake <TITLE_END> curling ribbon <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Sugar for snow <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Cupcakes Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Line the cups of 2 to 4 mini muffin tins with paper liners . <NEXT_STEP> Mix the sugar flour cocoa powder baking powder baking soda and salt together in a mixer fitted with a whisk attachment. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs and milk and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Drizzle in the oil and the vanilla and almond extracts and mix. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer running at low speed add the boiling water and mix just until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the lined muffin cups about 2/3 full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until risen and firm to the touch about 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool in the pans. <NEXT_STEP> Frosting In a mixer fitted with a paddle attachment cream the butter until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sugar vanilla and 2 tablespoons milk and mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add more milk a little at a time until the frosting is thick and spreadable. <NEXT_STEP> Using a flexible spatula frost the tops of the cooled cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate at least 1 hour before assembling the tree. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble the tree spread a thick layer of sprinkles out on a plate. <NEXT_STEP> Dip the tops of the cupcakes in the sprinkles and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Tie curling ribbon around the candy canes and curl with a scissor blade. <NEXT_STEP> One inch up from the bottom of the styrofoam cone stick toothpicks into the cone 1 1/2 inches apart making a circle around the cone and leaving them sticking out at least 1 inch. <NEXT_STEP> Place the cone on a serving platter. <NEXT_STEP> Make the bottom ring of cupcakes by spearing the bottom of a cupcake onto one of the toothpicks in the cone with the frosting facing out and with the side of the cupcake resting on the plate. <NEXT_STEP> One inch above the tops of the first row of cupcakes place another row of toothpicks 1 1/2 inches apart all around the cone positioning them so that the second row will rest between the tops of the first row. <NEXT_STEP> You will fit fewer cupcakes on the second row feel free to cut a cupcake in half if necessary to fit into the space available. <NEXT_STEP> Spear the cupcakes onto the toothpicks as before. <NEXT_STEP> Continue up the cone to form a tree of cupcakes ending with a single cupcake on top. <NEXT_STEP> Serve within one hour or refrigerate up to 24 hours. <NEXT_STEP> Stick the candy canes in the styrofoam and stick gilded cranberries on with a little extra icing. <NEXT_STEP> Pour sugar on the serving platter around the tree. <NEXT_STEP> To gild the cranberries roll them on the sheets of gold leaf to roughly coat. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Cupcake Christmas Tree <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> almond <NEXT_INPUT> german <NEXT_INPUT> buttermilk <NEXT_INPUT> evaporated <NEXT_INPUT> brown <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 14 to 15 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 12 tablespoons unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup light brown sugar lightly packed <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 extra large eggs at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup buttermilk shaken at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup sour cream at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons freshly brewed coffee <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 3/4 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup unsweetened cocoa powder such as Pernigotti <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 tablespoons unsalted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 can evaporated milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 cups light brown sugar lightly packed <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 extra large egg yolks <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon pure almond extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups sweetened flaked coconut <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup blanched sliced almonds toasted <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup chopped pecans <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. <NEXT_STEP> Line cupcake pans with 14 or 15 paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment cream the butter granulated sugar and brown sugar on medium high speed for 5 minutes until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Lower the speed to medium add the eggs one at a time then add the vanilla and mix well. <NEXT_STEP> In a separate bowl whisk together the buttermilk sour cream and coffee. <NEXT_STEP> In a third bowl sift together the flour cocoa powder baking soda and salt. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on low add the buttermilk and flour mixtures alternately in thirds beginning with the buttermilk and ending with the flour. <NEXT_STEP> Don t overmix Fold the batter a few times with a rubber spatula to be sure it s mixed. <NEXT_STEP> Scoop the batter into the cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Bake in the center of the oven for 20 to 25 minutes until a toothpick comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Cool for 10 minutes remove from the pans and allow to cool completely before frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Melt the butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk in the evaporated milk brown sugar and egg yolks and bring to a simmer over medium heat. <NEXT_STEP> Simmer stirring constantly with a wooden spoon for about 15 minutes until slightly thickened. <NEXT_STEP> If the mixture looks a bit curdled beat it vigorously with a whisk. <NEXT_STEP> Off the heat stir in the vanilla extract almond extract coconut almonds pecans and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to cool for about an hour. <NEXT_STEP> Frost the cupcakes with a knife or small metal spatula. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> German Chocolate Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> beat <NEXT_INPUT> speed <NEXT_INPUT> white <NEXT_INPUT> mixer <NEXT_INPUT> cheese <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 1/2 cups cake flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup milk at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 stick unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large egg whites at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces cream cheese at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 stick unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon lemon juice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 cups confectioners sugar <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line 12 muffin cups with paper cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Sift the flour baking powder and salt into a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Stir together the milk and vanilla in a small bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the butter using an electric mixer on low speed until smooth about 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually beat in 1/2 cup of the granulated sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Increase the speed to high and beat until light and fluffy about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the mixer speed to low. <NEXT_STEP> Add about one third of the flour mixture and beat until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add half the milk mixture and beat until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat adding flour then milk and then the remaining flour stopping and scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed. <NEXT_STEP> Increase the mixer speed to medium and beat briefly to make a smooth batter set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Put the egg whites in a clean bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Whip using an electric mixer on high speed until foamy. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually add the remaining 1/4 cup sugar and continue to beat until the egg whites are glossy and hold stiff peaks about 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Fold one third of the whites into the batter to lighten it and then fold in the remaining whites. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the cake batter evenly among the prepared muffin cups. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted in the center of the cakes comes out clean rotating the tin halfway through about 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes on a rack in the tin for 10 minutes and then remove from the tin to cool completely on the rack. <NEXT_STEP> Beat together the cream cheese and butter using an electric mixer on medium speed until fluffy about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the vanilla and lemon juice. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the mixer speed to low and gradually add the confectioners sugar beating until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the frosting to a piping bag or resealable bag and pipe onto the tops of the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Copyright 2016 Television Food Network G.P. <NEXT_STEP> All rights reserved <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the mango chutney curd Put a small pot filled with 1 inch of water on the stovetop to boil. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium stainless steel bowl whisk the egg yolks and sugar until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add 4 ounces of the mango chutney and the mango nectar. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Place the bowl on top of the pot of boiling water. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the heat to a simmer. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk continuously until the mixture reduces and thickens to the consistency of sour cream 10 to 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Take the mixture off the stove. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter and whisk until the butter is fully incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in remaining 4 ounces mango chutney and the mango chunks into the curd and allow to cool before filling the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Line tins with 24 muffin cups. <NEXT_STEP> In a small saucepan heat the butter on low until just melted. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a large mixing bowl sift together the flour baking powder coriander and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sugars and whisk until all the dry ingredients are combined. <NEXT_STEP> In a separate bowl whisk the eggs and egg white until lightly beaten. <NEXT_STEP> Mix in the milk mango juice concentrate mango nectar and vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually add the wet ingredients into the dry whisking until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> Scoop 1/2 cup batter into the saucepan of melted butter. <NEXT_STEP> Stir until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the oil and continue to mix until all are incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Pour back into the large bowl of batter. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Use a 1 1/2 ounce portion scoop to scoop the batter into each muffin cup filling 2/3 full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick comes out clean when inserted into the cake 18 to 22 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Allow the cupcakes to cool in the pan for 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Then remove to a cooling rack until completely cool. <NEXT_STEP> Hollow out 1/2 inch of the center of the cupcake with a corer or paring knife. <NEXT_STEP> Fill with the mango chutney curd. <NEXT_STEP> Top with a dollop of Sweetened Condensed Milk Whipped Cream and a Dried Mango Star Garnish. <NEXT_STEP> A viewer who may not be a professional cook provided this recipe. <NEXT_STEP> The Food Network Kitchens chefs have not tested this recipe and therefore we cannot make representation as to the results. <NEXT_STEP> In a stand mixer with the whisk attachment beat the heavy cream until soft peaks form. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the mixer to low speed and slowly pour in the condensed milk. <NEXT_STEP> Add the salt. <NEXT_STEP> Mix until firm peaks form. <NEXT_STEP> Do not over mix. <NEXT_STEP> Use a small rolling pin to flatten a few pieces of dried mango. <NEXT_STEP> Cut out 24 stars with 1/2 inch star shaped cookie cutter. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Mango Coriander Pound Cake Cupcakes with Mango Chutney Filling and Sweetened Condensed Milk Whipped Cream <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> yolk <NEXT_INPUT> bean <NEXT_INPUT> paste <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> boston <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 24 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 4 eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 2/3 cups gluten free flour blend <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 sticks butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cups whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup canola oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Vanilla Bean Pastry Cream recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Dark Chocolate Italian Meringue Buttercream recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup cornstarch <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 whole egg <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 ounces egg yolks <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons vanilla bean paste <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup plus 2 tablespoons granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 ounces egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon cream of tartar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 ounces good quality dark chocolate chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 sticks butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla bean paste <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/16 teaspoon fine sea salt <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Line two 12 cup muffin pans with cupcake liners and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Crack the eggs into a small container and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Set the sugar aside. <NEXT_STEP> Then in a small bowl mix the gluten free flour nutmeg and salt together with a fork and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer on medium speed beat the butter with a paddle attachment until the butter is light in color and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sugar to the butter and continue beating until the sugar is uniformly incorporated into the butter. <NEXT_STEP> Stop the mixer and scrape down the sides of the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Then restart the mixer on low speed and add 1 egg at a time waiting until it is fully incorporated in the butter mixture before adding the next egg. <NEXT_STEP> Once all the eggs have been added stop the mixer and scrape down the sides of the bowl to ensure that all the butter is incorporated with the eggs. <NEXT_STEP> Add the dry ingredients in three additions alternating with the milk and oil added in two additions fully incorporating each addition into the batter before moving to the next step. <NEXT_STEP> If needed stop the mixer after each addition and scrape down the sides of the bowl and then resume mixing on low. <NEXT_STEP> Once all the dry ingredients and the milk have been combined with the butter mixture evenly fill the cupcake pan cavities two thirds of the way. <NEXT_STEP> Bake the cupcakes until the top of each cupcake is slightly springy to the touch and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean 14 to 16 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the oven and immediately turn the cupcakes out of the pan onto a cooling rack. <NEXT_STEP> Let the cupcakes cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Putting it all together Using an apple corer or knife core the centers out of the cooled cupcakes and remove. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcakes with the Vanilla Bean Pastry Cream. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the Dark Chocolate Italian Meringue Buttercream to cover the top of each cooled cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Bring the shallow dish or container for the finished pastry cream near the stovetop and have the plastic wrap nearby as well. <NEXT_STEP> Measure the butter and vanilla bean paste into a small container and bring over near the stovetop. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the milk and 1/4 cup sugar into a heavy saucepot and scald over medium heat until the milk starts to steam. <NEXT_STEP> Do not boil the milk Meanwhile whisk together the cornstarch and the remaining 1/4 cup sugar to combine and prevent any lumps in the cornstarch and then add the whole egg and egg yolks. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the egg yolk mixture until smooth and completely combined and then bring over to the stove area and set the bowl with the yolks on top of a damp dish towel. <NEXT_STEP> When the milk is steaming remove from the heat. <NEXT_STEP> Whisking the egg yolk mixture constantly slowly pour the milk in a steady stream into the egg yolk mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Once all the milk is combined with the egg yolk mixture pour it back into the saucepot and return to medium high heat whisking constantly. <NEXT_STEP> Continue whisking and bring it to a boil. <NEXT_STEP> Let the egg yolk mixture boil for 1 minute and then remove from the heat. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the butter and vanilla bean paste and then pour the entire contents of the pot into the shallow dish. <NEXT_STEP> Immediately cover the surface of the pastry cream with the plastic wrap and refrigerate until cool about 1 hour. <NEXT_STEP> Once cool remove from the refrigerator and whisk until completely smooth and lump free. <NEXT_STEP> Fill a piping bag with the pastry cream and set aside until you need it. <NEXT_STEP> Measure the sugar and 1/4 cup water into a heavy saucepan and heat over high heat until the sugar mixture reaches 250 degrees F 15 to 20 minutes . <NEXT_STEP> While the sugar is cooking beat the egg whites on medium speed in the mixing bowl of a stand mixture to the soft peak stage . <NEXT_STEP> Be careful not to over whip the whites Add the cream of tartar and continue whipping. <NEXT_STEP> While the egg whites are whipping on medium speed gently pour the sugar syrup down the side of the mixing bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the speed up to high and whip until the mixing bowl no longer feels warm to the touch about 7 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile melt the dark chocolate in a microwave safe bowl at 30 second intervals stirring in between each interval until the chocolate is completely melted. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the mixer speed back to medium and add the butter in small chunks until it is completely incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Stop the mixer scrape down the sides of the bowl and add the vanilla bean paste and sea salt. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the mixer back on medium low speed until the vanilla paste has mixed entirely through the buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon a small amount of the buttercream into the melted dark chocolate and stir to combine. <NEXT_STEP> Add the chocolate mixture back to the buttercream and whip thoroughly stopping the mixer to scrape down the sides of the bowl to make sure all the chocolate is combined. <NEXT_STEP> Fit an 18 inch plastic piping bag with an 847 star tip and twist the bag right by the tip to prevent the buttercream from leaking out. <NEXT_STEP> While you grasp the piping bag right above the star tip with your hand fold the top of the piping bag over your hand and spoon the butter cream into the piping bag. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Boston Cream Pie Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> snout <NEXT_INPUT> decorating frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Frost the cupcakes with the Raspberry Balsamic Cream Cheese Frosting. <NEXT_STEP> In a small bowl mix the raspberries with the granulated sugar and let stand for 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Place the raspberries in a small saucepan and add 1 tablespoon of the balsamic vinegar. <NEXT_STEP> Let simmer over medium heat for 15 minutes the raspberries should cook down and create a sauce. <NEXT_STEP> Then crush the berries or run through a blender for a smoother frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside to cool. <NEXT_STEP> Mix the remaining 3 tablespoons balsamic vinegar into the raspberry sauce and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl or the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with paddle attachment beat the cream cheese and butter until creamy. <NEXT_STEP> Add 1/2 cup of the powdered sugar and beat until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the raspberry sauce and beat until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining powdered sugar a bit at a time and beat until creamy. <NEXT_STEP> Add more sugar if a thicker consistency is desired. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Lemon-Raspberry Cupcakes with Raspberry-Balsamic Cream Cheese Frosting <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 ounces red licorice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup cornstarch <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 egg yolks slightly beaten <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 teaspoon cream of tartar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon over the heat for 1 to 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Once the sugar has dissolved remove from the heat and beat with an electric mixer on high until stiff peaks have formed 5 to 7 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Stir vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup sour cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 large crisp sweet apple such as Gala peeled cored and finely chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 large egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line 24 muffin cups with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk together the flour baking soda nutmeg and salt in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the butter and sugar together in a large bowl using an electric mixer on medium high speed until fluffy about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the eggs one at a time and then the vanilla beating until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the mixer speed to low and beat in half of the flour mixture until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sour cream mixing to combine and then the rest of the flour. <NEXT_STEP> Beat until well combined taking care not to overmix. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the chopped apples. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter evenly among the prepared muffin cups filling them almost halfway full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick top of each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Use the back of a spoon to create peaks and valleys in the frosting as desired. <NEXT_STEP> Working in batches place the cupcakes under the broiler and cook until the meringue is browned in spots 1 to 2 minutes watching carefully to avoid burning. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Apple Meringue Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> evenly. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter and pulse until the mixture looks like coarse sand with some pea size bits of butter. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk together the milk vanilla and eggs in a small bowl or <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup seltzer water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup coffee brewed strong cooled <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup soy milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon non hydrogenated vegan margarine <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon rum <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 ripe bananas sliced into 1/4 inch slices <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Line a standard cupcake pan with 12 cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Sift the sugar flour cocoa baking soda and salt into a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Set the bowl aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a small bowl whisk together the seltzer water coffee oil and vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and whisk until just incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vinegar and incorporate. <NEXT_STEP> Do not over mix the batter. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners 3/4 full and bake until a toothpick inserted into each cupcake comes out clean 19 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the ganache Heat the soy creamer in a double boiler over medium heat until steaming. <NEXT_STEP> Do not boil. <NEXT_STEP> In a separate bowl pour the hot creamer over the chocolate and let sit for 30 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the soy creamer and chocolate until the chocolate is melted and the 2 ingredients are completely combined. <NEXT_STEP> The ganache should be thick but still pourable. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting In the bowl of a stand mixer whip the shortening margarine and banana compound. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape the bottom of the bowl to ensure that all ingredients are mixed thoroughly. <NEXT_STEP> On low speed slowly add the sugar a little at a time. <NEXT_STEP> Once the sugar is incorporated mix on medium high speed until all the ingredients are combined and the frosting is fluffy about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Drop the whole banana into the frosting and let it mix for an additional 2 minutes or until the banana is mashed. <NEXT_STEP> On low speed add in the soy milk until incorporated a little at a time until desired consistency is reached. <NEXT_STEP> Put the frosting into a pastry bag and cut 1/2 inch off the tip. <NEXT_STEP> In a small saucepan melt the brown sugar and margarine on medium heat. <NEXT_STEP> When the sugar crystals are completely dissolved in the melted margarine add the rum and mix. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sliced bananas and stir gently. <NEXT_STEP> Let it come to a boil and thicken to desired texture. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat and let cool. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Dip the tops of each cupcake into the ganache so that the entire cupcake top is covered. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside for 10 minutes to allow the ganache to set on the cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe a dollop of banana frosting on top of each cupcake and garnish the top with 2 slices caramelized bananas. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Gilbert Ganache-fried Cupcakes: Chocolate Seltzer Cupcakes with Ganache, Banana Frosting, and <YIELD_START> 12 servings <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 3 tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 ounces unsweetened chocolate chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> teaspoon kosher salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 tablespoons unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon orange flavored liqueur rum or brandy <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 10 ounces semisweet chocolate chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/3 cups heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch of kosher salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Shaved white chocolate for topping <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Make the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a 12 cup muffin pan with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the cocoa powder and 1/4 cup water in a small bowl until smooth set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Put the unsweetened chocolate in a microwave safe bowl and microwave stirring every 30 seconds until melted set aside and let cool. <NEXT_STEP> Sift the flour and baking soda into a large bowl stir in the salt. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the butter and thick about 1 hour. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the remaining 1/3 cup heavy cream and the confectioners sugar in a large bowl with a mixer until soft peaks form. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in 1/4 cup of the cooled ganache cream. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the remaining ganache with a mixer on medium speed until light and fluffy 3 to 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the whipped ganache to a pastry bag fitted with a star tip and constantly for 3 minutes . <NEXT_STEP> Remove the pan from the heat and scrape the frosting base into a shallow bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Press a sheet of plastic wrap directly on the surface and refrigerate until chilled and thick at least 2 hours. <NEXT_STEP> For the cake Meanwhile preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line the cups of two 12 cup muffin pans with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the flour baking powder salt and cloves in a bowl until evenly combined. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the sugar butter vanilla and orange zest in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment and beat on medium speed until pale and fluffy about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time beating well after each addition until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Alternately add the flour mixture and the hefeweizen beginning and ending with the flour mixture until the batter is smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter among the muffin cups then bake until a cake tester inserted in the center of the cupcakes comes out clean about 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let the cupcakes cool in the pan for 10 minutes then transfer the cupcakes to a wire rack and let cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the frosting base from the refrigerator and let stand for 10 minutes to come to room temperature. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the butter for the frosting on medium speed until lightened and creamy about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Mash the frosting base with the back of a spoon until it is spreadable then add a third of the frosting base to the butter and beat until evenly incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Add half of the remaining frosting base beat until smooth then add the remaining frosting base and the vanilla and beat until the frosting is fluffy and light about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Frost the cupcakes with a spoon or transfer the frosting to a pastry bag fitted with a 1/2 inch wide fluted tip and pipe mounds onto the top of each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Garnish each cupcake with an orange wedge before serving. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Hefeweizen Orange Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> mandarin high and mix until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Take 3/4 cup of the frosting and reserve. <NEXT_STEP> Take 1 cup of the frosting and add 8 to 10 drops of green food coloring to make a grassy color the grass Line the remaining 5 cupcakes horizontally under the legs. <NEXT_STEP> Spread half of the green frosting in an even layer along the cupcakes covering and connecting them. <NEXT_STEP> Next to each cupcake while pulling upward to create grass. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat using the rest of the frosting until all of the cupcakes are covered. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Little Lamb Pull-Apart Cupcakes <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup hot water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup mayonnaise <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup chocolate chips <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 cups ricotta cheese <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 tangerines zested <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup heavy whipping cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 cups Cornstarch <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Line a mini cupcake pan with 24 mini cupcake liners or a regular size cupcake pan with 12 cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Sift the flour baking soda and salt into a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Set the bowl aside. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of an electric stand mixer with a paddle attachment mix the water mayonnaise and cocoa powder together. <NEXT_STEP> Add the granulated sugar and flour mixture and mix on medium speed for 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Using a bowl scraper fold in the chocolate chips. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners two thirds full with batter and bake until golden and baked through 25 to 35 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the filling In the bowl of an electric stand mixer with the paddle attachment combine the ricotta cheese powdered sugar and tangerine zest on low speed until all components are thoroughly combined. <NEXT_STEP> For the ganache Bring the heavy whipping cream to a slight boil in a small saucepan over medium high heat. <NEXT_STEP> Immediately remove from heat and pour over chocolate chips in a glass or heat resistant bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Gently stir the mixture until all of the chocolate chips have melted. <NEXT_STEP> Set in the refrigerator to expedite the cooling and thickening process. <NEXT_STEP> For the candied tangerines Slice the tangerines into 12 medium thin slices. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle a thick layer of sugar in a medium saucepan and lay the tangerine slices in the sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle another thick layer of sugar over the top of the tangerine slices and cook the fruit over medium high heat until caramel in color. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the pan from the heat and remove the tangerine slices onto a heat resistant plate using tongs. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Core the cupcakes by taking a small knife to the center of each one and cutting in a circle from the top to bottom of the cake. <NEXT_STEP> Fill this hole with the tangerine cheese until the filling reaches the top of the cake. <NEXT_STEP> Using a knife place a smattering of chocolate ganache on the top of the cupcake near the filling. <NEXT_STEP> Stick a wedge of the Tuile Cookie into the filling and garnish with a slice of candied tangerine. <NEXT_STEP> Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of an electric stand mixer with the paddle attachment cream the butter and powdered sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Add the egg whites one at a time scraping the sides of the bowl after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla extract and the flour and mix until all the ingredients are thoroughly combined. <NEXT_STEP> With an offset spatula spread the tuile cookie dough onto the lined cookie sheet to about 1/8 inch thick. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until golden brown 10 to 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Mix the purple food coloring vodka and cornstarch together until the desired consistency of food safe paint is acquired. <NEXT_STEP> Using a medium round brush splatter the paint onto the tuile cookie in an abstract fashion. <NEXT_STEP> Break the cookie into imperfect shapes . <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate Tangerine Cannoli Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> goat <NEXT_INPUT> water to moisten the top and attach 2 yellow sprinkles for eyes. <NEXT_STEP> Add pupils to the eyes by dipping a skewer into the melted chocolate and make small dots on the yellow sprinkles. s head. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat to make 11 more caterpillars. <NEXT_STEP> Allow them to dry 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Frost each cupcake with about 2 tablespoons buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> Place <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup extra brute cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup buttermilk shaken <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup heart healthy olive oil blend such as Smart Balance <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon natural cherry extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon Madagascar vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 eggs at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup espresso <NEXT_INGREDIENT> One 21 ounce jar Amarena cherries in syrup <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup milk chocolate <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 sticks salted butter chilled <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup sour cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 cups sifted confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup dark chocolate for candy making <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Edible ink <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 ounce gold dust <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup assorted metallic chocolate pearls <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F degrees. <NEXT_STEP> Line two 2 dozen mini cupcake pans with cupcake metallic or paper liners and spray with oil spray. <NEXT_STEP> For the crust In a food processor fitted with the blade attachment add the cherries sugar cookies and butter. <NEXT_STEP> Then pulse until it s a paste that sticks when pinched with your fingers. <NEXT_STEP> Press 1 tablespoon of the crust into the prepared pans. <NEXT_STEP> For the cupcakes Sift the granulated sugar flour cocoa baking soda baking powder and salt into the bowl of an upright mixer fitted with the paddle attachment. <NEXT_STEP> In another bowl combine the buttermilk oil blend extracts and eggs with a whisk until fully combined. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on low speed slowly add the wet ingredients to the dry until fully combined. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer still on low slowly add the espresso and stir just to incorporate scraping the bowl with a rubber spatula. <NEXT_STEP> Using small ice cream scoop fill the prepared pans three quarters of the way full with batter. <NEXT_STEP> Drop 1 cherry drained of its juice into the center of each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Bake and cool the cupcakes completely the metallic liners bake for 11 minutes and the paper liners bake for 9 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting To melt the chocolate place it in a double boiler over simmering water on low heat for 5 to 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Stir occasionally until completely smooth and no pieces of chocolate remain. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat and let cool until lukewarm 5 to 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl beat the butter until creamy with an electric hand mixer on medium speed about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sour cream vanilla and confectioners sugar and beat until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add the melted cooled chocolate and beat until creamy and of a desired consistency. <NEXT_STEP> Fill a pastry bag fitted with a small round tip and reserve for assembly. <NEXT_STEP> For the chocolate pieces Melt the chocolate in a double boiler as above. <NEXT_STEP> Line mold on a sheet tray. <NEXT_STEP> Using a spoon fill the mold to the brim with chocolate. <NEXT_STEP> Place in the freezer and leave for 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> When you take them out turn your mold gently over a sheet tray. <NEXT_STEP> The chocolates should come out without too much trouble but if you find them getting stuck tap the mold firmly against the counter or flex the mold a little and that should free them. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer edible ink that reads priceless by pressing the words lightly on the chocolate to adhere. <NEXT_STEP> Finish by painting a thin layer of gold dust on the edges of the priceless tag. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Generously frost the top of each cupcake with the chocolate sour cream frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Adorn with priceless tags and sprinkle with chocolate metallic pearls. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> "Priceless" Cupcakes <TITLE_END> Cheese Frosting <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> brulee <NEXT_INPUT> ounce <NEXT_INPUT> creme <NEXT_INPUT> caramel <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 20 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 10 ounces all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces sour cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 ounces eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 1/2 ounces vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 1/2 ounces prepared vanilla pudding <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 ounces buttermilk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 ounces granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla bean paste <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 large egg yolks <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 ounces cream cheese at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 pound 4 ounces powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 3/4 ounces dulce de leche caramel <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/2 ounces evaporated milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 ounce vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Granulated sugar for garnish <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Fresh raspberries for garnish <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a regular size cupcake pan with 20 paper liners and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of an electric stand mixer measure the flour brown sugar baking soda and salt and whisk to combine. <NEXT_STEP> Then measure the sour cream eggs vegetable oil vanilla pudding buttermilk and vanilla extract into the mixing bowl and mix on low speed for 30 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Stop the mixer and scrape down the sides of the bowl using a rubber spatula. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the mixer back on medium speed and mix until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> Use a rubber spatula to stir the batter. <NEXT_STEP> Make sure that all flour and dry ingredients are completely combined into the batter. <NEXT_STEP> Fill 20 cupcake liners two thirds full with batter and bake until the top bounces back when touched about 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the creme brulee filling Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Whisk together the sugar vanilla bean paste and egg yolks in a mixing bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly whisk in the heavy cream until completely combined. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the mixture into a 9 by 9 inch casserole dish. <NEXT_STEP> Place the casserole dish on an 18 by 13 inch cookie sheet and pour 2 cups of water into the bottom of the cookie sheet to use as a water bath. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until set for 30 to 45 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the oven and cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Once completely cooled scoop up all of the baked creme brulee and put in a pastry bag. <NEXT_STEP> Cut 1/2 inch off the top of the pastry bag. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> For the caramel frosting Whip the butter and cream cheese in the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with a paddle attachment until soft and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Stop the mixer and add approximately half of the powdered sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the mixer onto low for 30 seconds and then to medium until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Stop the mixer and add the rest of the powdered sugar along with the dulce de leche evaporated milk and vanilla extract. <NEXT_STEP> Mix the frosting on low until the powdered sugar starts to incorporate. <NEXT_STEP> Then turn the mixer to medium high and mix until very light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Put the frosting in a pastry bag fitted with a large round tip. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Using a large round piping tip cut a hole in the center of each baked cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Fill each cupcake generously with the creme brulee filling. <NEXT_STEP> Then frost the top of each cupcake with the caramel frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle each frosted cupcake with 1 teaspoon granulated sugar. <NEXT_STEP> With a torch torch the sugar on top of each cupcake until golden brown. <NEXT_STEP> Garnish with a fresh raspberry and serve. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Brown Sugar Caramel Creme Brulee Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> peanut <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> butter 2 tablespoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 pounds 4 ounces sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 9 ounces scant non hydrogenated vegan margarine <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon egg replacer <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons ginger juice commercial or fresh <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups plus 2 tablespoons soy milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup minced ginger packed <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups prepared peach puree store bought <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 tablespoons sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon water or brandy <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon cornstarch <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 ounces non hydrogenated vegetable shortening <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 ounces non hydrogenated vegan margarine <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 ounces blueberry puree store bought <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 pound 13 ounces powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons blueberry juice concentrate <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Fresh blueberries for garnish optional <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Line standard cupcake pans with 36 standard cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Sift the flour baking powder and salt into a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Set the bowl aside. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of an electric stand mixer cream the sugar and margarine with the whisk attachment about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> In a small bowl or cup combine the water and egg replacer and stir to dissolve the egg replacer. <NEXT_STEP> Add the egg replacer to the sugar and mix until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape the bottom of the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Add the ginger juice and mix until combined. <NEXT_STEP> In a small bowl combine the soy milk and vanilla and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the mixer speed to low and slowly add the dry ingredients and the soy milk alternating between the 2 ending with the soy milk. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in the minced ginger by hand into the batter. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners 3/4 full with batter and bake until a toothpick inserted into each cupcake comes out clean 19 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the filling In a medium heavy bottomed saucepan stir together the puree and sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Heat on medium high heat until the mixture begins to bubble around the edges. <NEXT_STEP> In a small bowl mix the water or brandy and cornstarch into a slurry. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly add the cornstarch mixture to the puree while whisking. <NEXT_STEP> Cook for 2 more minutes while stirring. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Put the cooled peach filling into a piping bag and cut 1/2 inch off the tip. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting In the bowl of a stand mixer whip the shortening and margarine until completely combined. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape the bottom of the bowl to ensure that all the ingredients are mixed thoroughly. <NEXT_STEP> Add the blueberry puree and vanilla and mix until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape the bottom of the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> On low speed slowly add the sugar a little at a time. <NEXT_STEP> Add the blueberry juice and mix to combine. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape the bottom of the bowl and mix on medium high speed until all the ingredients are combined and the frosting is fluffy about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Put the frosting into a pastry bag and cut 1/2 inch off the tip. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble With a plastic drinking straw or a small paring knife make holes in the center of each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Squeeze the peach filling into the center of each cupcake until filled but not overflowing about 1 tablespoon per cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe a dollop of blueberry frosting onto each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Garnish with a few fresh blueberries if using. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Working Blue Cupcakes: Ginger Cupcakes with Peach Filling and Blueberry until well incorporated about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Some pumpkin purees have more moisture than others if the cake batter seems dry then add more pumpkin puree 1/4 cup at a time. <NEXT_STEP> Using an ice cream scoop fill the molds 2/3 of the way to the top with batter. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until the tops are golden brown and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean about 12 minutes. <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1/3 cup butter softened <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs plus 1 egg white <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups cake flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pink candy goo for filling <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 recipe American Buttercream recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Red yellow and black food coloring <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons red piping gel <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 sticks butter softened <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 cups powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 to 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract optional <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch of kosher salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup whole milk <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a 12 cup muffin tin with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment cream the butter and sugar for about 2 minutes until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time beating after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the egg white scraping the sides of the bowl as you go. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla and beat on medium high speed for about 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> In a separate medium bowl whisk the flour baking powder and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Mix the flour mixture and the milk into the egg mixture in three parts flour milk flour taking care to scrape down the sides as you go and incorporating each addition well. <NEXT_STEP> Mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter evenly between the muffin cups using an ice cream scoop the batter should come about three quarters of the way up the sides. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean 15 to 16 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let the cupcakes cool in the pans on a wire rack for 10 to 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Then remove from the pan to the rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the filling and decoration Use a cupcake corer to hollow out the center of the cupcakes saving the tops then fill with a couple tablespoons of candy goo. <NEXT_STEP> Slice the top off of the plug you removed from the cupcake and place back in the hole to seal in the filling. <NEXT_STEP> Use a couple of drops of red food coloring and the smallest amount of yellow and black to color your frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Frost the tops of cupcakes with a thin layer of buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> Place the remaining buttercream into a pastry bag fitting with a medium round tip. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe squiggles around the top of the cupcakes creating two hemispheres of the brain. <NEXT_STEP> Thin the red piping gel with a teaspoon of water and use a spoon to drizzle over top of the brain to get into crevices. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment combine all the ingredients. <NEXT_STEP> Whip the mixture on low speed for a while. <NEXT_STEP> When the sugar is incorporated turn the mixer speed up and whip until the buttercream is smooth and looks right to you. <NEXT_STEP> If it s too cold persuade it with a blowtorch if you have one. <NEXT_STEP> If it s too wet add a bit more powdered sugar. <NEXT_STEP> If it s too stiff add a bit more butter. <NEXT_STEP> Be sure to scrape the sides of the bowl once or twice to make sure everything is combined. <NEXT_STEP> Use immediately or store in an airtight container at room temperature for 24 hours or in the fridge for up to 2 weeks. <NEXT_STEP> Rewhip cold buttercream before using it. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Brain Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> fluffy about 5 minutes scrape down the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly mix in the soy milk applesauce and vanilla and mix for 2 more minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly add the flour mixture and then fold in the vinegar. <NEXT_STEP> Divide half of the batter among the liners sprinkle on some of the streusel and then top with the remaining batter. <NEXT_STEP> Top off with more of the streusel and a sprinkle of medium heat. <NEXT_STEP> Bring to a simmer and simmer for 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside to cool. <NEXT_STEP> For the cinnamon frosting Using a stand mixer with a whisk attachment mix the vegan butter and shortening until light and fluffy about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the bowl add the vanilla and mix for 2 more minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the confectioners sugar and cinnamon and mix aside to cool slightly about 5 minutes and then pour the mixture through a strainer. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool for 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Using an apple corer or paring knife cut out the center of each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Put a generous amount of the apple compote in each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Frost with a small amount of cinnamon frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Place a shortbread crust on top each. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Cherry Moonshine Pie Cupcake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> popcorn <NEXT_INPUT> corn <NEXT_INPUT> peanut <NEXT_INPUT> butterscotch <NEXT_INPUT> <NEXT_STEP> Cook on medium heat until the mixture is golden in color. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the saucepan from the heat. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the butter and baking soda. <NEXT_STEP> Working quickly spread the mixture onto the greased sheet pan. <NEXT_STEP> Allow the mixture to cool slightly before using a spatula to spread the mixture out even further. <NEXT_STEP> Once cooled a little more stretch the candy out to be thin. <NEXT_STEP> Once fully cooled approximately 30 minutes break the candy into small pieces. <NEXT_STEP> You will not need all this brittle for the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> The extra can be stored in a plastic storage container for snacking or a second batch of cupcakes For the Buttermilk Pound Cake In a large bowl beat together the sugar and butter until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add in the eggs 1 at a time. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the bowl and mix after each egg addition. <NEXT_STEP> In a separate bowl sift together the cake flour all purpose flour baking powder salt and baking cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> This is a little sticky and messy In a food processor blend the butter sugar cocoa and salt until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add the corn syrup and vanilla extract. <NEXT_STEP> Blend again making sure to scrape the sides of the food processor. <NEXT_STEP> Add the chocolate and pulse until completely combined. <NEXT_STEP> It should be smooth and creamy. <NEXT_STEP> Place the brown sugar salt butter corn syrup and vanilla extract into a microwave safe container and cook on high power for 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Remove and stir until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Place the container back in the microwave and cook again for another 2 minutes or until the mixture is bubbling. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the container from the microwave and stir in the baking soda. <NEXT_STEP> It will foam up. <NEXT_STEP> Spray a large stainless steel bowl with nonstick spray and place the popcorn in it. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the hot mixture from the microwave over the popcorn and toss until evenly coated. <NEXT_STEP> Spread the popcorn over a sheet tray and move it around until it is all separated. <NEXT_STEP> Allow the mixture to cool before layering on top of the fudge icing. <NEXT_STEP> In a bowl whisk together the egg whites and sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Heat them over a bain marie until hot and the sugar is melted. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the hot egg white sugar mixture into the bowl of an electric mixer and whisk on high until the mixture is cooled. <NEXT_STEP> Switch to a paddle attachment. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer running on medium high speed gradually add the softened butter until the frosting is thick smooth and glossy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla extract and mix until combined. <NEXT_STEP> For the assembly Fill the cooled cupcakes with the butterscotch caramel. <NEXT_STEP> Spread the fudge icing on top. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle the caramel corn over the icing and top with a dollop of the vanilla buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> Top the buttercream with a mini chocolate shell candy. <STEP_END> <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoons salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 large egg <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 large egg yolk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup buttermilk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup peanut butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 ounces cream cheese at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 drop food coloring optional <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Chocolate wafer cookies <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Licorice strips <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Toasted coconut <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Small candies <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Position a rack in the middle of the oven and preheat to 300 degrees F. Set liners in muffin cups. <NEXT_STEP> Put the chocolate and prune juice in a microwave safe bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Heat in the microwave on low power stirring occasionally until completely melted. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the flour sugar cocoa powder baking soda baking powder and salt in a large bowl. <NEXT_STEP> In another bowl beat the egg and yolk with an electric hand mixer at high speed until slightly thick and lemon colored about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly add buttermilk oil vanilla and melted chocolate mixture to eggs beating until thoroughly combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the flour mixture and beat until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter among muffin tins filling them 1/2 of the way. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cupcakes comes out <NEXT_STEP> Put a dot of frosting in the middle of the wafer cookie and invert the cone shaped piece of cake on top to make a witches hat. <NEXT_STEP> Use skinny licorice toasted coconut or cereal flakes for hair and candies for eyes and/or nose. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate for up to 30 minutes before serving. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Wicked Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> popcorn <NEXT_INPUT> mascarpone <NEXT_INPUT> corn <NEXT_INPUT> caramel <NEXT_INPUT> ganache <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 24 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 2 2/3 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups gluten free all purpose baking mix <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup canola oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 ounces heavy whipping cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 ounces chopped good quality milk chocolate such as Callebaut <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 bag salted microwave popcorn popped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces salted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Two 7 ounce jars marshmallow creme <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces mascarpone <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup heavy whipping cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons vanilla bean paste <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon salt <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cake batter Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Line two 12 cup muffin pans with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer with a paddle attachment add the sugar gluten free baking mix cocoa powder and salt and mix on low speed until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time waiting until each is fully incorporated before adding the next. <NEXT_STEP> Add the milk oil and vanilla and mix on low speed until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Stop the mixer and scrape down the sides of the bowl to make sure all the ingredients are thoroughly combined. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the mixer to low and slowly pour in 1 cup hot water making sure it is evenly incorporated into the batter. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners two thirds full with the batter and bake until the top of each cupcake is slightly springy to the touch and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean 14 to 16 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Immediately turn the cupcakes out of the pans onto a cooling rack and let cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the chocolate ganache Put the cream in a saucepot and heat to a scald over medium heat. <NEXT_STEP> Do not boil Put the chocolate in a mixing bowl and pour the hot cream over it. <NEXT_STEP> Let it sit a moment and then gently stir to combine and melt the chocolate. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside to cool and thicken up slightly. <NEXT_STEP> The ganache can be made several days ahead of time and kept in an airtight container in the refrigerator. <NEXT_STEP> For the caramel corn Line a baking sheet with a silicone baking mat or parchment paper. <NEXT_STEP> Spread the popcorn out on the baking sheet and carefully pick out and discard any unpopped kernels. <NEXT_STEP> In a saucepot bring the butter sugar salt and 1/4 cup water to a rolling boil over medium high heat. <NEXT_STEP> Stirring constantly boil until the mixture thickens and darkens to the color of peanut butter. <NEXT_STEP> Just before the mixture starts to smoke quickly pour it over the popcorn on the baking sheet. <NEXT_STEP> Using two spatulas quickly toss the popcorn in the caramel to coat the corn and spread it out on the baking sheet. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside to cool completely and then break up into pieces. <NEXT_STEP> For the marshmallow creme mascarpone frosting In the bowl of a stand mixer using a whisk attachment combine the marshmallow creme mascarpone heavy cream vanilla extract vanilla bean paste and salt and whisk on low speed until there are no lumps and all the ingredients are combined. <NEXT_STEP> Turn to medium high speed and whip to medium firm peaks. <NEXT_STEP> Fit an 18 inch piping bag with a round tip and twist and hold the bag right by the tip to prevent the frosting from leaking out. <NEXT_STEP> Fold the top of the piping bag over your hand and spoon the frosting into the bag. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble dip each cupcake in the chocolate ganache roll in the caramel corn pieces to create a crunchy shell top with the marshmallow creme mascarpone frosting and drizzle with more chocolate ganache. <NEXT_STEP> Garnish with a piece of caramel corn <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Barbie's Creamy Dreamy Cupcake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> spiced <NEXT_INPUT> mascarpone <NEXT_INPUT> black <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 24 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1/2 cup extra dark chocolate chips <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup boiling water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup unsweetened applesauce <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup sour cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 large
