black pepper cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a standard muffin tin with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Place the chocolate and water in a bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Let sit for 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Stir the chocolate mixture until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add the applesauce sour cream oil vanilla and eggs. <NEXT_STEP> Beat until smooth about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the brownie mix flour granulated sugar cocoa pudding mix pepper cinnamon baking powder and salt to the chocolate mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Mix until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Scoop the batter into the muffin tin filling each cup three quarters full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until done 21 to 23 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> For the icing Whisk the heavy cream until stiff peaks form . <NEXT_STEP> In another bowl whisk together the mascarpone and confectioners sugar until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Gently fold the whipped cream into the mascarpone mixture until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Frost the cupcakes with the icing. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Spiced Black Pepper Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> caramel <NEXT_INPUT> salted <NEXT_INPUT> bean <NEXT_INPUT> mascarpone <NEXT_INPUT> sel <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 36 mini cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 6 tablespoons self rising flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 tablespoons all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 stick unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 egg at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 teaspoon vanilla bean paste <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 tablespoons butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup plus 1 tablespoon heavy cream at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon fleur de sel <NEXT_INGREDIENT> One 8 ounce package cream cheese <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 egg <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces mascarpone at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 stick unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon vanilla bean paste <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups confectioners sugar <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line mini cupcake pans with paper liners . <NEXT_STEP> For the vanilla bean cupcake In a small bowl combine the self rising and all purpose flours. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Using a stand mixer with the paddle attachment cream the butter on medium speed until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sugar gradually and beat until fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the egg. <NEXT_STEP> Add the flour mixture in two parts alternating with the milk and vanilla extract and mix until well blended. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in the vanilla bean paste. <NEXT_STEP> For the salted caramel Cook the sugar in a medium saucepan over medium heat whisking it occasionally as it melts until it turns a deep amber color. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter and stir until melted. <NEXT_STEP> Add the heavy cream and whisk until the caramel is smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat and let cool in a glass bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Add the fleur de sel. <NEXT_STEP> For the salted caramel cheesecake Mix together the cream cheese sugar vanilla and egg in a stand mixer with the whisk attachment until fluffy and smooth about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Mix in a third of the salted caramel. <NEXT_STEP> Layer the cupcake liners with some of the vanilla bean cupcake batter first. <NEXT_STEP> Add a drizzle of the salted caramel before adding a layer of the salted caramel cheesecake batter. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the liners with both batters about three quarters full because the cupcakes will rise. <NEXT_STEP> Bake about 18 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the vanilla bean mascarpone frosting Beat the mascarpone butter and vanilla in the bowl of an electric mixer. <NEXT_STEP> Add the confectioners sugar and beat until fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Frost the cooled cupcakes with the frosting decorating with the extra caramel. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Diamonds and Salted Caramel Are a Girl's Best Friend Cheesecake Cupcake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cake <NEXT_INPUT> german <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> pecan <NEXT_INPUT> layer <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> Tow 9-inch layer cakes or 24 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 4 ounces baker s chocolate <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups cake flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 pound unsalted butter room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 eggs separated <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup buttermilk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Coconut Pecan Filling recipe follows or whatever you prefer <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Favorite chocolate frosting for the sides <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups evaporated milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 egg yolks slightly beaten <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/2 cups flaked coconut <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups toasted pecans <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> In a microwave safe bowl add the chocolate and water and heat in a microwave or over a double boiler until melted. <NEXT_STEP> Stir until smooth and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a separate bowl sift together the cake flour baking soda and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. In the bowl of a stand mixer cream together the butter vanilla extract granulated sugar and brown sugar until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Add egg yolks 1 at a time beating well after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Blend in the melted chocolate. <NEXT_STEP> Add the flour mixture and buttermilk alternating until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the egg whites to a small bowl and beat with an egg beater until stiff peaks form. <NEXT_STEP> Gently fold the whites into the batter until well incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the batter evenly into two 9 inch cake pans or two 12 capacity cupcake tins. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean about 30 minutes for the larger cakes and 15 to 20 for the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the oven to a cooling rack and allow to cool completely before filling and frosting. <NEXT_STEP> To Assemble the German Chocolate Cake Put a cake layer on top of a serving plate and top with a generous layer of the caramel/pecan filling. <NEXT_STEP> Cover the frosting with another cake layer of and spread with the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Top with the final layer and frost. <NEXT_STEP> Spread dark chocolate frosting or your favorite chocolate frosting around the outside of the entire cake. <NEXT_STEP> Cut into wedges and serve. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the evaporated milk slightly beaten egg yolks granulated sugar brown sugar vanilla and butter in a large saucepan or heavy pot over low heat. <NEXT_STEP> When the butter melts raise the heat to medium stirring constantly. <NEXT_STEP> The mixture will thicken after 10 to 12 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat. <NEXT_STEP> Add the coconut and pecans and cool before frosting the cakes. <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 24 pieces SNICKERS Brand Miniatures <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup orange STARBURST Brand Jellybeans <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tube chocolate decorative frosting with plain tip <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup sliced almonds <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup M M S Brand Chocolate Candies <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> 1. <NEXT_STEP> Line the 2 muffin tins with the paper cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Prepare the cake mix and bake according to the package directions. <NEXT_STEP> 2. <NEXT_STEP> Let the cupcakes cool to room temperature. <NEXT_STEP> 3. <NEXT_STEP> In the meantime tint the frosting with yellow food coloring to the desired shade. <NEXT_STEP> Dab a teaspoon of frosting on the bottom of each SNICKERS Brand Miniatures and place one on top of each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> 4. <NEXT_STEP> Frost the top of the cupcake covering both the cupcake and candy. <NEXT_STEP> This will help support the frosting beehive. <NEXT_STEP> 5. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon the remaining frosting into a resealable plastic bag. <NEXT_STEP> Using scissors snip a small corner of the bag. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the frosting in a spiral fashion starting at the bottom of the hive and working your way up to the top. <NEXT_STEP> 6. <NEXT_STEP> Place jellybeans randomly around the cupcake hives and gently squeeze the chocolate frosting in a zigzag pattern on top of them. <NEXT_STEP> 7. <NEXT_STEP> For the bee s wings place an almond slice on both sides of each jellybean. <NEXT_STEP> 8. <NEXT_STEP> To serve create flower cut outs from the construction paper. <NEXT_STEP> Place the flowers on a table or serving tray put a hive on each flower and sprinkle with M M S Brand Chocolate Candies. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Beehive Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> ganache <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Ganache <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/2 cups granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup unsweetened cocoa <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 3/4 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup vegetable shortening <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup evaporated milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Dash of salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 10 ounces semisweet or bittersweet chocolate <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup heavy cream <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Cut cone shaped hole in top of cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Remove cone and cut off tip. <NEXT_STEP> Fill cavity in cupcake with cream filling. <NEXT_STEP> Replace cone top. <NEXT_STEP> Ice with soft ganache or icing. <NEXT_STEP> Preheat oven to 350 degrees. <NEXT_STEP> Grease 2 10 by 3 by 9 inch cake pans or cupcake molds. <NEXT_STEP> Cream butter and sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Add cocoa and cream. <NEXT_STEP> Add eggs one at a time creaming well after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Sift together dry ingredients. <NEXT_STEP> On first speed add dry ingredients in three stages alternating with water beginning and ending with dry. <NEXT_STEP> Mix only until well blended do not overmix. <NEXT_STEP> Pour into prepared pans and bake 35 to 45 minutes or until done. <NEXT_STEP> Cool in pan before turning out. <NEXT_STEP> Cream sugar and shortening until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> In separate bowl mix milk and flour. <NEXT_STEP> Beat milk mix into sugar mix and beat until well blended. <NEXT_STEP> Add salt and vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Melt chocolate in microwave or on top of double boiler. <NEXT_STEP> Bring cream to boil. <NEXT_STEP> Pour cream and melted chocolate into mixing bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Beat at low or medium speed for approximately 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool thoroughly before use or refrigerate until ready to use. <NEXT_STEP> Ganache can be stored covered in the refrigerator for one month. <NEXT_STEP> To use ganache remove from refrigerator and soften at room temperature or in microwave until useful consistency. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Magic Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> coconut <NEXT_INPUT> uniform <NEXT_INPUT> yellow <NEXT_INPUT> blue <NEXT_INPUT> nonpareil <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 24 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 box chocolate cake mix <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 cups sweetened shredded coconut <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Yellow red and blue food coloring <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup mini candy coated chocolates such as mini M and M s <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup mixed small fruit flavored candies such as Nerds <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup rainbow nonpareil sprinkles <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup jumbo rainbow nonpareil sprinkles <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 to 3 cups your favorite vanilla frosting or two 16 ounce containers store bought vanilla frosting <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Bake 24 cupcakes according to the box instructions. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment add 1 cup of the shredded coconut. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the mixer on low add 8 drops of yellow food coloring and mix until the coconut is a uniform bright yellow. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer to a bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Add another cup of the coconut to the bowl and turn the mixer on low. <NEXT_STEP> Add 6 drops of yellow food coloring and 4 drops of red food coloring and mix until the coconut is a uniform reddish orange . <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the coconut to a separate bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Wash and dry out the standing mixer bowl and add the remaining 1 cup coconut. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the mixer on low and add 6 to 8 drops of blue food coloring. <NEXT_STEP> Mix until the coconut is a uniform bright blue. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer to a third bowl. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium bowl mix together the chocolate candies fruit candies and nonpareils. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Using a 1/2 inch round cutter cut out a well in each cupcake . <NEXT_STEP> Use a small spoon to scoop out the wells being careful not to go all the way through the bottom of the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Fill each cupcake well about two thirds full with the mixed candy about a heaping tablespoon. <NEXT_STEP> Cover the holes with the reserved cut out tops. <NEXT_STEP> Frost the cupcakes with the vanilla frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Press some of the blue coconut onto the outer third of the top of each cupcake to form a stripe then press some of the yellow coconut in the center third and finally the orange coconut in the final third. <NEXT_STEP> You should have 3 equal stripes on the top of each cupcake. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Pinata Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> fudge <NEXT_INPUT> cookie <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/2 cups chocolate sandwich wafer cookies finely ground <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 tablespoons unsalted butter melted <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/8 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups teaspoon cream of tartar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line cupcake pans with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Sift together the flour sugar cocoa baking soda baking powder and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl combine the buttermilk oil eggs and vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly add the wet ingredients to the dry. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly stir in the coffee and water. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake pans about two thirds full. <NEXT_STEP> Place a piece of Chocolate Fudge Cookie Bar in each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cakes comes out clean 9 to 11 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool completely and then frost with Marshmallow Meringue Frosting and enjoy Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Combine the cookie crumbs and salt with the melted butter. <NEXT_STEP> Press into the bottom of a greased 13 by 9 inch pan. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 8 minutes and let cool. <NEXT_STEP> Melt the chocolate chips and condensed milk together until completely melted and combined. <NEXT_STEP> Pour over the cookie crust and let cool. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the sugar water egg whites and cream of tartar over a double boiler until stiff peaks form 10 to 12 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat and stir in the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Continue beating until the frosting is thick about 3 minutes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate Fudge Cupcakes filled with Chocolate Fudge Cookie Bar and Marshmallow Meringue Frosting <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> beef <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> bacon <NEXT_INPUT> cheeseburger <NEXT_INPUT> pickle <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> Baking spray with flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 slices white bread <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces lean ground beef <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 teaspoon kosher salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 slices bacon <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 medium red onion chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon spicy mustard <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon sweet pickle relish <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 ounces sharp Cheddar cut into 12 cubes <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup sour cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Our Special Sauce <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup mayonnaise <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons ketchup <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Garnishes <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Shredded romaine lettuce <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Sliced tomatoes <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Chopped red onion <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Dill pickle slices <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Line one 12 cup standard muffin tin with paper cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Spray the liners with baking spray. <NEXT_STEP> Cut a 2 inch round from each slice of bread and toast in the oven on a baking sheet until lightly browned. <NEXT_STEP> Save the rest for breadcrumbs. <NEXT_STEP> Place a piece of toast in the bottom of each cup and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Cook the ground beef in a 10 inch skillet over medium heat until browned stirring occasionally about 6 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in 1/2 teaspoon salt and the pepper. <NEXT_STEP> Drain off any fat if necessary and place the beef in a medium bowl set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Wipe out the skillet with a paper towel and cook the bacon over medium heat until crisp turning once about 6 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove and drain on paper towels. <NEXT_STEP> Remove all but 1 tablespoon of the bacon fat from the skillet and add the onions. <NEXT_STEP> Cook over medium heat stirring frequently until the onions are very soft about 8 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the mustard and relish. <NEXT_STEP> Stir into the bowl with the ground beef. <NEXT_STEP> Divide evenly between the prepared cups. <NEXT_STEP> Place a cheese cube in each cup and push gently down into the meat mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk together the flour baking powder and remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk together the milk sour cream and eggs in a 1 quart glass measuring cup. <NEXT_STEP> Add the milk mixture to the flour mixture and whisk just until blended. <NEXT_STEP> Return to the measuring cup. <NEXT_STEP> Pour over the beef mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cupcakes comes out clean 18 to 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes in the tin on a rack for 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> For the sauce Combine the mayonnaise ketchup and relish. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Drizzle the cooled cupcakes with the sauce. <NEXT_STEP> Garnish with the reserved bacon and with lettuce tomato onions and pickles. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Cheeseburger Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> coconut <NEXT_INPUT> cake <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> eat <NEXT_INPUT> individual <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 large cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 1/2 cups unsalted butter cut into pieces <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup freshly brewed coffee <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup water or milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup unsweetened Dutch process cocoa <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 1/4 cups granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 teaspoon fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup sour cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 large eggs room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Confectioners sugar for dusting <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 ounces semisweet chocolate finely chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup canned unsweetened coconut milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 to 2 tablespoons corn syrup <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups unsweetened coconut chips or shredded coconut lightly toasted <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line the large muffin tins with large cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Put the butter coffee water and cocoa in a microwave safe bowl cover with plastic wrap and microwave on HIGH until the butter melts about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk to combine. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile whisk the flour granulated sugar baking powder salt and baking soda in a large bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the sour cream with the egg and vanilla in a small bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the hot cocoa mixture into the dry ingredients. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the sour cream mixture just to combine don t overmix. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter evenly between the prepared muffin tins filling each one about 3/4 of the way full . <NEXT_STEP> Bake cupcakes until a toothpick inserted in the center of the cake comes out clean about 30 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes completely in the tin on a rack. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from liners and return cakes to a rack. <NEXT_STEP> For the glaze Put chocolate in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Bring coconut milk and corn syrup to a boil stirring constantly then pour it over the chocolate. <NEXT_STEP> Let the mixture stand for 10 minutes then stir until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Spread 1 tablespoon warm glaze evenly over each cake then scatter the coconut over the top. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Have Your Own Cake and Eat It Too (Individual Chocolate Cakes) <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> 1/4 cup plus 1 tablespoon cornstarch <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/2 cups whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup mashed bananas <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon unsalted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Yellow food coloring <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 sticks unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 large eggs at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup buttermilk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups peanut butter chips <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Banana chips for topping <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Make the pudding Whisk the sugar cornstarch and salt in a medium saucepan. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk in the milk until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Place the pan over medium high heat and bring to a boil stirring constantly. <NEXT_STEP> Add the mashed bananas and reduce the heat to medium. <NEXT_STEP> Cook stirring until thickened about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the butter and vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Strain the pudding through a medium mesh sieve into a medium bowl pressing the pudding through with a rubber spatula. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk in a few drops of the yellow food coloring if desired . <NEXT_STEP> Place plastic wrap directly on the surface of the pudding to prevent a skin from forming. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate until chilled at least 2 hours. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile make the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 . <NEXT_STEP> Line two 12 cup muffin pans with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the flour baking powder salt and baking soda in a large bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the butter and sugar in a separate large bowl with a mixer on medium high speed until fluffy about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the speed to medium and beat in the eggs one at a time then beat in the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the speed to low and beat in half the flour mixture then the buttermilk then the remaining flour mixture until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the peanut butter chips. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter among the prepared muffin cups filling them about three quarters of the way. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until lightly browned and a toothpick inserted into the centers comes out clean 25 to 30 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool 10 minutes in the pans then transfer the cupcakes to racks to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the pudding vigorously to loosen. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer to a piping bag fitted with a 1/4 inch round tip. <NEXT_STEP> Insert the tip into the center of each cupcake and fill with pudding then pipe more of the pudding on top. <NEXT_STEP> Top with banana chips. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Peanut Butter Cupcakes with Banana Pudding <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> plug <NEXT_INPUT> cream <NEXT_INPUT> corn <NEXT_INPUT> setting <NEXT_INPUT> beat <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> Nonstick vegetable spray for coating muffin tin <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 cups cake flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 10 tablespoons unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup buttermilk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup coffee brewed strong and hot <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Vanilla Cream Filling recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Ganache Frosting recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 tablespoons vegetable shortening <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 tablespoons unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup light corn syrup <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 ounces semisweet chocolate coarsely chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup heavy cream <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Set a rack in the middle of the oven and preheat to 350 degrees. <NEXT_STEP> Generously coat a 12 slot muffin tin with nonstick vegetable spray. <NEXT_STEP> Into a large bowl sift the flour cocoa baking soda baking powder and salt together three times. <NEXT_STEP> In a mixing bowl beat the butter and sugar together at high speed for 15 seconds until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time beating until each is incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Continue beating until light and fluffy about 6 minutes more. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on its lowest setting beat in a third of the flour mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the buttermilk and vanilla then another third of the flour. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the coffee and then the remaining flour. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cups of the muffin tin two thirds full and bake for 15 minutes or until the centers spring back when lightly pressed and a cake tester comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Set the pan on a rack to cool. <NEXT_STEP> With a small knife carefully carve a 1 inch round by 1 inch deep plug out of the bottoms of the cupcakes you re going to need the plug to refill the hole so don t chuck it out. <NEXT_STEP> Fill with vanilla cream. <NEXT_STEP> Cut a 1/4 inch disk off the cake plug and cover the exposed cream. <NEXT_STEP> Dunk the cupcakes into the frosting to coat then place on a rack frosted side up. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer to the refrigerator for 20 minutes to set before serving. <NEXT_STEP> With an electric mixer beat together the vegetable shortening and butter until blended. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the mixer down to its lowest setting and gradually add the confectioners sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the mixer back up and beat a high speed until light and fluffy about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> At a drizzle gradually beat in the vanilla and corn syrup until the filling is the consistency of mayonnaise about 2 minutes more. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape the vanilla cream frosting into a pastry bag fitted with a 1/4 inch plain tip. <NEXT_STEP> Put the chocolate in a small bowl. <NEXT_STEP> In a small saucepan over medium heat bring the cream just to the simmering point. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the hot cream over the chocolate and working from the center out gently stir with a whisk to melt the chocolate and blend until smooth. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Cream-Filled Devil's Food Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> spinach <NEXT_INPUT> feta <NEXT_INPUT> follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> White luster for decorating <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Edible pearls for decorating <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 10 egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 15 ounces sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 pounds butter beating until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Gently add the flour mixture in two batches alternating with the milk mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the bowl from the mixer and fold in the moscato. <NEXT_STEP> in the bowl of stand mixer. <NEXT_STEP> Set the bowl over a pot of gently simmering water and heat stirring with a wooden spoon until the sugar has dissolved and is warm to the touch . <NEXT_STEP> speed whip until glossy and stiff about 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Switch to the paddle attachment and lower the speed to medium. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter piece by piece incorporating each before adding more. <NEXT_STEP> Lower the speed further and mix until silky and smooth. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Moscato Cupcakes with Duff's Swiss Meringue Buttercream <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> chocolate milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup canola oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> One 19.5 ounce package dark chocolate cake mix <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 tablespoons unsalted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> One and a half 7 ounce jars marshmallow creme <NEXT_INGREDIENT> One 10 ounce bag dark chocolate chips <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon light corn syrup <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Half 12 ounce can whipped vanilla frosting <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line twenty four 2 1/2 inch muffin cups with paper baking cups and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl combine the chocolate milk oil eggs and the cake mix beat with an electric mixer on low speed for 30 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Using a rubber spatula scrape down sides of the bowl and beat on medium speed for 2 minutes more. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon the batter into the prepared muffin cups filling each two thirds full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a wooden pick inserted in the centers comes out clean 18 to 24 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the muffin tins and cool on wire racks. <NEXT_STEP> For the marshmallow filling in a large microwave safe bowl microwave the butter on high setting for 20 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the marshmallow creme. <NEXT_STEP> Microwave on medium setting for 1 minute more. <NEXT_STEP> Cool for 2 minutes and then beat with an electric mixer until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Make a 1/2 inch slit in the bottom center of each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon the marshmallow filling into a pastry bag fitted with a round tip. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the filling into the slits in the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Place the chocolate chips in a medium microwave safe bowl and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a small saucepan combine the cream and corn syrup. <NEXT_STEP> Cook over medium heat just until boiling. <NEXT_STEP> Pour over the chocolate chips and stir until completely smooth. <NEXT_STEP> If not completely smooth microwave on medium setting for 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool until the mixture thickens about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Dip the cupcake tops into the chocolate mixture. <NEXT_STEP> If necessary use a knife to smooth the tops. <NEXT_STEP> Place the cupcakes into another paper liner and let the chocolate harden a bit. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon the vanilla frosting into a pastry bag filled with a small round tip. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe a line of small loops across the center of each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Allow the chocolate mixture to set. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Black and White Cupcakes <INGREDIENT_START> 1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 large egg <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon grated orange zest <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 ounces semisweet chocolate chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch of cream of tartar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Orange gel food coloring for tinting <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Make the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a 12 cup muffin pan with liners. <NEXT_STEP> Put the cocoa powder in a large bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Microwave the milk and water in a small microwave safe bowl until steaming 1 to 2 minutes pour over the cocoa powder and whisk until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool slightly. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the flour baking soda and salt in a small bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the sugar vegetable oil egg vanilla and orange zest into the cocoa mixture then whisk in the flour mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter among the prepared muffin cups filling them three quarters of the way. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until the tops of the cupcakes spring back when gently pressed 20 to 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool 5 minutes in the pan then remove to a rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Make the ganache Microwave the chocolate and heavy cream in a microwave safe bowl in 30 second intervals stirring until melted about 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Let sit until thickened but still pourable 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon over the cupcakes gently spreading to cover. <NEXT_STEP> Let set 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile make the meringue Whisk the egg whites sugar and cream of tartar in a large heatproof bowl set over a saucepan of simmering water . <NEXT_STEP> Cook whisking until the sugar dissolves 2 to 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat beat with a mixer on medium high speed until stiff glossy peaks form 5 to 8 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Tint with orange food coloring. <NEXT_STEP> Generously spread the meringue on the cupcakes and lightly brown with a kitchen torch. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate-Orange cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons mint extract <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line 24 muffin cups with liners. <NEXT_STEP> For the crust In a small bowl stir together the crushed cookies and butter until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Divide among the prepared cupcake cups. <NEXT_STEP> Using a small juice glass or your fingers press the crumbs into the bottom of the cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until fragrant about 8 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the cupcakes In a large bowl whisk together the sugar flour cocoa baking powder baking soda and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs milk oil and vanilla and using a hand mixer beat on medium speed 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the boiling water. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the batter into the prepared cupcake liners . <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a wooden pick inserted in the center comes out clean 17 to 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool 10 minutes in the pan. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the cupcakes from the tins and transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the buttercream Meanwhile in the bowl of an electric mixer beat the butter until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually add the confectioners sugar until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the salt mint extract and if using food coloring. <NEXT_STEP> Beat until creamy about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the buttercream to a pastry bag fitted with a medium round tip. <NEXT_STEP> Using an apple corer remove the center of the cupcake down to the cookie crust. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcakes with buttercream and smooth the tops with an offset spatula. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> For the ganache Place the chocolate in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium saucepan heat the butter and heavy cream until steaming . <NEXT_STEP> Add the extract. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the hot cream over the chocolate and let stand 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Using a rubber spatula stir until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool slightly about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Dip the tops of the cupcakes into the melted chocolate . <NEXT_STEP> Let the cupcakes set on a wire rack before serving about 1 hour. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Thin Mint Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> peanut <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> glaze vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 10 ounce bag peanut butter chips <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon unsalted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 ounces milk chocolate finely chopped <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Make the cupcakes Position a rack in the middle of the oven and preheat to 350 degrees F using the convection setting if available. <NEXT_STEP> Line a 24 cup mini muffin pan with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the butter cocoa powder and 1/4 cup water in a microwave safe bowl cover with plastic wrap and microwave until the butter melts about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk to combine then whisk in the brown sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the flour baking powder baking soda and salt in a large bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk in the warm cocoa mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate until the topping is set about 10 minutes then beat with a mixer until fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer to a pastry bag with a 1 inch round tip and pipe peaks onto each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Place in the freezer while you make the glaze. <NEXT_STEP> Make the glaze Put the butter chocolate and 3 tablespoons hot water in a small deep microwave safe bowl cover with plastic wrap and microwave on 50 percent power until the chocolate melts about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Dip the frozen peaks of each cupcake into the glaze letting the excess drip off. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate until set about 5 minutes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Mini Peanut Butter Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> layer <NEXT_INPUT> flavoring <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Position an oven rack in the center of the oven and preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. the sprinkles and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the egg whites in a bowl and beat with an electric mixer on medium speed until frothy about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the cream of tartar and beat until soft peaks form about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually add the granulated sugar about 1 tablespoon at a time. <NEXT_STEP> Increase the speed to medium high and continue beating until the peaks are stiff and very shiny about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the vanilla and lemon zest. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the bowl from the mixer. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle 1/4 of the flour mixture over the egg whites and gently fold in with a rubber spatula. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in the remaining flour mixture in 3 additions. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter evenly among the lined muffin cups mounding it so it s taller than the liners. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until the cupcakes spring back when pressed gently with your fingertip and a toothpick inserted in the centers comes out clean 14 to 16 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool in the pan for a few minutes then transfer to a rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting Put the cream cheese and confectioners sugar in a medium bowl and beat with an electric mixer on medium high speed until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add the heavy cream and vanilla and continue to beat until the mixture forms stiff peaks. <NEXT_STEP> When ready to serve top each cupcake with a generous dollop of frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Use the back of a spoon to swirl the frosting a little. <NEXT_STEP> Decorate each cupcake with some sprinkles. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Birthday Angel's Food Cupcakes with Peanut Butter Buttercream Frosting <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> lime <NEXT_INPUT> gelatin <NEXT_INPUT> key <NEXT_INPUT> meringue <NEXT_INPUT> bean <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 24 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 1/2 cups gluten free ginger spice or graham cracker cookie crumbs such as Pamela s Spicy Gingersnapz <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 tablespoons salted butter melted <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces salted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons vanilla bean paste <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 2/3 cups gluten free all purpose baking mix <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon lemon juice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 teaspoon powdered gelatin <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup heavy whipping cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup prepared key lime curd <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 pound sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 7 ounces egg whites at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon cream of tartar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons vanilla bean paste <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cookie crumb mixture Mix together the cookie crumbs and melted butter in a small bowl. <NEXT_STEP> For the cake batter Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Line two 12 cup muffin pans with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Put 1 tablespoon of the cookie crumb mixture in the bottom of each cupcake liner. <NEXT_STEP> Set the muffin pans aside. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer with a paddle attachment beat the butter on medium speed until light in color and fluffy about 6 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sugar and continue beating until uniformly incorporated into the butter stop the mixer and scrape down the sides of the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Restart the mixer on low speed and add the eggs one at a time waiting until each egg is fully incorporated before adding the next. <NEXT_STEP> Once the eggs have been added stop the mixer and scrape down the sides of the bowl to insure that all of the ingredients are incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla bean paste and blend uniformly. <NEXT_STEP> Add the gluten free baking mix in three additions alternating with the milk in two additions fully incorporating each addition into the batter before moving to the next. <NEXT_STEP> If needed stop the mixer after each addition scrape down the sides of the bowl and resume mixing on low. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners two thirds full with the batter and bake until the top of each cupcake is slightly springy to the touch and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean 14 to 16 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Immediately turn the cupcakes out of the pans onto a cooling rack and let cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the lime filling In a small bowl mix 1 tablespoon water with the lemon juice sprinkle the gelatin over the liquid and let the gelatin bloom and hydrate. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer whip the cream on high speed to medium firm peaks. <NEXT_STEP> Melt the bloomed gelatin in the microwave just until melted and clear 15 to 20 seconds do not overheat as this will kill the gelatin Stir the key lime curd into the gelatin until all mixed in and then pour the lime curd into the whipping cream. <NEXT_STEP> Mix completely and refrigerate until ready to use. <NEXT_STEP> For the meringue frosting In a small saucepot combine the sugar and 1/3 cup water and set over high heat. <NEXT_STEP> With a wet pastry brush wipe down any sugar crystals on the sides of the pot. <NEXT_STEP> Cook until the sugar mixture registers 280 degrees F on a candy thermometer. <NEXT_STEP> While the sugar syrup is cooking beat the egg whites and cream of tartar in the bowl of a stand mixer with a whisk attachment on medium high speed until the mixture reaches the medium peak stage. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the mixer down to medium low and very very very slowly pour the hot sugar syrup into the whipping egg whites. <NEXT_STEP> Once all the sugar is added add the vanilla bean paste and turn the speed up to high. <NEXT_STEP> Whip until the mixture is very light and fluffy and the mixing bowl is no longer hot to the touch about 9 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Fit an 18 inch piping bag with a star tip and twist and hold the bag right by the tip to prevent the frosting from leaking out. <NEXT_STEP> Fold the top of the piping bag over your hand and spoon the meringue frosting into the bag. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble use an apple corer or paring knife to core out the center of each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Fill each cupcake with some of the lime filling and top with some of the meringue frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Use a blowtorch to lightly toast the top of the meringue. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Barbie's Florida Key Lime Pie Cupcake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pumpkin <NEXT_INPUT> spice oil vanilla apple cider vinegar food coloring and egg in a large bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Fold the flour mixture into the buttermilk mixture in two batches until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Pour about 1/4 cup cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons premium fruit pectin such as Sure Jell <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 vanilla bean seeded <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Dash of salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 pound butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup port wine <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Place 24 cupcake liners in cupcake pans. <NEXT_STEP> In an electric mixer with the paddle attachment cream the butter and sugar for 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl and then add the eggs one at a time. <NEXT_STEP> Add the almond extract and food coloring. <NEXT_STEP> In a separate bowl combine the absinthe and heavy whipping cream. <NEXT_STEP> In another bowl sift the flour baking powder and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the mixer to the lowest setting and then add the almond meal flour mixture and absinthe mixture alternating the ingredients starting with the dry and <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners with 2 1/2 ounces of cupcake batter. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 21 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> After cooling frost with the Port Wine Black Currant Swiss Merengue Buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> For the black currant preserves Combine and dissolve the currants grape juice sugar and pectin in saucepan. <NEXT_STEP> Cook on medium to high heat stirring constantly. <NEXT_STEP> When the mixture reaches a boil continue to cook for 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool in the refrigerator. <NEXT_STEP> For the buttercream Dissolve the sugar egg whites salt and vanilla bean seeds over a double boiler. <NEXT_STEP> Lightly whisk until the egg white mixture is hot to the touch. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the hot whites into a room temperature mixing bowl and whip with a whisk attachment on high until stiff peaks form and the mixture is double in volume. <NEXT_STEP> Cut the butter into 2 inch pieces. <NEXT_STEP> Change to a paddle attachment and slowly add a few pieces of butter at a time. <NEXT_STEP> Continue beating until the mixture begins to look light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Stop the mixer and scrape the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the speed to low. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla extract and continue to beat on LOW speed for 45 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Once thoroughly combined slowly add the port wine and 1/2 cup black current preserves and then beat on medium to high speed until all ingredients are fully combined an additional 45 to 60 seconds. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Absinthe, Almond, Black Currant and Cherry Cupcakes with Poppy Seeds <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <NEXT_STEP> Immediately transfer to a medium bowl and let cool slightly. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk in the granulated sugar eggs milk and vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the all purpose flour almond flour baking powder pumpkin pie spice and salt in a large bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Add the brown butter mixture and whisk until just combined . <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter among the prepared muffin cups filling them of each cupcake to look like a stem and drape the green sour gummy belt candy to look like a vine. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with the remaining cupcakes and candy. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate until the frosting is slightly firm about 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> For the royal icing Whisk together the confectioners sugar and meringue powder in a large bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Add 3 tablespoons water and beat with a mixer on medium high speed until soft glossy peaks form adding up to 1 more tablespoon water if necessary . <NEXT_STEP> Tint with black gel food coloring until very black. <NEXT_STEP> Cover the bowl with a damp paper towel and plastic wrap to prevent the icing from drying out until ready to use. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the royal icing to a piping bag fitted with a small round tip. <NEXT_STEP> Pie jack o lantern faces on each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside until the royal icing has set about 30 minutes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Jack-O-Lantern Pumpkin Spice Cupcakes <TITLE_END> smooth it over the top allowing the frosting to cover the small gaps between the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Use the white frosting to pipe the football s laces and the white markings on either end of the the flour shredded coconut granulated sugar baking powder and salt in a large bowl with an electric mixer on low speed until combined about 15 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter 1 tablespoon at a time continuing to beat on low speed until the mixture forms a ball about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Stop the mixer and add half the cream of coconut mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Beat on low speed until the flour mixture is moistened about 15 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Increase the mixer speed to medium and beat until the batter is light and fluffy about 45 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer still running slowly yolk mixture back into the saucepan and reduce the heat to medium. <NEXT_STEP> Cook until the filling thickens and boils stirring constantly. <NEXT_STEP> Strain the filling through a fine mesh sieve. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the filling before assembling the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Yield about 1 1/4 cups. <NEXT_STEP> For the orange cream cheese icing Beat the cream cheese and butter in a large bowl with an <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the orange zest and vanilla extract until fully incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Yield 3 cups. <NEXT_STEP> For the garnish Generously sprinkle the pineapple with sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Use a cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Dig a small hole inside each of the cupcakes using a teaspoon. <NEXT_STEP> Fill each hole with the mango filing. <NEXT_STEP> Top with the orange cream cheese icing. marshmallows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 cups rice cereal such as Rice Krispies <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Line cupcake or muffin pans with 24 liners. <NEXT_STEP> In a mixing bowl combine the flours granulated sugar baking powder and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Add in the butter and sour cream. <NEXT_STEP> In a pitcher combine the milk vanilla extract and eggs. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly add into the butter flour mixture until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the shredded coconut and coconut extract. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners and bake for 20 minutes rotating halfway through. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the oven and cool completely before frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcakes with Lychee Curd. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe with Kumquat Swiss Meringue Buttercream Frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Top with a Crispy Treat. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium pot over medium heat combine the pureed lychee granulated sugar lime juice and eggs whisking until combined and it comes to a low simmer. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat and add in the butter whisking until the butter is melted. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate immediately. <NEXT_STEP> Over medium heat warm the granulated sugar and egg whites over a double boiler until the sugar is fully dissolved. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat and transfer to a stand mixer and whip using the whisk attachment until room temperature. <NEXT_STEP> Switch to the paddle attachment and beat in the butter 2 tablespoons at a time. <NEXT_STEP> Whip until the frosting becomes light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the preserves and extract. <NEXT_STEP> Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Liberally spray a baking sheet with pan spray. <NEXT_STEP> Toast the quinoa until golden about 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Melt the butter and marshmallows in the microwave until the marshmallows begin to puff up. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the cereal and toasted quinoa. <NEXT_STEP> Spread out in a thin layer on a baking sheet. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate and then cut into squares. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Eat It Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sausage <NEXT_INPUT> ricotta <NEXT_INPUT> wrapper <NEXT_INPUT> meat <NEXT_INPUT> mango <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 2 tablespoons olive oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cinnamon stick <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 whole cloves <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 medium onion finely diced <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 cloves garlic minced <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 pound mild Italian chicken sausage casing removed <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup tomato paste <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 crushed tomatoes <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup chopped fresh basil plus 12 whole small leaves <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup part skim ricotta <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup freshly grated Parmesan plus more for topping <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups shredded mozzarella plus more for topping <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup mango chutney <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 package wonton wrappers <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. For the meat sauce In a large skillet over medium high heat warm the olive oil until it shimmers. <NEXT_STEP> Add the cinnamon stick and whole cloves. <NEXT_STEP> Add the onion sprinkle with a little salt and saute until softened but not browned. <NEXT_STEP> Add the garlic and saute until fragrant about 1 minute longer. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sausage breaking up the clumps with your spoon. <NEXT_STEP> Cook until the sausage is no longer pink 2 to 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the tomato paste and cook 1 to 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the crushed tomatoes 1/4 cup chopped basil as well as some salt and pepper. <NEXT_STEP> Stir to combine and simmer uncovered for about 15 minutes stirring every now and then. <NEXT_STEP> Allow the meat sauce to cool about 15 minutes before building lasagna cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> As the meat sauce is cooking prepare the ricotta filling. <NEXT_STEP> For the ricotta filling Stir together the ricotta 3/4 cup Parmesan 3/4 cup mozzarella and mango chutney. <NEXT_STEP> Season with lots of pepper about a teaspoon and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble the cupcakes Pull out your favorite cupcake pan. <NEXT_STEP> If your pan is not nonstick spray the cups with cooking spray. <NEXT_STEP> Place a wonton wrapper in each cup. <NEXT_STEP> Don t worry if you re using square ones. <NEXT_STEP> Drop about 1 tablespoon of meat sauce into the bottom of each cup. <NEXT_STEP> Then add 1 teaspoon of ricotta filling. <NEXT_STEP> Then cover with another wonton wrapper rotating it about 90 degrees so that the corners of the first wrapper and the second wrapper aren t right on top of each other. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat this until you ve built 3 layers total. <NEXT_STEP> Top each with a small basil leaf then another wonton wrapper. <NEXT_STEP> Finish each cupcake with a spoonful of meat sauce a little shredded mozzarella and pinch of grated Parmesan. <NEXT_STEP> Pop them into the oven and bake for 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> When time s up resist the temptation to eat them right away or else you ll burn your mouth Let them rest on the counter for about 10 minutes and they should slip out of the muffin tin easily. <NEXT_STEP> Top with more shredded basil if you like. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Lasagna Cupcakes with Sausage and Mango Chutney <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> fondant <NEXT_INPUT> cream <NEXT_INPUT> ounce in the pan. <NEXT_STEP> Tap down with the bottom of a whisk to make a hard flat surface in the bottom of the cupcake liner. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> For the cheesecake batter In a cheese and butter stopping to scrape down the bowl and ensure there are no lumps. <NEXT_STEP> Add the confectioners sugar and blue food coloring and mix to fully incorporate. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> .06 ounce container edible star glitter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup turbinado sugar <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line two 2 dozen mini cupcake pans with paper cupcake liners and spray with oil spray. <NEXT_STEP> For the crust In a food processor fitted with the blade attachment add the hazelnuts brown sugar and gingersnaps and pulse until a medium fine paste. <NEXT_STEP> Then add the butter and liqueur and pulse until it s a paste that sticks when pinched with your fingers. <NEXT_STEP> Place 1 tablespoon of the crust into the prepared pans. <NEXT_STEP> For the cupcakes In a medium bowl sift together the flour baking powder and salt set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of an upright mixer fitted with the paddle attachment cream the butter and brown sugar until light and fluffy 3 to 4 minutes scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the eggs one at a time and then beat in the extracts. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on low speed add the flour mixture in three parts alternating with the buttermilk and beginning and ending with the flour mixture beat until combined after each combine the brown sugar evaporated milk and butter and cook for 10 minutes stirring constantly with a wooden spoon. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat and allow to slightly cool . <NEXT_STEP> Reserve for assembly. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting In the bowl of an upright mixer fitted with the paddle attachment beat the butter and salt together until lightened and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the speed to low and add the confectioners sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Mix until thoroughly combined. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl and add the caramel sauce heavy cream and vanilla bean paste. <NEXT_STEP> Beat on medium high speed until light and airy and completely mixed about 2 minutes). <NEXT_STEP> Place in a pastry bag fitted with a small star tip and leave at room temperature. <NEXT_STEP> For the stars Lay out a large piece of parchment paper on a baking sheet on your work surface and spray with oil spray. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium saucepan mix the granulated sugar salt and 3/4 cup water stir over low heat until the sugar dissolves to make a syrup. <NEXT_STEP> Increase the heat and bring the syrup to a boil. <NEXT_STEP> Lower the heat slightly and swirl the pan once or twice so the syrup colors evenly to a golden blonde. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat and transfer to a flat work surface. <NEXT_STEP> Dip the tines of a fork into the golden blonde colored caramel and in sweeping motions make a star pattern on the parchment paper. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat until the desired amount of stars is achieved. <NEXT_STEP> Allow the caramel to harden and then gently lift off the parchment paper and reserve for cupcake adornments. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Dip the tops of the cooled cupcakes in the room temperature butterscotch glaze. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the caramel buttercream frosting in a 1 inch diameter rosette on top of the glazed cupcakes and sprinkle with edible star glitter and turbinado sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Then finish by adorning with a radiating star topper. <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> brushstrokes <NEXT_INPUT> candy <NEXT_INPUT> melting <NEXT_INPUT> turkey <NEXT_INPUT> front <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 24 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> One 15.25 ounce box chocolate cake mix plus required ingredients <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/2 ounces white melting candy <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 ounces yellow melting candy <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 ounces orange melting candy <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 ounces red melting candy <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Two 16 ounce tubs chocolate frosting <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 24 milk chocolate drop candies such as Hershey s Kisses <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 24 miniature twist pretzels <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Bake 24 cupcakes according to the package directions. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile cut 4 sheets of parchment to about the size of baking sheets. <NEXT_STEP> In separate microwave safe bowls melt the melting candy in the microwave in 10 second intervals until fully melted. <NEXT_STEP> Dip a 1/2 inch paintbrush into one color of melted candy making sure you have a generous amount on the brush. <NEXT_STEP> Paint a 1 inch stripe on one of the parchment pieces the line should be opaque brush on more if necessary. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with the remaining melts covering each piece of parchment with different colored candy lines. <NEXT_STEP> You should have 72 brushstrokes of the white candy and 96 brushstrokes each of the yellow orange and red candy. <NEXT_STEP> If the bowls of melting candy harden during the process soften in the microwave as needed. <NEXT_STEP> Let the stripes set at room temperature until dried about 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe or spread a generous amount of frosting on the cupcakes . <NEXT_STEP> Press a milk chocolate drop candy point side up on each cupcake positioning it on the lower third of the center. <NEXT_STEP> These are the turkey tails. <NEXT_STEP> Cut or break each pretzel so you get 2 T shaped pieces out of each one. <NEXT_STEP> These will be the turkeys feet. <NEXT_STEP> Next add the feathers Carefully peel off 4 red brushstrokes and insert them in a row along the top edge of a cupcake at a 45 degree angle. <NEXT_STEP> These are the back feathers. <NEXT_STEP> Make a second row of 4 orange brushstrokes in front of the red ones. <NEXT_STEP> Then add 4 yellow brushstrokes in front of the orange and 3 white brushstrokes in front of the yellow. <NEXT_STEP> Insert a pretzel foot on either side of the chocolate drop candy. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with the remaining ingredients to make 23 more cupcakes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Turkey <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 cups brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 cups granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 raw flour and the all purpose flour. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl cream the granulated sugar butter milk and vanilla extract. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs incrementally alternating with the flour mixture. the vanilla extract last. <NEXT_STEP> Heat the oil over medium heat in a large saucepan. <NEXT_STEP> Mix the granulated and brown sugar together. <NEXT_STEP> Cut any desired shape in the raw flour until bubbling about 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk in the cocoa powder until dissolved. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk in the granulated sugar oil vanilla and egg until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in the flour mixture until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter among the cupcake liners . <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean 15 to 18 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let the cupcakes cool in the pan for 10 minutes then remove to a wire rack to cool completely about 1 hour. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the butter in an electric mixer fitted with a paddle attachment on candies into boot shapes and mold them over the straws. <NEXT_STEP> To make the witches hats Twist open the chocolate sandwich cookies so you have 12 circles. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape away the white frosting and save for another use. <NEXT_STEP> Spread a small amount of colored frosting into the center of each cookie and top with a milk chocolate candy. <NEXT_STEP> To decorate the cupcakes Pipe purple frosting onto 3 cupcakes orange frosting onto 3 cupcakes green frosting onto 3 cupcakes and blue frosting onto the remaining 3 cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Place a hat offset on top of the frosting of each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Arrange some shredded wheat underneath each hat to mimic hair. <NEXT_STEP> Stick 2 legs into each cupcake opposite the hat so they are slightly slanted upward. <STEP_END> <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons red gel paste food coloring <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup sour cream at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon white vinegar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Red pink and white miniature nonpareils for sprinkling <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 large egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoons cream of tartar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 to 3 drops pure almond extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Equipment Standard 12 muffin tin <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line the muffin tin with pink or white cupcake liners In a medium bowl sift together the flour cocoa powder and salt. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a standing mixer fitted with the paddle attachment beat the butter and sugar on high speed until light and fluffy about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Occasionally turn off mixer and scrape down the sides of the bowl with a rubber spatula. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the speed to low add the eggs 1 at a time and mix until incorporated after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Add the food coloring and vanilla and mix well. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on low alternately add the flour mixture and sour cream in 3 additions beginning and ending with the flour waiting until each addition is well incorporated before adding the next. <NEXT_STEP> In a small bowl combine the vinegar and soda and once fizzing has stopped add to the batter and mix well. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter evenly in the tin filling each liner about 3/4 full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until cupcakes are set and spring back when touched 20 to 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool in the pan for 10 minutes then remove to a wire rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> For meringue icing Bring a few inches of water to a gentle simmer in a saucepan large enough to hold a standing mixer bowl above the water. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the egg whites sugar cream of tartar and salt together in the bowl until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Set the bowl over the simmering water and whisk constantly until sugar is completely dissolved and mixture is smooth and hot to the touch 2 to 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer to the standing mixer fitted with the whisk attachment and beat at medium high speed until meringue is cool and holds a soft peak 4 to 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> With the speed on low add the vanilla and almond extracts increase speed to medium and continue whisking until mixture is glossy and holds a stiff peak 1 to 2 minutes more. <NEXT_STEP> To decorate Using a spoon or offset spatula spread about 1/2 cup meringue over each cupcake and sprinkle with nonpareils. <NEXT_STEP> Cupcakes are best served the day they are made. <NEXT_STEP> Cook s Note If you re unable to find gel food coloring add drops of liquid food coloring until the desired shade of red is achieved. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Red Velvet Cupcakes with Fluffy Meringue Icing <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pecan <NEXT_INPUT> <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> mango <NEXT_INPUT> ginger <NEXT_INPUT> syrup <NEXT_INPUT> caramelized <NEXT_INPUT> spray <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon ground ginger <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon ground cloves <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 tablespoons unsalted butter melted <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 tablespoons vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup packed dark brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 tablespoons molasses <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups plus 2 tablespoons slightly cold unsalted butter cut into small pieces <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 small or 2 large ripe mangoes coarsely chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 large egg yolks <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Cooking spray <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup light corn syrup <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup finely diced candied ginger for garnish <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Make the ginger syrup Combine the granulated sugar fresh ginger and 3/4 cup water in a small saucepan and bring to a boil over high heat. <NEXT_STEP> Cook until the sugar has melted and the mixture thickens slightly about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat and let infuse for 30 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Strain the syrup before using. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile make the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line 12 muffin cups with paper liners and spray the liners with cooking spray. <NEXT_STEP> Sift together the flour baking powder baking soda salt ground ginger cinnamon and cloves into a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the melted butter vegetable oil brown sugar eggs molasses and 3/4 cup water in a large bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and stir until the batter is smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Fill each paper liner with cup batter about 1/4 inch below the top of the liner. <NEXT_STEP> Bake just until the tops feel firm and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out with a few moist crumbs attached 12 to 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the oven and brush the tops liberally with the ginger syrup. <NEXT_STEP> Let sit in the pan for 5 minutes before removing. <NEXT_STEP> Let the cupcakes cool completely on a wire rack before frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Make the buttercream Heat 2 tablespoons butter in a large saute pan over high heat. <NEXT_STEP> Add the mangoes and cook until caramelized and soft about 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer to a food processor and process until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Pass the mixture through a medium mesh strainer into a bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Discard the solids. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment beat the egg yolks on high speed until creamy and pale yellow about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Spray a heatproof measuring cup with cooking spray. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the sugar and corn syrup in a saucepan and bring to a full rolling boil over medium high heat. <NEXT_STEP> Cook without stirring until the syrup reaches the soft ball stage 238 degrees F to 242 degrees F on a candy thermometer. <NEXT_STEP> Immediately pour the syrup into the measuring cup to halt the cooking. <NEXT_STEP> Add a small amount of the sugar syrup to the beaten egg yolks turn the mixer on to high speed and beat for about 5 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Continue stopping the mixer adding syrup and beating until all of the syrup is incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the mixture until it is completely cool. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining 2 cups butter a few pieces at a time beating until incorporated before adding more. <NEXT_STEP> When all of the butter has been blended in add the vanilla and the mango puree and beat until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Frost the top of each cupcake liberally with the mango buttercream and garnish with the candied ginger. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Gingerbread Cupcakes With Caramelized Mango Buttercream <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pasta <NEXT_INPUT> turkey <NEXT_INPUT> Frost cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Place the large marshmallow in the center. <NEXT_STEP> Lightly frost the back of the candy eyes and press them onto the marshmallow. <NEXT_STEP> Frost the back of the jujube candy and put below the eyes for a nose. <NEXT_STEP> Frost the short piece of licorice lightly and press underneath the nose to make the mouth. <NEXT_STEP> Press mini marshmallow halves all around the cupcake and the face to make the lambs coat. <NEXT_STEP> Frost the tips of the pink jelly beans and stick on top of the lamb s head to make ears. <NEXT_STEP> Stick the purple jelly beans in the front and back of the cupcake for feet. <NEXT_STEP> Curl the long piece of licorice and press into frosting to make the lamb s tail. <NEXT_STEP> Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line two 12 cup cupcake tins with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Put tins on a baking sheet. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Process the sugar and butter in a food processor until very creamy scraping of the processor as needed after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Process until the batter is very smooth and pourable like pancake batter about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Evenly pour the batter into the prepared cups filling them 3/4 of the way full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until the cakes are just firm and spring back when gently pressed and the tops are golden 18 to 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool slightly in tin until cool enough to handle. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer to a rack and cool completely before frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the milk and vanilla extract together in a small bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly beat the butter and sugar in another medium bowl with an electric mixer until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Raise the speed to high and mix until light and fluffy about 5 to 7 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the fluff and salt and reduce the speed to low. <NEXT_STEP> Add the milk and vanilla mixture scrape the bowl down and mix until fully incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Raise the mixer to high and beat briefly until fluffy about 1 to 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Use right away. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Little Lamb Cupcake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> tree <NEXT_INPUT> cone <NEXT_INPUT> <TITLE_START> Ganache Frosting <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> marble <NEXT_INPUT> glaze <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> glazed <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 2 tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup chopped semisweet chocolate <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup heavy cream <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and line a 12 cup muffin tin with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the flour baking powder and salt together in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the eggs and sugar together in another medium bowl with an electric mixer on medium high speed until light and foamy about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> While beating gradually pour in the butter and then the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the mixer speed to low and <NEXT_STEP> Remove the mixing bowl and stir in the chocolate chips by hand. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate for 1 hour. <NEXT_STEP> Roll the dough into 1/2 inch balls. <NEXT_STEP> Place on a greased cookie combined. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the bowl then add the remaining wet ingredients and beat to combine. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the bowl and paddle. <NEXT_STEP> Increase the speed to medium and beat until slightly firm about 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> For the marshmallow web beat the marshmallows in a large bowl with a mixer fitted with the whisk attachment on low speed until the marshmallows break up about 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Increase the speed to medium high and beat until glossy and smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add the confectioners sugar and beat again until very thick and smooth about 1 more minute. <NEXT_STEP> Using two forks pull out about 1 tablespoon of marshmallow at a time stretch into thin strands and drape over the top and around each cupcake to create a web. <NEXT_STEP> Stick one gummy spider candy on each then let the marshmallow set about 15 minutes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate Spider Web Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> peanut <NEXT_STEP> Dunk the cupcakes into the frosting to coat then place on a rack frosted side up. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer to the refrigerator for up to 20 minutes to set before serving. <STEP_END> Line a 24 count regular size cupcake pan with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> In a heavy duty mixing bowl cream together the butter and shortening on medium speed. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs 1 at a time until completely combined. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl with a rubber spatula. <NEXT_STEP> Add the superfine sugar with the mixer set to low speed. <NEXT_STEP> Once combined set the mixer to medium speed and mix for 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Sift together the cake flour cinnamon salt and baking powder. <NEXT_STEP> Begin to add the sifted dry ingredients to the batter alternating with the warm milk. <NEXT_STEP> In a separate bowl blend the plantain with a hand mixer. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla and the blended plantain to the batter. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners almost to the top. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until the cake bounces back when you touch it about 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the pan and place onto a tray to cool. <NEXT_STEP> Using a pastry bag and piping tip frost the cupcakes with the Avocado Buttercream and top with 1 plantain chip. <NEXT_STEP> In a heavy duty mixing bowl cream the butter until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Add 3 cups powdered sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl with a rubber spatula. <NEXT_STEP> In a food processor blend the avocados until smooth and add into the buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> Then add the remaining 4 cups powdered sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F.
