Line two cupcake pans with dark cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter and granulated sugar to the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment. <NEXT_STEP> Beat on medium speed until light and fluffy 3 to 4 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sour cream orange zest and vanilla and beat until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the egg whites in two batches mixing until well combined after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed to be sure all the ingredients are well incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the flour baking powder and salt in a separate large bowl and whisk together. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the milk and orange juice in a measuring cup. <NEXT_STEP> Add half the dry ingredients to the batter and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add half the milk mixture and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining dry ingredients and mix until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed to be sure all the ingredients are well incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Add the last of the milk mixture and mix to combine being sure not to overmix. <NEXT_STEP> Use an ice cream scoop to fill the cupcake liners three quarters of the way to the top. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted in the center of a cupcake comes out with a few crumbs sticking to it 15 to 17 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to cool for 2 to 3 minutes then remove to a cooling rack to finish cooling completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the rum marshmallow filling Add the marshmallow creme to a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the rum until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the filling to a disposable pastry bag. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting Put the butter in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment. <NEXT_STEP> Beat on high speed until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla and salt and beat until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the cocoa powder and beat on low speed until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add half the powdered sugar and half the milk. <NEXT_STEP> Beat on low speed until the ingredients are moistened then turn the mixer to high and beat until well incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining powdered sugar and another 2 tablespoons milk mix on low again until the ingredients are moistened then turn the mixer to high and beat until fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Use a paring knife to cut a small plug out of the center of the top of each cupcake saving the cake plugs. <NEXT_STEP> Cut the tip from the pastry bag with the filling and fill the center of each cupcake with a small amount of marshmallow filling. <NEXT_STEP> Trim the bottoms of each cake plug and use to seal the holes in each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> To decorate Frost each cupcake with the frosting using an offset spatula to smooth the tops. <NEXT_STEP> Arrange the cupcakes next to each other with their edges touching in a 4 by 6 grid on a large cake board or platter. <NEXT_STEP> Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. <NEXT_STEP> Roll out the green gum paste to about 1/8 inch thick and cut twenty four 1 inch squares. <NEXT_STEP> Place on the lined baking sheet and let dry 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Roll out the blue gum paste and cut four 2 inch teardrops place on the lined baking sheet and let dry for 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with each of the three remaining colors to make a total of 12 more teardrops. <NEXT_STEP> Brush the top of each of the blue teardrops with a small amount of the alcohol then sprinkle with blue edible glitter. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with each of the colored teardrops sprinkling each with its coordinating colored glitter. <NEXT_STEP> Use a small amount of alcohol to moisten the top half of a green square then position a teardrop on top pointy side out to look like a small lightbulb on a string of lights. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with the remaining teardrops and squares. <NEXT_STEP> Let dry for a few minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Use an offset spatula to place a lightbulb on top of each cupcake varying the colors and the direction they are pointing throughout the grid of cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Thread the licorice laces around looping them and attaching them to lightbulb bases occasionally to mimic a tangle of holiday lights. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Orange Chocolate Cupcake Mosaic <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> polenta <NEXT_INPUT> mascarpone together the butter and the sugar until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer running add the egg yolks 1 at a time. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the milk vanilla and lemon zest. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on low speed add the dry ingredients to the butter mixture until just incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> In a clean dry bowl whip the egg whites until soft peaks form. <NEXT_STEP> Add a pinch of sugar while the whites are mixing. <NEXT_STEP> Add half of the whites to the mixture and beat with the paddle. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the bowl from the mixer and gently fold in the remaining egg whites with a stand mixer bowl fitted with a paddle attachment add the milk vegetable oil 1 cup cold water pineapple vanilla extract and eggs. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the wet ingredients together on medium speed for 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the dry mixture into the bowl in three additions scraping down the sides after each addition is mixed in. <NEXT_STEP> Pour half of the cooled Brown Sugar Sauce into the mixer bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Mix on low to medium speed until all the ingredients are mixed together the batter will look smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Fill each cupcake liner three quarters full with the batter. <NEXT_STEP> Bake on the center rack for the best results. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick comes out clean 25 to 32 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> The cupcakes will be golden. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Poke a hole in the center of each cupcake fill with the Pineapple Filling. <NEXT_STEP> Frost the cooled filled cupcakes with the Teriyaki Buttercream Frosting. <NEXT_STEP> becomes thick enough to coat the back of a metal spoon 10 to 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat and pour into a heatproof bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool. <NEXT_STEP> Mix 1/2 cup cold water and the cornstarch in a small bowl with a fork. <NEXT_STEP> Puree the pineapple brown sugar and the water mixture in a blender. <NEXT_STEP> Bring the mixture to a boil in a medium saucepan over medium to high heat. <NEXT_STEP> Stir with a wooden spoon until the mixture reduces down to a thick syrup. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat and pour into a bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the filling in the refrigerator. <NEXT_STEP> When cool pour the filling into a squeeze sauce bottle. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of an electric stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment beat the butter on medium speed until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides. <NEXT_STEP> Add the egg yolks one at a time to the butter mixing in between each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Mixing on low speed add the powdered sugar to the bowl 1 cup at a time until the sugar is fully incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides again. <NEXT_STEP> Add the teriyaki sauce half of the brown sugar sauce and vanilla to the mix beat on medium low 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> In a small saucepan melt the butter over medium heat. <NEXT_STEP> Add the brown sugar and stir until the sugar and butter melt together. <NEXT_STEP> Add the roasted pig and stir until all the meat is coated with the mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Pour onto wax paper and cool. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Hot Lava <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chocolate by side in another pastry bag fitted with a large star tip. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the frosting onto the cupcakes in a spiral motion to create a swirl. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate Egg Cream Cupcakes therefore we cannot make any representation as to the results. <NEXT_STEP> In medium saucepot bring the milk and vanilla beans to a boil. <NEXT_STEP> Using a whisk continuously stir in the flour until <NEXT_STEP> Cut the chicken into 1 inch cubes and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a bowl add the all purpose flour garlic powder onion powder and paprika and sprinkle with salt and pepper. <NEXT_STEP> In another bowl pour in the buttermilk. <NEXT_STEP> Place the cubed chicken into the buttermilk then remove and place into the flour until all the pieces are covered in flour. <NEXT_STEP> Add the chicken to the oil and fry until golden brown 4 to 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside a handful of small pieces for garnish. <NEXT_STEP> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Line muffin pans with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium bowl cream together the butter and granulated sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the eggs one at a time and then stir in the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the cake flour and baking powder add to the creamed mixture and mix well. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the buttermilk until the batter is smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add the maple syrup shredded fried chicken and spiced dry mix to the batter and stir. <NEXT_STEP> Then scoop the batter into the liners. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 20 to 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> The cupcakes are done when they spring back to the touch. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting In a mixing bowl cream together the butter and cream cheese until well blended. <NEXT_STEP> Then add the powdered sugar 1 cup at a time. <NEXT_STEP> Add the maple extract. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Once the cupcakes are cool you may use a spoon or piping bag to frost the cupcakes with the maple frosting. <NEXT_STEP> After you have frosted use a small piece of the remaining fried chicken to garnish the top of the cupcakes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Chicken and Buttermilk Waffle Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> for 10 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla extract butter and 4 tablespoons sour cream. <NEXT_STEP> Mix on low for 30 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl and beat on medium high speed until creamy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining tablespoon sour cream if necessary to bring the frosting to spreading consistency. <NEXT_STEP> Place the apples in a medium saucepan on the stove. filling thickens. <NEXT_STEP> If needed gradually add the cornstarch and whisk after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> After the mixture thickens remove the pan from the heat and add the jalapeno. nectar or maple syrup <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons canola oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons organic cane sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons apple cider vinegar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups organic unbleached white flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup dark cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 cups dark chocolate chunks <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup soy milk or non dairy milk of your choice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup agave nectar or maple syrup <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups coconut milk fat <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup organic brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons course sea salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup organic vegetable shortening <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup vegan margarine <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 cups powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup dark cocoa powder <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Line standard size cupcake pans with 16 cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium bowl whisk together the soy milk agave nectar canola oil cane sugar vanilla extract and apple cider vinegar and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl sift the flour cocoa powders baking powder baking soda and salt and whisk them together. <NEXT_STEP> Add your wet mixture to the dry and whisk until the mixture is evenly moist and only a few lumps remain. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> For the ganache Whisk together the chocolate chunks soy milk and agave nectar in a microwave safe bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Place the bowl into a microwave and heat for 1 minute increments whisking in between until the mixture is thick and smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Take your cupcake batter and start to stream in about 1 cup of the chocolate ganache and gently fold it into the batter. <NEXT_STEP> Do not fully mix it into the batter it should be swirled in. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the liners three quarters full and bake until a toothpick comes out clean 12 to 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the salted caramel sauce In a nonstick saucepan add the coconut milk fat. <NEXT_STEP> Add in the brown sugar vanilla and salt and whisk well. <NEXT_STEP> Bring the mixture to a boil on medium high heat whisking occasionally. <NEXT_STEP> Once the mixture starts to boil reduce the heat to a low bowl and cook for 35 to 45 minutes whisking every couple of minutes until the sauce has reduced by half. <NEXT_STEP> The resulting mixture will be thick and golden. <NEXT_STEP> Allow the caramel to cool slightly and use immediately. <NEXT_STEP> For the buttercream Whip the shortening and margarine together in a mixer bowl with the paddle attachment until fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the bowl and put back onto the mixer on low speed and slowly add the powdered sugar and cocoa powder. <NEXT_STEP> Once the mixture is fully incorporated stream in 1 cup of the chocolate ganache. <NEXT_STEP> Once the ganache is added you may turn the mixer to medium high and whip until the buttercream is very fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Poke a hole in the center of each cupcake using the end of a wooden spoon or small offset spatula. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the hole completely with salted caramel sauce. <NEXT_STEP> Using a round frosting tip generously frost the top of each cupcake with the dark chocolate buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> Drizzle the top of each cupcake with more salted caramel sauce. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Vegan Chocolate Ganache Cupcakes with Salted Caramel and Dark Chocolate until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the pecans and chips. <NEXT_STEP> The batter will be loose. <NEXT_STEP> Cover and refrigerate until just firm about 30 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Using a small ice <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> shamrock <NEXT_INPUT> green <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> st <NEXT_INPUT> patrick <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 24 servings (makes 6 shamrock cakes plus 3 cupcakes) <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> Cooking spray <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/2 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 cups buttermilk well shaken <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon green liquid food coloring <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 large eggs lightly beaten <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Green liquid food coloring <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup green sanding sugar for decorating <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line two 12 cup muffin tins with paper liners and spray with cooking spray. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the flour cocoa powder baking powder baking soda and salt in a medium bowl set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the buttermilk food coloring and vanilla in a spouted measuring cup set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the granulated sugar and butter in a stand mixer on medium speed until very light in color and fluffy about 5 minutes scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer still on medium slowly add the eggs and beat until fully incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the speed to the lowest setting with the mixer running add 1/3 of the flour mixture then 1/2 of the buttermilk mixture then 1/2 of the remaining flour mixture then the remaining buttermilk mixture then the remaining flour mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides and beat until well mixed. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the prepared liners about 3/4 full of batter. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until the cupcakes bounce back when pressed and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean 20 to 22 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool in the pan for a few minutes then transfer to a rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting Put the flour in a small saucepan. <NEXT_STEP> Vigorously whisk in about 1/2 cup milk making sure to get the whisk into the edges of the pan until you have a smooth thick paste. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly whisk in the remaining milk until fully incorporated and the mixture is smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Cook over medium heat whisking constantly until the mixture is very thick about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape into a bowl press plastic wrap onto the surface and refrigerate until cool about 45 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Using a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment beat the butter and granulated sugar on medium speed until very light and fluffy about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the cooled flour mixture a tablespoon at a time and beat until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Switch to the whisk attachment add the vanilla salt and 3 to 5 drops green food coloring and whip until very light and fluffy like thick whipped cream up to 10 minutes with a stand mixer or 12 minutes with a hand mixer. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Using a sharp serrated knife cut 3 cupcakes in half vertically gently sawing through the paper liners set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Frost the remaining cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Put the sanding sugar on a small plate and roll the edge of each cupcake 3/4 of the way around in the sugar making a green border around each with a gap on one side. <NEXT_STEP> On a large serving platter arrange 18 cupcakes in groups of three pushing them together at the gaps to make 6 shamrock cakes. <NEXT_STEP> Dip the tops of the cupcake halves in sugar and wedge a pointy end of 1 half between 2 of the cupcakes in each group to form the stems. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> St. Patrick's Day Green Velvet Cupcake Shamrocks <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cherry <NEXT_INPUT> malted <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake until well blended. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla and whipping cream and beat on medium speed for 2 minutes until light spreadable and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the cherry preserves until well incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> When the cupcakes have finished baking let sit in the pans for 2 minutes and then transfer the cupcakes to wire racks to cool for 10 minutes more. <NEXT_STEP> While the cupcakes cool transfer the buttercream to a pastry bag fitted with a large star tip. <NEXT_STEP> Alternatively you can frost the cupcakes with a knife or offset spatula. <NEXT_STEP> When the cupcakes have cooled pipe the buttercream in decorative swirls on top of the cupcake . <NEXT_STEP> Garnish the top of each cupcake with a malted milk ball or cherry and serve. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Double Chocolate Malt Shop Cupcakes with Cherry-Vanilla Buttercream <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> lemon <NEXT_INPUT> strip <NEXT_INPUT> poppy <NEXT_INPUT> seed <NEXT_INPUT> candied <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 24 servings <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 3 lemons scrubbed and dried <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 large egg white lightly beaten <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup superfine sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 box Lemon Cake Mix <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 box lemon pudding mix <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 large eggs lightly beaten <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup water at least one day before.Using a pairing knife carefully cut wide slices of rind from the lemon. <NEXT_STEP> Trim the white pith from the underside of the slices. <NEXT_STEP> Cut the lemon rinds into 24 thin strips. <NEXT_STEP> Curl each strip around your finger brush with egg white and dust liberally with sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Set the sugared strips on a clean baking sheet and place in a warm dry spot overnight. <NEXT_STEP> Or place the sheet in a preheated 200 degree F oven for 3 4 hours until dry. <NEXT_STEP> CAKE Combine the cake and pudding mixes in a large bowl stirring to blend. <NEXT_STEP> Add the oil eggs water and lemon juice stirring after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in the lemon zest and poppy seeds until just blended. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon the batter evenly into the prepared cupcake tins about 3/4 full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake on the middle oven rack until the tops of the cupcakes spring back to the touch and are not too golden about 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool in the pan for 15 minutes and then allow to cool completely on a wire rack before frosting or decorating. <NEXT_STEP> FROSTING Make while the cakes are cooling or the morning of the shower.Using a wooden spoon cream the butter in a large bowl Add the remaining ingredients and continue creaming until the frosting is well blended and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Frost the cupcakes with a small spatula and decorate with the candied lemon strips. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Lemon Poppy Seed Cupcakes with Butter Frosting and Candied Lemon Strips <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sage <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon finely chopped fresh sage <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. and 1 cup water in a medium saucepan. <NEXT_STEP> Bring to a boil add the cranberries and return to a boil. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the heat and boil gently for 10 minutes stirring occasionally. <NEXT_STEP> Cover and cool completely at room temperature. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer cream the cream cheese and butter together on medium high speed until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add the salt and vanilla extract. <NEXT_STEP> Beat until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Add the powdered sugar 1/2 cup at a time beating well after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the juice from the Cranberry Compote and then add the chopped sage and mix on low speed until fully incorporated. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Butternut Squash Cupcakes, Cranberry Compote Filling and Sage-Cream Cheese Frosting Line a mini cupcake or muffin pan with 24 mini cupcake liners or a regular size cupcake or muffin pan with 9 cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Sift the flour baking powder baking soda and salt into a medium size bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Set the bowl aside. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of an electric stand mixer with a paddle attachment cream the butter and sugar together about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl and then add the vanilla and one egg at a time scraping down the sides of the bowl after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the mixer to the lowest speed and add the flour mixture and sour cream alternating between the 2 beginning and ending with the flour. <NEXT_STEP> Mix the cinnamon and brown sugar together in a small bowl and fold by hand into the batter. <NEXT_STEP> Do not fully mix into the batter it should be swirled in. <NEXT_STEP> Fill 24 mini cupcake liners 1/2 full with batter and bake for 30 minutes or fill 9 regular size cupcakes 3/4 full with batter and bake for 32 minutes or until golden and baked through. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes completely. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Generously frost the top of each cupcake with the maple cream cheese mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Chop the maple glazed turkey bacon into a fine dice and divide evenly among the cupcakes sprinkle over the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle the maple sugar on top of the bacon to resemble sand . <NEXT_STEP> Whip the cream cheese and maple butter in the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with a whisk attachment until fully incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in by hand the jelly and fresh strawberries. <NEXT_STEP> Put the frosting into a pastry bag and cut 1/2 inch off the tip. <NEXT_STEP> Cook the bacon on the stove top in 2 nonstick skillets coated with olive oil spray over medium heat turning once making sure the bacon is fully cooked. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the heat down and divide the maple syrup between the 2 skillets drizzle the syrup over the bacon. <NEXT_STEP> Continue to cook turning the bacon often watching closely that the syrup does not burn. <NEXT_STEP> You want the bacon to be coated with the syrup and caramelized but not soggy. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool. <STEP_END> Line the muffin tin with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Put the butter cocoa and stout in a microwave safe bowl cover loosely with plastic wrap and microwave until the butter melts about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk to combine. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile whisk the granulated sugar flour baking powder baking soda and salt together in a large bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the sour cream vanilla and eggs together in a small bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the cocoa mixture into the dry ingredients. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the sour cream mixture just until combined being careful to avoid over mixing. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter among the prepared muffin tins filling each about three quarters full or about 1/4 cup per cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted in the center of the cupcakes comes out clean about 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes completely in the tin on a cooling rack about 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the liners and return the cupcakes to the rack. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting Place the brown sugar cinnamon ginger allspice nutmeg and egg whites in a large metal mixing bowl set over a pot of simmering water. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk constantly until the sugar melts and the mixture is very thin and warm. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the bowl from the heat and transfer to a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk on high speed until stiff peaks form about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Continue beating on low speed until cool. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer set to medium speed beat the butter a few pieces at a time. <NEXT_STEP> The mixture may curdle before coming together. <NEXT_STEP> Using a spoon offset spatula or piping bag dollop spread or pipe about 1/2 cup of the frosting on each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Occasionally beat the frosting to maintain the smooth texture. <NEXT_STEP> Decorate with sugar flowers if using and serve. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate Stout Cupcakes with Gingerbread-Spice Swiss Buttercream <TITLE_END> <NEXT_STEP> Do not over mix the batter. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners 3/4 full and bake until a toothpick inserted into each cupcake comes out clean 19 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the sauce In a small heavy bottomed saucepan stir together the sugar and water. <NEXT_STEP> Cover and bring to a boil. <NEXT_STEP> Let boil until the mixture starts to turn sugar a little at a time. <NEXT_STEP> Once the sugar is incorporated add the vanilla paste and bourbon and mix on low until the liquids are incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape the bottom of the bowl and not overflowing about 1 tablespoon per cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe a dollop of vanilla bean bourbon frosting onto of each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Drizzle the top with more bourbon caramel sauce and sprinkle with candied pecans to garnish. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> George Caramelin: Chocolate Cinnamon Cupcakes with Vanilla Bean Bourbon Frosting, Bourbon Caramel Sauce, and Candied Pecans frosting. <NEXT_STEP> 7. <NEXT_STEP> Press a nugget of floral clay into the bottom of each flower pot. <NEXT_STEP> Press a cupcake into a flowerpot. <NEXT_STEP> Insert the flower cookie stick in the center. <NEXT_STEP> anchoring it in the clay for support. <NEXT_STEP> Decorate the cupcake with 2 green M M S Brand Peanut Chocolate Candies. <NEXT_STEP> TIP You can also make jumbo cupcakes as well as miniature cupcakes for a varitey of plant sizes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Cupcake Garden <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> plantain <NEXT_INPUT> caramelized <NEXT_INPUT> hazelnut <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup butter softened <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup buttermilk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups caramelized mashed plantains <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces cream cheese softened <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup chocolate hazelnut spread <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 cups powdered sugar <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> 2 tablespoons finely crushed plantain chips For the caramelized plantains Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Mix the melted butter brown sugar and cinnamon in a small bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Put the sliced plantains in an 8 inch square baking dish and pour in the butter mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Toss the plantains until well coated with the mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Bake in the preheated oven until caramelized about 15 to 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the pan from the oven and mash the plantains with a fork. <NEXT_STEP> The yield should be about 2 cups mashed caramelized plantains. <NEXT_STEP> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line 16 cups of 2 standard 12 capacity cupcake pans with liners. <NEXT_STEP> Add the flour baking powder baking soda and salt to a sifter and sift into a large bowl. <NEXT_STEP> In another large bowl add the softened butter and granulated sugar and mix with a hand mixer until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the eggs buttermilk vanilla extract and the mashed caramelized plantains until the batter is smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly stir in the sifted flour mixture and mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Evenly spoon the cupcake batter into the 16 liners filling the cups 3/4 full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick in the center comes out clean and the tops are light golden brown about 22 to 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the oven and let cool for 5 minutes in the pan. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the cupcakes to a cooling rack and cool completely about 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> For the chocolate hazelnut cream cheese frosting Add the cream cheese chocolate hazelnut spread and vanilla extract to a large bowl and beat with a hand mixer until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly mix in the powdered sugar scraping down sides of the bowl as needed until the frosting is smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Assemble the cupcakes Put the frosting in a pastry bag fitted with a 1/2 inch diameter decorating tip. <NEXT_STEP> Frost the cooled cupcakes and sprinkle the top of each cupcake with crushed plantain chips. <NEXT_STEP> Arrange on a serving platter and serve. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Caramelized Plantain Cupcakes with a Chocolate Hazelnut Cream Cheese Frosting <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 sticks unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 large whole eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons coconut extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/2 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup half and half <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup flake coconut <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup half and half <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons coconut extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 package instant vanilla pudding mix <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup flake coconut <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 sticks unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 pounds powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon coconut extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup half and half plus more for thinning frosting if needed <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Flake or toasted coconut for garnish <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the convection oven to 325 degrees F or a standard oven to 350 degrees F. In large mixer bowl cream together the granulated sugar and butter until light and fluffy with a heavy duty mixer. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time and mix thoroughly after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Add the coconut extract and mix well. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the flour baking soda and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Add half of the flour to the mixer bowl along with 1/2 cup of the half and half. <NEXT_STEP> Mix until the flour is mixed in scraping the sides of the bowl with a rubber spatula. <NEXT_STEP> Add the rest of flour mixture and the other 1/2 cup half and half. <NEXT_STEP> Mix until the batter is smooth and all of the flour lumps are gone. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in the coconut flakes. <NEXT_STEP> Fill 24 cupcake liners half full and bake for 20 minutes in the convection oven or 28 minutes in the standard oven. <NEXT_STEP> The tops of the cupcakes should be lightly browned. <NEXT_STEP> Check the cupcakes to make sure no batter sticks to a wooden toothpick when inserted into the cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the mousse filling In large mixer bowl beat the heavy cream half and half coconut extract and pudding mix until light and fluffy using a heavy duty mixer. <NEXT_STEP> It should have the consistency of whipped cream. <NEXT_STEP> Gently fold in the coconut using a plastic spatula. <NEXT_STEP> Put the filling in a pastry bag or zipper bag with a corner cut off. <NEXT_STEP> For the coconut buttercream In large mixer bowl beat together the butter and half of the powdered sugar using heavy duty mixer. <NEXT_STEP> Add the half and half and the rest of the powdered sugar along with the coconut extract and mix well. <NEXT_STEP> If the frosting is thicker than you would like add 1 teaspoon of additional half and half at a time mixing well after each addition until the frosting reaches the correct consistency. <NEXT_STEP> The thickness may depend on the humidity levels in your region. <NEXT_STEP> Put into a pastry bag. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Make a hole in the middle of each cupcake using a sharp knife. <NEXT_STEP> Be sure and leave a small amount of cake in the bottom of the hole. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcakes with the mousse filling. <NEXT_STEP> Frost with coconut buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> You may top the cupcakes with more flake coconut or toasted coconut as desired. <NEXT_STEP> Serve immediately or chill until ready to serve. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Coconut Cupcakes with Whipped Coconut Mousse Filling and Coconut Buttercream <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> marshmallow cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 3/4 cup cornstarch <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Two 1/4 ounce envelopes gelatin <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup buttermilk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup warm coffee <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup coconut oil warmed <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the marshmallow topping Combine the cornstarch and powdered sugar in a bowl and evenly distribute over a sheet pan. <NEXT_STEP> This is what you will place the marshmallows on as they finish so they don t stick. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle the gelatin over 1/3 cup very cold water in the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with a whisk attachment. <NEXT_STEP> In a small saucepan fitted with a candy thermometer mix the granulated sugar and corn syrup with 1/3 cup water. <NEXT_STEP> Place over medium high heat and bring to a simmer. <NEXT_STEP> When the syrup reaches 245 degrees F remove from the heat. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the mixer to medium and slowly pour the hot syrup into the gelatin being careful not to hit the whisk or let it run down the sides of the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Once all of the syrup is incorporated turn the mixer to high and beat until the mixture begins to cool it will gain volume turn white and start to pull from the sides of the bowl and the exterior of the bowl will be close to room temperature 12 to 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the orange extract and mix to combine. <NEXT_STEP> Lightly spray a large serving spoon with cooking spray. <NEXT_STEP> Drop about 1/2 cup size scoops of the marshmallow on the powdered sugar mixture and let cool spraying the spoon in between scoops you want 18 scoops total. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and line cupcake pans with 18 cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the flour granulated sugar cocoa powder baking soda baking powder and salt in a large bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the buttermilk coffee coconut oil vanilla and eggs in another bowl with a whisk. <NEXT_STEP> Make a well in the dry ingredients and add the wet mixture whisking until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> Fill each cupcake liner two thirds full with the batter. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until puffed and an inserted cake tester comes out clean 10 to 12 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool for 5 minutes before removing the cupcakes from the pan. <NEXT_STEP> Place the marshmallow scoops on top of the warm cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Using a culinary torch torch each marshmallow to caramelize. <NEXT_STEP> Serve. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate Cupcakes with Burnt Orange Marshmallows <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> white chocolate over the icing on each cupcake and refrigerate for 30 minutes to set the icing. <NEXT_STEP> Allow the cupcakes to come to room temperature for 15 to 20 minutes before serving. <TITLE_START> Red Velvet Cone Cakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chestnut <NEXT_INPUT> sesame <NEXT_INPUT> black <NEXT_INPUT> ounce <NEXT_INPUT> chopstick <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 5 ounces unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3.5 ounces brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3.5 ounces granulated cane sugar teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 9 ounces Caramel recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 10 ounces sour cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Black <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons black sesame powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 ounces chestnut paste or chestnut cream such as Clement Faugier <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 ounces unsweetened chestnut puree such as Clement Faugier <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces unsalted butter softened <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 ounces powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon dark rum <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Nonstick cooking spray <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup granulated cane sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons white vinegar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup white sesame seeds <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup black sesame seeds <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a regular size cupcake or muffin pan with 12 cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of an electric stand mixer cream the butter and sugars together about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile combine the flours baking soda baking powder and salt in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk together and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the eggs and vanilla in a small bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the mixer bowl and then add the vanilla and egg mixture one egg at a time with the mixer on low speed. <NEXT_STEP> Add the Caramel. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl again and then increase the speed to medium and combine thoroughly. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer the lowest speed add the flour mixture and the sour cream alternating between the two beginning and ending with the flour. <NEXT_STEP> Mix only until just combined do not over mix. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners with a 16 size ice cream scoop or about half full and bake until dark golden and baked through about 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes completely. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Core each cupcake using an apple corer. <NEXT_STEP> Fill each cupcake with the Black Sesame Pastry Cream and generously frost with the Chestnut Cream Frosting so that the frosting resembles a mountain of noodles. <NEXT_STEP> Top each cupcake with a pair of the Black and White Sesame Chopsticks. <NEXT_STEP> In a heavy bottomed saucepan combine the sugar with 4 tablespoons water to moisten. <NEXT_STEP> Place over medium high heat and without stirring cook until the sugar is dark amber in color. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile place the cream in a saucepan over medium heat and warm to a simmer. <NEXT_STEP> Turn off the heat on the caramelized sugar and slowly add the warmed cream while stirring the caramel with a wooden spoon. <NEXT_STEP> Be careful as the mixture will splatter. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to thicken slightly over medium heat about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the lemon juice if using. <NEXT_STEP> Cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Bring the milk to a boil in a small saucepan. <NEXT_STEP> In a small bowl whisk together the yolks with the sugar and cornstarch until smooth and well blended. <NEXT_STEP> While whisking slowly pour in one quarter of the milk into the yolk mixture to temper the yolks. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remainder of the milk while whisking. <NEXT_STEP> Pour back into the saucepan and place on medium heat. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk vigorously and constantly until the mixture thickens. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat and whisk in the vanilla extract. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to sit for 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk in the butter piece by piece. <NEXT_STEP> Add the tahini and black sesame powder and whisk to blend. <NEXT_STEP> Cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Cream together the chestnut paste and chestnut puree in a food processor fitted with a metal blade until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add the softened butter powdered sugar rum and vanilla extract and continue to process until well blended. <NEXT_STEP> If chunks remain press the cream through a fine sieve to remove any large chestnut chunks. <NEXT_STEP> Place the cream in a piping bag with a spaghetti tip. <NEXT_STEP> Line a half sheet pan with a sheet of parchment paper. <NEXT_STEP> Coat the paper with cooking spray. <NEXT_STEP> Coat a wide spatula and a rolling pin with cooking spray. <NEXT_STEP> In a small heavy bottomed saucepan or unlined copper pot combine the sugar vinegar and 1 teaspoon water. <NEXT_STEP> Cook over low heat until the sugar is melted and the mixture is thick. <NEXT_STEP> Stir a little. <NEXT_STEP> Cook until the sugar reaches 248 degrees F on a candy thermometer. <NEXT_STEP> At this point add the sesame seeds to the sugar and stir well with a wooden spoon. <NEXT_STEP> Quickly scrape the mixture onto the parchment and spread evenly first with the prepared spatula and next with the rolling pin. <NEXT_STEP> The desired thickness is about 1/16 inch thick. <NEXT_STEP> Cool at room temperature for about 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cut the candy into 12 chopstick shapes each about 3 inches long with the aid of a Chinese cleaver and a heavy pan. <NEXT_STEP> This technique makes cutting easier even when the candy gets a bit hard. <NEXT_STEP> Let the candy cool completely. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Sesame Chestnut Mountain Cupcakes (Chestnut Caramel Cake with Black Sesame Cream Line a 12 cup muffin pan with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk together the flour baking powder and salt in a bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the butter and sugar in a bowl with an electric mixer on medium high speed until fluffy about 4 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the eggs one at a time scraping down the bowl as needed. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the mixer speed to medium low beat in half of the flour mixture then all of the milk then the remaining flour mixture until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter among the muffin cups filling each three quarters full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake rotating the pan halfway through until a toothpick inserted into the center of a cupcake comes out clean 18 to 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the pan to a rack and let cool 5 minutes then remove the cupcakes to the rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Using a serrated knife trim off the tops of the cupcakes so that they are flat. <NEXT_STEP> Place the dark chocolate and bowl of chocolate in the microwave at medium power stirring every 30 seconds until just liquid and smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Working with one cupcake a time spoon 1 heaping tablespoon of the dark chocolate on top spreading it evenly over the top with the back of the spoon. <NEXT_STEP> While the dark chocolate is still liquid spoon 1 teaspoon of the white chocolate in the center of the cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Drag a toothpick or skewer through the center of the white chocolate outward to form a tail. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with the remaining cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Rewarm the dark chocolate until liquid again if necessary. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape the chocolate into a resealable plastic bag snip off one corner and pipe small dots of dark chocolate on the white chocolate ghosts to form 2 eyes. degrees F. powder in a small bowl until smooth let cool slightly. <NEXT_STEP> Stir together the milk and vinegar in another small bowl and let stand until thickened 3 to 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk together the boiler. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the chocolate to a small piping bag and snip a tiny hole. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe a spiral on each of the cupcake tops that spans the full size of the top. <NEXT_STEP> Run a toothpick from the center point of the spiral and drag to the edge of the cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Do this 3 to 5 times creating a web. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with the remaining cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Top with a gummy spider if using. <NEXT_STEP> Spooky <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Red Velvet Cake with Mascarpone Frosting <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> orange <NEXT_INPUT> chardonnay and blended. <NEXT_STEP> Decrease the speed of the mixer to slow and add half of the dry ingredients. <NEXT_STEP> Mix for 1 minute scraping the sides of the bowl occasionally. <NEXT_STEP> Add the unsalted butter melted and warm <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup hot water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Equipment <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup cupcake pan with 12 cups lined with paper liners <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Electric mixer <NEXT_INGREDIENT> SCHARFFEN BERGER Chocolate Frosting <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Ingredients <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 ounces unsweetened SCHARFFEN BERGER 99 unsweetened chocolate coarsely chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 tablespoons unsalted butter cut into several pieces <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/8 teaspoon salt <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> SCHARFFEN BERGER Chocolate Frosting Place the chocolate and butter in a medium bowl and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Bring the cream sugar and salt to a simmer in a large saucepan. <NEXT_STEP> Simmer for 4 minutes stirring frequently. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the hot cream over the chocolate. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk just until the chocolate is completely melted and the mixture is smooth and glossy. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside to cool at room temperature without stirring for 2 to 3 hours or until the frosting is cool and thick enough to spread. <NEXT_STEP> Or refrigerate the frosting for about 45 minutes or more without stirring then let it stand at room temperature until it is the desired consistency. <NEXT_STEP> SCHARFFEN BERGER Chocolate Cupcakes Position a rack in the lower third of the oven. <NEXT_STEP> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. <NEXT_STEP> In a large mixing bowl mix the flour cocoa powder sugar baking soda and salt together thoroughly. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter eggs and vanilla and beat on medium speed for one minute. <NEXT_STEP> Add half of the water and beat for 20 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape the sides of the bowl and add the remaining water. <NEXT_STEP> Beat for 20 30 seconds until the batter is smooth. <NEXT_STEP> The batter will be thin enough to pour. <NEXT_STEP> Divide it evenly among the lined cups. <NEXT_STEP> Bake 18 22 minutes just until a toothpick inserted into a few of the cupcakes comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Set the pan on a rack to cool. <NEXT_STEP> Frost the cupcakes when they are completely cool. <NEXT_STEP> Store and serve at room temperature. <NEXT_STEP> TIP For light tender cupcakes spoon flour and cocoa lightly into measuring cups and then sweep the measures level without tapping or shaking them. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> SCHARFFEN BERGER Chocolate Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sauce <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> ranch <NEXT_INPUT> cornstarch <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 10 ounces unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 21 ounces granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup buttermilk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups grated sharp Cheddar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup dried cherries <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup chopped green onions <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup apple juice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons honey <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons hot sauce <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup chopped chives <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 tablespoons honey <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cake batter Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F line cupcake pans with 24 cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl whisk together the pastry flour cornstarch baking powder baking soda and salt and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Using an electric mixer with a paddle attachment cream the butter until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually add the granulated sugar and mix until light and fluffy scraping down the sides of the bowl occasionally. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time beating well after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Mix in the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Alternately add the flour mixture and the buttermilk starting and ending with the flour mixture and beating well after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides and then fold in the Cheddar dried cherries and green onions. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon the batter into the liners and beat the cream cheese confectioners sugar honey and hot sauce in a bowl until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in the chives. <NEXT_STEP> For the honey simple syrup In a bowl combine the honey and 1/2 cup hot water and stir. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble With a pastry brush brush each cupcake with the honey simple syrup. <NEXT_STEP> Add some frosting to the top of each cupcake and garnish with the candied ham. combined. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the bowl and beaters with a rubber spatula. <NEXT_STEP> Beat an additional 2 minutes on medium speed scraping the bowl occasionally. <NEXT_STEP> Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and let it sit for 1 hour. <NEXT_STEP> Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. pan to the oven and bake for 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool cupcakes in the pan for 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Using a knife loosen the sides of the cakes and invert the pan onto a cutting board. sugar cocoa powder baking soda and salt in a large bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Add 1 cup warm water the vegetable oil vanilla and vinegar and mix until combined . <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter among the cupcake liners and bake until an inserted toothpick comes out clean 16 to 18 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes completely before frosting. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting In a stand mixer with a whisk another minute. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining confectioners sugar and cookie spread and mix on medium low to fully incorporate. <NEXT_STEP> Increase the speed to medium and whip until the mixture is it reaches a boil. <NEXT_STEP> Pour over the dark chocolate and wait a minute before stirring. <NEXT_STEP> Fill a piping bag with frosting and frost the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Drizzle some ganache over <NEXT_INPUT> filling <NEXT_INPUT> skillet <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> Apple Filling <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 medium apples peeled cored and cut into 1/8 inch thick slices <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup granulated sugar plus more for sprinkling <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Large pinch apple pie spice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons unsalted butter plus melted butter for brushing <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Cupcakes <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Cooking spray <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 teaspoons apple pie spice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 sticks unsalted butter melted <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Whipped Topping <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 tablespoons confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon sour cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Apple pie spice for sprinkling <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the apple filling Toss together the apples granulated sugar lemon juice apple pie spice and salt in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Melt the butter in a medium skillet over medium heat. <NEXT_STEP> Add the apples and cook stirring frequently until the apples are tender but still pliable and the liquid is simmering about 6 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the flour and stir until it dissolves and the liquid thickens. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the skillet from the heat and let the filling cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the filling evenly into 12 little packed mounds within the skillet set aside. <NEXT_STEP> For the cupcakes Position an oven rack in the center of the oven and preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a 12 cup muffin tin with paper liners and coat the liners and the top of the tin with cooking spray. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk together the flour baking powder apple pie spice and salt in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> In another medium bowl beat the sugar and eggs with an electric mixer on medium high speed until light and creamy about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> While continuing to beat gradually pour in the butter then add the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Adjust the mixer to medium low and add half the flour mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Add the milk then the remaining flour mixture taking care not to overmix the batter. <NEXT_STEP> It will be thin like pancake batter transfer it to a liquid measuring cup to make filling the lined muffin cups easier. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter evenly among the cups of the prepared muffin tin. <NEXT_STEP> Top each with a mound of apple filling. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 15 minutes . <NEXT_STEP> Remove the tin from the oven gently brush the tops of the cupcakes with melted butter and sprinkle with granulated sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Continue to bake until the tops of the cupcakes which will bake and puff around the apple filling spring back when pressed 6 to 8 minutes more. <NEXT_STEP> Let the cupcakes cool in the tin for a few minutes then transfer to a rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the whipped topping Beat the heavy cream confectioners sugar and sour cream in a medium bowl with an electric mixer on medium high speed until the mixture forms soft peaks. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer it to a pastry bag or a resealable plastic bag with one corner snipped off. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe a dollop of whipped topping onto each cupcake and sprinkle with apple pie spice. <NEXT_STEP> Copyright 2016 Television Food Network G.P. <NEXT_STEP> All rights reserved <STEP_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. In a large bowl whisk together the flour salt baking powder and baking soda. <NEXT_STEP> In another bowl whisk together the vanilla extract milk and vegetable oil. <NEXT_STEP> Cream together the butter and sugar with a hand held mixer in a large bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs 1 at a time and mix to combine. <NEXT_STEP> Alternate the dry and wet ingredients to the egg mixture starting and ending with the dry ingredients. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the batter 2/3 full into the cupcake tins and bake for 15 to 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the oven and allow to cool before frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Put a bone template on a waxed paper lined cookie sheet. <NEXT_STEP> Melt the chocolate over a double boiler. <NEXT_STEP> When melted pour the chocolate into a resealable bag. <NEXT_STEP> Press out the excess air and seal the bag. <NEXT_STEP> Snip a 1/8 inch corner from the bag and following the bone template pipe an outline onto the waxed paper. <NEXT_STEP> Fill in the bone with chocolate. <NEXT_STEP> Tap the cookie sheet lightly to smooth the top of the chocolate. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with the remaining chocolate to make 6 bones. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate until firm about 5 to 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Spread the vanilla frosting on top of 6 cupcakes mounding it slightly. <NEXT_STEP> Using a sharp knife make a small slit in the top of each doughnut hole. <NEXT_STEP> Carefully peel 1 chocolate bone from the waxed paper and insert the pointed end into the slit. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with the remaining bones and doughnut holes. <NEXT_STEP> Place 1 doughnut hole on top of each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Put in the freezer for 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Spread the frosting over the doughnut hole until it is smooth and covered. <NEXT_STEP> Add the cornflake crumbs to a medium bowl and gently press the frosted cupcakes into the crumbs to cover completely. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the cupcakes to the aluminum tray. <NEXT_STEP> Cut the yellow fruit chews into 1 inch squares. <NEXT_STEP> the fruit chew in the well at an angle. <NEXT_STEP> Heat the caramel sauce for 2 to 4 seconds in the microwave and drizzle it on top of the cupcake so that it fills the well and spills over like gravy. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with remaining 5 cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Cut the fruit chews into 1/4 inch cubes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla frosting to a small bowl and add enough green food coloring until it becomes bright green color. <NEXT_STEP> Spread on top of the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Arrange the green candies and orange chews on top pressing them into the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the cupcakes to the aluminum tray. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> TV Dinner Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> soup <NEXT_INPUT> tomato <NEXT_INPUT> clove <NEXT_INPUT> pierced beating well in between each addition and scraping down the sides of the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the speed to medium and add half of the flour mixture the milk and then the remainder of the flour bottoms with nonstick spray. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment cream together the butter and granulated sugar until smooth 3 to 5 minutes. <TITLE_START> Chocolate Glazed Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> hat <NEXT_INPUT> cone <NEXT_INPUT> belt <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> bent <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 3/4 cup whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup unsweetened natural cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 large egg <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 ounces semisweet chocolate chips <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 stick unsalted butter softened <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons unsweetened natural cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 to 2 tablespoons whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Black gel food coloring <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces semisweet chocolate chips <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 sugar ice cream cones <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon coconut oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups black sanding sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 green sour belt candies <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 yellow candy coated chocolates such as M Ms <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a cupcake pan with 12 paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Heat the milk in a small saucepan to just below a simmer. <NEXT_STEP> Pour over the cocoa powder in a large bowl and whisk until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool slightly. <NEXT_STEP> Stir together the flour baking soda and salt in a small bowl and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the sugar oil egg and vanilla into the cooled cocoa mixture until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add the flour mixture and whisk just until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the mixture among the paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a tester inserted in the centers comes out clean 20 to 23 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool in the pan for a few minutes then transfer the cupcakes to a wire rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting Put the chocolate chips in a microwave safe bowl and heat in 30 second intervals stirring well with a rubber spatula between each until completely melted and smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Cool slightly. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the butter on medium high speed with an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment until light and smooth about 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Add the cooled chocolate and beat until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the confectioners sugar and cocoa and beat on low to combine. <NEXT_STEP> Add 1 tablespoon milk and the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Beat on high until light and fluffy adding the last tablespoon of milk if needed to make a smooth pipeable frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Starting with about 1/8 teaspoon beat in black gel coloring to tint the frosting nearly black . <NEXT_STEP> For assembly Line a baking sheet with parchment and clear space in your refrigerator or freezer to accommodate the level pan. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the chocolate chips and coconut oil in a medium microwave safe bowl and heat in 30 second intervals stirring well between each until completely melted and smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool slightly. <NEXT_STEP> While the chocolate cools use a paring knife to gently saw off the tip of each ice cream cone at an angle to make the bent tips of the hats. <NEXT_STEP> Use a small spoon to coat the cut end of a cone with melted chocolate and lay it flat on the prepared baking sheet. <NEXT_STEP> Attach the tip piece at an angle so it looks like the point of the hat is bent and paint with a little more chocolate to seal the two pieces together. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with the remaining cones and refrigerate or freeze until set 5 to 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Once the cones are fused together pour the sprinkles into a shallow bowl or small sheet pan. <NEXT_STEP> Working one at a time lightly coat the cones in melted chocolate and roll in the sprinkles. <NEXT_STEP> Set upright on the lined baking sheet. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate the cones until set 5 to 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Put the frosting in a piping bag fitted with a large star tip. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe a round of frosting in the center of each cupcake and press on a hat to adhere. <NEXT_STEP> Cut the sour belts to wrap around the base of the hats about 1/2 inch from the bottom. <NEXT_STEP> Use a little frosting to adhere the ends to the hat if needed. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe frosting around the perimeter of the cupcakes to make a brim for each hat. <NEXT_STEP> Stick a yellow candy on each sour belt to make a hat buckle gently pressing it into the frosting so it sticks. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Witch Hat Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 tablespoons unsalted butter softened <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 11/2 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 egg <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup buttermilk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 21/2 to 3 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons fresh orange juice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Black or dark brown food coloring <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F. Butter 12 muffin tin wells or line them with paper muffin cups. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium bowl whisk together flour cocoa baking powder baking soda and salt reserve. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl using an electric mixer set on medium high speed beat together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the egg and vanilla and beat well. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the flour mixture in 3 batches alternately with buttermilk. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon into the prepared muffin tins filling each cup about 2/3 full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted in the center of the cake comes out clean 16 to 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the oven let cool in the pan for 5 minutes then transfer to a rack and let cool to room temperature. <NEXT_STEP> To make the icing place the egg whites in a bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Using an electric mixer set on high speed beat until soft peaks form. <NEXT_STEP> Add the confectioners sugar vanilla and orange juice and continue to beat until thick and shiny. <NEXT_STEP> If too thick add more orange juice. <NEXT_STEP> If too thin add more confectioners sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer 1/3 of the icing to a small bowl and color with black or dark brown food coloring. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon this dark icing into a pastry bag fitted with a tip or pour it into a plastic squeeze bottle. <NEXT_STEP> Now ice the cupcakes and make the cobwebs Spoon the white icing into the center of the cupcake and spread with a small spatula or butter knife. <NEXT_STEP> Starting at the center of a cupcake pipe a spiral of the dark icing from the center to the outer edge. <NEXT_STEP> Then drag a sharp knife point from the center of the spiral to the edge of the cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Wipe the knife clean move about a 1/2 inch to the left or right and drag the knife in the opposite direction from the outer edge to the middle of the cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Continue in this way until you have worked your way around the cupcake and formed the cobweb. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with the remaining cupcakes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Cocoa Cobweb Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> worm <NEXT_INPUT> cola <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> gum orange extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup powdered sugar sifted <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 48 candy worms <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 package chocolate cookies crushed <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat oven to 350 often. <NEXT_STEP> Fill cupcake papers 2/3 full with cake batter. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 25 to 30 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool in pan for 10 minutes before removing from pan. <NEXT_STEP> Cool completely on fitted with a 1/4 inch round decorating tip. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the frosting on the cupcake by starting at the outside edge circling twice and than working toward the center. <NEXT_STEP> Finish cupcakes loops over the top of the cake with the remaining frosting in the piping bag. <NEXT_STEP> Serve immediately or cover and refrigerate for up to 2 days. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Creme-Filled Chocolate baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon fine sea salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 cups packed dark brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 tablespoons vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 large eggs at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/2 cups buttermilk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> One 2 pound bag confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> One 13.4 ounce can prepared dulce de leche <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Milk or heavy cream for thinning the frosting <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon fine sea salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 cups graham cracker crumbs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 cake ice cream cones <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 sugar ice cream cones <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 30 brown sugar cubes <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon honey <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 ounces orange candy melting wafers <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 ounce red candy melting wafers <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 ounces white candy melting wafers <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon unsweetened cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 ounces semisweet chocolate melted <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 mini flag cupcake picks <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Position the racks in the upper and lower thirds of the oven and preheat to 350 degrees F. For the cakes Coat two 8 inch round cake pans and two 6 inch round cake pans with nonstick baking spray with flour. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk together the flour baking powder cinnamon and salt in a large bowl and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the butter brown sugar vegetable oil and vanilla in the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment. <NEXT_STEP> Beat until fluffy and light about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time beating well after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Add half the dry ingredients to the butter sugar mixture and mix on low speed until just incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Add the buttermilk and mix again until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining flour mixture and mix until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the bowl with a rubber spatula folding in any ingredients that didn t get incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter between the prepared pans filling each no more than 3/4 full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted near the center of the cakes comes out clean about 30 minutes for the 6 inch cakes and 40 to 45 minutes for the 8 inch cakes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool in the pans for 5 minutes then turn the cakes out onto wire racks to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> If necessary level the cakes with a serrated knife or cake leveler. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the whip attachment combine the butter and confectioners sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Beat on low speed gradually increasing to high as the sugar is incorporated and the mixture is light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the dulce de leche in three additions until thoroughly combined. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in milk or cream 1 tablespoon at a time until the mixture is a spreadable consistency about 2 tablespoons. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the fine sea salt. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer 3/4 cup of the frosting to a piping bag and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Cover the remaining frosting with a damp towel so it doesn t dry out. <NEXT_STEP> For assembly Place an 8 inch cake layer on an 8 inch cake board. <NEXT_STEP> Top with 1 cup caramel frosting spreading evenly to the edges. <NEXT_STEP> Top with a second layer. <NEXT_STEP> Cover the entire cake with a layer of frosting using a cake smoother or bench scraper to make the frosting as smooth and even as possible. <NEXT_STEP> Chill for 20 minutes or until the frosting is firm. <NEXT_STEP> Pour half the graham cracker crumbs onto a rimmed baking sheet. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the chilled cake from the refrigerator and roll the sides in the crumbs. <NEXT_STEP> Cover the top of the cake evenly with crumbs gently patting them into the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Place a 6 inch cake layer on a 6 inch cake board and top with 1/2 cup caramel frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat the frosting chilling and crumb coating process as before. <NEXT_STEP> Place the finished 6 inch tier on top of the 8 inch cake. <NEXT_STEP> Anchor the two cakes together using one long cake dowel if desired. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate the cake while you prepare the remaining decorations. <NEXT_STEP> Reserve the pan of graham cracker crumbs to use later. <NEXT_STEP> Make the spires and turrets by frosting the top inner edges of two cake cones with the caramel frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Nest a second cake cone inside each frosted one. <NEXT_STEP> Coat the outsides of the cones with frosting using a small offset spatula then roll both cone stacks in the reserved graham cracker crumbs until completely coated. <NEXT_STEP> Frost the exterior of two sugar cones with the caramel frosting and roll in the graham crumbs. <NEXT_STEP> Snip a small hole at the end of the piping bag and pipe a thick line of caramel frosting on the inside of each cake cone and top with the coated sugar cones so they point upward. <NEXT_STEP> Trim away 1 inch from the bottom of one of the remaining sugar cones with a serrated knife using a gentle sawing motion. <NEXT_STEP> Cover the cone with caramel frosting and roll in the crumbs. <NEXT_STEP> Coat the remaining sugar cone with frosting and roll in the crumbs. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate all the decorated cones until firm about 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the cake from the refrigerator and position the two assembled cake cone towers on either side of the front of the cake. <NEXT_STEP> Anchor each in place using a dot of frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Arrange the two remaining decorated sugar cones on top of the cake. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe a mound of frosting under each cone to anchor it in place. <NEXT_STEP> Put the brown sugar cubes in a large bowl and drizzle with honey. <NEXT_STEP> Toss with a fork to coat the cubes with honey then toss with some of the remaining graham cracker crumbs. <NEXT_STEP> Arrange the coated cubes around the top edges of the cake tiers. <NEXT_STEP> Use a dot of piped frosting to anchor each cube in place. <NEXT_STEP> Use the remaining frosting to cover the serving plate. <NEXT_STEP> Generously sprinkle the remaining graham cracker crumbs over the frosting to create a sandy beach appearance. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate while you prepare the candy decorations. <NEXT_STEP> Make the decorations Combine the orange and red candy melting wafers in a microwave safe bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Microwave in 30 second intervals stirring well with a rubber spatula between each until the candy is melted and smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the candy to a piping bag snip the end and pipe into the starfish candy mold. <NEXT_STEP> Put the candy molds on separate small trays or baking sheets. <NEXT_STEP> Rap each pan on the countertop to remove air bubbles and freeze until set about 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the candy out onto a work surface immediately after removing from the freezer. <NEXT_STEP> Place the white candy melting wafers in a microwave safe bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Microwave in 30 second intervals stirring well with a rubber spatula between each until the candy is melted and smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the candy to a piping bag snip the end and pipe into the shell and sand dollar molds. <NEXT_STEP> Put the candy molds on separate small trays or baking sheets. <NEXT_STEP> Rap the pans on the countertop to remove air bubbles and freeze until set about 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the candy out onto a work surface immediately after removing from the freezer. <NEXT_STEP> Allow all the candy decorations to come to room temperature. <NEXT_STEP> Dip a dry art brush in the cocoa powder and tap off excess. <NEXT_STEP> Lightly brush across the white candy pieces to give them dimension. <NEXT_STEP> Arrange the candy shells and starfish around the cake tiers as desired. <NEXT_STEP> To make the castle doors and windows put the melted semisweet chocolate in a piping bag and snip a small hole at the end. <NEXT_STEP> Put the printed template on a small sheet pan. <NEXT_STEP> Cover the template with parchment paper and pipe chocolate onto the paper following the outlines of the shapes on the template. <NEXT_STEP> Use a toothpick to spread the chocolate into corners and fill any holes. <NEXT_STEP> Freeze the chocolate until firm about 10 minutes then turn the pieces over using a toothpick. <NEXT_STEP> Handle the pieces as little as possible to avoid melting the chocolate. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe caramel frosting on the back of each chocolate piece and attach to the sandcastle. <NEXT_STEP> Use a metal skewer or cocktail pick to gently tap a hole into the tip of each sugar cone. <NEXT_STEP> Insert the cupcake flags into the sugar cone spires. <NEXT_STEP> Bring the cake to room temperature before serving. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Sandcastle Cake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> leg <NEXT_INPUT> hairy <NEXT_INPUT> longlegs <NEXT_INPUT> daddy <NEXT_INPUT> scissors <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 1 cupcake <YIELD_END> into place. <NEXT_STEP> Use scissors to cut 8 pieces of licorice for the legs. <NEXT_STEP> Holding all of the legs together in a bunch bend them in 1/2 and crease. <NEXT_STEP> Push the end of each leg <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 ounces butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/2 cups cake flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup buttermilk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Ganache recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Violet Buttercream recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces chocolate <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 ounces egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 ounces sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces butter cut into small pieces at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon violet essence <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Violet food coloring <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Whisk together boiling water and cocoa. <NEXT_STEP> Cover and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> With a mixer cream together the butter sugar salt and vanilla extract. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs 1 at a time and continue creaming until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Sift together the flour baking soda and baking powder and add this mixture alternately with the buttermilk. <NEXT_STEP> Add cocoa and water mixture and mix until thoroughly combined. <NEXT_STEP> Scoop into cupcake pans and bake for 20 to 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool completely before decorating. <NEXT_STEP> Dip tops of cooled cupcakes in the warm ganache and let set. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe more ganache on top for decoration. <NEXT_STEP> To fill put buttercream in a pastry bag with a small round tip. <NEXT_STEP> Stick tip into the center of each cupcake and pipe in filling. <NEXT_STEP> Be careful not to pipe too much or you will break the cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Serve. <NEXT_STEP> Chop chocolate and place in a stainless steel or glass bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Bring cream and sugar just to a boil in a small saucepan and then pour over chocolate. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk together and then stir in butter until melted. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk together the egg whites and sugar in a stainless steel bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Place bowl in a water bath set over low heat. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk occasionally until sugar is dissolved and mixture is very warm about 150 degrees F. Remove from water bath and whip with a hand held mixer on high speed until stiff peaks. <NEXT_STEP> Lower speed and add the butter in small pieces. <NEXT_STEP> Add vanilla and violet essence and mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add violet color 1 drop at a time until desired shade is reached. <NEXT_STEP> Use to fill cupcakes as directed above. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate Devil's Food Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> strawberry <NEXT_INPUT> cake <NEXT_INPUT> layer <NEXT_INPUT> jam <NEXT_INPUT> sliced <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 8 to 10 servings <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> Butter for greasing pans <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Flour for flouring pans <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 box strawberry cake mix <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 can strawberry nectar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 pound fresh strawberries cleaned <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup strawberry jam divided <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 container strawberry frosting <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. between prepared pans. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. <NEXT_STEP> Cool cakes in pans on cooling racks for 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Invert
