<YIELD_START> 24 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 2 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 sticks unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 ounces baking chocolate melted <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 large whole eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/2 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup half and half <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 pound semisweet chocolate chips <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon unsalted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup half and half <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 package instant chocolate pudding mix <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the convection oven to 325 degrees F or a standard oven to 350 degrees F. In large mixer bowl cream together the sugar and butter until light and fluffy with a heavy duty mixer. <NEXT_STEP> Add the melted chocolate and mix well. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time and mix thoroughly after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla and mix well. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the flour baking soda and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Add half of the flour to the mixer bowl along with 1/2 cup of the half and half. <NEXT_STEP> Mix until the flour is mixed in scraping the sides of the bowl with a rubber spatula. <NEXT_STEP> Add the rest of flour mixture and the other 1/2 cup half and half. <NEXT_STEP> Mix until the batter is smooth and all of the flour lumps are gone. <NEXT_STEP> Fill 24 cupcake liners half full and bake for 20 minutes in the convection oven or 28 minutes in the standard oven. <NEXT_STEP> The tops of the cupcakes should be lightly browned. <NEXT_STEP> Check the cupcakes to make sure no batter sticks to a wooden toothpick when inserted into the cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the ganache Put the chocolate chips heavy cream and butter in a medium microwave safe bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Microwave on high for 30 seconds at a time stirring after each time until the chocolate chips are melted and the ganache has the consistency of hot fudge. <NEXT_STEP> It will look like a mess at first but as you continue to stir it will start to form a thicker mixture. <NEXT_STEP> If the ganache becomes too thick to dip put it back in the microwave for about 15 seconds and stir again. <NEXT_STEP> For the chocolate whipped mousse filling and topping In large mixer bowl beat the heavy cream half and half and pudding mix until light and fluffy using heavy duty mixer. <NEXT_STEP> It should have the consistency of whipped cream. <NEXT_STEP> Put the filling in a pastry bag or zipper bag with a corner cut off. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Make a hole in the middle of each cupcake using a sharp knife. <NEXT_STEP> Be sure and leave a small amount of cake in the bottom of the hole. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcakes using the filling in the bag. <NEXT_STEP> Using the same bag frost the tops of the cupcakes with the filling. <NEXT_STEP> Put in the freezer until the topping mixture is cold and somewhat stiff about 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Dip each cupcake in ganache and immediately sprinkle with mini chocolate chips and garnish with a piece of chocolate bar. <NEXT_STEP> Let the cupcakes sit until the ganache is set. <NEXT_STEP> Then serve or refrigerate until time to serve. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Death by Chocolate Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> stout <NEXT_INPUT> rocky <NEXT_INPUT> beer <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> slivered <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 stick unsalted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup stout <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 tablespoons unsweetened Dutch process cocoa <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons stout <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch kosher salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 large egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Big pinch fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/2 sticks unsalted butter softened but cool cut into cubes <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces 60 percent cacao chocolate melted and cooled <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup mini marshmallows toasted <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup roasted slivered almonds <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cake batter Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a standard muffin pan or cupcake pan with 12 cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> In a pot heat the butter and stout over medium heat until the butter is melted. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat add the cocoa powder and whisk until the mixture is smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside to cool slightly. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium bowl sift together the flour granulated sugar baking soda and salt and whisk to blend. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Using a stand mixer beat the sour cream and egg together in a large bowl to blend. <NEXT_STEP> Add the stout/chocolate mixture and beat just to combine. <NEXT_STEP> Add the flour mixture and mix on a low until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter among the cupcake liners filling them three quarters full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a tester inserted into the centers comes out clean about 17 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes on a rack completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the beer syrup In a pot combine the granulated sugar and stout and simmer together until the sugar is completely dissolved. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat and stir in the vodka. <NEXT_STEP> Set the mixture aside to cool. <NEXT_STEP> For the stout filling Using a stand mixer beat the confectioners sugar and butter together until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the stout vanilla extract and salt and mix until creamy. <NEXT_STEP> For the rocky road frosting In a clean metal bowl of a stand mixer whisk the granulated sugar and egg whites together over a pot of simmering water. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk occasionally until a candy thermometer inserted in the mixture registers between 140 and 160 degrees F . <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the mixture to the stand mixer and using the whisk attachment whip until the mixture turns white and almost doubles in size and the outside of the bowl feels at room temperature. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla and salt and continue to whisk. <NEXT_STEP> Switch the attachment from a whisk to a paddle and at a low speed add the butter a few tablespoons at a time and continue mixing. <NEXT_STEP> The frosting is done when it looks glossy and smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the chocolate. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in the mini marshmallows and slivered almonds with a rubber spatula. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Brush the beer syrup onto the cupcakes with a pastry brush or drizzle over the cupcakes using a spoon. <NEXT_STEP> Allow the cupcakes to absorb the syrup. <NEXT_STEP> Cut a small and shallow hole in each cupcake and fill each hole with some of the stout filling. <NEXT_STEP> Using an ice cream scoop scoop some rocky road frosting onto each cupcake. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Rocky Beer Float Cupcake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> custard <NEXT_INPUT> rum <NEXT_INPUT> margarine <NEXT_INPUT> earth <NEXT_INPUT> <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup corn syrup <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon non hydrogenated vegan margarine such as Earth Balance <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a standard cupcake pan with 12 standard cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Sift the flour baking soda and salt into a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Set the bowl aside. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of an electric stand mixer cream the brown sugar and margarine with the whisk attachment about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> In a small bowl or cup combine 1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons water and the egg replacer and stir to dissolve the egg replacer. <NEXT_STEP> Add the egg replacer to the sugar and mix until combined. <NEXT_STEP> In a small bowl combine the soymilk and vinegar and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the mixer speed to low and slowly add the dry ingredients and the soymilk alternating between the two ending with the soymilk. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners three quarters full with batter and bake or until a toothpick inserted into each cupcake comes out clean about 19 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes completely. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble With a plastic drinking straw or a small paring knife make holes in the center of each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Squeeze the Coconut Custard Filling in the center of each cupcake until filled but not overflowing about 1 tablespoon per cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe a dollop of Spiced Rum Frosting onto each cupcake and garnish with a few pieces of the Cracked Brown Sugar Brittle. <NEXT_STEP> This recipe was created by a contestant during a cooking competition. <NEXT_STEP> The Food Network Kitchens have not tested it for home use therefore we cannot make any representation as to the results. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium heavy bottomed saucepot stir together 1 3/4 cups of the coconut milk and the sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Heat on medium high until the mixture begins to bubble around the edges. <NEXT_STEP> In a small bowl mix the remaining 1/4 cup coconut milk and the cornstarch into a slurry. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly add the cornstarch mixture to the hot sugar mixture while whisking. <NEXT_STEP> Cook for 2 more minutes while stirring. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from heat and let cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Put the cooled Coconut Custard into a piping bag and cut 1/4 inch off the tip. <NEXT_STEP> Yield 2 cups. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer whip the margarine and shortening until completely combined. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape the bottom of the bowl to ensure that all ingredients are mixed thoroughly. <NEXT_STEP> On low speed slowly add the powdered sugar a little at a time. <NEXT_STEP> Add the cinnamon allspice and cloves and mix. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape the bottom of the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Add the rum and mix to combine. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape the bottom of the bowl and mix on medium high speed until all the ingredients are combined and the frosting is fluffy about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Put the frosting into a pastry bag and cut 1/2 inch off the tip. <NEXT_STEP> Yield 2 quarts. <NEXT_STEP> Ingredients and Directions Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium heavy bottomed saucepan boil the sugar corn syrup 1/4 cup water and salt stirring until the sugar dissolves. <NEXT_STEP> Place a candy thermometer into the pan and cook on medium heat until the mixture reaches 300 degrees F. Remove from the heat and stir in the baking soda and margarine. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the mixture onto the prepared cookie sheet and quickly spread the hot mixture thinly on the sheet. <NEXT_STEP> Let the candy cool completely and break it into small pieces with your fingers. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Rolling Stones Brown Sugar Cupcake with Coconut Custard Filling, Spiced Rum Frosting and Cracked Brown <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cone <NEXT_INPUT> red <NEXT_INPUT> yellow <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> clown <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 place settings, plus 12 additional cupcakes Shoestring licorice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 small red gumballs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Mini candy covered chocolate candies <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Large multi color nonpareil sprinkles for extra cupcakes <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line 2 muffin tins with white paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Make the cake mix according to package instructions substituting the milk for water. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the batter into the lined muffin tins and bake until golden and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean about 12 to15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the tins from the oven and let them cool completely on a wire rack. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl using a hand mixer beat the frosting with enough confectioners sugar to create a stiff consistency. <NEXT_STEP> Remove about 1/2 cup of the frosting and color it with either red or yellow food coloring. <NEXT_STEP> Put the frosting into a pastry bag or resealable plastic bag fitted with a small star tip. <NEXT_STEP> When the cupcakes are cool frost the top of 12 cupcakes with an offset spatula. <NEXT_STEP> . <NEXT_STEP> Put each cupcake into a red or yellow liner. <NEXT_STEP> The liners will not fit snugly but will resemble a frilly clown s collar. <NEXT_STEP> To decorate Write the name for each guest on colored flags. <NEXT_STEP> Using a small amount of rubber cement fold 1 edge over the top of the toothpick to attach. <NEXT_STEP> Using a serrated knife cut about 1 1/2 inches off the bottom of the sugar cones. <NEXT_STEP> Using pastry brush coat each lightly with piping gel. <NEXT_STEP> Roll 6 cupcakes in yellow sanding sugar and the other 6 in the red. <NEXT_STEP> Firmly but gently insert the flag into the top of each cone. <NEXT_STEP> Put the cones slightly towards the back of each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Snip the licorice into 12 pieces for mouths and approximately 120 for hair. <NEXT_STEP> A clean pair of tweezers is helpful for attaching the hair along the base of the sugar cone. <NEXT_STEP> Add a gumball to each for a nose and either 2 brown or blue candy coated chocolates for eyes. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe small stars with colored frosting along the base of the cones and hair and along the base near the top of the liner. <NEXT_STEP> For extra cupcakes Divide some white frosting into 2 small bowls and color 1 with red coloring and 1 with yellow. <NEXT_STEP> Fit 2 pastry bags with a star tip and fill each with 1 color of the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe a swirl of red frosting onto 6 cupcakes and a swirl of yellow on the remaining cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle each cupcake with nonpareil sprinkles. <NEXT_STEP> Arrange all of the cupcakes on a cupcake stand and serve. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Birthday Party Clown Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> rose <NEXT_INPUT> nail <NEXT_INPUT> petal <NEXT_INPUT> row <NEXT_INPUT> mound with 16 Texas liners or 24 regular cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Sift together the flour baking powder baking soda and salt set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the melted butter with the sugar in a stand butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 sticks unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 to 4 cups powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 to 4 tablespoons Bailey s Irish Cream <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line cupcake pans with 24 liners. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium bowl whisk together the flour baking powder and salt. <NEXT_STEP> In another medium bowl mix the milk and instant coffee stirring until the instant coffee dissolves. <NEXT_STEP> Using an electric mixer beat the butter until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually add the granulated sugar about 1/4 cup at a time beating on medium speed until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides and beat on high speed about 2 minutes more until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time beating well after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Alternately add the flour and milk mixture beating on low speed just until combined scraping down the sides of the bowl often. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon the batter into the liners filling the cups half to two thirds full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean 18 to 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Take a cupcake and hold it upside down submerging the top into the Espresso Ganache lightly pressing down until the entire top of the cupcake is covered. <NEXT_STEP> Lift the cupcake letting the extra chocolate fall away. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the cupcake right side up. <NEXT_STEP> Let the cupcake cool completely before frosting with Bailey s Irish Cream Frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Place the chopped chocolate in a bowl. <NEXT_STEP> In a small saucepan over medium heat heat the heavy cream and instant espresso until it simmers. <NEXT_STEP> Pour over the chopped chocolate and add the butter. <NEXT_STEP> Let stand for about 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Stir until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Using an electric mixer with the paddle attachment cream the butter until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add the powdered sugar 1/2 cup at a time whipping after each addition scraping the sides of the bowl occasionally. <NEXT_STEP> Add the Bailey s Irish Cream and blend but do not over whip. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Five O'Clock Jump Shot <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> grass <NEXT_INPUT> chick <NEXT_INPUT> fluff <NEXT_INPUT> coconut <NEXT_INPUT> color <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 1 cupcake <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 Vanilla Cupcake recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> About 1/3 cup White Fluff Frosting recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Green Coconut Grass recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 small candied malt balls <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 yellow chick peep <NEXT_INGREDIENT> White Airhead candy <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 2/3 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup unsalted butter cut into 1 inch pieces <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large egg yolks <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 2/3 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/3 cups cake flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 10 tablespoons unsalted butter softened <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup marshmallow fluff <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups sweetened shredded coconut <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 to 2 teaspoons liquid green food coloring <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 to 1 teaspoon liquid yellow food coloring <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Frost a cupcake with fluff frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Press a circle of coconut grass on top. <NEXT_STEP> Nestle the malted eggs on top of the grass. <NEXT_STEP> Gently press the peep onto the center of the grass. <NEXT_STEP> Cut the white Airhead into a 1/2 oval shape trim one side so it has a cracked egg jagged edge. <NEXT_STEP> Place egg next to chick. <NEXT_STEP> Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line two 12 cup cupcake tins with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Put tins on a baking sheet. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Process sugar and butter in a food processor until very creamy scraping sides as needed 1 to 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs and yolks one at a time pulsing after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Add the milk water and vanilla and process to blend. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk both flours baking powder and salt in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Add the dry ingredients in 3 batches to the wet pulsing and then scraping batter off the sides of the processor as needed after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Process until the batter is very smooth and pourable like pancake batter about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Evenly pour the batter into the prepared cups filling them 3/4 of the way full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until the cakes are just firm and spring back when gently pressed and the tops are golden 18 to 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool slightly in tin and turn out of tin when cool enough to handle. <NEXT_STEP> Cool cupcakes completely on a rack before frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the milk and vanilla extract together in a small bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly beat the butter and sugar in another medium bowl with an electric mixer until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Raise the speed to high and mix until light and fluffy about 5 to 7 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the fluff and salt and reduce the speed to low. <NEXT_STEP> Add the milk and vanilla mixture scrape the bowl down and mix until fully incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Raise the mixer to high and beat briefly until fluffy about 1 to 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Frost cupcake immediately. <NEXT_STEP> Preheat oven to 250 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. <NEXT_STEP> Place a mesh rack on top if available. <NEXT_STEP> Put coconut in a shallow bowl. <NEXT_STEP> While tossing with a large spoon add food coloring drop by drop until the desired color is reached. <NEXT_STEP> A little more green than yellow makes a pretty grass color. <NEXT_STEP> Add a few tablespoons water to moisten the mixture and help disperse the color evenly. <NEXT_STEP> If the color is too dark add additional water as needed to dilute to the desired color. <NEXT_STEP> Drain the coconut in a sieve or strainer. <NEXT_STEP> Spread the coconut in an even layer on the rack or directly on the lined baking sheet. <NEXT_STEP> Place in the oven until dry about 10 to 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Use immediately or store in covered container for up to 3 days. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Chick and Egg Cupcake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> brain <NEXT_INPUT> red <NEXT_INPUT> coloring <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> velvet <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 2 1/2 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon fine sea salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup buttermilk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon white distilled vinegar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons red food coloring <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup unsalted butter softened <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 cups powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Red and black food coloring <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon sea salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cups canola oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup buttermilk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup coconut milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 extra large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup sweetened shredded coconut <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 tablespoons unsalted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large egg yolks <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup freshly squeezed lime juice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Zest of 2 limes <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 sticks unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 1/2 cups powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons coconut milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon coconut rum <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F and line muffin pans with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium bowl sift the cake flour granulated sugar baking soda and salt. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment combine the oil buttermilk coconut milk vanilla and eggs. <NEXT_STEP> Mix until all the ingredients are fully combined about 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix only until all the ingredients are barely incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in the shredded coconut. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the liners about three quarters of the way full and bake 17 to 19 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let the cupcakes cool slightly before removing them from the pan and transferring to a cooling rack. <NEXT_STEP> For the lime curd In the bowl of an electric mixer beat the butter and granulated sugar until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly add the eggs and yolks and then beat until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the lime juice. <NEXT_STEP> The mixture WILL look curdled. <NEXT_STEP> Do not fear it will smooth out as the butter melts when you cook the mixture. <NEXT_STEP> In a stainless steel saucepan cook the mixture over low heat until it smooths out. <NEXT_STEP> Increase the heat to medium and cook stirring constantly until the mixture is thick 10 to 12 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Do not let it boil. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the curd from the heat and stir in the lime zest. <NEXT_STEP> Put the curd in a clean bowl and wrap it tightly. <NEXT_STEP> Place in the fridge until cool about 1 hour. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting In electric mixing bowl with paddle attachment beat the butter until fluffy and pale in color. <NEXT_STEP> Add the powdered sugar gradually and beat until fully combined. <NEXT_STEP> Drizzle in the coconut milk and rum. <NEXT_STEP> Add more powdered sugar or coconut rum to adjust the consistency of the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Core out the center of the cupcakes fill with lime curd and frost with coconut rum frosting. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Coconut Rum and Lime Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> ounce <NEXT_INPUT> cognac <NEXT_INPUT> cherry granulated sugar with an electric mixer on medium speed until light and foamy about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> While beating gradually pour in the butter and then the vanilla mixing until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the mixer speed to low and add half of the flour mixture mixing until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the milk mixing until combined and then the remaining flour mixture mixing until just incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer one third of the batter to a small bowl and stir in the cocoa powder. <NEXT_STEP> Alternate dropping spoonfuls of each batter into each cupcake liner using a cream cheese and butter using an electric mixer on medium speed until fluffy about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the vanilla and lemon juice. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the mixer speed to low and gradually pan. <NEXT_STEP> Cook until the mixture turns pale amber and registers 340 degrees F on the candy thermometer. <NEXT_STEP> Dip the prepared whisk into the caramel. <NEXT_STEP> Holding the whisk about 2 feet above the spoon handle swing the caramel back and forth like a pendulum in long arcs allowing the strands to fall in threads over the handle. <NEXT_STEP> Let stand until ready to use. from the heat. <NEXT_STEP> When the chocolate begins to cool transfer it to a pastry bag and tie off the top of the bag using a twist tie. <NEXT_STEP> Line a baking sheet with a silicone mat. tablespoons raw sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups frozen blueberries <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons sifted cornstarch <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon raw sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/8 teaspoon cinnamon <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 orange zested <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 cups heavy whipping cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 vanilla beans split and seeds scraped out <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cake batter Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F line a cupcake pan with 12 cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Put the butter in the bowl of a stand mixer with a paddle attachment and beat slowly until it is smooth and creamy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the brown sugar and salt and cream at moderate speed until the mixture is light and fluffy 8 to 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time beating after each addition before adding the next. <NEXT_STEP> Mix until light and fluffy scraping down the sides of the bowl to insure even mixing about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Sift together the cake flour baking powder baking soda and cinnamon in a medium bowl and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Mix together the milk sweet potatoes orange juice and vanilla in a separate bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Add one quarter of the flour mixture to the butter and egg mixture and beat just until blended in. <NEXT_STEP> Add one third of the milk mixture and beat just until blended in. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with the remaining ingredients alternating the flour with the milk until all the ingredients are used. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl occasionally for even mixing. <NEXT_STEP> Toss the blueberries together with the raw sugar in a small bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Scoop up the batter into the cupcake liners and lay 2 to 3 sugared blueberries on each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until an inserted toothpick comes out clean about 22 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool completely before frosting. <NEXT_STEP> For the blueberry filling Put the blueberries cornstarch granulated sugar raw sugar cinnamon orange zest and 2 tablespoons water into a saucepan and set over medium heat. <NEXT_STEP> Bring to a boil and simmer until reduced to a jam like consistency about 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> For the chantilly cream Using an electric mixer whip the cream on high in a cold bowl add the confectioners sugar and vanilla bean seeds and whip until fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Use a corer to remove the center of each cupcake and insert some blueberry filling. <NEXT_STEP> Cover each cupcake with the chantilly cream. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Sweet Potato <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large egg yolks <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 2/3 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/3 cups cake flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 tablespoons light corn syrup <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Food coloring as desired <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Dip cupcake into the icing let excess to drip back into bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Place cupcake on a rack over paper towels to catch any drips. <NEXT_STEP> Cut a length of the licorice about 1 1/2 inches long press the ends together to form a ring. <NEXT_STEP> Press ring into the icing to make a nest. <NEXT_STEP> Fill nest with coconut grass and place eggs in the nest. <NEXT_STEP> Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line two 12 cup cupcake tins with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Put tins on a baking sheet. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Process sugar and butter in a food processor until very creamy scraping sides as needed 1 to 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs and yolks one at a time pulsing after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Add the milk water and vanilla and process to blend. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk both flours baking powder and salt in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Add the dry ingredients in 3 batches to the wet pulsing and then scraping batter off the sides of the processor as needed after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Process until the batter is very smooth about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Evenly pour the batter into the prepared cups filling them 3/4 of the way full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until the cakes are just firm and spring back when gently pressed and the tops are golden 18 to 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool slightly in tin and turn out of tin when cool enough to handle. <NEXT_STEP> Cool cupcakes completely on a rack before frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Put the sugar in an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on the lowest speed slowly add the water the corn syrup and vanilla extract. <NEXT_STEP> When the sugar is sufficiently moistened raise the speed to high and beat for 2 minutes until completely smooth and glossy. <NEXT_STEP> Divide and color as desired. <NEXT_STEP> Store at room temperature covered with plastic wrap directly on the surface of the icing to prevent forming a skin. <NEXT_STEP> For cupcakes Dip the surface of the cupcake into the icing allowing excess to drip into bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Clean any excess from the sides. <NEXT_STEP> Alternately use a knife or a spreader to apply. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk as needed to keep icing glossy and smooth while using. <NEXT_STEP> For Light Blue Icing Combine 2 to 3 drops of blue food coloring to 1 cup of Basic Glaze Icing. <NEXT_STEP> For Deep Yellow Icing Combine 4 to 5 drops of yellow food coloring to 1 cup of Basic Glaze Icing. <NEXT_STEP> For Purple Icing Combine 4 drops of red and 5 drops of blue food coloring to 1 cup of Basic Glaze Icing. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Robin's Egg Nest <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup Crisco All Vegetable Shortening <NEXT_INGREDIENT> or 1/2 stick Crisco Baking Sticks All Vegetable Shortening <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 tsp. baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 tsp. Meringue recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 48 Stacked Peach and Green Almond Cake recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 pint fresh raspberries for garnish <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Raspberry jam for garnish <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 bar bittersweet dark chocolate for garnish <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup seedless raspberry jam <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 large egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup plus 2 tablespoons paste <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cups unsalted butter softened <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Peach vegetable dye <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Green vegetable dye <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line mini cupcake pans with 48 mini cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment cream the butter and sugar on medium speed until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs 1 at a time scraping the bowl after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla and almond extracts. <NEXT_STEP> Sift together the flour baking powder baking soda and salt in a large bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Alternate folding the milk and flour mixture into the butter mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners halfway and bake for 12 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Dip the top of each cupcake into the Raspberry Glaze making sure to cover the entire top of the cake to the rim of the paper. <NEXT_STEP> Using a pastry bag fitted with a large round tip pipe a generous dollop of the pale lavender Swiss Meringue in the center of the cake keeping a rim of the Raspberry Glaze visible. <NEXT_STEP> Top the Swiss Meringue with the stacked Peach and Green Almond Cake. <NEXT_STEP> Using a small pastry brush glaze each raspberry with raspberry jam and sit on top of the cake. <NEXT_STEP> Lightly dust the top of each cupcake with zested bittersweet dark chocolate. <NEXT_STEP> Place the jam in a small saucepan. <NEXT_STEP> Dissolve the jam to liquid over low heat 1 to 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the egg whites sugar and salt in a heatproof bowl of a standing mixer set over a pan of simmering water. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk constantly until the mixture is warm to the touch and the sugar has dissolved. <NEXT_STEP> Attach the bowl to the mixer fitted with the whisk attachment. <NEXT_STEP> Starting on low and gradually increasing to medium high speed whisk until stiff but not dry peaks form. <NEXT_STEP> Continue mixing until the mixture is fluffy and glossy and completely cool. <NEXT_STEP> Add a few drops of purple vegetable dye and mix well until a light lavender color. <NEXT_STEP> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line 2 half sheet trays with silicone mats. <NEXT_STEP> Sift together the flour and salt in a small bowl and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment beat the almond paste and sugar together until small crumbs form. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter and beat on high speed until the mixture is combined. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the bowls and add the eggs 1 at a time beating until each is incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Add the flour mixture in 3 parts beating on low speed after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batters between 2 small mixing bowls. <NEXT_STEP> In the first bowl add a few drops of the peach vegetable dye to the batter and mix well until a pale peach color. <NEXT_STEP> In the second bowl add a few drops of the green vegetable dye and mix well until a pale green color. <NEXT_STEP> Spread each batter on prepared sheet trays. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> When cooled cut the peach cake using a 1 inch round fluted pastry cutter and cut the green cake using a 1/2 inch round fluted pastry cutter. <NEXT_STEP> Stack the green cakes on top of the peach cakes and set aside. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Almond Cupcakes <TITLE_START> Cappuccino "Cup" Cakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> peppermint <NEXT_INPUT> corn <NEXT_INPUT> patty <NEXT_INPUT> disk <NEXT_INPUT> microwave <INPUT_END> syrup <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup vegetable shortening or cocoa butter softened <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons peppermint extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces bittersweet chocolate finely chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup light corn syrup <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 tablespoons unsalted butter <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Make the cupcakes Position a rack in the middle of the oven and preheat to 350 degrees F. about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk to combine then whisk in the brown sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the flour baking powder baking soda and salt in a large bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk in the warm cocoa mixture. <NEXT_STEP> In another bowl whisk the buttermilk eggs and vanilla stir into the batter until just combined but don t overmix. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter among the prepared cups filling each about three quarters of the way. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until the cupcakes spring back when touched 30 to 35 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool in the pans 10 minutes then transfer to racks to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Make the topping Beat the confectioners sugar corn syrup shortening and peppermint extract with a mixer until a tight paste forms. <NEXT_STEP> Gather into a ball place between two sheets of parchment paper and roll out to 1/4 inch thick . <NEXT_STEP> Use a 21/2 inch round cutter or juice glass to cut into disks reroll the scraps. <NEXT_STEP> Place a peppermint disk on top of each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Make the glaze Put the chocolate corn syrup butter and 1/4 cup water in a microwave safe bowl cover with plastic wrap and microwave on 50 percent power until the chocolate melts about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk to combine then cool slightly. <NEXT_STEP> Spread the glaze over the peppermint topping leaving some peppermint exposed. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate until set at least 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Serve cold. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Mint Patty Cakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pea <NEXT_INPUT> chicken <NEXT_INPUT> thyme <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoons unsalted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 small onion finely chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon fresh thyme leaves <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup shredded rotisserie chicken plus more for garnish <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 medium carrots <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup sour cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Crust <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 sheet peas thawed plus more for garnish <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 ounces cream cheese <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon finely grated lemon zest <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Freshly ground black pepper <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and position a rack in the middle of the oven. <NEXT_STEP> Line one 12 cup standard muffin tin with cupcake liners and spray generously with baking spray. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk together the flour cornmeal sugar baking powder 1 teaspoon salt and the pepper in a large bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Heat 2 tablespoons softened butter in a medium skillet over medium high heat. <NEXT_STEP> Once the butter begins to foam add the onions and thyme and cook stirring frequently until soft and dark brown about 8 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Season with the remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat and stir in the chicken and grated carrot just to warm through. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside to cool. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk together the milk sour cream eggs and 2 tablespoons melted butter. <NEXT_STEP> Toss the chicken onion mixture into the flour and then stir in the milk egg mixture until just combined . <NEXT_STEP> Evenly divide among the prepared muffin cups and bake until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean 20 to 22 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes on a rack in the tin for 10 minutes and then remove. <NEXT_STEP> Cool on the rack completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the crust Increase the oven to 425 degrees F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper. <NEXT_STEP> Cut the puff pastry into twelve 2 inch rounds and arrange on the prepared baking sheet. <NEXT_STEP> Poke each round a few times with a fork cover with another sheet of parchment and weigh down with another baking sheet. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the top baking sheet and parchment paper and sprinkle with the thyme leaves salt and pepper. <NEXT_STEP> Return to the oven and bake until golden brown and crispy about 5 minutes more. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to cool . <NEXT_STEP> For the sweet pea cream Combine the peas and 1 tablespoon water in a small microwave safe bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Cover with plastic wrap and cook for 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the cream cheese sour cream lemon zest salt and pepper to taste in the bowl of a food processor. <NEXT_STEP> Pulse until blended and smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add the peas and parsley and pulse once or twice just to roughly chop the peas. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape into a small bowl cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate until ready for use . <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Top the cupcakes with a heaping tablespoon of sweet pea cream and spread to coat. <NEXT_STEP> Decorate each with a piece of chicken chopped carrots and peas. <NEXT_STEP> Top with a crust. <NEXT_STEP> Serve immediately. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Chicken Pot Pie Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> carrot <NEXT_INPUT> cheek <NEXT_INPUT> fur <NEXT_INPUT> face <NEXT_INPUT> buttercream <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 servings <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 1/4 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup sliced almonds <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon ground ginger <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon ground allspice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup grated carrots <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 sticks unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch of fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 to 4 tablespoons milk or heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup unsweetened cocoa <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 stick unsalted butter softened <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 to 4 tablespoons milk or heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Red food coloring <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Green yellow or blue candy coated chocolates <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a 12 cup muffin pan with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the flour almonds baking powder baking soda salt cinnamon ginger and allspice in a food processor and pulse until the almonds are finely ground. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk together the grated carrots granulated sugar oil vanilla and eggs in a large bowl until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the flour mixture until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter evenly among the prepared muffin cups. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted in the center of a cupcake comes out clean 10 to 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer to a rack and let cool for 5 minutes then remove the cupcakes from the pans to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the vanilla American buttercream Combine the butter confectioners sugar and salt in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment and beat on low speed until mostly incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla increase the speed to medium high and beat until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Adjust the consistency with milk or cream as desired. <NEXT_STEP> Use immediately or refrigerate in an airtight container up to 3 days. <NEXT_STEP> For the chocolate frosting Sift the confectioners sugar and cocoa into a large bowl. <NEXT_STEP> In another large bowl combine 1 cup of the sugar mixture with the butter and 1 tablespoon of the milk or cream beating with an electric mixer until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add another cup of sugar mixture and another 1 tablespoon milk or cream beating well. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining sugar mixture and another 1 tablespoon milk or cream and beat until the frosting is fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Add the remaining 1 tablespoon milk or cream if needed for desired consistency. <NEXT_STEP> For the assembly Use some red food coloring to tint 1/2 cup of the vanilla American buttercream pink. <NEXT_STEP> Scoop the pink buttercream into a pastry bag fitted with a no.6 straight tip. <NEXT_STEP> Scoop the remaining white buttercream into a pastry bag fitted with a no.4 straight tip. <NEXT_STEP> Scoop the chocolate frosting into a pastry bag fitted with a no.15 fluted tip. <NEXT_STEP> Using the chocolate frosting create the fur Pipe around the edge of each cupcake by pulling a dollop of frosting to a point over the edge of the cupcake . <NEXT_STEP> Layer the frosting as needed to cover any missing spots. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe a second circle of fur slightly overlapping the first covering almost the entire cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Then create the ears Toward the edge of each cupcake pipe a triangle shape with the chocolate frosting layering it so that it is higher than the fur frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Fill in the center of the triangle with the pink buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat to make a second ear. <NEXT_STEP> Place two candy coated chocolates in the center of the cupcakes to create eyes. <NEXT_STEP> Use the chocolate frosting to fill around the eyes so that they look set into the face. <NEXT_STEP> Underneath the eyes create the cheeks Pipe two circles with the white buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe a smaller circle underneath and between the cheeks for the mouth. <NEXT_STEP> Using the pink buttercream and centering between the cheeks and above the mouth pipe three dots in a triangle shape to make the nose. <NEXT_STEP> Using the frosting of your choice pipe two lines along the center of the face from the nose between the eyes and between the ears. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Carrot-Ginger Cat-Face Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> icing <NEXT_INPUT> button <NEXT_INPUT> Put all the ingredients for the cupcakes except the milk into a food processor and blitz furiously. <NEXT_STEP> Then pour in the milk and process again until you have a smooth batter. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the mixture between either the big muffin pans or the 3 small pans. <NEXT_STEP> Cook the big cupcakes for about 15 to 20 minutes and the small ones for about 10 minutes although you might need to keep a closer eye on the little ones. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes on a wire rack. <NEXT_STEP> To ice the mini cupcakes mix the confectioners sugar with a tablespoon or 2 of water from a recently boiled kettle or cold water for instant royal icing until you have a smooth spreadable paste. <NEXT_STEP> In both cases add water slowly you don t want this runny and nothing is more irritating than having to start sifting more sugar. <NEXT_STEP> The merest tiniest blob of food coloring paste in this case as <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Lilac-or Chocolate-Topped Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> coconut <NEXT_INPUT> grass <NEXT_INPUT> easter <NEXT_INPUT> color <NEXT_INPUT> coloring <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 2 cups coconut grass <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 2 cups sweetened shredded coconut <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 to 2 teaspoons liquid green food coloring <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 to 1 teaspoon liquid yellow food coloring <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat oven to 250 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. <NEXT_STEP> Place a mesh rack on top if available. <NEXT_STEP> Put coconut in a shallow bowl. <NEXT_STEP> While tossing with a large spoon add food coloring drop by drop until the desired color is reached. <NEXT_STEP> A little more green than yellow makes a pretty grass color. <NEXT_STEP> Add a few tablespoons water to moisten the mixture and help disperse the color evenly. <NEXT_STEP> If the color is too dark add additional water as needed to dilute to the desired color. <NEXT_STEP> Drain the coconut in a sieve or strainer. <NEXT_STEP> Spread the coconut in an even layer on the rack or directly on the lined baking sheet. <NEXT_STEP> Place in the oven until dry about 10 to 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Use immediately or store in covered container for up to 3 days. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Coconut Easter Grass for Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pistachio <NEXT_INPUT> flower <NEXT_INPUT> dried <NEXT_INPUT> velvet <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 cup all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon ground allspice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 large egg <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon distilled white vinegar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon red food coloring <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 ounces cream cheese at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 tablespoons unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch of salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup mixed orange yellow and brown nonpareils <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Make the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a 12 cup muffin pan with liners. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the flour cocoa powder baking soda cinnamon allspice and salt in a large bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the granulated sugar milk vegetable oil egg vinegar red food coloring and vanilla in a blender and blend until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add to the flour mixture and stir until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter among the prepared muffin cups filling them three quarters of the way. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until the tops of the cupcakes spring back when gently pressed 20 to 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool 5 minutes in the pan then remove to a rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile make the frosting Beat the cream cheese butter vanilla and salt in a large bowl with a mixer on medium high speed until creamy 2 to 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the speed to medium low gradually add the confectioners sugar and beat until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Increase the mixer speed to high and beat until fluffy about 1 more minute. <NEXT_STEP> Spread the frosting on the cupcakes and dip in the nonpareils shake off any excess. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Red Velvet Cupcakes with Nonpareils <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cranberry <NEXT_INPUT> walnut <NEXT_INPUT> cake <NEXT_INPUT> thanksgiving <NEXT_INPUT> baking <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 24 individual cakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 8 tablespoons unsalted butter at room temperature plus more for the pans <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups sifted all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup sour cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup dried cranberries cherries or raisins <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup light brown sugar packed <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons cold unsalted butter cut into pieces <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup coarsely chopped walnuts or pecans <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Make the Cake. <NEXT_STEP> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line the muffin tins with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> In a mixer fitted with a paddle attachment cream the butter until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> While the mixer is running slowly add the sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time waiting for each to be incorporated before adding the next and mix until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Sift together the flour baking soda baking powder and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Working in batches add the flour mixture to the butter sugar mixture alternating with dollops of sour cream. <NEXT_STEP> Mix in the cranberries. <NEXT_STEP> Pour or spoon the batter into the prepared tins filling them no more than 3/4 full. <NEXT_STEP> Make the Topping Combine the brown sugar flour and cinnamon in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter pieces and using your fingertips pinch the ingredients together into a sandy crumbly mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Add the walnuts and mix. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle the mixture over the cakes. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until risen and browned about 20 to 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool 10 minutes in the pan. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Cranberry Walnut Crumb Cakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> fondant <NEXT_INPUT> butterfly <NEXT_INPUT> flower <NEXT_INPUT> petal <NEXT_INPUT> color <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 6 to 8 each of roses, daisies, butterflies <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> One 10 ounce bag mini marshmallows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> One 1 pound box confectioners sugar sifted plus additional for dusting <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Vegetable shortening for kneading the fondant <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 different colors gel food coloring <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Confectioners sugar for rolling the dough <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the marshmallow fondant combine the marshmallows and 1 tablespoon water in a large microwave safe bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Microwave in 30 second intervals stirring in between each until melted about 1 1/2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Pour about three quarters of the sifted confectioners sugar into the marshmallows and stir to combine. <NEXT_STEP> Once the mixture becomes too stiff to stir grease your counter and hands with shortening and dump the mixture onto the counter. <NEXT_STEP> Knead adding more confectioners sugar a little at a time until the fondant is very smooth not sticky and holds its shape in a ball without relaxing. <NEXT_STEP> Use right away or grease it lightly with additional shortening wrap tightly in plastic wrap and refrigerate for several days. <NEXT_STEP> For the flowers and butterflies Divide the fondant into 3 pieces. <NEXT_STEP> Working with one piece at a time made an indentation in the top with your thumb and drop in food coloring . <NEXT_STEP> Grease your hands and counter with shortening . <NEXT_STEP> Knead the dough until the color is even adding more food coloring if you want it darker. <NEXT_STEP> Wrap in plastic while you repeat with the remaining pieces of dough and different colors. <NEXT_STEP> To make a rose pinch off a walnut size ball of the fondant color of your choice. <NEXT_STEP> Very lightly dust your work surface with confectioners sugar . <NEXT_STEP> Roll the fondant to a scant 1/8 inch thickness. <NEXT_STEP> Use a small round cutter and punch out 10 to 12 rounds. <NEXT_STEP> Roll the first round around itself to create the inside of the rose. <NEXT_STEP> Continue to roll the pieces around each other starting one petal halfway after the previous. <NEXT_STEP> Press the bottom together and peel the petals back slightly to open the rose. <NEXT_STEP> To make a daisy pinch off a walnut size ball of the fondant color of your choice. <NEXT_STEP> Very lightly dust your work surface with confectioners sugar . <NEXT_STEP> Roll to a scant 1/8 inch thickness. <NEXT_STEP> Use a 6 petal flower cutter to cut out as many flowers as you can. <NEXT_STEP> Use a toothpick to press a line down the center of each petal. <NEXT_STEP> For each flower roll some fondant in a contrasting color into a ball slightly smaller than the center of the flower. <NEXT_STEP> Press to flatten slightly and poke the top all over lightly with a toothpick . <NEXT_STEP> Brush the bottom lightly with water and stick it in the center of the flower. <NEXT_STEP> Lay the flowers inside an egg carton to dry so the petals stand up 2 to 3 hours. <NEXT_STEP> To make a butterfly pinch off a walnut sized ball of the fondant color of your choice. <NEXT_STEP> Very lightly dust your work surface with confectioners sugar . <NEXT_STEP> Roll the fondant to a scant 1/8 inch thickness. <NEXT_STEP> Use a 6 petal flower cutter to cut out a few daisy shapes. <NEXT_STEP> Cut and remove the top and bottom petal with a paring knife leaving a V shaped notch the 4 remaining petals should look like a butterfly s wings. <NEXT_STEP> Pinch off 4 tiny pieces of fondant in a different color and roll into balls. <NEXT_STEP> Flatten to make spots for the butterfly s wings and attach to the wings using a little water to adhere. <NEXT_STEP> Pinch off a small piece of fondant in a third color and roll into a snake about 2 inches long. <NEXT_STEP> Snip the top third in half lengthwise with scissors and pull apart to make antennae. <NEXT_STEP> Attach to the body with a little water. <NEXT_STEP> Lay a piece of parchment over a rolling pin and lay the butterfly on it face down to dry about 4 hours and up to overnight. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Marshmallow Fondant Flowers and Butterflies <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> lime <NEXT_INPUT> crystallized <NEXT_INPUT> ginger <NEXT_INPUT> opal <NEXT_INPUT> micro <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 48 mini cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 1/2 cups plus 1/8 cup olive oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups superfine sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups crystallized ginger run through food processor <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 cups cake flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons ground ginger <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 teaspoons vanilla <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Lime Buttercream recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Micro opal basil for garnish <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Micro mint for garnish <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Lime zest for garnish <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 cups fresh lime juice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons cornstarch <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 pound unsalted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 cups confectioners sugar <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line mini cupcake pans with 48 mini cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer with the paddle attachment mix the oil and sugar on high speed until creamy and fully incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Mix in the crystallized ginger until fully incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Add the egg whites and mix well. <NEXT_STEP> Sift together the flour baking powder ground ginger and salt in a large bowl. <NEXT_STEP> On medium speed add the flour mixture alternately with the milk and vanilla mixture until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Do not over mix. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners three quarters of the way and bake for 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Using a pastry bag fitted with a small round tip pipe the top of the cupcakes in a dot pattern with Lime Buttercream creating 6 dots to cover the tops of the cakes. <NEXT_STEP> Snip a small cluster from the stem of each branch of the micro herbs. <NEXT_STEP> Place the bunches in the center of the icing. <NEXT_STEP> Zest fresh lime zest over the cakes to finish off the garnish. <NEXT_STEP> Place the lime juice and cornstarch in a small pan on the stove. <NEXT_STEP> Cook over medium heat whisking until the mixture thickens. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the lime curd to a silicone mat and refrigerate until cool about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer with the paddle attachment cream the butter and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Add the cooled lime curd. <NEXT_STEP> Add the confectioners sugar and beat until light and fluffy. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Crystallized Ginger Olive Oil Cupcakes with Lime Buttercream, Opal Basil, Mint, and Lime Zest <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> raspberry <NEXT_INPUT> frosting <NEXT_INPUT> cone <NEXT_INPUT> spiral <NEXT_INPUT> hi <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 20 servings <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 cup all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 large egg <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 20 cake ice cream cones <NEXT_INGREDIENT> One 1.3 ounce bag freeze dried raspberries <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/3 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon cream of tartar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch of fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 large egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces bittersweet chocolate finely chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons coconut oil <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Whisk together the flour baking soda and salt in a medium bowl set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Heat the milk in a saucepan until hot but not boiling. <NEXT_STEP> Pour over the cocoa powder in a large bowl and whisk until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Cool slightly about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the sugar vegetable oil vanilla and egg into the cocoa mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk in the dry ingredients until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Place the cones upright so they fit snugly in 2 large loaf pans. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter evenly among the cones filling them about halfway. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean and the tops spring back when pressed lightly 20 to 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer to a cooling rack and let cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting Put the freeze dried raspberries in a blender or food processor and grind to a fine dust set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the sugar cream of tartar salt and egg whites in a large metal bowl and whisk until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Place over a pan of simmering water and heat stirring until the mixture is warm and the sugar is dissolved 2 to 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Off heat beat with an electric mixer on medium high speed until the frosting is cool and forms stiff glossy peaks 4 to 6 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer one third of the frosting to a large piping bag fitted with a 3/4 inch plain tip. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in 2 tablespoons of the raspberry powder to the remaining frosting and then put half of that into the piping bag on top of the white frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in 2 more tablespoons raspberry powder into the remaining frosting and put into the piping bag. <NEXT_STEP> Start by piping a spiral of white frosting onto each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Once you get to the pinker frosting pipe a second spiral on each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> When you get to the darker pink frosting pipe a third spiral on each cupcake ending with a bit of a peak of the dark frosting on top Refrigerate until the frosting is well chilled about 1 hour. <NEXT_STEP> For the chocolate dip Meanwhile combine the chocolate and coconut oil in a microwave safe bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Microwave in 30 second intervals stirring in between each until just melted about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer to medium narrow container . <NEXT_STEP> Dip the frosting of each cupcake into the melted chocolate leaving a little of the white frosting visible. <NEXT_STEP> Let the excess drip back off then turn the cone right side up and let the chocolate set until dry about 5 minutes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 to 4 tablespoons milk <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Cream the butter in a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment . <NEXT_STEP> On low speed beat in the powdered sugar and then the salt. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla increase the speed to medium high and beat until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in 2 tablespoons milk adjust the consistency with extra milk as desired. <NEXT_STEP> Use immediately or refrigerate in an airtight container for up to 3 days. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to come to room temperature and beat on medium high until smooth. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Vanilla Buttercream <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> lemon <NEXT_INPUT> cheesecake <NEXT_INPUT> gentleman <NEXT_INPUT> blonde <NEXT_INPUT> cream <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 36 mini cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 6 tablespoons self rising flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 tablespoons all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 stick unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 egg at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Zest and juice of 1 lemon <NEXT_INGREDIENT> One 8 ounce package cream cheese <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 egg <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Zest and juice of 1 lemon <NEXT_INGREDIENT> One 8 ounce package cream cheese <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 stick butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup whipping cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon vanilla <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line mini cupcake pans with paper liners . <NEXT_STEP> For the lemon cupcake In a small bowl combine the self rising and all purpose flours. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Using a stand mixer with the paddle attachment cream the butter on medium speed until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sugar gradually and beat until fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the egg. <NEXT_STEP> Add the flour mixture in two parts alternating with the milk and vanilla and mix until well blended. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in the lemon zest and juice. <NEXT_STEP> For the lemon cheesecake Mix together the cream cheese sugar vanilla and egg in a stand mixer with the whisk attachment until fluffy and smooth about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Mix in the lemon zest and juice. <NEXT_STEP> Layer the cupcake liners with lemon cupcake batter first. <NEXT_STEP> Then add a layer of the lemon cheesecake batter. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the liners with both batters about three quarters full because the cupcakes will rise. <NEXT_STEP> Bake about 18 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the whipped cream cheese frosting Using a stand mixer cream together the cream cheese and butter. <NEXT_STEP> Mix in the confectioners sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Add the whipping cream and vanilla and whip until stiff. <NEXT_STEP> Put the frosting in a piping bag and frost the cooled cupcakes generously. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Gentlemen Prefer Blondes and Lemon Cheesecake Cupcake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> banana <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> anise <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> cardamom <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 24 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> Nonstick cooking spray for spraying liners <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 2/3 cups cake flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 ounces unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 very ripe medium bananas <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup buttermilk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon anise <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon ground cardamom <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 ounces white chocolate finely chopped <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcake batter Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line cupcake pans with cupcake liners lightly spray the liners with cooking spray. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium mixing bowl sift together the cake flour baking powder baking soda and salt and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer with a paddle attachment cream the butter and sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Add the bananas and beat until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Mix the vanilla extract and eggs into the banana mixture scrape down the sides of the bowl and beat until incorporated about 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Add the dry ingredients and buttermilk to the banana mixture in three parts alternating between the dry and wet ingredients. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl and beat for 30 seconds between each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Scoop one scoop of the batter into each cupcake liner. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until the cupcakes bounce back from gentle pressure about 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the pans and cool. <NEXT_STEP> For the white chocolate ganache In a microwave safe bowl microwave the heavy cream anise and cardamom in 30 second intervals until hot but not boiling. <NEXT_STEP> Add the white chocolate and stir gently using a rubber spatula until the chocolate is melted and the mixture is smooth. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble dip the cooled cupcakes in the melted white chocolate ganache. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Banana Cupcake with Spiced White Chocolate Glaze <TITLE_END> cake. <NEXT_STEP> You will need 4 strips to make it around the entire heart cake the fourth strip will need to be shorter so cut it to fit cleanly between the end of the first and third strips. <INPUT_START> chicken <NEXT_INPUT> potato <NEXT_INPUT> glazed <NEXT_INPUT> sweet <NEXT_INPUT> brown <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 24 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> Nonstick cooking spray for spraying liners <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 2/3 cups cake flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 teaspoons cinnamon <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 ounces unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 cups granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup canned sweet potatoes mashed <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup buttermilk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 boneless skinless chicken breast <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups dark brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 pound unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 20 ounces confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch salt <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcake batter and brown sugar glazed chicken Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line cupcake pans with cupcake liners lightly spray the liners with cooking spray. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium mixing bowl sift together the cake flour 1 teaspoon of the cinnamon the baking powder baking soda and a pinch salt. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer with a paddle attachment cream the butter and granulated sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sweet potatoes and beat until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Mix the vanilla extract and eggs into the sweet potato mixture scrape down the sides of the bowl and beat until incorporated about 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Add the dry ingredients and buttermilk to the sweet potato mixture in three parts alternating between the dry and wet ingredients. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl and beat for 30 seconds between each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Scoop one scoop of the batter into each cupcake liner. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until the cupcakes bounce back from gentle pressure 25 to 30 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the pans and cool. <NEXT_STEP> Heat the oil in a skillet over medium high heat. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle both sides of the chicken with 1/2 teaspoon salt. <NEXT_STEP> Cook until golden brown and caramelized about 4 minutes and then flip over to cook the other side. <NEXT_STEP> Continue cooking to an internal temperature of 165 degrees F. Set aside to cool slightly. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium saucepan over medium heat combine the reserved sweet potato liquid brown sugar the remaining 2 teaspoons cinnamon and 1/2 teaspoon salt and bring to a boil. <NEXT_STEP> Simmer until the mixture has the consistency of maple syrup about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Finely dice the cooked chicken breast and place in a medium mixing bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the syrup over the chicken and toss to coat. <NEXT_STEP> For the buttercream frosting In the bowl of a stand mixer with a paddle attachment beat the butter on medium speed until smooth and free of lumps. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly add the confectioners sugar and cinnamon while mixing on the lowest speed. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Mix on medium speed until combined and smooth. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Using a pastry bag fitted with an open tip ice the cooled cupcakes with two rings of buttercream to form a well. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the well with glazed chicken and some of the syrup. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Sweet Potato Cupcake with Brown Sugar Glazed Chicken <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> prosecco <NEXT_INPUT> baby <NEXT_INPUT> sparkling <NEXT_INPUT> easter <NEXT_INPUT> mini <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 48 mini cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 1/2 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup unsalted butter melted <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 to 3 tablespoons Prosecco or Champagne <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Sanding sugar or tiny candies for decorating <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. mixer until light and foamy about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> While beating gradually pour in the butter and then the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> While mixing slowly add half the dry ingredients then add all the milk and follow with the rest of the dry ingredients. <NEXT_STEP> Take care not to over mix the batter. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter evenly in the prepared tins Bake until a tester inserted in the center of the cakes comes out clean about 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool cupcakes on a rack in the tin. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk together the confectioners sugar and Prosecco until smooth and sugar dissolves. <NEXT_STEP> Dip the tops of each baby cake in the Prosecco glaze sprinkle with sugar or top with tiny candies and return to the rack to set about 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cooks Note This is a great way to use up leftover bubbly. <NEXT_STEP> This recipe works just as well with flat Prosecco. <NEXT_STEP> For a full wine flavor prick the mini cupcakes with toothpicks when they are cooling then drizzle with some Prosecco before icing with the glaze. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Sparkling Baby Cakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> peppermint <NEXT_INPUT> mint <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> flirty <NEXT_INPUT> whipping <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 24 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 2 2/3 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups gluten free baking mix <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup canola oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup heavy whipping cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups chopped good quality milk chocolate such as Callebaut <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon gluten free peppermint extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup plus 2 tablespoons sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 ounces egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon cream of tartar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 sticks salted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon gluten free peppermint extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch fine sea salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup mini chocolate chips <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cake batter Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Line two 12 cup muffin pans with cupcake liners and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer with a paddle attachment add the sugar gluten free baking mix cocoa powder and salt and mix on low speed until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time waiting until each egg is fully incorporated before adding the next. <NEXT_STEP> Add the milk oil and vanilla and mix on low speed until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Stop the mixer and scrape down the sides of the bowl to make sure all the ingredients are thoroughly combined. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the mixer to low and slowly pour in 1 cup hot water making sure it is evenly incorporated into the batter. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners two thirds full with the batter and bake until the top of each cupcake is slightly springy to the touch and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean 14 to 16 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Immediately turn the cupcakes out of the pans onto a cooling rack and let cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the mint chocolate ganache filling Put the cream in a saucepot and heat to a scald over medium heat. <NEXT_STEP> Do not boil Put the chocolate in a mixing bowl and pour the hot cream over it. <NEXT_STEP> Let it sit a moment and then gently stir to combine and melt the chocolate. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the peppermint extract and then set aside to cool and thicken up. <NEXT_STEP> The ganache can be made several days ahead of time and kept in an airtight container in the refrigerator. <NEXT_STEP> For the mint chocolate chip Italian meringue buttercream Put the sugar and 1/4 cup water in a heavy saucepan and heat over high heat until the sugar mixture registers 250 degrees F on a candy thermometer 15 to 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> While the sugar is cooking whip the egg whites on medium speed in the bowl of a stand mixer to the soft peak stage being careful not to over whip. <NEXT_STEP> Add the cream of tartar and continue whipping. <NEXT_STEP> While the egg whites are whipping on medium speed gently pour the sugar syrup down the side of the mixing bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the speed up to high and whip until the mixing bowl no longer feels warm to the touch about 7 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the mixer back to medium and add the butter in small chunks whipping until it is completely incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Stop the mixer scrape down the sides of the bowl and add the peppermint extract and sea salt. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the mixer back to medium low speed and mix until the peppermint extract is fully incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Add the mini chocolate chips and stir to combine. <NEXT_STEP> Fit an 18 inch piping bag with a round tip and twist and hold the bag right by the tip to prevent the buttercream from leaking out. <NEXT_STEP> Fold the top of the piping bag over your hand and spoon the buttercream into the bag. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble use an apple corer or knife to core out the center of each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Fill each cupcake with some of the mint chocolate ganache and frost the top of each with some mint chocolate chip Italian meringue buttercream. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Barbie's Fresh and Flirty New York Night Out Cupcake <TITLE_END> <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon sea salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 ounces cream cheese <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 pounds powdered sugar sifted <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F.
