granulated sugar 1/4 cup water and the honey. <NEXT_STEP> Bring to a boil and stir until the water has evaporated and the figs are soft. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sea salt and refrigerate until cool. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting Whip the cream cheese and butter in an electric mixer with the paddle attachment until fully incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on low gradually add the powdered sugar until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla and mix until fully incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Use a knife to make a hole in the center of the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Fill with salted honey fig compote and then frost with cream cheese frosting. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Figueroa Cupcakes: Chunky Lemon Fig Cake, Salted Honey Fig Compote, Cream Cheese Frosting <TITLE_END> <NEXT_STEP> Cook for 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Drain and repeat the process two more times. <NEXT_STEP> In a large pan over medium heat stir the sugar and 1 cup water together until the sugar has dissolved. <NEXT_STEP> Bring to a boil add the peels and reduce to heat to low. <NEXT_STEP> Cook swirling occasionally until the peels are very soft and almost translucent 45 minutes to 1 hour. <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 4 cups sweetened flake coconut <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pink or red powdered food coloring or use assorted colors <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups cake flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon fine sea salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup chopped unsweetened chocolate <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup hot freshly brewed coffee <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup sour cream at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/2 cup whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons coconut extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 pound unsalted butter softened <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Crystallized Flowers optional garnish recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 teaspoons meringue powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Bowl of ice cubes <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup fine granulated sugar in a fine mesh sugar duster or salt shaker <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the tinted coconut Place the coconut in a mason jar or zip top bag. <NEXT_STEP> Add 3 to 5 drops of food coloring one drop at a time. <NEXT_STEP> Shake until it is completely covered and the desired color is evenly distributed. <NEXT_STEP> For the cupcakes Position an oven rack in the lower third of the oven and preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line 18 cupcake cups with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment combine the sugar flour baking soda and sea salt. <NEXT_STEP> Let the mixer run on low for 2 to 3 minutes to incorporate air without sifting. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile place the chocolate in a medium bowl and pour the hot coffee and vanilla extract over the chocolate. <NEXT_STEP> Let the chocolate and coffee mixture stand for about 2 minutes to melt the chocolate then stir until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In another medium bowl whisk the oil and eggs together quickly so that they combine thoroughly. <NEXT_STEP> They will be thick and satiny and light in color. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk in the sour cream but leave some visible streaks of white being careful not to over mix. <NEXT_STEP> Pour in the melted chocolate mixture and mix until just combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the chocolate and sour cream mixture to the dry ingredients in the mixing bowl fitted with the paddle attachment and mix on medium speed adding in thirds until just combined 1 to 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the bowl from the mixer and incorporate with a rubber spatula any ingredients that may be hiding at the bottom of the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> The batter will be very wet and chocolaty so it helps to transfer the batter into a liquid measuring cup to make it easier to pour. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the batter into the prepared cupcake pan filling each baking cup about two thirds full. <NEXT_STEP> Refill the measuring cup as needed and repeat until all of the cupcake cups are filled. <NEXT_STEP> Bake the cupcakes until a cake tester inserted in the center comes out clean 20 to 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside to cool for at least 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Once the cupcakes are cooled remove them from the paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> For the creamy coconut buttercream frosting Combine the flour 1/2 cup of the milk and vanilla extract in a small saucepan and whisk until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Over medium heat gradually add the remaining 1 1/2 cups milk and whisk constantly. <NEXT_STEP> Continue to cook the mixture until it comes to a low boil. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the heat to low and continue to whisk until the mixture begins to thicken and starts to burp 2 to 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the mixture from the heat and transfer it to a small heat proof bowl to cool. <NEXT_STEP> Stir the mixture occasionally as it continues to cool to keep it lump free. <NEXT_STEP> If you do get few lumps don t worry you can whisk the mixture to dissolve the lumps or pass the mixture through a mesh sieve to get a completely smooth consistency. <NEXT_STEP> Set the mixture aside to cool to room temperature. <NEXT_STEP> In a stand mixer or with an electric mixer fitted with the whisk attachment whip the butter on medium speed until it is soft and creamy 2 to 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually add in the sugar and beat on high speed until light and fluffy 5 to 7 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually add in the cooled milk mixture and increase the mixer to medium high speed and whip until the frosting is light and fluffy scraping down the bottom and sides of the bowl with a rubber spatula to make sure the frosting is thoroughly mixed. <NEXT_STEP> The frosting can be stored in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 2 days. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble the cupcakes Use an apple corer or a paring knife to scoop out a hole in the middle of the cupcake about 1 inch deep. <NEXT_STEP> Fill a pastry bag fitted with a 1/2 inch pastry tip with the buttercream frosting and fill the hole of each cupcake with frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Frost the cupcakes all over with the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Place the coconut in a small bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Roll the frosted cupcakes in the tinted coconut and decorate with Crystallized Flowers if desired. <NEXT_STEP> Store the cupcakes in an airtight container for up to 2 days. <NEXT_STEP> Dilute the meringue powder with 4 tablespoons warm water. <NEXT_STEP> Pick some pesticide free fresh. <NEXT_STEP> fully opened edible flowers such as Johnny jump ups pansies violets marigolds and roses. <NEXT_STEP> Gently give the flowers a water bath in a small bowl of water with a pinch of salt. <NEXT_STEP> Next dunk them in a bowl filled with ice cubes to perk the petals up. <NEXT_STEP> Gently remove the flowers and set aside to air dry on paper towels. <NEXT_STEP> Working over a small bowl apply a thin layer of the meringue powder mixture with the paint brush. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle the sugar over the flowers shaking off the excess. <NEXT_STEP> Use the tweezers to make sure the delicate flower is completely covered with sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside to dry in a cool dry place for 2 to 4 hours. <NEXT_STEP> The flowers will take a bit longer to dry in humid weather. <NEXT_STEP> Store the dry flowers in an airtight container for up to 6 months. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Pinkies Chocolate Lunch Box Treats <TITLE_END> While the sugar cooks begin whipping the egg whites in a stand mixer with the whisk attachment to full volume. <NEXT_STEP> Once the temperature of the sugar reaches 235 degrees F pour the sugar into the egg whites. <NEXT_STEP> Continue whipping until the mixture cools to just above body temperature about 4 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly add in 1 pound butter . <NEXT_STEP> After each addition allow the butter to mix in almost completely before adding more. <NEXT_STEP> The mixture should separate and come back together. <NEXT_STEP> In a small saucepan heat 8 ounces water to a boil. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat and add the loose tea . <NEXT_STEP> Steep for 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> After 10 minutes strain into a separate bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Once the butter mixture has come back together fluffy about 5 minutes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate Cupcakes with a Chocolate, Orange and Clove Infused Ganache Filling and a Chinese Spiced Tea Buttercream <TITLE_END> 1/2 cup milk at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 large eggs at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 pounds milk chocolate chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 ounces semisweet chocolate chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 16 ounce container sour cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon coffee <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon pure vanilla extract <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> To make the cake Position a rack in the center of the oven and preheat to 350 degrees F. Brush two 8 inch round cake pans with oil line the bottoms with circles of parchment paper lightly brush the paper and pan with oil and dust with flour. <NEXT_STEP> Put the flour baking powder and salt into the bowl of a food processor. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sugar and orange zest and pulse a few times to combine evenly. <NEXT_STEP> Cut the butter into small pieces and add to dry ingredients. <NEXT_STEP> Pulse until the mixture looks like coarse sand with some pea size bits of butter about 5 times. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the milk eggs and vanilla together in a liquid measuring cup. <NEXT_STEP> With the processor running pour in the wet ingredients and process to make a smooth batter . <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter between the prepared pans and bake until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean about 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cakes on a rack for 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Then run a knife around the edges of the pans turn the cakes out onto a plate and peel off the paper. <NEXT_STEP> Flip the cakes upright and cool completely on the rack about 45 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> . <NEXT_STEP> When ready to ice the cake make the frosting Put the chocolates in a medium microwave safe bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Microwave on medium for a minute stir and repeat until chocolate melts about 3 minutes in all. <NEXT_STEP> Let chocolate cool slightly. <NEXT_STEP> Stir the sour cream coffee and vanilla into the chocolates. <NEXT_STEP> Beat with a handheld electric mixer until frosting is silky and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Set a large flat plate on a large inverted bowl or bottom of a salad spinner . <NEXT_STEP> Dab a little frosting in the center of the plate and place a cake layer top side up on top. <NEXT_STEP> With an offset spatula scoop about one third of the frosting onto the cake and spread it evenly to the edge of the cake. <NEXT_STEP> Place the other layer on top and press down lightly. <NEXT_STEP> Spread another third of the frosting around the sides. <NEXT_STEP> Spread the remaining frosting on the top of the cake. <NEXT_STEP> Lightly touch the frosting with the back of a spoon to make swirly peaks. <NEXT_STEP> Serve immediately or set aside at room temperature for up to 2 hours before serving. <NEXT_STEP> If refrigerating the cake bring to room temperature 30 minutes before serving. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Birthday Cake with Chocolate Frosting <TITLE_END> the gumball in the center. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Marshmallow Chick Flower <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pineapple <NEXT_INPUT> salad <NEXT_INPUT> grill <NEXT_INPUT> carrot <NEXT_INPUT> grilled <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 4 servings <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 2 carrots peeled <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 ears fresh corn shucked <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 pineapple rings <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Olive oil for drizzling <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 scallions finely chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 stalks celery diced <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 seedless cucumbers diced <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon pineapple juice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon grained Dijon mustard <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon liquid smoke <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup extra virgin olive oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the salad Prepare the ingredients for the grill. <NEXT_STEP> Cut the carrots into halves equal in length. <NEXT_STEP> Then cut the smaller tip of the carrot into fourths lengthwise and the larger half into sixths or eighths. <NEXT_STEP> The key is making the spears all the about the same size. <NEXT_STEP> Line up the prepared carrots corn and pineapple slices on a tray and drizzle with olive oil. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle all with a pinch or two of salt and a few grinds of pepper. <NEXT_STEP> Flip the pineapple rings and repeat the process for them only. <NEXT_STEP> Roll and jiggle the rest to fully coat them. <NEXT_STEP> Grill the prepared ingredients. <NEXT_STEP> Heat the grill or grill pan to medium high. <NEXT_STEP> Place the carrots corn and pineapple rings directly on the grill. <NEXT_STEP> Use tongs to tend to the grill. <NEXT_STEP> Roll and flip the vegetables until your personal preference for doneness pulling each off to a tray when done. <NEXT_STEP> The carrots are best when charred caramelized and a bit crispy on the ends 10 to 12 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Corn is great fresh so just go for color on all sides about 8 minutes total. <NEXT_STEP> The pineapples are best when slightly charred but still juicy about 6 minutes total flipping once. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the salad ingredients. <NEXT_STEP> When the grilled goods are all cool enough to handle chop the carrots pineapples and trim the kernels off the corn. <NEXT_STEP> Add to a bowl along with the scallions celery and cucumber. <NEXT_STEP> For the vinaigrette In a medium bowl add the pineapple juice mustard apple cider vinegar sugar and liquid smoke and whisk until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Continue to whisk rigorously while slowly pouring the olive oil into the bowl with your other hand or with the help of a friend nice to have them in the kitchen Taste the vinaigrette and season with a pinch of salt and few grinds of black pepper. <NEXT_STEP> Dress the salad. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the vinaigrette over the bowl then gently toss using tongs. <NEXT_STEP> Serve room temperature or chilled. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Sunny's Grilled to Chill Salad <TITLE_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 3/4 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 teaspoon plus 1 pinch fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 sticks unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 large egg <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 large egg yolk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon finely grated lemon zest <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup store bought lemon curd <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup light corn syrup <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Lemon jelly beans for garnish if desired <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Line one 12 cup standard muffin tin with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Sift together the flour baking powder and 3/4 teaspoon of the salt. <NEXT_STEP> Beat together the butter and 1 cup of the sugar with an electric mixer until pale and fluffy about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the egg yolk zest and 1 1/2 teaspoons of the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the speed to low and add the flour mixture in three additions alternating with the milk beginning and ending with the flour mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter among the muffin cups and bake until a tester inserted in the middle of the cakes come out clean 20 to 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cakes for 10 minutes in the tin and then remove and cool completely on a rack. <NEXT_STEP> Put the lemon curd in a piping bag fitted with a 1/8 inch round pastry tip. <NEXT_STEP> Insert the tip into the center of each cupcake and pipe in equal amounts of curd. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the egg whites corn syrup the remaining 1/2 cup sugar the remaining 1 teaspoon vanilla and the remaining pinch of salt in a metal bowl set over a saucepan of simmering water. <NEXT_STEP> Beat with an electric mixer until thick and fluffy about 7 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat and beat until the frosting is slightly cooled about 2 minutes longer. <NEXT_STEP> Mound the frosting on top of the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> If desired use a kitchen torch to brown the frosting and garnish with a lemon candy. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Lemony Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> almond <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cake <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> glaze <NEXT_INPUT> lunch <NEXT_INPUT> glazed <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 6 small cakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 1/2 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup unsalted butter melted <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 ounces semisweet chocolate finely chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 tablespoons corn syrup <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Fresh raspberries colorful candies or royal icing <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line the muffin tin with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the flour baking powder and salt together in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> In another medium bowl beat the eggs and sugar with an electric mixer until light and foamy about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> While beating gradually pour in the butter and then the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> While mixing slowly add half the dry ingredients then add all the milk and follow with the rest of the dry ingredients. <NEXT_STEP> Take care not to over mix the batter. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter evenly in the prepared tin. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a tester inserted in the center of the cakes comes out clean about 30 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool cupcakes on a rack in the tin for 10 minutes then remove. <NEXT_STEP> Cool on the rack completely. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble the cakes Slice a small layer off the top of the domed side of each cupcake to make a flat surface. <NEXT_STEP> Peel cupcake liners off and place cakes upside down on a rack. <NEXT_STEP> To make the glaze Put the chocolate in a medium heatproof bowl. <NEXT_STEP> In a small saucepan bring cream water and corn syrup to a simmer. <NEXT_STEP> Pour hot cream over the chocolate and shake bowl gently so cream settles around the chocolate. <NEXT_STEP> Set mixture aside soft about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk until smooth taking care not to incorporate too many air bubbles. <NEXT_STEP> To Decorate While still warm and loose pour a thin layer of glaze over each cake. <NEXT_STEP> If desired set aside for about one hour before serving if pressed for time slip the cakes into the freezer to set. <NEXT_STEP> Decorate mini cakes with fresh berries or candies. <NEXT_STEP> If using candies to decorate press into still slightly wet glaze before it sets. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate-Glazed <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 3 1/4 ounces unsalted butter softened <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 1/2 ounces granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 1/4 ounces cake flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/2 ounces coconut milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 ounces whole eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 ounces egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/2 ounces desiccated coconut <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 ounce granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 ounces dark rum <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 1/4 ounces light brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 ounces clover honey <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 small ripe pineapple <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 1/2 ounces unsalted butter softened <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 17 1/2 ounces cream cheese <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 9 ounces powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 ounce tangelo flavored paste such as Amoretti <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Desiccated coconut <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Mandarin orange segments <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Rolled fondant street sign <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a standard muffin pan with 12 cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment combine the butter and granulated sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Cream on high speed until the butter is light and fluffy about 6 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Sift together the flour baking powder and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the coconut milk whole eggs egg whites and vanilla extract. <NEXT_STEP> Alternately add the flour mixture and the coconut milk mixture to the creamed butter in three stages allowing the batter to mix for 30 seconds after adding the dry or wet ingredients. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in the desiccated coconut. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners three quarters full with batter and bake until golden brown and baked through about 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> For the dark rum syrup Bring the granulated sugar and 1 ounce water to a gentle simmer. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat and stir in the dark rum. <NEXT_STEP> Liberally douse the baked cupcakes with syrup immediately upon removing the cupcakes from the oven. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the pineapple filling Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Sprinkle the brown sugar into the bottom of an 8 inch square baking dish. <NEXT_STEP> Drizzle the honey and sprinkle the cinnamon on top of the brown sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Peel core and small dice the pineapple. <NEXT_STEP> Evenly distribute the pineapple over the brown sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Wrap the baking dish with aluminum foil and bake for 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the oven remove the foil and stir the pineapple and liquefied sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Replace the foil and bake the pineapple for another 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the oven remove the foil and stir the pineapple and liquefied sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Bake the pineapple uncovered for another 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the oven and allow to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the tangelo cream cheese icing In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with a paddle beat the butter until light and fluffy on medium high speed. <NEXT_STEP> Add the cream cheese and mix on medium high speed until well combined and lump free. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the mixer bowl and add the powdered sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Stir on low speed until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla extract and tangelo paste and beat on medium high speed for 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Place in a pastry bag fitted with a large round tip. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Using an apple corer remove the center core of the baked cupcakes and fill with oven roasted pineapple. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe tangelo cream cheese icing generously on top of the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Roll the cupcake icing in toasted desiccated coconut and garnish with a mandarin orange segment and rolled fondant street sign. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Cruising Down Collins <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> coconut <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> marshmallow <NEXT_INPUT> tres <NEXT_INPUT> lech <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 30 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 5 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 1/4 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups canola oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups yogurt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons coconut bakery emulsion <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons vanilla <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 cups coconut shavings <NEXT_INGREDIENT> One 14 ounce can sweetened condensed milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> One 12 ounce can evaporated milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/8 teaspoon cream of tartar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 3/4 pounds unsalted butter cut into 1 inch pieces <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon vanilla <NEXT_INGREDIENT> A few drops coffee flavored oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups chopped white chocolate <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 30 marshmallows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 30 chocolate covered espresso beans <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cake batter Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Line cupcake pans with 30 cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Sift together the flour baking powder salt and baking soda in a large bowl and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer with a paddle attachment cream the sugar and eggs until light yellow in color about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Mix in the oil until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sifted ingredients and mix until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Mix in the yogurt. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl add the coconut emulsion and vanilla and mix until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners three quarters full with batter. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until an inserted toothpick comes out clean about 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let the cupcakes cool for 15 minutes and then pull them from the pans and place on a cooling rack or baking sheet to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Leave the oven on for the toasted coconut. <NEXT_STEP> For the toasted coconut Spread the coconut out evenly on a baking sheet forming a single layer. <NEXT_STEP> Bake stirring halfway through until golden brown but not scorched about 12 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool for 15 minutes and then transfer to a bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> For the tres leches mix Whisk the sweetened condensed milk evaporated milk and heavy cream together. <NEXT_STEP> Poke three holes in the top of each baked cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Brush the tres leches mix on top of each cupcake three times. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting In the bowl of a stand mixer with a whisk attachment combine the egg whites and cream of tartar and whip at medium speed until frothy. <NEXT_STEP> Add 1 1/2 cups of the sugar and whip at high speed until stiff peaks form. <NEXT_STEP> In a saucepan stir the remaining 1/2 cup sugar into 1/2 cup water. <NEXT_STEP> Put a candy thermometer in the pan and place the pan over medium high heat. <NEXT_STEP> When the simple syrup reaches the soft ball stage immediately pour it into the egg whites while the mixer is on low speed. <NEXT_STEP> Once all the syrup is added turn the mixer to high and whip until the bottom of the bowl is cool about 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter and whip until smooth and silky. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla and coffee flavored oil and mix until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Scoop 1/4 cup frosting onto each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Roll each cupcake upside down in the bowl of toasted coconut until the top is rounded and coated in coconut set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Melt the white chocolate in a double boiler. <NEXT_STEP> Cut the marshmallows in half diagonally. <NEXT_STEP> Dip two marshmallow pieces in the white chocolate and place on a cupcake toward the top . <NEXT_STEP> Place a chocolate covered espresso bean in the middle of the cupcake . <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with the remaining marshmallows and espresso beans. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Sandy <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> red <NEXT_INPUT> deliciousness <NEXT_INPUT> apple <NEXT_INPUT> cranberry 1 1/2 cups ground chocolate sandwich cookies with chocolate filling <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Two 13.5 ounce cans vanilla rolled wafer cookies such as Pirouette <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the tomatoes Knead the red fruit chews together in your hands until soft and pliable. <NEXT_STEP> Divide into 4 equal pieces and roll into small balls. <NEXT_STEP> Use a skewer to make wrinkles in the top and drill a small hole in each. <NEXT_STEP> For the carrots Knead the orange fruit chews in your hands until soft and pliable. <NEXT_STEP> Divide into 4 equal pieces and form each piece into a carrot shape. <NEXT_STEP> Drill a hole in the top of each with a skewer. <NEXT_STEP> For the eggplant Knead the purple fruit chews together in your hands until soft and pliable. <NEXT_STEP> Divide into 4 equal pieces and form each piece into an eggplant shape. <NEXT_STEP> Knead the green fruit chews in your hands until soft and pliable. <NEXT_STEP> Divide into 4 equal pieces form each piece into a stem shape and place one on each eggplant. <NEXT_STEP> For the lettuce Knead the green and yellow fruit chews together in your hands until soft pliable and evenly mixed. <NEXT_STEP> Divide into 4 equal pieces. <NEXT_STEP> Roll out each piece into a 4 inch long rope and lightly press to flatten. <NEXT_STEP> Roll up each rope to form concentric circles like a head of lettuce flaring out the outer layer to form leaves. <NEXT_STEP> For the bunny butt and feet Place the regular marshmallow on the end of a skewer and frost it entirely with the frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Roll the marshmallow in the coconut to completely coat. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the skewer. <NEXT_STEP> Dab a small dollop of the white frosting on the flat side of the regular marshmallow to use as glue towards the top in the 12 o clock position. <NEXT_STEP> Glue on the mini marshmallow to create a bunny tail. <NEXT_STEP> To make bunny feet use the pink icing to pipe paw pads onto each almond. <NEXT_STEP> Dab 2 small dollops of the white frosting on the flat side of the regular marshmallow to use as glue towards the bottom in the 4 and 8 o clock positions. <NEXT_STEP> Glue on the bunny feet. <NEXT_STEP> For the sunflowers Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. <NEXT_STEP> In a small bowl combine the almonds yellow food coloring and 1/2 teaspoon water and mix until the almonds are yellow. <NEXT_STEP> Spread out on the lined baking sheet to dry. <NEXT_STEP> Insert the almond slices into the frosting around the edge of the mini cupcakes in 2 rows to mimic the petals of a sunflower. <NEXT_STEP> Carefully sprinkle the center of each cupcake with the chocolate sprinkles to mimic sunflower seeds. <NEXT_STEP> For the cake assembly If using a 1/2 sheet cake use a toothpick to draw a 12 by 8 inch rectangle in the center of the cake 1 1/2 inches from the edges. <NEXT_STEP> This rectangle will be the dirt garden plot. <NEXT_STEP> Cut about 58 of the rolled wafer cookies in half and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> If using a 1/4 sheet cake draw a 10 by 6 1/2 inch rectangle in the center of the cake 1 inch from the edges to form the dirt garden plot. <NEXT_STEP> Cut about 36 of the rolled wafer cookies in half and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Fill a large resealable plastic bag with the green frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Using a toothpick punch 8 to 10 holes in one of the corners along the bottom of the bag. <NEXT_STEP> Squeeze the bag and pipe grass in the border around the garden plot. <NEXT_STEP> Carefully spread an even layer of the ground cookies inside the rectangle to create dirt for the garden plot. <NEXT_STEP> Using the remaining ground cookies make 4 evenly spaced long dirt mounds in the plot. <NEXT_STEP> Press the rolled wafer cookie halves around the outside of the cake to form a fence. <NEXT_STEP> Place the eggplants along one of the dirt mounds. <NEXT_STEP> Place the carrots along the second dirt mound and plant some into the dirt. <NEXT_STEP> Insert mint sprigs into the top of the carrots to create carrot tops. <NEXT_STEP> Place the lettuce heads along the third dirt mound. <NEXT_STEP> Place the tomatoes along the fourth with mint sprigs to mimic vines. <NEXT_STEP> Place a sunflower mini cupcake in each corner of the garden and place 2 mint sprigs around each to mimic leaves. <NEXT_STEP> Place the bunny butt in the garden plot. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Pass The Garden Cake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> lime <NEXT_INPUT> key <NEXT_INPUT> curd <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> bottled <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 24 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 2 sticks unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon finely grated lime zest <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Key Lime Curd recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Key Lime Frosting recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup graham cracker crumbs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Key Lime slices for garnish optional <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 large egg yolks <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 stick unsalted butter cut into cubes <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon grated lime zest <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup freshly squeezed or bottled Key lime juice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 tablespoons unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup sweetened condensed milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 tablespoons freshly squeezed or bottled Key lime juice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup confectioner s sugar <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and line one 12 cup standard muffin tin with paper cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Cream the butter in a large bowl with an electric mixer until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually add the granulated sugar and beat until light and fluffy about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time scraping down the sides of the bowl between additions. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the flour baking powder lime zest and salt in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Add one third of the flour mixture to the butter mixture beat in half the milk. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat additions ending with the flour. <NEXT_STEP> Beat until combined taking care not to overmix. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter between the prepared muffin tins filling the cups two thirds full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cupcakes comes out clean and the tops spring back when pressed gently 18 to 22 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes in the tins on a rack for 10 minutes and then remove from the tins and cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Pour the Key Lime Curd into a squeeze bottle with 1/4 inch opening. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcakes with curd by inserting the tip into the top of each cupcake and squeezing a couple tablespoons of filling into each cupcake the cupcake will feel heavier and curd may be visible as it comes up to the top of the cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Stir the Key Lime Frosting and dip the top of each cupcake into the frosting allowing any excess to drip off. <NEXT_STEP> Roll the edge of each cupcake in the graham cracker crumbs and place on a serving platter. <NEXT_STEP> Garnish with a slice of Key lime if desired. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk together the yolks granulated sugar lime juice and salt in a small heavy bottomed saucepan. <NEXT_STEP> Cook over medium heat whisking constantly about 6 minutes or until the mixture is thick enough to coat the back of a spoon and registers 160 degrees F on an instant read thermometer. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat and strain through a fine sieve into a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the butter one piece at a time stirring until combined before adding the next piece. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the lime zest and cover with plastic wrap pressed directly on the surface of the curd. <NEXT_STEP> Chill completely about 1 hour. <NEXT_STEP> 3 ounces cream cheese at room temperature Beat the cream cheese and butter in a bowl with electric mixer at medium speed until fluffy about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually beat in the sweetened condensed milk scraping down the sides of the bowl to combine well. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the lime juice and vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> On low speed gradually add the confectioners sugar and beat until well combined. <NEXT_STEP> Chill 30 minutes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Key Lime Pie Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> candy <NEXT_INPUT> gum <NEXT_INPUT> green <NEXT_INPUT> jelly <NEXT_INPUT> chewy <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 1 cupcake <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 purple chewy candy drop such as Jujube <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 frosted cupcake <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 oblong fruit the chewy candy drop in the center of the cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Put the gum pieces around it in a petal pattern. <NEXT_STEP> If necessary snip the green jelly candy into a piece about 2 inches long. <NEXT_STEP> Put it on the cupcake next to the candy drop and between 2 petals it should hang over the cupcake slightly. <NEXT_STEP> Use a paring knife to press 1 vein down the center of the fish and a coloring <NEXT_INPUT> basic <NEXT_INPUT> easter <NEXT_INPUT> coconut <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 1 cupcake <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 Vanilla Cupcake recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Basic Glaze Icing tinted light blue recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Green Coconut Grass recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 small yellow malted milk eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 2/3 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup unsalted butter cut into 1 inch pieces <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large egg yolks <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 2/3 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/3 cups cake flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 tablespoons light corn syrup <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Food coloring as desired <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups sweetened shredded coconut <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 to 2 teaspoons liquid green food coloring <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 to 1 teaspoon liquid yellow food coloring <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Dip cupcake into the icing let excess drip back into bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Place cupcake on a rack over paper towels to catch any drips. <NEXT_STEP> Top with a small mound coconut grass. <NEXT_STEP> Place malted milk eggs on top. <NEXT_STEP> Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line two 12 cup cupcake tins with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Put tins on a baking sheet. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Process sugar and butter in a food processor until very creamy scraping sides as needed 1 to 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs and yolks one at a time pulsing after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Add the milk water and vanilla and process to blend. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk both flours baking powder and salt in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Add the dry ingredients in 3 batches to the wet pulsing and then scraping batter off the sides of the processor as needed after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Process until the batter is very smooth about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Evenly pour the batter into the prepared cups filling them 3/4 of the way full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until the cakes are just firm and spring back when gently pressed and the tops are golden 18 to 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool slightly in tin and turn out of tin when cool enough to handle. <NEXT_STEP> Cool cupcakes completely on a rack before frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Put the sugar in an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on the lowest speed slowly add the water the corn syrup and vanilla extract. <NEXT_STEP> When the sugar is sufficiently moistened raise the speed to high and beat for 2 minutes until completely smooth and glossy. <NEXT_STEP> Divide and color as desired. <NEXT_STEP> Store at room temperature covered with plastic wrap directly on the surface of the icing to prevent forming a skin. <NEXT_STEP> For cupcakes Dip the surface of the cupcakes into the icing allowing excess to drip into bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Clean any excess from the sides. <NEXT_STEP> Alternately use a knife or a spreader to apply. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk as needed to keep icing glossy and smooth while using. <NEXT_STEP> For Light Blue Icing Combine 2 to 3 drops of blue food coloring to 1 cup of Basic Glaze Icing. <NEXT_STEP> For Deep Yellow Icing Combine 4 to 5 drops of yellow food coloring to 1 cup of Basic Glaze Icing. <NEXT_STEP> For Purple Icing Combine 4 drops of red and 5 drops of blue food coloring to 1 cup of Basic Glaze Icing. <NEXT_STEP> Preheat oven to 250 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. <NEXT_STEP> Place a mesh rack on top if available. <NEXT_STEP> Put coconut in a shallow bowl. <NEXT_STEP> While tossing with a large spoon add food coloring drop by drop until the desired color is reached. <NEXT_STEP> A little more green than yellow makes a pretty grass color. <NEXT_STEP> Add a few tablespoons water to moisten the mixture and help disperse the color evenly. <NEXT_STEP> If the color is too dark add additional water as needed to dilute to the desired color. <NEXT_STEP> Drain the coconut in a sieve or strainer. <NEXT_STEP> Spread the coconut in an even layer on the rack or directly on the lined baking sheet. <NEXT_STEP> Place in the oven until dry about 10 to 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Use immediately or store in covered container for up to 3 days. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Chicken's Egg Easter Basket <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> buttercream <NEXT_INPUT> blue <NEXT_INPUT> red <NEXT_INPUT> meringue <NEXT_INPUT> white <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 24 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 1/2 cups of sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 ounces unsalted butter room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons ground cinnamon freshly grated nutmeg and ground cloves mixed <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup pastry flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Splash vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup pureed pumpkin <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups mini chocolate chips <NEXT_INGREDIENT> White Red Blue and Black Buttercream recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 10 egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 15 ounces granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/2 pounds unsalted butter room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Red and blue food coloring <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and lightly spray 2 standard cupcake tins. <NEXT_STEP> In an electric mixer on low speed combine the sugar and butter until well mixed. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the mixer up to medium high speed and beat until light and fluffy scraping down the sides of the bowl occasionally about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> In a large bowl whisk together the baking powder salt flour cinnamon nutmeg and cloves. <NEXT_STEP> In a separate smaller bowl whisk together the vanilla extract and egg whites mixing well. <NEXT_STEP> Stir the pumpkin puree into the whites just until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl with the creamed butter and sugar add the flour and pumpkin mixtures about 1/3 at a time mixing until just incorporated ending with the pumpkin. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the bowl and beater and remove the beaters. <NEXT_STEP> With a rubber spatula fold the batter until it is one even color. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in the mini chocolate chips. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the prepared cupcake tin filling until the cups are almost full. <NEXT_STEP> Dip your fingers in a little bit of water and use it to pat down the mixture in each cup. <NEXT_STEP> Put the tin in the preheated oven and bake until a toothpick inserted comes out clean about 10 to 12 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the tin to a wire rack and allow to cool to room temperature. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> Leave the majority white for the base frosting and color approximately a quarter of the white in 3 portions with red blue and red and blue mixed together coloring to pipe the eyes. <NEXT_STEP> Unmold the cupcakes onto a work surface. <NEXT_STEP> Frost the cupcakes with the white buttercream and smooth it out with a knife or a small offset spatula. <NEXT_STEP> Fill 3 pastry bags with the blue buttercream and the black and red butter cream . <NEXT_STEP> Pipe on the iris of the eyes with blue buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe in the pupil with the black buttercream also add a couple of black lines to the iris as well. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe on veins using the red buttercream. <NEXT_STEP> Make sure to have a completely clean and dry bowl when you start your process any fat or liquid at all in the bowl will stunt the protein development of the albumen and you will not have a proper meringue at the end the results could be disastrous. <NEXT_STEP> Start whipping the egg whites slowly in the mixer by themselves until the whites are foamy. <NEXT_STEP> Increase the speed of the mixer and slowly start adding the sugar until all the sugar is incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Once all the sugar is combined increase the speed of the mixer even further and whip until the mixture is shiny and stiff. <NEXT_STEP> You now have a meringue. <NEXT_STEP> You know when your meringue is done when you pull out the whip hold it horizontally and you have what looks a sparrow s beak on the end of the whip. <NEXT_STEP> Replace the whip turn the mixer on medium and start adding the butter a bit at a time once all the butter is incorporated turn the mixer on high and leave it for a while. <NEXT_STEP> Depending on the weather the buttercream could take anywhere from 5 to 15 minutes to form. <NEXT_STEP> You will know when it has formed when you hear the motor of the mixer starting to slow down and whine a little bit. <NEXT_STEP> Also when you first add the butter your meringue will break down and look nasty this is good and is what you want. <NEXT_STEP> When the buttercream is done the mixture will be homogeneous and consistent...and tasty. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the buttercream from the bowl and put in an airtight container. <NEXT_STEP> Buttercream can be kept at room temperature for a few days or in the refrigerator for 1 or 2 weeks but always use warm buttercream when icing a cake. <NEXT_STEP> To warm up the buttercream put it back in the mixer using the whip or the paddle and apply direct heat to the mixer bowl with a propane torch you can find at any hardware store. <NEXT_STEP> Food coloring method. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Eyeball Mini Cakes <TITLE_END> Brush 2 baking sheets very lightly with oil. <NEXT_STEP> Sift the flour baking soda baking powder and salt into a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the buttermilk and vanilla together in a liquid measuring cup. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the butter in a large bowl with an electric mixer until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually add the sugar and continue to beat at high speed until light and fluffy about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs and yolks 1 at a time beating well after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> At low speed add the dry ingredients in 3 parts alternating with the wet in 2 parts beginning and ending with the dry to make a smooth batter. <NEXT_STEP> Evenly mound 2 tablespoons batter per cookie onto the prepared cookie sheets spacing them about 2 inches apart. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until the cookies are golden brown around the edges 12 to 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer cookies to rack and cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the chocolate icing Put the chocolate in a medium heatproof bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Bring the cream to a boil in a small saucepan pour over the chocolate. <NEXT_STEP> Shake the bowl gently so cream settles around the chocolate set aside until the chocolate melts about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk until smooth taking care not to incorporate too many air bubbles. <NEXT_STEP> Fill a pastry bag fitted with a small tip with about half of the chocolate icing. <NEXT_STEP> For the white icing Whisk the confectioners sugar corn syrup lemon juice and warm water together to make a smooth icing. <NEXT_STEP> Fill a pastry bag fitted with a small tip with about a quarter of the icing. <NEXT_STEP> To Decorate For tuxedo cookies Set the cookies on a rack over a rimmed cookie sheet. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the white glaze over the whole cookie to cover set aside to dry. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe a bowtie and tuxedo lapel with the chocolate icing. <NEXT_STEP> For a little black dress and pearls Pipe an outline of a woman s dress with the dark chocolate and fill in with more icing. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe white icing pearls around the top of the cookie. <NEXT_STEP> Add silver dragees or candy pearls to dress up if desired. <NEXT_STEP> Let cookies dry completely about 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Serve. <NEXT_STEP> Store cookies in a tightly sealed container for up to 2 days. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Tux and Gown Cookies <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cake <NEXT_INPUT> daisy <NEXT_INPUT> yellow <NEXT_INPUT> border <NEXT_INPUT> frosting <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 18 servings <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> Canola oil for greasing the pan <NEXT_INGREDIENT> One 15.25 ounce box classic yellow cake mix <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 sticks unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Large pinch kosher salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/8 teaspoon golden yellow gel food coloring <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cake Position the oven racks in the upper and lower thirds of the oven and preheat to 350 degrees F. Line 14 muffin cups with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Grease the bottom and sides of an 8 inch round cake pan. <NEXT_STEP> Prepare the cake batter according to the package instructions. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the prepared muffin cups halfway full with batter. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape the remaining batter into the prepared cake pan. <NEXT_STEP> Bake the cupcakes and cake rotating the pans halfway through until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cupcakes and cake comes out clean 18 to 20 minutes for the cupcakes and 23 to 28 minutes for the cake. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool in the pans about 10 minutes then turn out onto cooling racks and let cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting Meanwhile combine the butter confectioners sugar milk vanilla and salt in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment . <NEXT_STEP> Mix on low speed until mostly incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Increase the speed to medium high and mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer 3 cups of the frosting to a large pastry bag fitted with a 1/4 inch plain round tip . <NEXT_STEP> Transfer 1 cup of the frosting to a small bowl and tint with the golden yellow gel food coloring. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape the yellow frosting into a small pastry bag fitted with a 3/8 inch plain round tip . <NEXT_STEP> Cover the remaining frosting with plastic and reserve for frosting the cake. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Place the cake layer upside down on an extra large cutting board or platter . <NEXT_STEP> Arrange the cupcakes in their liners around the cake to create a daisy shape. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe a border of the white frosting along the edges of the daisy. <NEXT_STEP> Using a small offset spatula spread the reserved white frosting evenly inside the border to frost the top of the cake and bring the cupcakes and cake together into one cake. <NEXT_STEP> Gently invert a small bowl in the center of the cake to lightly indent a circle. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Using the indented circle as a guideline pipe small dollops of the yellow frosting with peaks to fill in the circle. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe a border of white frosting along the edge of each petal to define their shapes. <NEXT_STEP> To serve remove the cupcakes and slice the cake. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Daisy Cake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> wedge <NEXT_INPUT> red <NEXT_INPUT> frosting <NEXT_INPUT> diamond <NEXT_INPUT> cake <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 10 to 12 servings <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> Canola oil for greasing <NEXT_INGREDIENT> One 15.25 ounce box classic yellow cake mix <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 sticks unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Large pinch kosher salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 drops leaf green gel food coloring <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 36 drops Christmas red gel food coloring <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 drops soft pink gel food coloring <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cake Position the oven racks in the upper and lower third of the oven and preheat to 350 degrees F. Line 3 cups in a 12 cup standard muffin tin with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Grease the bottoms and sides of two 9 inch round cake pans. <NEXT_STEP> Prepare the cake batter according to the package instructions. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon 1/4 cup of the batter into each of the lined muffin cups . <NEXT_STEP> Divide the remaining batter evenly between the prepared cake pans . <NEXT_STEP> Bake the cupcakes and the cake rotating the pans about halfway through until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cupcakes and cake comes out clean 16 to 18 minutes for the cupcakes and 18 to 20 minutes for the cakes. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool in the pans about 10 minutes then turn out onto cooling racks and let cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting Meanwhile combine the butter confectioners sugar milk vanilla and salt in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment . <NEXT_STEP> Mix on low speed until mostly incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Increase the speed to medium high and mix until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Tint 1 heaping cup of the frosting with the green gel food coloring in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape the green frosting into a pastry bag fitted with a 11/16 inch plain round tip . <NEXT_STEP> Tint 1 heaping cup of the frosting with 24 drops Christmas red gel food coloring in another medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape the dark red frosting into a pastry bag fitted with a 11/16 inch plain round tip . <NEXT_STEP> Tint 1 heaping cup frosting with 10 drops of Christmas red gel food coloring in a third medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape the light red frosting into a pastry bag fitted with a 11/16 inch plain round tip . <NEXT_STEP> Tint the remaining frosting with the pink gel food coloring and 2 drops Christmas red gel food coloring. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape 1 1/2 cups of the pink frosting into a pastry bag fitted with a 11/16 inch plain round tip . <NEXT_STEP> Cover the remaining pink frosting with plastic and reserve for layering the cake. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Place 1 cake layer upside down on the top half of on an extra large cutting board or platter and spread with the reserved pink frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Top with the second cake layer. <NEXT_STEP> Using a serrated knife cut the cake in half across the center. <NEXT_STEP> Make a second cut that crisscrosses the first so that the 2 cuts form a narrow X with the top half of the X slightly wider than the bottom. <NEXT_STEP> You will have 2 small wedges and 2 large wedges the cuts should intersect slightly below the center of the cake. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the small wedge cut out of the top of the cake. <NEXT_STEP> Trim off the larger two corners to make it into a diamond shape. <NEXT_STEP> Set the trimmed corners aside. <NEXT_STEP> Snuggle the diamond back in between the larger two wedges. <NEXT_STEP> For the ombre frosting Pipe a thick line of dark red frosting on the large left wedge in a crescent shape along the outer edge. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe a thick line of dark red frosting on the large right wedge in a crescent shape along the upper portion of the inner edge stopping where the four pieces of cake come together in the center . <NEXT_STEP> Pipe a thick border of dark red frosting around the diamond in the middle of the cake. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe a thick line of light red frosting on the large left wedge next to the dark red frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe 2 thick lines of light red frosting in on the large right wedge next to the dark red frosting to continue filling in the wedge. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe a line of light red frosting into the center of the diamond to fill in the diamond. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe thick lines of the pink frosting in crescent shapes next to the light red frosting on both large wedges so the cake is fully covered. <NEXT_STEP> Carefully drag a small offset spatula from the top of the left large wedge to the bottom curving with the lines to smooth and blend the frosting without mixing up the colors. <NEXT_STEP> Wipe the spatula clean and repeat on the right side. <NEXT_STEP> Wipe the spatula clean and use it to smooth out the frosting in the diamond. <NEXT_STEP> Arrange the cupcakes in a line at the bottom of the tulip to create a stem. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the green frosting in three straight vertical lines to cover and coat the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Arrange the reserved cake corners along the stem to create leaves and pipe the green frosting over the top to cover. <NEXT_STEP> Carefully drag a small offset spatula from top to bottom to smooth the frosting on the stem and leaves. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Tulip Cake <TITLE_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 2 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup dark cocoa such as Hershey s Special <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 sticks unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 eggs at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Dark Chocolate Filling recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Peanut Butter Frosting recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> One 32 ounce bag mini chocolate chips for garnish <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces bittersweet chocolate coarsely chopped such as Ghirardelli <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup plus 1/4 cup heavy sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line cupcake pans with 18 liners. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium bowl whisk together the flour cocoa powder baking soda baking powder and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Using an electric mixer with the paddle attachment cream the butter until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually add the granulated sugar about 1/4 cup at a time until the mixture is light and fluffy scraping down the sides of the bowl occasionally. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time beating well after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Alternately add the flour mixture and the milk starting and ending with the flour mixture beating well after each addition and scraping down the sides of the bowl occasionally. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon the batter into the liners. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean 16 to 18 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes completely. <NEXT_STEP> Make a hole in the center of each cupcake using a small paring knife or apple corer making sure not to go all the way to the bottom. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the Dark Chocolate Filling into each cupcake all the way to the top reserving some for garnish. <NEXT_STEP> Frost the cupcakes with Peanut Butter Frosting butter frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Place the chopped chocolate in a small bowl. <NEXT_STEP> In a small saucepan heat the heavy cream over low heat until it simmers. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat and pour over the chocolate pieces. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter and let stand for 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Stir until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool slightly. <NEXT_STEP> Cut 1/8 inch off the end of a piping bag. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the mixture into the piping bag. <NEXT_STEP> In a large mixing bowl using an electric mixer with paddle attachment whip the cream cheese on high speed about 30 seconds until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add the peanut butter and continue mixing on high speed for 1 minute until well blended scraping down the sides often. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> On low speed add the powdered sugar 1/2 cup at a time. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Double Drizzle <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> peach <NEXT_INPUT> almond <NEXT_INPUT> wedge <NEXT_INPUT> beat <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 1/2 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 stick unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/8 to 1/4 teaspoon pure almond extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup buttermilk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons unsalted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 small ripe peaches each cut into 6 wedges <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 sticks unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/2 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 tablespoons whole milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon pure almond extract <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Make the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a 12 cup muffin pan with liners. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the flour baking powder baking soda and salt in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Beat the butter and granulated sugar in a large bowl with a mixer on medium high speed until light and fluffy about 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the eggs one at a time then beat in the vanilla and almond extracts. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the mixer speed to low and beat in half of the flour mixture then the buttermilk then the remaining flour mixture until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter among the prepared muffin cups filling each about two thirds of the way. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until the tops of the cupcakes are lightly browned and spring back when gently pressed about 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool 5 minutes in the pan then transfer to a rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile cook the peaches Melt the butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. <NEXT_STEP> Add the peaches and granulated sugar cook stirring occasionally until the sugar dissolves and the peaches start softening 2 to 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cover and continue to cook stirring occasionally until the peaches are soft but still hold their shape about 5 more minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat and let cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Make the frosting Beat the butter and confectioners sugar in a large bowl with a mixer on medium speed until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Increase the speed to medium high and beat until fluffy 2 to 3 more minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the milk and vanilla and almond extracts and beat until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer to a piping bag fitted with a large round tip pipe onto the cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Refrigerate until the frosting is firm 20 to 30 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Top each cupcake with a peach wedge. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Cinnamon Buttercream recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Filo Puffs recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup evaporated milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pan spray <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 package shredded filo dough <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Carrot Cucpakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> fondant <NEXT_INPUT> elephant <NEXT_INPUT> leg <NEXT_INPUT> ear <NEXT_INPUT> piece <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 6 <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 5 ounces mini marshmallows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces confectioners sugar sifted plus more for kneading <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Vegetable shortening for kneading <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pink black and blue gel food coloring <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the marshmallow fondant Combine the marshmallows and 1 1/2 teaspoons water in a large microwave safe bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Microwave for 30 second intervals stirring in between each until melted and smooth about 1 1/2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add about three quarters of the sifted confectioners sugar into the marshmallow mixture and stir to combine. <NEXT_STEP> Once the mixture becomes too stiff to stir grease your counter and hands with shortening and dump the mixture onto the counter. <NEXT_STEP> Knead adding the remaining quarter of confectioners sugar a little at a time until the fondant is very smooth not sticky and holds its shape into a ball without relaxing. <NEXT_STEP> Use right away or grease it lightly with additional shortening wrap tightly in plastic wrap and store in an airtight plastic bag or container at room temperature for up to several days. <NEXT_STEP> Remove a 1 ounce piece from the fondant ball . <NEXT_STEP> Color the 1 ounce piece bright pink rolling and kneading to evenly incorporate the color. <NEXT_STEP> Work in a little confectioners sugar if the moisture from the food coloring makes the fondant too soft. <NEXT_STEP> Pull off an almond sized piece from the large white piece of fondant and color dark black working in additional confectioners sugar if needed. <NEXT_STEP> Color the remaining fondant bright blue working in additional confectioners sugar if needed. <NEXT_STEP> For the elephant head trunk ears and legs Divide the blue fondant into 6 pieces. <NEXT_STEP> Cut 1 piece in half. <NEXT_STEP> With greased hands roll a half into a head with an elongated trunk and transfer to a parchment lined baking sheet. <NEXT_STEP> Use a wooden skewer to poke 2 nostrils in the end of the trunk. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the remaining half into 4 pieces roll 2 pieces into stubby legs. <NEXT_STEP> Press together to join in a v shape. <NEXT_STEP> Roll and flatten the other 2 pieces into large round ears about 1 1/2 inches in diameter. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with the remaining 5 pieces of blue fondant. <NEXT_STEP> For the inside of the ear Divide the pink fondant into 12 pieces. <NEXT_STEP> Roll and flatten 2 pieces of pink fondant into rounds a little smaller than the blue ears and stick them in the middle of the blue ears. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with the remaining 10 pieces. <NEXT_STEP> Build the elephants Arrange a set of legs on the parchment v point up. <NEXT_STEP> Arrange the ears above the legs so that they are just barely touching. <NEXT_STEP> Rest the head on top of the ears and legs pressing lightly to adhere. <NEXT_STEP> Drape the trunk over one of the legs. <NEXT_STEP> Use a 1/4 inch round pastry tip to make toe indentations in the tip of each leg. <NEXT_STEP> Roll 2 tiny black balls and press in to adhere. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with the remaining fondant to make 5 more elephants. <NEXT_STEP> Let the elephants dry uncovered overnight. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Marshmallow Fondant Elephants <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> panda <NEXT_INPUT> fondant <NEXT_INPUT> black <NEXT_INPUT> piece <NEXT_INPUT> larger <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 6 <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 5 ounces mini marshmallows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces confectioners sugar sifted plus more for kneading <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Vegetable shortening for kneading <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Black gel food coloring <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the marshmallow fondant Combine the marshmallows and 1 1/2 teaspoons water in a large microwave safe bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Microwave for 30 second intervals stirring in between each until melted and smooth about 1 1/2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add about three quarters of the sifted confectioners sugar into the marshmallow mixture and stir to combine. <NEXT_STEP> Once the mixture becomes too stiff to stir grease your counter and hands with shortening and dump the mixture onto the counter. <NEXT_STEP> Knead adding the remaining quarter of confectioners sugar a little at a time until the fondant is very smooth not sticky and holds its shape into a ball without relaxing. <NEXT_STEP> Use right away or grease it lightly with additional shortening wrap tightly in plastic wrap and store in an airtight plastic bag or container at room temperature for up to several days. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the fondant in half. <NEXT_STEP> Color one half dark black with food coloring Divide the white portion into 6 pieces and the black into 6 pieces. <NEXT_STEP> For the panda head eye whites and foot pads Pull off an almond size piece of white fondant from one of the pieces and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Roll the larger piece into a head that is slightly triangular but still rounded. <NEXT_STEP> Roll the smaller piece out with a greased rolling pin about 1/4 inch thick. <NEXT_STEP> Use a 1/4 inch round pastry tip to cut out 2 eyeballs and 2 footpads. <NEXT_STEP> Press all 4 slightly to make slightly larger but still round. <NEXT_STEP> For the panda legs ears eyes and nose Divide a black piece of fondant into 2 pieces one slightly larger than the other. <NEXT_STEP> Form the larger piece into 2 stubby legs. <NEXT_STEP> Press together to join in a v shape. <NEXT_STEP> Arrange the set legs on the parchment v point up and attach the head onto the point. <NEXT_STEP> Use the 1/4 inch pastry tip to make toe indentations in the tip of each leg. <NEXT_STEP> Attach the white foot pads to the bottom of the feet brushing with a little water if needed to adhere. <NEXT_STEP> Roll a tiny piece of the remaining black fondant to make a slightly flat triangular shaped nose. <NEXT_STEP> Stick in the middle of the face point side down. <NEXT_STEP> Roll out the remaining black fondant with a greased rolling pin. <NEXT_STEP> Use a pastry tip with a 3/4 inch base to cut out 2 ears. <NEXT_STEP> Crease with the back of a paring knife. <NEXT_STEP> Brush the panda s head lightly with water where the ears go and attach the ears pressing slightly. <NEXT_STEP> Use the 1/4 inch pastry tip to cut out 2 eyes. <NEXT_STEP> Flatten to make slightly oval and larger than the white eyeballs. <NEXT_STEP> Stick the black eye circles to the sides of the nose. <NEXT_STEP> Attached the white eyeballs inside the black. <NEXT_STEP> Roll 2 tiny black balls and stick inside of the white. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with the remaining fondant to make 5 more pandas. <NEXT_STEP> Let the pandas dry uncovered overnight. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Marshmallow Fondant Pandas <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/2 pounds dark chocolate <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 quart heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 pound butter cubed <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat oven to 300 degrees. <NEXT_STEP> milk eggs oil and vanilla extract in a 5 quart mixer with a paddle attachment on first speed. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sour cream and mayonnaise. <NEXT_STEP> Add the dry ingredients 1 scoop at a time allowing each scoop to be incorporated before adding the next. <NEXT_STEP> Once all the dry ingredients are incorporated stop the mixer and scrape down sides and bottom. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the mixer up <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle with edible gold glitter. <NEXT_STEP> Make your own double boiler by filling a pot half way with hot water. <NEXT_STEP> Let the water come to a boil. <NEXT_STEP> Place a metal bowl over the pot making sure that the water does not touch the bottom of the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Put the chocolate in the bowl and stir to melt. <NEXT_STEP> When the chocolate is melted completely remove from the heat. <NEXT_STEP> Scald the cream in a pot over medium heat. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the heated cream over the melted chocolate and slowly incorporate the chocolate will appear glassy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the butter in pieces to the chocolate. <NEXT_STEP> Mix until all the butter has melted. <NEXT_STEP> Let set for 1 to 2 hours. <NEXT_STEP> The ganache is ready when it is a pipe able consistency. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Chili Chocolate Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> churro <NEXT_INPUT> cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 tablespoons unsalted butter room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup heavy cream room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup unsalted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces cream cheese <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 to 4 1/2 cups powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 tablespoons unsalted butter <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cake batter Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line two 12 cup muffin pans with cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> In a medium bowl sift together the flours baking powder cinnamon and salt. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment cream the sugar and butter on medium high speed until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time beating until just incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Beat in the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Reduce the mixing speed to low. <NEXT_STEP> Add the flour mixture in three batches alternating with the milk. <NEXT_STEP> Beat until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter evenly among the lined cups filling each three quarters full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick comes out clean 18 to 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer to a wire rack and cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the filling Combine the sugar and 1 tablespoon water into a medium bowl over medium high heat. <NEXT_STEP> Constantly stir until the sugar dissolves into a liquid form. <NEXT_STEP> The sugar will dissolve and start to turn brown. <NEXT_STEP> Once the sugar and water have completely dissolved add in the butter and vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly whisk in the heavy cream. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool for 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> the powder sugar 1 cup at a time incorporating fully before next addition. <NEXT_STEP> Add milk as needed if the frosting is too thick. <NEXT_STEP> Place the frosting into a piping bag fitted with a large star tip. <NEXT_STEP> Once the cupcakes have cooled pull out the centers with a cupcake corer. <NEXT_STEP> Melt down the butter. <NEXT_STEP> Mix together some cinnamon and sugar in a small bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Using a rubber brush brush the melted butter onto the cupcakes then roll the tops of the cupcakes into the cinnamon sugar mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcakes with the caramel sauce. <NEXT_STEP> Frost cupcakes with cream cheese frosting dust with more cinnamon and sugar. <NEXT_STEP> If you choose drizzle the cupcakes with leftover caramel sauce. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Churro spray <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup loosely packed pitted prunes <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup whole wheat flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup unsweetened cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup packed light brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup low fat plain Greek yogurt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 large egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/8 teaspoon cream of tartar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch of salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon finely grated orange zest <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Make the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a 12 cup muffin pan or two 24 cup mini muffin pans with paper liners lightly spray the liners with cooking spray. <NEXT_STEP> Soak the prunes in a bowl with 3/4 cup hot water until softened about 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Pour into a blender and puree until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the all purpose flour whole wheat flour cocoa powder baking powder baking soda salt and cinnamon in a large bowl. <NEXT_STEP> In another bowl whisk the prune puree brown sugar eggs yogurt vegetable oil and vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Fold the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients until just combined . <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter among the muffin cups filling each three quarters of the way. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick comes out clean 18 to 20 minutes for standard size cupcakes or 12 to 14 minutes for minis. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer to a rack and let cool in the pan 10 minutes then remove from the pan to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Make the frosting Whisk the egg whites granulated sugar cream of tartar and salt in a heatproof bowl set over a saucepan of simmering water until the sugar dissolves 1 to 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the bowl from the pan. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the egg white mixture to a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment beat on medium high speed until stiff peaks form 3 to 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Sift in the cocoa powder and add the vanilla and orange zest beat to combine. <NEXT_STEP> Spread the frosting on the cupcakes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate Cupcakes With Meringue Frosting <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chocolate <TITLE_START> Bunny Face <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> kernel <NEXT_INPUT> popcorn <NEXT_INPUT> pot <NEXT_INPUT> corn <NEXT_INPUT> smoked <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 8 to 10 servings <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> Nonstick vegetable oil spray for greasing <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup popcorn kernels <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 tablespoons sea salt plus more for sprinkling <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon canola oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 3/4 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup light corn syrup <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 tablespoons unsalted butter cut into small pieces <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 tablespoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces smoked or regular almonds coarsely chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces unsalted cashews <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces candy coated chocolate pieces optional <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil and grease generously with the spray. <NEXT_STEP> Generously spray a large bowl and all but the handle part of a large spoon or rubber spatula. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the popcorn salt and oil in a large deep pot with a lid and stir to coat the kernels in oil. <NEXT_STEP> Place the pot over moderately high heat cover with a lid and cook shaking the pot frequently to redistribute the kernels. <NEXT_STEP> Cook until all the kernels have popped 6 to 8 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the popcorn to the large prepared bowl discarding any un popped kernels. <NEXT_STEP> Combine 1/4 cup water the sugar and corn syrup in a large deep pot over moderately high heat and stir to combine. <NEXT_STEP> Cook undisturbed until the mixture develops a light amber color about 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the pot from the heat add the butter and baking soda and stir continuously to melt the butter and combine the ingredients about 20 seconds. <NEXT_STEP> Working quickly pour the sugar mixture over the popcorn and add the almonds cashews and chocolate if using. <NEXT_STEP> Use the prepared spoon to stir everything together trying to evenly coat the popcorn and nuts in caramel. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle with sea salt. <NEXT_STEP> Break the caramel corn into smaller bite size pieces and serve. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Circus Caramel Corn with Smoked Almonds and Sea Salt <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> granita <NEXT_INPUT> coffee <NEXT_INPUT> whipped
