<NEXT_INGREDIENT> teaspoon pure vanilla extract <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> GRANITA Combine the coffee sugar coffee liqueur and vanilla and stir until the sugar dissolves. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the mixture in a flat pan that s about 9 x 13 inches. <NEXT_STEP> Place the pan in the freezer for one hour until it starts to become slushy around the edges. <NEXT_STEP> Rake the mixture with a large fork to break up the crystals and place it back into the freezer. <NEXT_STEP> Every 30 minutes rake the mixture until it is completely frozen and granular throughout. <NEXT_STEP> Freeze until ready to serve. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon the granite into pretty stemmed glasses and top with a dollop of whipped cream. <NEXT_STEP> Serve immediately. <NEXT_STEP> SWEETENED WHIPPED CREAM Place the cream sugar and <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Make the cupcakes Position a rack in the middle of the oven and preheat to 350 degrees F. Line two 12 cup muffin pans with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the flour baking powder and salt in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> In another bowl beat the eggs and both sugars with a mixer until light and fluffy about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually beat in the melted butter and vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on low speed add half of the flour mixture the milk and then the remaining flour. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in the peanuts but don t overmix. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter evenly among the prepared cups filling each about halfway. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted into a cupcake comes out clean 20 to 22 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool in the pans 10 minutes then transfer to racks to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Make the nougat frosting Beat the marshmallow creme peanut butter and salt with a mixer until smooth set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Make the chocolate frosting Put both chocolates in a large microwave safe bowl and microwave on 50 percent power until soft about 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Stir then continue to microwave until melted 1 to 2 more minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the confectioners sugar milk butter vanilla and salt and beat with a mixer until smooth and creamy. <NEXT_STEP> Spread nougat frosting over each cupcake then top with chocolate frosting leaving some of the nougat exposed. <NEXT_STEP> Garnish with peanuts. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Peanut Cupcakes <NEXT_INPUT> arm <NEXT_INPUT> piece <NEXT_INPUT> monkey <NEXT_INPUT> tan <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 6 <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 5 ounces mini marshmallows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces confectioners sugar sifted plus more for kneading <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Vegetable shortening for kneading <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Brown black and tan gel food coloring <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the marshmallow fondant Combine the marshmallows and 1 1/2 teaspoons water in a large microwave safe bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Microwave for 30 second intervals stirring in between each until melted and smooth about 1 1/2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add about three quarters of the sifted confectioners sugar into the marshmallow mixture and stir to combine. <NEXT_STEP> Once the mixture becomes too stiff to stir grease your counter and hands with shortening and dump the mixture onto the counter. <NEXT_STEP> Knead adding the remaining quarter of confectioners sugar a little at a time until the fondant is very smooth not sticky and holds its shape into a ball without relaxing. <NEXT_STEP> Use right away or grease it lightly with additional shortening wrap tightly in plastic wrap and store in an airtight plastic bag or container at room temperature for up to several days. <NEXT_STEP> Remove a 1 ounce piece of the fondant and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Color the larger piece of fondant brown rolling and kneading to evenly incorporate the color. <NEXT_STEP> Work in a little confectioners sugar if the moisture from the food coloring makes the fondant too soft. <NEXT_STEP> Pinch off a very small piece of the 1 ounce chunk and color with a tiny amount of black gel working in additional confectioners sugar if needed. <NEXT_STEP> Color the remaining 1 ounce piece tan working in additional confectioners sugar if needed. <NEXT_STEP> For the monkey heads ears and arms Divide the brown fondant into 6 pieces. <NEXT_STEP> Divide each piece into a large piece and a small piece . <NEXT_STEP> Roll the larger pieces into an oval shaped head. <NEXT_STEP> Pinch a small piece off all the smaller pieces. <NEXT_STEP> Gather together and roll out to about 1/4 inch thick with a greased rolling pin. <NEXT_STEP> Cut out 12 ears using the tip of a 1/2 inch plain pastry tip. <NEXT_STEP> Press a cavity in each ear using the back of a paint brush. <NEXT_STEP> Brush the tops of the heads with a little water and stick on the ears. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the remaining smaller pieces in 2 and roll into long arms. <NEXT_STEP> Set squares of parchment on overturned bath cups. <NEXT_STEP> Press sets of arms together to make a v shape. <NEXT_STEP> Drape sets of arms over the cups so the arms hang down. <NEXT_STEP> Press the heads on top of the point where the arms meet. <NEXT_STEP> Roll out the tan pieces of fondant to about 1/4 inch thick using a greased rolling pin. <NEXT_STEP> Cut out 2 eyes from each piece with the tip of the 1/2 inch pastry tip. <NEXT_STEP> Cut out a nose from each with a pastry tip with a 3/4 inch wide base. <NEXT_STEP> Pull the noses slightly to make oval. <NEXT_STEP> Brush the front of the faces with a little water. <NEXT_STEP> Stick the noses on and make nostrils with a wooden skewer. <NEXT_STEP> Use the curved base of a pastry tip to make a smiling mouth indentation. <NEXT_STEP> Attach the tan eyes above the nose. <NEXT_STEP> Roll the black fondant into tiny eyeballs and press in the eyes. <NEXT_STEP> Let the monkeys dry uncovered overnight. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Marshmallow Fondant Monkey <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> carrot eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 large ripe kiwi peeled pureed and strained <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup sugar <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line 56 mini cupcake cups from 3 mini cupcake or muffin pans or 18 regular size cupcake or muffin cups from 2 regular size cupcake or muffin pans with paper cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> In a large mixing bowl combine the flour sugar baking soda and salt. <NEXT_STEP> In a second bowl mix the eggs buttermilk and oil. <NEXT_STEP> Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients. <NEXT_STEP> Once the ingredients are mixed add the lemon zest and lemon juice and blend until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Bake the cupcakes until golden brown and the centers spring back when lightly pressed 16 to 18 minutes for minis or 22 to 24 minutes for the regular size cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes in the pans for 5 minutes and then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Increase the oven temperature to 450 degrees F. wooden spoon about 12 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Set the pan over a large bowl of ice and continue to stir until the mixture has cooled slightly. <NEXT_STEP> Strain the mixture into a clean bowl and refrigerate until thickened and well chilled. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of an electric stand mixer combine the egg whites and sugar and whip until the mixture is firm and glossy. <STEP_END> <YIELD_START> 24 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 2 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 sticks unsalted butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 ounces baking chocolate melted <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 large whole eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/2 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup half and half <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 pound semisweet chocolate chips <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon unsalted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup half and half <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 package instant chocolate pudding mix <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the convection oven to 325 degrees F or a standard oven to 350 degrees F. In large mixer bowl cream together the sugar and butter until light and fluffy with a heavy duty mixer. <NEXT_STEP> Add the melted chocolate and mix well. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs one at a time and mix thoroughly after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla and mix well. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the flour baking soda and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Add half of the flour to the mixer bowl along with 1/2 cup of the half and half. <NEXT_STEP> Mix until the flour is mixed in scraping the sides of the bowl with a rubber spatula. <NEXT_STEP> Add the rest of flour mixture and the other 1/2 cup half and half. <NEXT_STEP> Mix until the batter is smooth and all of the flour lumps are gone. <NEXT_STEP> Fill 24 cupcake liners half full and bake for 20 minutes in the convection oven or 28 minutes in the standard oven. <NEXT_STEP> The tops of the cupcakes should be lightly browned. <NEXT_STEP> Check the cupcakes to make sure no batter sticks to a wooden toothpick when inserted into the cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the ganache Put the chocolate chips heavy cream and butter in a medium microwave safe bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Microwave on high for 30 seconds at a time stirring after each time until the chocolate chips are melted and the ganache has the consistency of hot fudge. <NEXT_STEP> It will look like a mess at first but as you continue to stir it will start to form a thicker mixture. <NEXT_STEP> If the ganache becomes too thick to dip put it back in the microwave for about 15 seconds and stir again. <NEXT_STEP> For the chocolate whipped mousse filling and topping In large mixer bowl beat the heavy cream half and half and pudding mix until light and fluffy using heavy duty mixer. <NEXT_STEP> It should have the consistency of whipped cream. <NEXT_STEP> Put the filling in a pastry bag or zipper bag with a corner cut off. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Make a hole in the middle of each cupcake using a sharp knife. <NEXT_STEP> Be sure and leave a small amount of cake in the bottom of the hole. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcakes using the filling in the bag. <NEXT_STEP> Using the same bag frost the tops of the cupcakes with the filling. <NEXT_STEP> Put in the freezer until the topping mixture is cold and somewhat stiff about 20 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Dip each cupcake in ganache and immediately sprinkle with mini chocolate chips and garnish with a piece of chocolate bar. <NEXT_STEP> Let the cupcakes sit until the ganache is set. <NEXT_STEP> Then serve or refrigerate until time to serve. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Death by Chocolate Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> strand <NEXT_INPUT> snowman <NEXT_INPUT> scarf <NEXT_INPUT> sphere <NEXT_INPUT> skewer <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 50 to 60 servings <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> Four 15.25 ounce boxes white cake mix <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups white candy melting wafers <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon prepared vanilla frosting <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup orange candy melting wafers <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 chocolate covered marshmallow cookies such as Mallomars <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Two 9 inch long strands plus ten 3 foot long strands rainbow sour candy strips or belts <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cake doughnuts <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/4 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons lemon juice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 large egg whites <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the snowman Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line mini muffin tins with white mini cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Prepare the cake batter according to the package directions for using egg whites. <NEXT_STEP> Fill each cupcake liner halfway with batter. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean 10 to 12 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer to a cooling rack to cool completely about 30 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat with the remaining cake batter . <NEXT_STEP> Microwave the white candy melting wafers in a medium microwave safe bowl in 30 second intervals stirring in between each until melted about 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Pour 2 tablespoons of the melted candy onto the center of a large serving platter or serving board . <NEXT_STEP> Place a 10 inch Styrofoam sphere on top of the candy and let set until hardened about 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> This will be the bottom round of the snowman. <NEXT_STEP> Trim 2 inches off the flat end of three 12 inch wooden skewers making sure that the skewers are even in length. <NEXT_STEP> Mark the center of the sphere and poke the 3 skewers bundled together into the center flat end first leaving about half the length of the skewers sticking out of the top. <NEXT_STEP> Align a 7 inch Styrofoam sphere on top and in the center of the 10 inch sphere and press down so the skewers are inserted into the smaller sphere securing the snowman head to the bottom. <NEXT_STEP> Leave a 1 inch gap between the 2 spheres. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside 5 cupcakes for making the nose later. <NEXT_STEP> Coat the bottom of 16 cupcakes with the melted candy and wedge them around the base of the bottom sphere so they are in contact with the board creating a ring of cupcakes to keep the base from moving. <NEXT_STEP> Poke a toothpick through the top center of each of the remaining cupcakes until the toothpick pokes out of the other side. <NEXT_STEP> Coat the bottom of one cupcake with some of the melted candy. <NEXT_STEP> Starting at the bottom of the snowman hold the top of the toothpick and poke the cupcake into the side of the sphere offset between the row of cupcakes below so that the toothpick is no longer showing and the coated bottom is pressed against the sphere. <NEXT_STEP> Working in batches so that the melted candy does not harden repeat with the remaining cupcakes until the bottom and head of the snowman are completely covered with cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> To make the carrot nose Crumble the reserved 5 cupcakes into as fine a crumb as possible in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla frosting to the bowl and mix until well combined and the mixture can be formed into a stiff ball. <NEXT_STEP> Mold into a 4 inch carrot shape. <NEXT_STEP> Cut a 12 inch wooden skewer in half discard the half without the point. <NEXT_STEP> Insert the skewer half lengthwise through the center of the carrot with the pointed end sticking out of the flat side of the carrot. <NEXT_STEP> Freeze until solid about 30 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Microwave the orange candy melting wafers in a medium microwave safe bowl in 30 second intervals stirring in between each until melted 1 to 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Dip the frozen carrot into the orange candy until completely coated. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer to a parchment lined dish until hardened about 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Attach the carrot nose to the center of the face with the pointed end of the skewer pressing in until the skewer is no longer visible and the carrot is straight. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting Bring a few inches of water to a boil in a saucepan that can hold a heatproof stand mixer bowl above the water without the bottom of the bowl touching. <NEXT_STEP> Add the sugar lemon juice salt and egg whites to the mixer bowl and whisk together by hand. <NEXT_STEP> Set the bowl above the boiling water and whisk until the mixture is warm to the touch and the sugar is completely dissolved. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer to the stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment and beat at medium high speed until the mixture is cool and holds stiff peaks 10 to 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer a quarter of the frosting to a large pastry bag fitted with a medium star tip. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe rosettes onto each cupcake starting in the center and swirling outwards until the entire cupcake is covered with frosting refilling the pastry bag with frosting as needed. <NEXT_STEP> To make the eyes and buttons Cut 3 toothpicks in half and discard one of the halves. <NEXT_STEP> Stick the pointed end of each remaining toothpick half into the back of a chocolate covered marshmallow cookie making sure it doesn t poke through the front. <NEXT_STEP> On the head where the eyes would be attach 2 marshmallow cookies to 2 cupcakes with the toothpicks. <NEXT_STEP> Attach 3 marshmallow cookies to 3 cupcakes down the front of the snowman where the buttons would be. <NEXT_STEP> To make the ear muffs Cut two 12 inch wooden skewers in half discard the ends without the point. <NEXT_STEP> Insert a skewer point side first into each side of the snowman head even with the eyes. <NEXT_STEP> Trim any excess skewer to leave 1 inch exposed. <NEXT_STEP> Attach a doughnut to each side of the head by pressing the doughnut into the skewer until it is flush with the head and pressing against the frosted cupcakes. <NEXT_STEP> Lay the two 9 inch sour candy strands next to each other across the top of the head to attach the ear muffs. <NEXT_STEP> Trim any excess if needed. <NEXT_STEP> To make the woven scarf Stack four 3 foot long sour candy strands on top of each other and position vertically in front of you. <NEXT_STEP> Measure 4 inches down from the top of the strands and insert a toothpick through all 4 pieces to attach them at the top. <NEXT_STEP> Separate the strands below the toothpick so they are no longer stacked on top of each other. <NEXT_STEP> Interlace the far right strand first under the strand next to it then over the strand next to that and finally under the last strand to create the first weave tightening as you go to create a snug pattern. <NEXT_STEP> Continue the pattern by bringing the same strand back over the strand closest to it then under the next strand and finally over the last strand on the far right. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat this pattern weaving side to side and back again until the strand has been completely woven through. <NEXT_STEP> Using a toothpick attach another 3 foot strand where the original one left off and continue until the new strand is woven through. <NEXT_STEP> Cut the remaining unwoven strands at the bottom. <NEXT_STEP> Use toothpicks to secure the scarf. <NEXT_STEP> Repeat this process starting with four new 3 foot sour candy strands and weaving in a fifth to create 2 woven scarf halves equal in length. <NEXT_STEP> Fray the unwoven section at the top of the scarf halves by pulling the different colors apart. <NEXT_STEP> Attach one of the scarf halves to the back of the snowman securing it with toothpicks. <NEXT_STEP> Wrap the scarf carefully around to the front of the snowman so the frayed end drapes near the buttons. <NEXT_STEP> Secure the other scarf half overlapping in the back if needed and wrap around to the front of the body so the ends of the scarves overlap. <NEXT_STEP> Keep chilled until serving. <NEXT_STEP> Serve within a day. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Gigantic Standing Snowman <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> yolk <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> cheese <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> egg <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 servings <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 8 ounces unsweetened chocolate <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/4 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup light brown sugar firmly packed <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 egg yolk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 3/4 cup cake flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp. baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup sweet butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup white sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 egg yolks <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp. vanilla <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces cream cheese <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 Tbs. corn syrup <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup sifted confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tsp. vanilla <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 Tbs. grated orange zest <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Food coloring <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. In top part of double boiler over boiling water heat chocolate 1/2 cup milk brown sugar and egg yolk. <NEXT_STEP> Stir continuously and remove from heat when smooth and thick. <NEXT_STEP> Sift flour baking soda and salt together into medium bow. <NEXT_STEP> In separate large bowl beat together butter and sugar add egg yolks 3/4 cup milk and vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Beat until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly add flour mixture and stir until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Add chocolate mixture and combine. <NEXT_STEP> In separate bowl beat egg whites until stiff. <NEXT_STEP> Fold into batter. <NEXT_STEP> Bake in cupcake tins for 20 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from oven and cool for 10 minutes in tins. <NEXT_STEP> Remove to cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Combine frosting ingredients and frost cupcakes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate Cupcakes With Cream Cheese Icing <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> avocado <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> flesh <NEXT_INPUT> spray <NEXT_INPUT> still <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 standard or 24 mini cupcakes; about 2 cups frosting <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> Cooking spray <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 teaspoon fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs at room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 sticks unsalted butter melted <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon orange zest <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Two 8 ounce avocados halved pitted and peeled <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 stick unsalted butter cut into 1/2 inch pieces and softened <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup confectioners sugar <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Make the cupcakes Position an oven rack in the center of the oven and preheat to 350 degrees F. Line one 12 cup standard muffin tin or one 24 cup mini muffin tin with cupcake liners and spray with cooking spray. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk together the flour baking powder and salt in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the eggs and sugar in a large bowl until light and foamy about 1 minute while still whisking gradually add the butter then the vanilla and orange zest. <NEXT_STEP> Add half the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and stir with a spoon to combine. <NEXT_STEP> Add the milk then the remaining dry ingredients and stir to combine but don t overmix. <NEXT_STEP> Divide the batter evenly among the cups in the prepared tin. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until a toothpick inserted in the center of the cakes comes out clean 18 to 20 minutes rotating the tin halfway through. <NEXT_STEP> Let the cupcakes cool in the tin on a cooling rack for 10 minutes then remove them from the tin and let them cool completely on the rack. <NEXT_STEP> Meanwhile make the frosting Process the avocado flesh and the butter in a food processor until completely smooth. <NEXT_STEP> With the processor still running slowly pour in the cream. <NEXT_STEP> Add the confectioners sugar and pulse until light green and completely combined about 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Cover and refrigerate until ready to use. <NEXT_STEP> Spread the frosting on the cooled cupcakes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Cupcakes with Avocado Buttercream <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> strawberry <NEXT_INPUT> rum <NEXT_INPUT> kiwi <NEXT_INPUT> shooter <NEXT_INPUT> replacer <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 36 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 pound 10 ounces unbleached flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 pound 4 ounces sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 9 ounces scant non hydrogenated vegan margarine <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon egg replacer <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups plus 2 tablespoons soy milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups kiwi puree store bought <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup cornstarch <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon lemon juice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 ounces non hydrogenated vegetable shortening <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 ounces non hydrogenated vegan margarine <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon lecithin <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 ounces strawberry puree store bought <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 pound 8 ounces powdered sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon lemon juice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon rum <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 36 large strawberries washed and dried <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup rum <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup strawberry rum frosting <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Line standard cupcake pans with 36 cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Sift the flour baking powder and salt into a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Set the bowl aside. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a stand mixer cream the sugar and margarine with the whisk attachment about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> In a small bowl or cup combine the water and egg replacer and stir to dissolve the egg replacer. <NEXT_STEP> Add the egg replacer to the sugar and mix until combined. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape the bottom of the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> In a small bowl combine the soy milk and vanilla and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the mixer speed to low and slowly add the dry ingredients and the soy milk alternating between the 2 ending with the soy milk. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners 3/4 full with batter and bake until a toothpick inserted into each cupcake comes out clean 19 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the curd In a medium heavy bottomed saucepan stir together the kiwi puree and sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Heat on medium high until the mixture begins to bubble around the edges. <NEXT_STEP> In a small bowl mix the water and cornstarch into a slurry. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly add the cornstarch mixture to the puree while whisking. <NEXT_STEP> Cook for 2 more minutes while stirring. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool completely. <NEXT_STEP> Put the cooled kiwi curd into a piping bag and cut 1/4 inch off the tip. <NEXT_STEP> For the frosting In the bowl of a stand mixer whip the shortening margarine and lecithin until completely combined. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape the bottom of the bowl to ensure that all the ingredients are mixed thoroughly. <NEXT_STEP> Add the strawberry puree and mix until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape the bottom of the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> On low speed slowly add the sugar a little at a time. <NEXT_STEP> Add the lemon juice and rum and mix to combine. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape the bottom of the bowl and mix on medium high speed until all the ingredients are combined and the frosting is fluffy about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Put the frosting into a pastry bag and cut 1/2 inch off the tip. <NEXT_STEP> For the shooters Remove the tops and cores from each strawberry. <NEXT_STEP> Set the tops aside in a bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Measure the rum into a measuring cup with a spout. <NEXT_STEP> Pour a teaspoon of rum into the empty cores of each strawberry. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe a teaspoon of strawberry frosting on top of each rum filled strawberry and place the leafy green strawberry tops back on each strawberry. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble With a plastic drinking straw or a small paring knife make holes in the center of each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Squeeze the kiwi curd in the center of each cupcake until filled but not overflowing about 1 tablespoon per cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe a dollop of strawberry frosting onto each cupcake and garnish with a strawberry rum shooter. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Strawberry Kiwi ounces cream cheese cold <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 teaspoons vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 1/2 cups powdered sugar <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a muffin pan with 24 regular size cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Spread the shredded coconut on a baking sheet and lightly toast in the oven until golden brown about 10 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Remove and cool. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of an electric stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment combine the sugar all purpose flour cake flour baking powder and salt. <NEXT_STEP> On low speed add the butter in small chunks. <NEXT_STEP> Then add the eggs one at a time followed by the egg whites. <NEXT_STEP> In a small bowl combine the milk and coconut extract. <NEXT_STEP> Add the mixture to the bowl stir together the cornstarch 1 tablespoon water and vanilla extract. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk the cornstarch mixture into the hot liquid and bring to a boil. <NEXT_STEP> Continue cooking the mixture until thick about 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat and stir in the coconut. <NEXT_STEP> Let the mixture cool completely before using. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of an electric stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment cream the butter and cream cheese until fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla extract and salt. <NEXT_STEP> Gradually add the powdered sugar until desired consistency is reached. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Honor: Coconut Cake with Coconut Creme Filling and Cream Cheese Buttercream <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> porter <NEXT_INPUT> corn <NEXT_INPUT> beer <NEXT_INPUT> caramel <NEXT_INPUT> meringue <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 3/4 cup cake flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/8 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup light brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon coffee extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup porter beer <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup cocoa <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup sour cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup porter beer <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup white chocolate coins <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup creamy peanut butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup milk chocolate coins <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup caramel corn such as Cracker Jack plus more for garnish <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 egg whites <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/8 teaspoon salt <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a mini cupcake pan with 12 cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Sift the flour baking soda and salt into a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Set the bowl aside. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of an electric stand mixer with a paddle attachment cream the sugar and oil together about 5 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl and then add the vanilla and coffee extracts and 1 egg at a time scraping down the sides of the bowl after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk your porter beer and cocoa together in a separate bowl and set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the mixer to low and add your sour cream. <NEXT_STEP> Continue with the mixer on the lowest speed and add the flour mixture and cocoa mixture alternating between the two beginning and ending with the flour. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the prepared liners half full with the batter and bake for 30 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool. <NEXT_STEP> For the ganache In a microwave safe bowl heat the porter beer to 130 degrees F. Pour the beer over the white chocolate in a clean medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the ganache into a sauce bottle for use. <NEXT_STEP> Hold at room temperature until the cupcakes are cooled. <NEXT_STEP> For the caramel corn crunch In a microwave safe bowl heat your peanut butter and milk chocolate for 30 second increments until melted. <NEXT_STEP> Stir with a spoon between heating. <NEXT_STEP> Crush the caramel corn in a food processor until fine. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the chocolate mixture over the caramel corn. <NEXT_STEP> Stir with a spoon until incorporated. <NEXT_STEP> Chill in the refrigerator until set. <NEXT_STEP> Scoop with a number 70 ice cream scoop on to a plate lined with waxed paper. <NEXT_STEP> Reserve at room temperature until assembly. <NEXT_STEP> For the meringue Combine the sugar and egg whites in a saucepan. <NEXT_STEP> Whisking constantly over low heat bring the mixture to 110 degrees F. extract and salt. <NEXT_STEP> This recipe should be done just prior to assembly. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Push the caramel corn filling into the middle of each porter cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Fill in the hole with the porter ganache. <NEXT_STEP> Chill until set. <NEXT_STEP> Fill a piping bag fitted with a star tip half full with the meringue. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe on top of the cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Toast the meringue with a kitchen torch. <NEXT_STEP> Garnish with caramel corn. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate Porter Cupcakes, Porter Ganache, Caramel Corn Crunch, Toasted Meringue <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> crystal <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> caramel <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> coffee <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> Butter for greasing pan <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Flour for flouring pan <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/3 cups hot water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 tablespoons instant coffee crystals <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 box chocolate fudge cake mix <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/3 cup vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 soft caramel candies unwrapped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 container chocolate frosting <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 jar marshmallow creme refrigerated <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup unsweetened cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup sweetened flaked coconut toasted <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Butter and flour 2 cupcake pans. <NEXT_STEP> Stir hot water and coffee crystals in large bowl until crystals dissolve. <NEXT_STEP> Let cool. <NEXT_STEP> Add cake mix oil and eggs to coffee in large bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Beat by hand or with a hand mixer for 2 minutes or until well blended. <NEXT_STEP> Fill each muffin cup halfway with batter. <NEXT_STEP> Place 1 caramel candy in the center of each. <NEXT_STEP> Pour remaining batter over caramels. <NEXT_STEP> Bake for 12 minutes or until cakes have puffed. <NEXT_STEP> Cool cupcakes in pans on a wire rack for 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Carefully remove cupcakes from pans and let cool completely before frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Cut off tops of cupcakes reserving both the tops and bottoms. <NEXT_STEP> Frost cupcake tops with chocolate frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Spoon 1 tablespoon of chilled marshmallow creme atop each cake bottom. <NEXT_STEP> Place cake tops back on top of cake bottoms. <NEXT_STEP> Dust tops with cocoa powder and sprinkle with coconut. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate Peak Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> corn <NEXT_INPUT> spiky <NEXT_INPUT> candy <NEXT_INPUT> yellow <NEXT_INPUT> cupcake <NEXT_INPUT> tuna <NEXT_INPUT> fraiche <NEXT_INPUT> germ <NEXT_INPUT> ginger <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 3/4 cup all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup wheat germ <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 tablespoons ground ginger <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 ounces unsalted butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3/4 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 eggs separated <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 tablespoons light cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Pinch salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 pound whipped cream cheese <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon fresh wasabi paste <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 pound creme fraiche <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 tablespoons black and white sesame seeds mixed divided <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon ground ginger divided <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 ounces sushi grade tuna chilled for 30 minutes <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 12 wasabi peas for garnish <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Line a cupcake or muffin pan with 12 regular size cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Sift the flour baking powder wheat germ ground ginger and salt into a medium size bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Set the bowl aside. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of an electric stand mixer with a paddle attachment cream the butter and sugar together about 6 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl then add the vanilla and 1 egg yolk at a time scraping down the sides of the bowl after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the mixer to low speed and add the flour mixture in a steady stream. <NEXT_STEP> Turn the mixer to medium speed and beat for 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Slowly add the cream. <NEXT_STEP> In a separate grease free bowl whisk the egg whites with an electric hand beater and a pinch of salt until they form stiff but moist peaks. <NEXT_STEP> Gently stir into the batter by hand with a spatula until no whites are visible. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners half full with batter and bake until they are golden and spring back when touched about 30 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes in their pan for 5 minutes before transferring to a cooling rack. <NEXT_STEP> For the wasabi cream filling Whip the cream cheese and wasabi paste by hand with a metal spoon in a small bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Cover until ready to use. <NEXT_STEP> For the tuna creme fraiche topping Combine the creme fraiche with 2 1/2 tablespoons of the sesame seeds and 3/4 teaspoon ginger mixing by hand with a spoon in a medium size bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Pass the tuna through a hand held zester to form small ribbons. <NEXT_STEP> Add the tuna to the creme fraiche and continue mixing. <NEXT_STEP> Add the lemon juice and mix until an even consistency is reached. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Remove and discard the center of each cooled cupcake using an apple corer. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the wasabi filling into each cavity until level with the top of the cake. <NEXT_STEP> Generously dollop the tuna creme fraiche mixture on top and sprinkle with remaining sesame seed and ginger mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Decorate with 1 wasabi pea placed in the center of the cake. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Wheat Germ and Ginger, Wasabi Cream, and Tuna Creme Fraiche Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> icing <NEXT_INPUT> basic <NEXT_INPUT> glaze <NEXT_INPUT> choice <NEXT_INPUT> yellow <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 1 cupcake <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 Vanilla Cupcake recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Basic Glaze Icing tinted Deep Yellow or color of choice recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 Jordan almonds color of choice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 pink dots <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 jujube color of choice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 6 pieces red string licorice <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 2/3 cups sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup unsalted butter cut into 1 inch pieces <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 large egg yolks <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2/3 cup water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 2/3 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/3 cups cake flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon fine salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 tablespoons light corn syrup <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Food coloring as desired <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> Dip the surface of the cupcake into the Deep Yellow Icing to cover top completely allowing excess to drip into the bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Clean any excess from the sides. <NEXT_STEP> Alternately use a knife or a spreader to apply. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk as needed to keep icing glossy and smooth while using. <NEXT_STEP> Place Jordan almonds on cupcake to make ears. <NEXT_STEP> Place 2 pink dots below almonds to make eyes. <NEXT_STEP> Place 1 mini jujube below eyes to make the nose. <NEXT_STEP> Cut pieces of red string licorice and place 3 on each side of the nose to make whiskers. <NEXT_STEP> Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line two 12 cup cupcake tins with paper liners. <NEXT_STEP> Put tins on a baking sheet. <NEXT_STEP> Set aside. <NEXT_STEP> Process sugar and butter in a food processor until very creamy scraping sides as needed 1 to 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs and yolks one at a time pulsing after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Add the milk water and vanilla and process to blend. <NEXT_STEP> Whisk both flours baking powder and salt in a medium bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Add the dry ingredients in 3 batches to the wet pulsing and then scraping batter off the sides of the processor as needed after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Process until the batter is very smooth and pourable like pancake batter about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Evenly pour the batter into the prepared cups filling them 3/4 of the way full. <NEXT_STEP> Bake until the cakes are just firm and spring back when gently pressed and the tops are golden 18 to 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool slightly in tin and turn out of tin when cool enough to handle. <NEXT_STEP> Cool cupcakes completely on a rack before frosting. <NEXT_STEP> Put the sugar in an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment. <NEXT_STEP> With the mixer on the lowest speed slowly add the water the corn syrup and vanilla extract. <NEXT_STEP> When the sugar is sufficiently moistened raise the speed to high and beat for 2 minutes until completely smooth and glossy. <NEXT_STEP> Divide and color as desired. <NEXT_STEP> Store at room temperature covered with plastic wrap directly on the surface of the icing to prevent forming a skin. <NEXT_STEP> For Light Blue Icing In a small bowl combine 2 to 3 drops of blue food coloring to 1 cup of Basic Glaze Icing. <NEXT_STEP> For Deep Yellow Icing In a small bowl combine 4 to 5 drops of yellow food coloring to 1 cup of Basic Glaze Icing. <NEXT_STEP> For Purple Icing In a small bowl combine 4 drops of red and 5 drops of blue food coloring to 1 cup of Basic Glaze Icing. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Bunny Face <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> parsley <NEXT_INPUT> seed <NEXT_INPUT> flax <NEXT_INPUT> poppy <NEXT_INPUT> toasted <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 48 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 1 cup butter <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 tablespoon water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup flax seeds toasted <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/4 cup poppy seeds <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups unsalted butter room temperature <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups superfine sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 5 eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon coconut extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups coconut flakes milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Muscat Raisin Filling recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Parsley Icing recipe follows <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup toasted coconut for garnish <NEXT_INGREDIENT> Organic green and pink tipped rose petals cut into chiffonade for garnish <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup milk <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup brown sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 cups Muscat raisins <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 cup toasted coconut <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 large bunch fresh Italian flat leaf parsley <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 envelopes unflavored gelatin <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup warm water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup cold water <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 cups unsalted butter cold <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 cups confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 cup finely chopped Flax Seed and Poppy Seed Toffee <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the toffee Line a baking sheet with a silicone mat. <NEXT_STEP> Put the butter in a medium saucepan over low heat. <NEXT_STEP> When the butter is halfway melted add the sugar and water and cook over low heat stirring very gently with a rubber spatula until completely combined. <NEXT_STEP> Clip on a candy thermometer on to the side of the pan turn the heat up to medium high and wait for the mixture to reach 300 degrees F about 15 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> The mixture will start to bubble and turn brown. <NEXT_STEP> If the browning seems uneven swirl the pan during the cooking process but do not stir. <NEXT_STEP> Once the mixture reaches 300 degrees F remove the pan from the heat and remove the candy thermometer. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the toasted flax seeds and poppy seeds. <NEXT_STEP> Pour onto the prepared baking sheet using an offset spatula to spread evenly. <NEXT_STEP> Chop by hand into small pieces. <NEXT_STEP> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Line mini cupcake pans with 48 mini cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Sprinkle each cupcake liner with 2 teaspoons Toasted Flax and Poppy Seed Toffee. <NEXT_STEP> In the bowl of a standing mixture fitted with the paddle attachment cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. <NEXT_STEP> Add the eggs 1 at a time scraping the bowl after each addition. <NEXT_STEP> Add the coconut extract and coconut flakes. <NEXT_STEP> Sift together the flour baking powder baking soda and salt in a separate bowl. <NEXT_STEP> Alternate folding the coconut milk and flour mixture into the butter mixture. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners three quarters of the way and bake for 11 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble When the cupcakes are cool to the touch use an apple corer to make a hole in the center of each cupcake . <NEXT_STEP> Put the Muscat Raisin Filling in a pastry bag snip the end and fill each cupcake to the top of the hole. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe the Parsley Icing high on the tops of each cupcake. <NEXT_STEP> Decorate the sides of the cupcakes with toasted coconut. <NEXT_STEP> Arrange a few rose petals in a circle on the tops of the cupcakes and fill the middle with additional Toasted Flax Seed and Poppy Seed Toffee. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the milk and brown sugar in a small saucepan over medium heat to dissolve the sugar. <NEXT_STEP> Add the raisins and continue to cook for 3 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Turn off the heat and let the mixture cool. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer to a blender and puree until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> Pour onto a half sheet tray and place in the refrigerator to cool. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the raisin mixture and toasted coconut by hand. <NEXT_STEP> For the puree Rinse and pat dry the parsley. <NEXT_STEP> Bloom the gelatin in the warm water. <NEXT_STEP> Trim the bottom 2 inches from the parsley and add the remaining parsley to a blender. <NEXT_STEP> Add the bloomed gelatin and cold water and blend until smooth. <NEXT_STEP> It should hold a slight peak and be bright green . <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the mixture to a baking sheet and cool quickly in the refrigerator. <NEXT_STEP> For the icing In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with a paddle attachment beat the butter and salt on high speed until light and fluffy about 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Add the confectioners sugar in 1/2 cup additions until fully mixed. <NEXT_STEP> Add the vanilla. <NEXT_STEP> Fold in the finely chopped toffee. <NEXT_STEP> Remove the parsley puree from the refrigerator and mix into the icing. <NEXT_STEP> Transfer the icing to a large pastry bag fitted with a large fluted star tip. <NEXT_STEP> Return to the refrigerator to keep firm. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START> Winning Recipe Mini Coconut Cupcakes with Poppy Seed Crust, Muscat Raisin Filling, and Parsley Icing with Toasted Coconut, Flax and Poppy Seed Toffee, and Organic Roses <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END><RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cabernet <NEXT_INPUT> wine <NEXT_INPUT> ounce <NEXT_INPUT> zinfandel <NEXT_INPUT> festival <INPUT_END> <YIELD_START> 12 cupcakes <YIELD_END> <INGREDIENT_START> 4 ounces red wine such as cabernet zinfandel blend <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 1/4 ounces all purpose flour <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 7 ounces sugar <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 1/2 ounces dark cocoa powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 ounces soybean vegetable oil <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 4 ounces sour cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 2 ounces whole eggs <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 8 ounces red wine such as cabernet zinfandel blend <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 3 1/2 ounces heavy cream <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 10 1/4 ounces semisweet chocolate couverture finely chopped <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 1 ounce <NEXT_INGREDIENT> 24 amarena cherries <INGREDIENT_END> <STEP_START> For the cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a standard muffin pan with 12 cupcake liners. <NEXT_STEP> Combine the red wine flour sugar cocoa baking powder baking soda and salt in the bowl of an electric stand mixer. <NEXT_STEP> Whip on medium speed for 2 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl and then add the vegetable oil and sour cream. <NEXT_STEP> Mix on medium speed for 1 additional minute. <NEXT_STEP> Scrape down the sides of the bowl and then add the eggs and vanilla extract. <NEXT_STEP> Mix on medium speed for 1 minute. <NEXT_STEP> Fill the cupcake liners three quarters full with batter and bake until golden brown and baked through about 25 minutes. <NEXT_STEP> Cool the cupcakes completely. <NEXT_STEP> For the ganache In a medium saucepot bring the red wine and heavy cream to a rolling simmer. <NEXT_STEP> Remove from the heat and stir in the chocolate with a whisk. <NEXT_STEP> Stir until the chocolate is fully melted and emulsified. <NEXT_STEP> Stir in the corn syrup. <NEXT_STEP> Pour into a small bowl and wrap tightly. <NEXT_STEP> Allow to cool at room temperature for at least 2 hours until the ganache has fully set. <NEXT_STEP> Place the ganache into a pastry bag fitted with a medium round tip. <NEXT_STEP> For the buttercream In a double boiler combine the egg whites sugar and cabernet wine powder. <NEXT_STEP> Stir with a whisk until the mixture is warm and the sugar is fully dissolved. <NEXT_STEP> Pour the warm egg white mixture into the bowl of an electric stand mixer. <NEXT_STEP> Whip on high speed until the meringue cools and stiff peaks are formed. <NEXT_STEP> Mix in the softened butter. <NEXT_STEP> Place into a piping bag fitted with a small round tip. <NEXT_STEP> To assemble Using an apple corer remove the center core of the baked cupcakes and fill each with 2 cherries. <NEXT_STEP> Pipe cabernet zinfandel chocolate ganache generously on top of the cupcakes and top with cabernet buttercream piped to look like a cluster of grapes. <STEP_END> <TITLE_START>
